instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Saute onions until fragrant. | Add pork, and cook until browned. Add kikiam and saute until light browned. Add liver and cook until dark browned. Set some aside for topping. | Add pork bouillon cubes and mix. Add water and soy sauce. Cook until simmering. | Add lomi noodles and simmer for about 5 minutes or until tender. | Add dissolved cassava starch and simmer until thick and sticky, about 5 minutes. | Add eggs and stir immediately. Simmer for 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. | Divide into bowls and serve with desired toppings. Serve with soy sauce, calamansi, red chilies, and onions on the side.

ingredients: 2-3 cups vegetable oil (for deep frying) | 2 350-gram block firm tofu (sliced into 1/2-inch squares) | 1 head Garlic (minced) | 1 1/2 inches ginger (thinly sliced) | 3/4 Cup white vinegar | 1 teaspoon Salt (or to taste) | 1 teaspoon ground black pepper (or to taste) | 1 piece siling labuyo (sliced) | 3 pieces green chilies (sili pangsigang) (sliced) | 3 medium red onions (sliced thinly) | 1 Cup mayonnaise
instructions: In a preheated medium-sized pan over medium high heat, preheat oil for deep frying. Deep frytofu, flipping, until evenly golden brown. Drain tofu. Using kitchen scissors, cut tofu into smaller cubes. Set aside. | Make the sauce: In a large bowl, add garlic, ginger, vinegar, salt, pepper, labuyo, and green chilies, and mix well. Add onions and toss gently. Fold in mayonnaise. Add fried tofu and mix together. Serve garnished with more chilies.

recipe_name: Chicken Menudo Recipe With Pickle Relish

2 tablespoons cooking

onion (peeled,

Sauce | 1 tablespoon Worcestershire
sauce | 3/4 Cup Tomato
sauce | 1/2 Cup water | 2 medium Potatoes (peeled,
cubed) | 2 medium carrots (peeled,
cubed) | 1/4 kilo chicken
liver (cubed into bite-sized
pieces) | 1/2 Cup raisins | 2 tablespoons pickle
relish | Salt (to
taste) | ground
black pepper (to

instructions: In a medium pot over medium heat, heat oil and then saute garlic and onion. | Add the chicken, and cook for 5 minutes. | Pour in soy sauce, tomato sauce, Worcestershire sauce, and water. Simmer for 5 minutes. Add potatoes and carrots, and then season with salt and ground black pepper. Simmer until potatoes are tender and mixture has thickened. | Add liver, raisins, and pickle relish. ingredients:

oil (plus more for
pan-frying) | 1 head Garlic (peeled,
finely
chopped) | 2 Small boneless
bangus (unmarinated) | Salt (to
taste) | ground
black pepper (to
taste) | 1/3 Cup all-purpose
flour | 1/2 165-gram
block quick-melting
cheese (grated)
instructions: Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add chopped garlic and cook until toasted or lightly golden brown. Season lightly with salt and remove from the pan, draining the oil. Set aside the garlic and the pan with the garlic oil. | Season the bangus with salt and ground black pepper. Place flour on a large plate or platter and season with salt and pepper. Dredge the bangus in the seasoned flour until both sides are coated. Shake lightly to release any excess flour. Set aside. | Pour more oil in the frying pan with the garlic oil for pan frying, about 1/2 inch high up the sides of the pan, and heat until the surface of the oil is shimmering. | Gently lay down and push the bangus, skin side down, into the hot oil. Fry until the bangus skin is crisp and gently flip over with a fish spatula. Fry the other side until crisp. Remove from the pan and transfer to a plate lined with a paper towel to absorb any excess oil. | Immediately top cooked bangus with quick-melting cheese and toasted garlic. Repeat with remaining bangus. Serve while hot.

ingredients:

frying) | 2 340-gram

as

instructions: In a medium pot over medium heat, heat oil. Add SPAM cubes and fry until lightly browned on all sides. ingredients:
3 tablespoons canola
oil | 1 teaspoon Atsuete
Seeds (annatto seeds) (more if
desired) | 1 medium red
onion (peeled,
chopped) | 3 cloves Garlic (peeled,
chopped) | 1/4 Cup peanuts (finely
chopped) | 3 tablespoons peanut
butter | 1/4 Cup rice
flour (toasted) | 2 cups water | 1 bunch long
beans (sitaw) (cut into 3-inch
lengths) | 2  eggplants (cut
into
wedges) | 2 bunches pechay
or bok
choy (separated) | bagoong
alamang (to
serve)
instructions: Bring a large pot of water over high heat to a boil. Lower heat to a simmer and blanch string beans, eggplants, and pechay in batches until just heated through. Remove from the boiling water, and set aside. | Meanwhile, in a pot over medium heat, heat oil. Add atsuete. Cook, stirring occasionally, to release its color. Remove and discard seeds. Add onion; cook until softened. Add garlic, and cook until fragrant.Add chopped peanuts and peanut butter. Stir. | Mix riceflour and water together. Pour into the pot. Stir. Bring to a boil, then simmer, and let thicken. Add blanched vegetablesand cook until justheated through. Transfer to a serving plate. Serve bagoong on the side.

recipe_name: Ginataang Halo Halo Recipe With Flavored Bilo Bilo and Tikoy
ingredients: 1/4 Cup small sago | 1 Cup glutinous rice flour (or use galapong) | 3 tablespoons water (or as needed) | 2 drops food coloring and flavoring of your choice (optional) (langka flavor) | 2 drops food coloring and flavoring of your choice (optional) (ube flavor) | 2 drops food coloring of your choice (red) | 1 drop food coloring and flavoring of your choice (optional) (strawberry flavor) | 2 cups water (more as needed) | 2 cups coconut milk | 1/2 Cup sugar (or to taste) | 2 pieces kamote (peeled, cubed small) | 3 pieces saba banana (peeled, sliced)
instructions:
Make Sago: In a small pot over medium heat, heat 2 cups water. Bring to a boil then add sago. Simmer for 5 minutes before stirring. Continue to boil for 10 minutes, regularly stirring to avoid scorching thesago at the bottom of the pot. Once there is just a small white dot at the center of the sago, turn off the heat and let sit for 5 minutes. Strain and set aside.
NOTE: You'll see the small white dots in the center of thesago will eventually disappear as it soaks in the hot water, an indication that thesago are completely cooked through. If after 5 minutes it hasn't, boil the sago again for another5 minutesbefore letting it soak. | Meanwhile, make Bilo Bilo: Divide glutinous rice flour intothree small bowls evenly, about 1/3 cup each. Add2teaspoons water to each bowl. Mix well into a firm dough. (You shouldform a dough, not a paste. If you make a paste, add more flour until you form a dough.) Add more water if needed. Repeat with the other two bowls. | Add 2 drops purple ube coloring and flavoring into one bowl. Mix well until the color is evenly distributed. Add 2 drops yellow langka coloring and flavoring to the second bowl and mix. Add 1 drop strawberry flavoring and 2 drops red food coloring to the last bowl and mix well. Pinch off 1/2 teaspoon amount of dough and roll it between your hands to form a small ball. Repeat until all the flavored dough are formed into small balls. Set aside on a plate without the balls touching.  | When ready to cook, pour water, coconut milk, and sugar into a large pot. Bring to a boil. Drop the bilo bilo one by one into the boiling coconut milk. Once all are added, gently stir to prevent the balls from sticking to the bottom of the pot. Lower heat to a simmer and cook until tender, about 10 to 15 minutes, stirring regularly. Poke each ball to test for doneness (balls should be soft and chewy). | Add the kamote and saba bananas and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. | Add cooked sagoand tikoy cubes. Stir and simmer only until heated through. If the soup is too thin, add more water and sugar until you achieve a consistency like soup. Servein bowls or chill before serving.
ingredient_names: sago | glutinous rice flour | food coloring | coconut milk | kamote | saba banana

ingredients:

sauce
instructions: Combine cola and barbecue sauce in a small saucepot over medium heat; simmer for 5 minutes.Serve with holiday ham or brushed on the ham before roasting the ham for 15 minutes.

Addhibeand cook until crisp. Remove from the oil. Add pork and shrimp bouillon pieces, and cook until dissolved. Pour inslurry. Bring to a boil then simmer until thickened, stirring. ingredients:
1/8 kilo ground
chicken (about 125
grams) | 2 slices sweet
ham (chopped) | 1 tablespoon pickle
relish | 1/4 Cup Cheese (grated) | 1/4 Cup raisins | 1/2 large Egg (beaten) | 2 whole chicken
breast fillets (skin on,
filleted) | Salt (to
taste) | ground
black pepper (to
taste) | Oil (for
frying)
instructions: Prepare a steamer. | In a medium bowl, mix ground chicken, ham, chorizo, pickle relish, cheese, raisins, and egg together. Season mixture with salt and ground pepper to taste. Cook a small amount of the mixture to check seasoning and adjust as needed. Set aside. | Lay plastic wrap over a chopping board. Place a whole 2 chicken breast fillet that s still connected in the center on the plastic, skin side down, and fold over the plastic wrap to cover. Using a meat mallet, flatten the whole chicken breast, focusing on the thicker areas to even out the thickness of the chicken. Remove plastic wrap and replace with foil. | Place flattened chicken breast onto the foil. Season with salt and ground pepper on both sides. Scoop half the ground chicken mixture onto the center of the chicken. Roll the chicken breast lengthwise encasing the chicken roll in the foil. Repeat with remaining chicken breast and ground chicken mixture. | Place foil-wrapped chicken rolls into the prepared steamer. Steam for 30 minutes. Remove from steamer. Let cool and then chill until ready to cook and serve. | When ready to cook, heat a frying pan over medium heat with enough oil for pan frying. Remove foil from chicken rolls and fry until the skin is crisp and the chicken is heated through, turning the chicken as needed to brown evenly on all sides. Remove from the heat and let rest slightly before slicing. Serve while hot with a chicken gravy on the side.

instructions: In a medium-sized pot over medium heat, add vinegar, water, salt, and whole peppercorns then stir. instructions: In a pot or saute pan, heat oil over medium heat. Add chicken pieces and sear the skin on all sides. Remove from the pot and set aside. | Add pork in batches to the hot oil. (The leftover liquid should have thickened slightly into a sauce.) | Season to taste with more salt as needed, and stir to combine. Serve while hot with steamed rice or fried garlic rice.

ingredients: 1 kilo whole pork belly (liempo) | 1 tablespoon Salt | 1/4 Cup patis (fish sauce) | 1 teaspoon black peppercorns | 2 pieces dried bay leaves | water (as needed)
instructions: Place the pork belly in a large pot. Add salt, patis, black peppercorns, and bay leaves. Pour enough water to cover. | Bring to a boil then simmer until tender, about 2 hours. (Alternatively, use a pressure cooker or instant pot to cut your cooking time in half.) | Remove tender pork from the water and set aside to cool. (Reserve water as pork stock for another recipe.) Once cool, set aside to chill overnight. | Preheat air fryer for 10 minutes at 200 degrees C when ready to cook. | Remove pork from the refrigerator and place it in the basket of the air fryer. Close and set the timer for 10 minutes. Decrease the heat to 180 degrees C and air fry for another 20 minutes.

Let it simmer until the chicken is cooked through and the potatoes are tender, or about 20 minutes. Add more water if needed. | Season with salt and pepper if desired. Serve with lots of steamed rice.

instructions: In a large wok or large frying pan over medium heat, heat half the oil. Saute garlic starts to turn golden brown. Add onions and cook until onions are translucent. | Add kikiam and squid balls, and sear sides over medium heat until cooked through. Add 1/4 up to 1/2 cup stock if the squid balls are not yet tender and cooked through. Cook until the liquid has evaporated then sear the kikiam and squid balls. Remove from the wok and set aside. | Add the remaining oil and heat over medium heat. Add the vegetables and cook until cooked through and wilted: cabbage, carrots, and the Baguio beans. | Pour in the stock. Bring to a boil then simmer. Add the dried pancit canton. Simmer until the noodles are rehydrated and softened with a little stock is still left over. | Return kikiam and squid balls to the wok and toss to combine. Season with soy sauce, oyster sauce, and ground black pepper, and toss again. Serve with pandesals and calamansi on the side.

recipe_name: Menudo Recipe With Hot Dog And Liver
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Canola Oil | 1 medium Red Onion | 3 cloves Garlic | 500 Grams Pork | 1/4 kilo Pork Liver | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 Cup Tomato Sauce | 1 Cup Water | 2 medium Potatoes | 2 medium Carrot | 1/2 Cup Raisins | 1/2 tablespoon Sugar | Black Pepper | Sugar
instructions:
In a medium pot over medium heat, heat oil and then saute garlic and onion. | Add the pork, and sear for 5 minutes, tossing as needed. Add pork liver and cook 3 minutes. | Pour in soy sauce, tomato sauce, and water,or enough water to cover. Bring to a boil then simmer, covered, until pork is tender. Add more water as needed.
Alternatively, use a pressure cooker totenderize the pork. Use the appliancemanufacturer's instructions on how touse the pressure cooker safely. | Once the pork is tender, add potatoes and carrots, and then season with salt and ground black pepper. Simmer until the potatoes are tender and the mixture has thickened. | Add hot dogs, raisins, and sugar to taste. Cook until hot dogs arejust heaed through. Season with more soy sauce and pepper to taste. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: canola oil | pork | pork liver | tomato sauce | potato | carrot | raisin

ingredients: 1 Cup banana ketchup | 2/3 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon liquid seasoning | 1 head Garlic (minced) | 1/4 Cup Calamansi Juice | 1/2 Cup lemon-lime soda ((7-up o Sprite)) | 1/2 teaspoon hot sauce | 1/2 Cup brown sugar | ground black pepper (to taste) | 1 kilo chicken leg quarters
instructions: Make the marinade: In a large bowl, mix banana ketchup, soy sauce, soy sauce, garlic, calamansi juice, pepper, sugar, lime-flavored soda, and hot sauce. | Set aside 1 cup of the marinade for basting, then pour remaining marinade over the chicken. Pierce the chicken using a fork so the marinade can flavor the chicken meat. Marinate chicken for atleast 30 minutes in the refrigerator. | Place chicken on a preheated grill. Baste chicken often to keep the meat from drying out. Grill until chicken is cooked through. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: banana ketchup | liquid | calamansi juice | lemon lime soda | hot sauce | brown sugar | chicken

ingredients: 3 tablespoons canola oil | 1 kilogram corned beef brisket (fresh, cubed) | 1 1/2 liters water | 1 medium red onion (quartered) | 1 medium radish (labanos) (lightly peeled, sliced into rounds) | 1 bunch okra (halved) | 1 piece green finger chili (siling pangsigang) | 2 40-gram packs sinigang sa sampaloc mix | 1 bunch kangkong (leaves and tender stalks only)
instructions: In a large pot over medium heat, heat oil. Add corned beef cubes and sear. Pour in just enough water to cover the beef. Bring to a boil. Remove any scum that rises to the surface. Cover and simmer for 2 to 3 hours or until the beef is tender. | Once beef is tender, remove cover and add onion, tomatoes, labanos, okra, and sili. Sprinkle in sampaloc mix. Bring to a boil, and simmer just until vegetables are tender. | Before serving, add and stir in kangkong. Cook just until kangkong leaves have brightened in color. Remove from heat. Serve hot with steamed rice.
ingredient_names: canola oil | beef | radish | okra | green finger chili | sinigang sa sampaloc mix | kangkong

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 1 kilo beef cubes | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1/2 kilo Potatoes (cut into bite-sized pieces) | 1 medium carrot (cut into chunks) | 2 pieces red or green bell peppers (cut into bite-sized pieces) | 1 150-gram pack tomato paste | 1 250-gram pack Tomato sauce | 1 85-gram can liver spread | 1 Cup coconut cream | 1 Cup water | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 2 pieces siling labuyo (birds eye chili) (sliced, optional) | 1/2 Cup green olives (pitted)
instructions: Sear or brown the beef cubes on all sides in oil in a heavy-bottomed pot. Set aside. | In the same pot, fry the potatoes, carrots, and bell pepper in oil. Remove the vegetables and set aside. | Saute garlic and onion until onion is translucent and garlic is golden brown. Add the seared meat and water. Let the meat boil for 15 to 30 minutes, covered, or until meat is tender. | Once the meat is tender, add the tomato paste, tomato sauce, and coconut cream. Let it simmer for 30 minutes over medium flame. | Season with salt and pepper. Add the olives and siling labuyo. Add the cooked vegetables to the pot. Let it simmer for 10 minutes uncovered. Serve hot with rice.
ingredient_names: beef cube | potato | carrot | bell pepper | 150 tomato paste | 250 tomato sauce | liver | coconut cream | labuyo | green olive

ingredients: 5 cups rice washing (hugas bigas) or water | 1 1-inch piece ginger (peeled and pounded) | 6 stalks green onions | 2 teaspoons black peppercorns | 2 teaspoons Salt | 500 Grams Pompano (cleaned and sliced into 3 to 4 pieces) | 500 Grams upo (bottle gourd) (peeled and cut into wedges) | 2 1/2 teaspoons patis (fish sauce) | 250 Grams pechay Tagalog | 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 piece tomato (chopped) | 180 Grams white miso paste (shiro miso) | 2 teaspoons patis (fish sauce) | 1/2 Cup fresh cilantro (to serve)
instructions: Combine rice washing, ginger, green onions, peppercorns, and salt in a pot over medium heat. Bring to a boil. | Lower heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Add pompano and upo. Simmer until cooked, about 6 to 8 minutes. | Add fish sauce and stir. Drop in pechay Tagalog and simmer for 1 minute. | Make the miso sauce: Heat oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Saute onion, garlic, and tomato until fragrant. Add miso and stir well. Pour 3/4 cup soup from the pesang pompano into the pan. Mix and cook for 3 minutes. | Season with fish sauce and cook for another 2 minutes. Serve pesang pompano hot with miso sauce and chopped cilantro on the side.
ingredient_names: rice water | 1 ginger | green onion | black peppercorn | pompano | wedge | pechay tagalog | vegetable oil | tomato | white miso paste | cilantro

ingredients: 1/4 cup canola oil (or any cooking oil) | 1 kilo pork belly strips (cut into pieces) | 1 teaspoon salt (more to taste) | 1/2 teaspoon whole black peppercorns | 8 cloves garlic (peeled and smashed slightly but left whole) | 1/2 cup coconut vinegar (or any white vinegar) | 3 cups water (more if needed) | 4 pieces dried bay leaves
instructions: In a pot or saute pan, heat oil over medium heat. Add pork in batches to the hot oil. Sear pork in batches until browned on both sides. | Once all the pork pieces are browned, return pork pieces to the pot and add salt, peppercorns, garlic cloves, vinegar, water, and bay leaves. | Bring to a boil then simmer over low heat, covered with a lid, for 30 minutes or until the pork is tender. (Add more water if needed.) Remove the lid and simmer again until the water has reduced and the leftover liquid has thickened slightly into a sauce. | Season to taste with more salt and stir to combine. Serve while hot with steamed rice or fried garlic rice.
ingredient_names: any cooking oil | pork | whole black peppercorn | any vinegar | dried bay leave

ingredients: 1 tablespoon patis (fish sauce) | 3 pieces calamansi (juiced, more to serve) | 2 medium white onion (chopped) | 4 medium ripe tomatoes (chopped) | 1 -i-inch piece ginger (grated) | 1 medium bangus (butterflied, deboned, scales removed) | 1/4 teaspoon Salt (or to taste) | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper (or to taste) | 2 pieces itlog na maalat (salted eggs) (chopped) | 1/2 Cup kesong puti (crumbled) | banana leaves (or foil) | wansoy (chopped (for garnish))
instructions: Mix patis, calamansi juice, onion, tomatoes, and ginger, and set aside. Season the milkfish with salt and pepper. Rub salt on all sides of the fish. | On a flat surface, lay the foil or banana leaves and place the fish on top of the fool or banana leaves skin side down. Top the fish with the onion and tomato mixture. | Add salted eggs and kesong puti on top of the onion and tomato mixture. Wrap the fish in foil or banana leaves. Make sure that the fish is covered with foil or banana leaves. | Prepare the grill by heating the charcoal. Cook the fish over High Heat for 15 minutes on each side. If a grill is not available, cook the fish in a dry wok over medium heat for 10 to 15 minutes on each side. Garnish the fish with wansoy before serving.
ingredient_names: calamansi | tomato | i ginger | bangus | itlog na maalat | kesong puti | banana leave | garnish

ingredients: 1/2 kilo pork (boiled until tender) | 1 medium white onion (chopped) | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1/2 kilo chicken livers (heart removed) | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | 2 cups pork stock (or water) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons oyster sauce | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper (or to taste) | 1/2 Cup snow peas (chicharo) | 1 medium carrot (sliced) | 2 pieces red or green bell peppers (deseeded and sliced) | 1 medium sayote (chayote) (sliced) | 1 head cauliflower (cut into bite-sized pieces) | 1 head cabbage (sliced) | 8 pieces young corn (chopped) | 12 pieces quail eggs (cooked) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Saute pork in a pot or wok to render the fat from the pork. Once fat is already rendered, saute onion and garlic. Add the chicken liver and allow to cook for 5 minutes. | In a small bowl dissolve the cornstarch in the pork stock. Pour into the pot or wok, add the seasoning ingredients: soy sauce, oyster sauce, and black pepper. Let it simmer for 5 minutes or until the sauce is thickened. | Add all the vegetables: snow peas, carrots, bell pepper, sayote, cauliflower, cabbage, and young corn. Mix all the ingredients and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the quail eggs. Season with salt to taste before serving.
ingredient_names: pork | chicken livers heart | cornstarch | pork stock | oyster sauce | snow pea | carrot | bell pepper | sayote | cauliflower | cabbage | young corn | quail egg

recipe_name: Chicken Pork Adobo Recipe With Gochujang
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Cooking Oil | 6 cloves Garlic | 1 medium Red Onion | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup Apple Cider Vinegar | 1 tablespoon Korean Hot Pepper Paste (Gochujang) | 1 1/2 cups Water | 1 tablespoon Brown Sugar | 250 Grams Pork | 250 Grams Chicken | 1 teaspon Sesame Oil | Green Onion
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pan, and add garlic and onions. Saute until garlic is fragrant and onions are translucent. | Add the light soy sauce, vinegar, gochujang, water, and brown sugar. Stir and bring to a boil. Add the pork, lower down the heat and simmer until tender, about 30 minutes) | When the pork is already tender, add the chicken thighs and cook until the chicken is cooked through and the sauce has reduced to almost half. | Stir in sesame oil. Place meat pieces on a serving plate, garnish with chopped green onions, and serve with piping hot rice.
ingredient_names: apple cider vinegar | korean hot pepper paste | brown sugar | pork | chicken | teaspon sesame oil | green onion

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 piece Chorizo de Bilbao (sliced diagonally) | 1 150-gram pack tomato paste | 2 Small red or green bell peppers (sliced) | 2 pieces tomatoes (sliced) | 2 cups water | 1 Cup canned chickpeas (garbanzos) | Salt (to taste) | 1/2 teaspoon ground black peppe (to taste)
instructions: Saute onion and garlic in oil until onion is translucent and garlic is fragrant. | Add the chorizo de Bilbao then cook for 5 minutes. | Add the tomato paste, bell pepper, and fresh tomatoes. Cook for 5 minutes. | Once tomatoes are cooked, add the squid. Add water and season the mixture with salt and pepper. Let it simmer for 15 minutes. | Add the garbanzos and let simmer for 10 minutes. Cook until the sauce reduces by half or becomes thick. Serve warm with rice.
ingredient_names: chorizo | 150 tomato paste | bell pepper | tomato | chickpea | black peppe

ingredients: 1 kilo Pork | 6 cloves Garlic | 2 medium Onion | 1 1/2 cups Kimchi | 1 teaspoon Gochugaru (Korean Dried Chili Flakes) | 6-8 cups Water | 1 22-gram pack Sinigang Mix | 5 pieces Okra | 1/2 Cup String Beans (Sitaw) | 1 teaspoon Fish Sauce (Patis) | 1 Cup Kangkong (Water Spinach) Leaves
instructions: Heat oil in a soup pot over medium heat. Add garlic and onions. Saute until fragrant and onions are translucent. | Add kimchi and gochugaru(red chili flakes) powder. Cook for 1to 2 minutes. | Add pork cubes and make sure that they are coated with the kimchi mixture. Add water and bring to a boil.Reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes or until pork is tender. | Once the pork is tender, add sinigang mix, okra, and string beans. Cook for 5 minutes.Season with salt, pepper, and fish sauce. | Turn off the heat, and add kang kong. Serve hot with rice.
ingredient_names: pork | kimchi | chili flake | 22 sinigang mix | okra | sitaw | sauce | kangkong

ingredients: 6 pieces chicken thigh fillets | 3 tablespoons patis (fish sauce) | 3 stalks lemongrass (tanglad) (bruised, white part finely chopped) | 1 clove Garlic (finely grated) | 2 teaspoons sugar | 1 teaspoon ground black pepper | 3 tablespoons patis (fish sauce) | 2 tablespoons white vinegar | 3 tablespoons sugar | 2 tablespoons lime juice | 1 piece red chili (finely chopped) | 2 cloves Garlic (finely chopped) | 1 stalk lemongrass (tanglad) (finely chopped) | Cucumber (sliced, to serve) | cilantro (or leeks, to serve)
instructions: Place the chicken in a large bowl. Add the fish sauce, lemongrass, garlic, sugar, and pepper. Mix until well combined. | Preheat a barbecue or charcoal-grill plate on High. Remove the chicken from the marinade and cook for about 5 minutes on each side or until cooked to your liking. Set aside for 5 minutes to rest. | Make the nuoc cham: whisk together the patis, vinegar, sugar, lime juice, chili, garlic, and lemongrass. Cover and set aside until ready to serve. | When ready to serve, drizzle chicken with nuoc cham. Serve chicken with cucumber and cilantro or leeks and with the rest of the sauce on the side.
ingredient_names: chicken | stalks lemongrass | lime juice | red chili | lemongrass | cucumber | cilantro

ingredients: 2 pieces medium or large squid ((about 500 grams), cleaned) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 piece siling labuyo (birds eye chilies) (sliced) | 1/2 Cup lemon-lime soda ((we used Sprite)) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon Calamansi Juice | 1/2 teaspoon liquid seasoning | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
instructions: Make slits on the squid by slicing through its top portion. | Combine all remaining ingredients in a bowl: garlic, chili, soda, soy sauce, calamansi juice, liquid seasoning, and pepper. Mix well. Add squid to the mixture and marinate for 1 hour. | Preheat a charcoal or stovetop griller. Remove squid from the marinade. Grill until completely cooked, about 3 minutes per side, basting the squid with the marinade throughout grilling. (Make sure not to overcook the squid as it will become tough and rubbery.) Serve immediately with your desired dipping sauce.
ingredient_names: squid | chily | lemon lime soda | calamansi juice | liquid

ingredients: 1 kilo Pork Leg (sliced) | 1 piece cinnamon stick | 2 pieces star anise | 4-5 pieces wood ear mushrooms (tenga ng daga) | 1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns | 10 pieces rock sugar | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 medium red onion (quartered) | 4 cloves Garlic (smashed) | 3/4 Cup sinamak vinegar | water (as needed) | spring onions (Chopped, for garnish) | fried garlic bits (for garnish)
instructions: In a large pot, bring water to a boil. Blanch the pork hocks for a few minutes to remove residues. Strain and clean the pork pieces with fresh water. | In a pressure cooker, add pork hocks, cinnamon sticks, star anise, black fungus, peppercorns, rock sugar, soy sauce, vinegar, onion, and garlic, and cover with enough water to just cover the pork. | Bring water to a boil, lower the heat to simmer, then close and seal the pressure cooker. Cook for 1 hour. (If using the traditional method, cook for 1 to 2 hours or until the meat is soft and starts to fall off the bone. Add more water while simmering, if necessary. | After 1 hour, release the pressure pin, and wait for 5 to 10 minutes before unsealing the lid and opening the pressure cooker. Do not immediately open or force the lid to open. | Transfer pork to a serving bowl and garnish with spring onions and fried garlic when ready to serve.
ingredient_names: pork | cinnamon | star anise | wood ear mushroom | whole black peppercorn | rock sugar | sinamak vinegar | green onion | fried garlic

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 5 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 1-inch piece ginger (minced) | 1 medium red onion (sliced) | 4 medium tomatoes (sliced) | 2 pieces Pompano (cleaned and gutted) | 10-15 pieces calamansi (juiced) | 2 tablespoons patis (fish sauce) | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper
instructions: Heat oil in a pot or wok. Saute garlic, ginger, and onions until fragrant or the onions become translucent then add the tomatoes. | Arrange the pampano on top of the garlic, onions, ginger, and tomato. Pour the calamansi juice and patis over the fish and sprinkle ground black pepper on top. Turn the heat down to Low, cover the pot or wok ,and let it simmer for 15 minutes. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: 1 ginger | tomato | pompano | calamansi

recipe_name: Sweet and Sour Chicken Meatballs Recipe
ingredients: 1 kilo ground chicken | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 1 large Egg | 1/2 teaspoon Salt (or to taste) | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper (or to taste) | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 2 medium red onions (cut into quarters) | 2 medium red bell peppers (sliced) | 1 medium carrot (sliced) | 1 Cup Pineapple Tidbits (with juice) | 1 Cup banana ketchup | 2 tablespoons oyster sauce | 1 teaspoon cornstarch | 1/2 Cup warm water | 1/4 Cup brown sugar | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | Oil (as needed)
instructions: In a bowl, combine the ground chicken, onion, egg, salt, and black pepper. | Take a small amount and fry it to check the taste. Adjust seasoning as desired. | Once the taste is to your satsifaction, form the ground chicken mixture into small meatballs and refrigerate for 15 minutes. | Fry each meatball in a pot with hot oil. Drain excess oil from the meatballs on paper towels. Set aside. | Make the sweet and sour sauce: Saute garlic and onions in hot oil. Add the ginger, then the bell peppers and carrots. Add in the pineapple tidbits with juice, banana ketchup, and oyster sauce. Let it simmer. | In a small bowl, mix the water and cornstarch. Pour the mixture into the pot and stir over low heat. Add the brown sugar. Let the sauce simmer for 15 minutess or until the sauce has thickened. Season the sauce with salt and pepper according to your taste. | Add the meatballs to the pot and mix with the sauce. Transfer to a serving dish and serve while hot.
ingredient_names: chicken | egg | bell pepper | carrot | pineapple tidbit | banana ketchup | oyster sauce | cornstarch | warm water | brown sugar

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 5 cloves Garlic | 1 medium Red Onion | 1 1-inch piece Ginger | 1/2 kilo Pork | 1 kilo Pig's Blood | 1 Cup Vinegar | 2 cups Coconut Milk (Gata) | 2 tablespoons Fish Sauce (Patis) | Salt | Black Pepper | 2 pieces Finger Chilies (Siling Pangsigang)
instructions:
Saute garlic in oil, add onions and ginger, then add the pork. Saute until the pork is cooked. | Add the blood and pour the vinegar. Let it simmer for 10 minutes then add the coconut milk. | Once the sauce has thickened season with patis, salt, and pepper. Add the finger chilies. Simmer for 10 minutes. Once cooked, transfer to a bowl and serve with warm puto.
***
ingredient_names: 1 ginger | pork | pig's blood | coconut milk | sauce | finger chili

recipe_name: Filipino Pork Barbecue Recipe with Sriracha
ingredients: 1 Cup banana ketchup | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 head Garlic (minced) | 1/4 Cup Calamansi Juice | 1/2 Cup lemon-lime soda | 3 tablespoons Sriracha | 1/2 Cup brown sugar | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1 kilo pork shoulder (kasim) (cut into 1/2-inch cubes) | 1/2 Cup vegetable oil | spiced vinegar (for serving)
instructions: Make the marinade: In a large bowl, mix banana ketchup, soy sauce, garlic, calamansi juice, lime-flavored soda, sriracha, brown sugar, black pepper, and salt. | Thread meat onto barbecue sticks. Add fat at the end of each skewer. | Arrange skewers in a container. Set aside 1 cup of the marinade for basting, then pour the remaining marinade over the skewers. Marinate overnight in the refrigerator. After marinating meat should be dark with a little bit of red color as it has absorbed the marinade. | For the basting sauce: Mix reserved marinade with oil. | When ready, cook skewers on a hot grill, brushing the meat with the basting sauce as you grill. Grill until the meat is cooked through. Serve hot with spicy vinegar.
ingredient_names: banana ketchup | calamansi juice | lemon lime soda | sriracha | brown sugar | pork | vegetable oil

ingredients: 1 Cup dried green mung beans (monggo) | 5 cups water | 3 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 200 Grams garlic longganisa (such as the Cabanatuan, Cebu, Vigan, or Tuguegarao variety) | 2 pieces tomatoes (chopped) | 2 pieces eggplants (sliced into half moons) | 1 piece pork bouillon cube | 1 teaspoon patis (fish sauce) | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper | 2 cups malunggay leaves
instructions: Drain soaked monggo and transfer to a pot. Add water and boil over medium heat until tender, about 1 hour. If desired, you can also lightly mash the monggo. Set aside. | Heat oil in another pot over medium-high heat. Saute onion and garlic until fragrant. Add longganisa and cook until browned, breaking the meat further until fully crumbled. Reserve about 3 tablespoons cooked longganisa for topping. | Add tomatoes and eggplants. Cook for 1 minute. | Add monggo and water. Bring back to a boil. | Lower heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Add bouillon cube, fish sauce, and pepper. Simmer for another 5 minutes. | Turn off heat. Add malunggay leaves and stir. Transfer to a serving dish, top with reserved longganisa, and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: green mung bean | vegetable oil | tuguegarao variety | tomato | half moon | pork bouillon cube | malunggay leave

ingredients: 1/4 Cup all-purpose flour | 2 teaspoons Salt | 1 kilo tilapia (cleaned) | vegetable oil (for frying) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 head Garlic (minced) | 1 medium red bell pepper (diced small) | 1/2 Cup Butter | 2 tablespoons oyster sauce | 2 tablespoons sugar | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper | 1 tablespoons chopped green onions
instructions: Combine flour and salt in a shallow bowl. Dredge tilapia in flour mixture. Set aside. | Heat oil in a deep-fryer over medium heat. Deep-fry tilapia until golden and crispy, about 3 to 4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Set aside and keep warm. | Make the butter garlic sauce: Heat oil in a pot or wok over medium heat. Fry garlic until browned and crispy. Set some garlic aside for topping. | Add bell pepper and saute for 30 seconds. | Add butter and oyster sauce. Mix until butter is completely melted and mixture starts to simmer. | Add sugar, salt, and pepper. Stir until sugar is completely dissolved. | Add tilapia and toss carefully. Transfer to a serving platter. Top with reserved crispy garlic and green onions.
ingredient_names: all purpose flour | tilapia | vegetable oil | bell pepper | butter | oyster sauce | green onion

ingredients: 1/4 Cup Oil (Test oil notes for id 172231) | 3 2-inch blocks Firm Tofu (tokwa) (Firm tofu inserted manually in db and json format for id 172231) | 6 cloves Garlic (Sample garlic update for id 172231 by julious ) | 1 medium Red Onion | 1 medium Potatoes | 1/2 medium Carrot | 2 tablespoons Tomato Paste | 1/4 Cup Tomato Sauce | 1/2 Cup Water | 1 teaspoon Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon White Sugar | 1 tablespoon Pickle Relish | 1/4 Cup Raisins | 1 medium Bell Pepper | Salt | Pepper
instructions: On medium-high heat, heat oil in a pan and fry tokwa until golden brown. Set aside. | Discard half the oil, and saute the garlic and onions until onions are translucent. | Add the potatoes and carrots. Saute for 2 minutes. | Add in tomato paste, tomato sauce, water, soy sauce, sugar, and pickle relish. Add salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 2to 3 minutes. | Add in the fried tokwa. Simmer until the sauce is reduced to half and vegetables are soft. Make sure that each cube of tokwa is coated in sauce. | Add in the raisins and bell pepper. Simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve with rice or use as the filling for pan de sal the next day when the tokwa has absorbed most of the sauce.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 1 medium tomato (chopped) | 1 kilo medium-sized squid (cleaned, cut into rings) | 1 1/2 cups coconut milk | 3 teaspoons patis (fish sauce) | 1 teaspoon ground black pepper | 2 pieces green finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (sliced) | 2 tablespoons fresh basil leaves (chopped) | red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (for garnish)
instructions: In a saute pan, heat oil. Saute garlic, onion, and tomatoes for a few minutes then add the squid. Stir fry for a few minutes again until the squid are slightly cooked. Set aside. | Pour in coconut milk and season with fish sauce and black pepper. Simmer again for a few minutes until the sauce is thickened. | Add the green chili and basil. Add squid and cook 1 minute or so. Do not overcook. Top with red chili before serving. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: tomato | squid | coconut milk | green finger chili | basil leave | red chili pepper

ingredients: 1 kilo tilapia (Gutted, cleaned, and rinsed well, cut in half) | Oil (for frying) | 2 medium Potatoes (cut into 4) | 5 pieces saging na saba (cut in half) | 1 bunch pechay Tagalog | 1 medum red onion (chopped) | 5 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/4 Cup tomato paste | 1 Cup water | 15 pieces Baguio beans (trimmed and cut in half) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Fry the tilapia in oil until crispy and set aside. | In the same pan and the oil, fry the potatoes and saging na saba until browned and cooked. Set aside. | Still using the same pan, remove excess oil. Leave about 2 tablespoons oil. Saute garlic, onions, and green beans. | Add the tomato paste and water. Return the cooked saging na saba and potatoes. Let it simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. | Add the cooked tilapia and let it simmer for 5 minutes. Serve warm.
ingredient_names: tilapia | potato | na saba | pechay tagalog | medum onion | tomato paste | baguio bean

recipe_name: Grilled Pork Belly (Inihaw na Liempo) Recipe

Put the pork belly one by one on the hot grills and cook until browned. Serve with vinegar with chili and garlic.

recipe_name: Ginisang Gulay with Bagoong and Gata Recipe
ingredients: 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 4 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 6 pieces string beans (sitaw) (cut into 2-inch pieces) | 2 cups coconut milk | 6 to 8 pieces okra | 1 medium talong (eggplant) (sliced) | 1 Small red bell pepper (cubed) | 1 1/2 tablespoons shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper (or to taste) | 1  red chili (to garnish)
instructions: Heat oil in a wok. Saute garlic and onion. Continue to cook until the onions are soft. | Add the sitaw. Continue to saute for 3 minutes. | Pour the coconut milk into the cooking pot. recipe_name: Chicken Tinola Recipe in Coconut Water with Mushrooms
ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 30 Grams red onion (chopped) | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1/2-inch piece ginger (cut into strips) | 1 kilo Chicken (cut into 8 pieces) | 4 cups water | 2 pieces coconut (juice and meat) | 1 10-gram pack wood ear mushrooms (tenga ng daga) | 4-6 pieces shiitake mushrooms | 1 370-gram can young corn | 2 pieces sayote (chayote) (sliced (or 1 green papaya, sliced)) | 1 bunch pepper leaves (dahon ng sili) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | fish sauce (patis) (to taste)
instructions: Heat the oil in a medium pot. Saute the onion, garlic, and ginger. Add the chicken. Cook for 10 minutes. | Cover the chicken with water and coconut juice. Add the shiitake and tenga ng daga, young corn, sayote, and coconut meat. Let it boil. | Once cooked, season with salt, pepper, and patis according to taste.
ingredient_names: ginger | chicken | coconut | 10 wood ear mushroom | shiitake mushroom | young corn | green papaya

recipe_name: Inihaw Na Sinigang Na Tuna Belly Recipe
ingredients: 1 600-700 gram fresh tuna belly (about 2 whole slabs) | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | 1 22-gram pack sinigang sa sampaloc mix | 2 tablespoons light brown sugar | 1 teaspoon atsuete seeds | 3 tablespoons vegetable oil
instructions: Place tuna belly in a shallow bowl. Pour soy sauce over the tuna. | Combine sinigang sa sampaloc powder and sugar. Rub mixture all over tuna. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 4 hours. | Meanwhile, combine atsuete seeds and vegetable oil in a saucepan over low heat. Simmer for 1 minute. Remove from heat and let stand for 2 minutes. Drain and discard seeds. Set aside. | Once tuna is ready, heat a grill pan or a charcoal grill. Brush some of the atsuete oil on the pan or the grill grates. | Baste tuna belly with remaining atsuete oil. Grill tuna belly just until flesh changes color and flakes easily, about 4 minutes per side. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: whole slab | 22 sinigang sa sampaloc mix | brown sugar | seeds | vegetable oil

recipe_name: Pechay And Hibe Fried Rice Recipe
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Dried Shrimp (Hibe) | 1 Cup Hot Water | 3 tablespoons Vegetable Oil | 6 cloves Garlic | 150 Grams Pechay Leaves | Salt | 1 thumb-sized piece Ginger | 3 cups Day-Old Brown Rice | 2 large Egg | 2 teaspoons Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon Pepper | 1 teaspoon Sesame Oil
instructions: Soak hibe in hot water for 15 minutes. Strain and discard liquid. Set aside. | Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Saute half of the garlic until fragrant. | Add pechay and saute until stems are just slightly tender, about 30 seconds. Season with salt to taste. Remove from wok and set aside. | Heat remaining oil in the wok. Saute remaining garlic and ginger until fragrant. Add hibe and cook for 1 minute. | Add rice and mix until well coated with oil. Make a well in the center. Add beaten eggs and cook. Stir well with the rice. | Add pechay and toss well. Add soy sauce, white pepper, and sesame oil. Mix well. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: dried shrimp | hot water | vegetable oil | pechay leave | ginger | day old brown rice | egg | sesame oil

recipe_name: Ginisang Ampalaya With Egg And Tofu Recipe
ingredients: 2 pieces ampalaya (about 500 grams) | 1 tablespoons Salt (for soaking) | 1 500-gram pack firm tofu (sliced into cubes) | 1/2 Cup all-purpose flour | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 2 Small tomatoes (deseeded and chopped) | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper | 2 large eggs (beaten) | vegetable oil (for frying and sauteing)
instructions: Slice ampalaya in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds and discard. Slice ampalaya into thin half-moons and place in a bowl filled with water. Add salt and mix. Let stand for 15 minutes. Remove water and rinse ampalaya. Squeeze out any excess water. Set aside. | Heat oil in a frying pan. Dredge tofu cubes in flour. Fry in batches until crisp and golden, about 6 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Set aside. | Heat 3 tablespoons oil in a pot over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until fragrant. Add tomatoes and saute until softened. | Add ampalaya and mix to combine. Cover for 5 minutes or until ampalaya is softened. Season with salt and pepper. | Add tofu cubes. Pour in beaten eggs and toss gently until completely cooked, about 2 minutes. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: ampalaya | 500 firm tofu | all purpose flour | tomato | egg | vegetable oil

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 6 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1 medium red onion (roughly chopped) | 1 thumb-sized ginger (roughly chopped) | 2 pieces Pompano (cleaned and gutted) | 2 stalks Leeks (sliced) | 1 piece green finger chili (siling pangsigang) | 4-5 pieces birds eye chilies (siling labuyo) | 1 400-ml can coconut milk | 1/8 Cup water | 1 tablespoon sugar | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a large frying pan and add onions, ginger, and garlic. Saute until garlic is fragrant and onions are translucent. | Add the pampano and cook for 2 minutes on each side. | Pour in the coconut milk and simmer for 3 minutes. Add the siling pangsigang and bird's eye chilies. Add the water. Season with salt and pepper. Add sugar. | Simmer for 20 minutes or until the coconut milk separates. Serve hot with rice.
ingredient_names: ginger | pompano | leek | green finger chili | chily | milk

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1 Small red onion (chopped) | 1 Small banana blossom (Puso ng saging) | 2 pieces eggplant (sliced) | 1/2 bundle string beans (sitaw) (cut into 2-inch lengths) | 1/4 Cup atsuete seeds (soaked in 1 cup water) | 1/4 Cup peanut butter | 1 1/2 kilo whole chicken (cut into 8 pieces) | 4 cups water | 1/2 Cup ground peanuts | 1/4 Cup rice flour | 1 bundle pechay or bok choy | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 1/2 Cup shrimp paste (bagoong) (to serve)
instructions: Heat oil in a large saucepot. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. | Add puso ng saging, eggplant, and string beans. | Strain annatto seeds and discard. Add annatto water and peanut butter to the pot. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes. | Add the chicken, water, ground peanuts, and rice flour. Stir gently and simmer until thick. Once the chicken is cooked, add pechay or bok choy. Season to taste. Serve with bagoong.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | banana blossom | eggplant | sitaw | seeds | peanut butter | whole chicken | peanut | rice flour | bok choy

ingredients: 2 pieces chicken wings | 2 pieces chicken thighs | 2 pieces chicken legs | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup unsweetened pineapple juice | 3-4 pieces laurel leaves | 8 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce | 1 tablespoon whole black peppercorns | 2 medium Potatoes (peeled, quartered) | 1/4 Cup water | 2 tablespoons fried garlic (to serve) | 3/4 Cup Oil (for frying) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Put chicken pieces in a bowl and add soy sauce, vinegar, unsweetened pineapple juice, laurel leaves, half of the crushed garlic, Worcestershire sauce, and whole peppercorns. Mix well, cover, and marinate for at least 30 minutes. (Overnight marination is recommended). | In the meantime, peel and slice the potatoes into quarters. Fry the potatoes in oil for 3 to 5 minutes or until tender. Set aside. | Brown the remaining garlic in the same pan. Set aside. | Transfer the chicken pieces and marinade to a deep pan and cook over medium heat for 25 to 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked. | Add the fried potatoes. Cook for 5 more minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with fried garlic and serve while hot.
ingredient_names: chicken | pineapple juice | laurel | worcestershire sauce | whole black peppercorn | potato | fried garlic

ingredients: 2 pieces ampalaya (bitter gourd) (around 12 inches (30 cm), cut into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces, cores removed) | 250 Grams ground pork | 250 Grams Ground beef | 5 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium carrot (minced) | 1 medium red onion (minced) | 1 medium red bell pepper (minced) | 2 tablespoons pickle relish | 1/4 Cup breadcrumbs
instructions: Preheat the oven to 180 degrees C or 350 degrees F. | Slice the ampalaya into 2-inch (5 cm) pieces and remove the core. Set aside. | In a bowl, mix together the pork, beef, garlic, carrot, onion, red bell pepper, pickle relish and bread crumbs. Season with salt and pepper. | Fill the ampalaya with the meat mixture. | Line a baking pan with parchment paper, arrange the stuffed ampalaya on it. Bake for 45 to 55 minutes or until the ampalaya is tender and the meat is cooked through. Transfer to a serving plate and serve.
ingredient_names: ampalaya | pork | beef | carrot | bell pepper | pickle relish | breadcrumb

ingredients: 1 kilo green mussels (tahong) (with shells on) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 medium red onion (finely chopped) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 2 medium red bell peppers (cut into small pieces) | 2 pieces green finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (sliced) | 3 pieces red chilies (sliced) | 2 tablespoons oyster sauce | sal (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | water (as needed)
instructions:
Blanch mussels in salted boiling water for 5 minutes. Set aside and let it cool. Once cooled, remove the meat of the mussels from its shells. Makes sure the sand is removed from the meat. | Heat the oil in a pan, saute the onions and garlic for 1 minute. Add the mussels, red bell pepper, chilies and oyster sauce. Let it cook for 5 minutes. | Season with salt and pepper then serve with rice.
[ArticleReco:{"articles":["17197","20722","20796","23042"]}]
ingredient_names: green mussel | vegetable oil | bell pepper | green finger chili | red chily | oyster sauce | sal

ingredients: 1 kilo pork pata (sliced into serving pieces) | 10 cups water (divided) | 6 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon whole black peppercorns | 1/4 Cup banana blossoms | 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup brown sugar | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Boil 5 cups of water in a large pot over medium heat. Add the pork pata and boil the pork for 10 to 15 minutes. Discard the water and clean the pork. Remove any hairs. Set aside. | Boil another 5 cups of water in the same pot. Add garlic, soy sauce, peppercorns, and bay leaves. | Return the pork to the pot and simmer for 60 minutes or until the pata is tender. | Add the vinegar and simmer for 10 minutes. Add the banana blossoms. Simmer for 5 more minutes. | Add the brown sugar, and salt and pepper to taste. Simmer for 5 minutes. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: pork pata | whole black peppercorn | banana blossom | brown sugar

ingredients: 3 pieces eggplant | 4 tablespoons Oil (divided) | 6 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/2 medium red onion (minced) | 1/4 kilo ground pork | 2 small squares firm tofu (tokwa) (cubed small) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon sugar | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | banana ketchup (to serve)
instructions: Grill eggplants directly on the stove in the flame until charred and soft. Cool. Carefully peel the skin off each of the eggplants. Set these aside. | Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a pan, and add onions and garlic. Saute until fragrant. | Add ground pork and cook for 5 minutes. Add soy sauce and sugar, and continue cooking until meat is thoroughly cooked. | Add the diced tokwa and cook with the pork until well combined and the tokwa absorbs some of the soy sauce (tokwa will turn brown). When the pork and tokwa mixture is cooekd through, set aside. | In a bowl, beat 3 eggs and combine with the pork-tokwa mixture. In another bowl, beat the remaining 2 eggs. Take one eggplant and dip in the beaten eggs making sure both sides are coated. | Heat the remaining 2 tablespoons oil in a frying pan. Add the egg-soaked eggplant then top with a spoonful of egg-pork-tokwa mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes on one side. Add a bit more egg on top. When the bottom has set, flip the eggplant over and cook for another 1 to 2 minutes. When the tortang talong is done, set it aside on a plate. | Repeat the cooking process with the remaining eggplants. Serve hot with rice and banana ketchup.
ingredient_names: eggplant | pork | squares | banana ketchup

ingredients: 750 Grams pork belly slab (liempo) | 2 cups water | 1 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/3 Cup white vinegar | 3 pieces laurel leaves | 1/2 tablespoon black peppercorns | 1 head Garlic (minced) | 3 cups day-old rice (for adobo rice) | 1/2 Cup cornstarch (for dredging) | 1/2 Cup mayonnaise (or as needed for adobo mayo) | cooking oil (for deep frying)
instructions:
Slice the pork belly slab into two equal pieces lengthwise.  | In a pot, combine water, soy sauce, white vinegar, laurel leaves, peppercorn, minced garlic and two pieces of pork belly slab. | Simmer it for about 40 minutes or until tender. Remove and set aside the slabs. Let pork cool down. Reserve the adobo braising liquid. | To make adobo rice, in a saute pan, saute minced garlic with 1 teaspoon adobo oil from the adobo braising liquid. Add the day-old rice and season it with the 3 tablespoons adobo braising liquid. Set aside. | For the adobo mayo, mix mayonnaise with 2 to 3 tablespoons adobo braising liquid according to your taste. Set aside.  | After cooling down the slabs, dredge each slab with cornstarch. (Make sure to remove excess cornstarch.) 
  | In a saucepan, deep fry the adobo slabs over medium heat for about 10 minutes. | Assemble the adobo slabs on top of the adobo rice, drizzle it with adobo mayo, and garnish it with chili flakes or onion leeks.
ingredient_names: pork | laurel | black peppercorn | day old rice | cornstarch | mayonnaise | deep frying

ingredients: 2 tablespoons annatto seeds (atsuete seeds) | 2 tablespoons hot water | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 Small red onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 Small tomato (deseeded and chopped) | 500 Grams ground pork | 1 1/2 cups water | 2 medium Potatoes (cubed) | 1 large carrot (cubed) | 1 tablespoon patis (fish sauce) | 1 Cup Corn kernels | 1/2 Cup raisins | 1/2 Cup frozen green peas (thawed) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Soak atsuete seeds in hot water for at least 15 minutes. Drain and set aside. | Heat oil in a pot. Saute onion and garlic until fragrant. Add tomato and saute until softened. | Add pork and cook until light browned, about 5 minutes. Add water and simmer until pork is tender, about 15 to 20 minutes. | Add potatoes and carrots and continue simmering until tender, about 5 minutes. | Once almost all water has evaporated, add fish sauce and mix. Add corn, raisins, and green peas. Mix until heated through. Season with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: annatto seed | hot water | vegetable oil | tomato | pork | potato | carrot | corn kernel | raisin | green pea

ingredients: 4 medium eggplants | 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 Small red onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic | 1 Small tomato (deseeded and diced) | 150 Grams chicken breast fillet (diced) | 1/2 teaspoon Salt (or to taste) | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper (or to taste) | 1/4 Cup Cheese (grated) | 3 large eggs | 1/2 teaspoon Salt (or to taste) | 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil (divided)
instructions: Grill eggplants over an open flame until skin is blackened. Let cool slightly, then peel off skin. Gently flatten eggplants using a fork. Set aside. | Make the chicken filling: Heat oil in a pan. Saute onion and garlic until fragrant. Add tomato and saute until softened. Add chicken and season with salt and pepper. Saute until chicken is cooked. Transfer chicken to a bowl. Add cheese and mix. Set aside. | Combine eggs, salt, and flour in another bowl. Beat until well combined. | Place 1 eggplant on a small plate. Take a portion of the chicken filling and spread on top of the eggplant. Spoon over some of the egg mixture to cover the surface. | Heat 1/2 tablespoon oil in a frying pan. Slide eggplant into the pan. Fry until the underside is golden brown. Carefully flip the eggplant and cook the other side until golden. Drain cooked tortang talong on paper towels. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Serve warm.
ingredient_names: eggplant | vegetable oil | tomato | chicken | cheese | egg | all purpose flour

ingredients: 1 kilo Shrimp (antennas removed/trimmed, legs trimmed) | 10 to 15 cloves Garlic (peeled) | 1 330-ml can Sprite (or any lemon-lime soda) | 1 tablespoon rock salt
instructions: Arrange the shrimp in a large pan. Add the garlic and pour in the can of Sprite. Season with salt. Cover the pan and heat over medium heat. | Bring to a boil then simmer for 5 minutes. Remove cover and let the shrimp cook uncovered for 10 minutes. Turn off heat and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: antenna removed trimmed | any lemon lime soda | rock salt

ingredients: 1 kilo tulingan (or bullet tuna) | 15 pieces kamias (or 10 dried kamias) | 1/4 Cup rock salt | banana leaves (as needed)
instructions: Clean the tulinganwellandremove the gills and innards. (Make sure all the blood has come out.) | Make a slice alongthe body of the fish, makingone horizontal line. Rub rock salt all over the fishandinside the fish. Wrap each head of the fish with banana leaves. | Place the fish in the pot and cover the fish with water. Add the kamias, bring to a boil, thenlet it simmer for 4 to 5 hours, covered. Add water as needed until super tender.
ingredient_names: bullet tuna | dried kamias | rock salt | banana

ingredients: 1/2 800-gram pack vermicelli noodles (sotanghon) (soaked in hot water, drained, chopped into 2-inch strands) | 4 10-gram packs Dried Wood Ear Mushrooms (Tenga Ng Daga) (soaked in hot water, drained, chopped) | 1 medium red onion (peeled, finely chopped) | 2 cloves Garlic (peeled, finely chopped) | 1 medium carrot (peeled, grated) | 1/4 kilo ground pork | 1/4 Cup patis (fish sauce) | 2 tablespoons sugar | 1/2 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper (or to taste) | 1/2 teaspoon Salt (or to taste) | 18 pieces dried rice paper | 1 1/2 tablespoons fresh calamansi juice | 2 1/2 tablespoons sugar | 2 tablespoons patis (fish sauce) | 1/4 Cup water | 2 cloves Garlic (peeled, chopped) | 1 teaspoon ginger (peeled, chopped) | 1 piece siling labuyo (chopped or to taste) | 3 small heads Romaine lettuce (washed, dried, separated) | water (as needed) | cooking oil (for deep frying)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine sotanghon, tenga ng daga, onion, garlic, carrots, and ground pork. Season with patis, sugar, pepper, and salt. Mix well. | Prepare a shallow dish with water. When ready to roll, dunk rice paper briefly in the water and place it on a cutting board. (Do not soak for too long or it will soften and become hard tohandle.) Place about 2 heaping tablespoonfuls of the filling onto one side of the rice paper, leaving enough space to fold.Gently fold the short end of the softened rice paper over the filling. Fold the sides. Tucking the filling in to squeeze out as much air as possible, roll the rice paper tightly closed. Repeat with remaining rice paper and filling. Set aside. | When ready to fry, add enough oil for deep frying in a wok or deep saute pan or pot. Heat over medium heat. Place enough spring rolls in the hot oil so thelumpia do not touch each other. (Rice paper will be sticky.) Fryuntil just crisp.Remove from the oil and drain on a rack. Repeat with remaining lumpia. | Increaseheat to medium-high. Double fry the spring rolls until crisp. Drain well. (No need to fry again if the spring rolls become crisp during the first fry.) | Make the dipping sauce: Combine sugar, patis, calamansi juice, water, garlic, and siling labuyo in a jar. Close and shake or whisk until sugar dissolves. Keep chilled until ready to use. | To serve, slice the spring rolls in half on the diagonal with a knife or cut with scissors.Arrange lettuce leaves on a platter and top with lumpia. serve with dipping sauce.
ingredient_names: 800 vermicelli noodle | dried wood ear mushroom | carrot | pork | dried rice paper | calamansi juice | ginger | labuyo | romaine lettuce | deep frying

ingredients: 4 cups water | 1 large red onion (halved) | 1 whole Garlic (crushed) | 2 tablespoons rock salt | 1 teaspoon ground pepper | 1 teaspoon dried basil (ground) | 1 teaspoon dried thyme (ground) | 4 pieces dried bay leaves | 1 tablespoon whole peppercorns | 1 whole Chicken | 1 bunch lemongrass (tanglad) | 4 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) (divided in half) | 1 liter Cooking oil for deep-frying (more if needed)
instructions: Make poaching liquid: Boil 4 cups of water in a large pot. Add onions, garlic, rock salt, ground pepper, basil, thyme, bay leaves, and whole peppercorn. Bring to a boil then simmer over medium heat. | Stuff the chicken with tanglad. Rub 2 tablespoons patis on the chicken. Let marinate for 5 minutes. | Poach the chicken in the simmering liquid over low-medium heat. (The flesh will turn white but the skin should be intact. One chicken weighing 1 kilo should cook through in approximately 30 minutes.) Do not boil. | Remove the chicken from the poaching liquid. Remove any herbs and spices stuck on the skin. Rub the remaining patis all over the chicken. Let it rest until dry (approximately 10 minutes). | Pre-heat oil in a large pan for deep frying. | Once the chicken is dry and oil is simmering, deep fry it until light golden in color. Flip the chicken as needed. | Remove from the pan, let it rest for 1 minute. Slice and serve! Best served with banana ketchup mixed with Worcestershire sauce.
ingredient_names: whole garlic | rock salt | dried basil | dried thyme | dried bay leave | whole peppercorn | whole chicken | lemongrass | deep frying

ingredients: 1 kilo santol (peeled, seeds removed) | 1 tablespoon Oil | 1 medium-sized red onion (minced) | 1 medium-sized whole garlic (minced) | 1/2 kilo pork (menudo cut) | 2 pieces green chili fingers (siling pang-sigang) (sliced into small pieces) | 2 pieces Thai Red Chili (sliced into small pieces) | 2 tablespoons shrimp paste | 2 cups coconut milk
instructions: Boil santol for 3 to 5 minutes in a large pot. Drain water and then cool. | Grate santol and then strain to remove excess water. Alternatively, use a blender or food processor and process until there are no big chunks left. | In a pan, heat oil and saute onion, garlic, pork, chilis, and shrimp paste over medium fire. | Add grated santol and coconut milk. | Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes or until the oil from the coconut milk and pork is rendered and pork is tender. Serve with steamed rice.
ingredient_names: santol | whole garlic | pork | green chili finger | thai red chili | coconut milk

ingredients: 3 cups dashi stock | 6 tablespoons mirin | 6 tablespoons Japanese soy sauce ((we used Kikkoman)) | 4 tablespoons white sugar | 2 Small white onions (sliced) | 5-6 medium-sized shiitake mushrooms (sliced) | 600 Grams Beef (thinly sliced) | 4 teaspoons spring onions (minced) | 4 large egg yolks (to serve) | steamed rice (to serve)
instructions: Make the Donburi sauce: In a big pot over a low-medium fire, combine dashi, mirin, soy sauce, and white sugar, and mix until sugar dissolves.  | Mix donburi sauce, onions, and mushrooms. Add beef and let simmer over medium heat until the sauce reduces. | To serve, put beef on top of a bowl of cooked rice and pour over the sauce as desired. Add 1 egg yolk in the center of the beef topping and garnish with spring onions. Repeat with remaining beef. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: dashi stock | mirin | japanese soy sauce | shiitake mushroom | beef | green onion | egg yolk | steamed rice

ingredients: 5 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 large red onion (minced) | 1 large ginger (minced) | 2 pieces green chilies (siling pangsigang) | 2 pieces red chili pepper (siling labuyo) | 6 cloves Garlic (minced) | Salt (to taste) | 1 30-gram pack curry powder ((I used green curry mix)) | 1 kilo Pompano (fish cut into small portions) | 3 medium tomatoes (diced) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 1/2 liter water | 1 medium carrot (diced) | 1 Small potato (diced) | 1 Small green bell pepper (diced) | 1 Small cauliflower (sliced) | 1 Small eggplant (sliced diagonally) | 1 200-gram pack coconut cream
instructions: In a pan, saute onion, ginger, green chili, red chili, and garlic in cooking oil. Add a pinch of salt. | Add curry powder mix. | Add and cook pompano fish. Turn the fish to coat fish with the curry mix. | Add tomatoes and a dash of pepper. Add water. | Cover the pan and bring to a boil. | Add the vegetables (carrot, potato, bell pepper, cauliflower, and eggplant), cover the pan, and simmer for 3 minutes. Stir carefully to coat the vegetables. | Add the coconut cream and simmer for 5 minutes. Best served hot with rice.
ingredient_names: ginger | green chily | red chili pepper | 30 curry powder | portion | tomato | carrot | potato | bell pepper | cauliflower | eggplant | 200 coconut cream

ingredients: 500 Grams beef sirloin (thinly sliced and cut into pieces) | 1/4 Cup fresh calamansi juice | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 medium white onions (peeled, sliced into rings) | 4 cups water (or as needed) | ground black pepper (to taste (optional)) | Oil (as needed, for frying)
instructions: In a bowl, combine beef, soy sauce, and calamansi juice. Cover and set aside at least one hour up to overnight. | In a saute pan over high heat, heat enough oil to cover the bottom. Add onions and saute, stirring, until just softened. Remove from heat and set aside. | In the same pan, add sliced beef. Add water. Bring to a boil then simmer until tender. Remove any scum that rises to the surface. Add more water as needed until beef is tender. Once beef is tender, simmer the sauce until reduced and flavorful. Season with a little ground black pepper if desired. | Return onions to the pan and cook until just softened. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: sirloin | calamansi juice

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 3 pieces Garlic (peeled and chopped) | 1 medium red onion (peeled and chopped) | 1/4 kilo pork liver (cubed) | 1/2 kilo pork pigue (cubed medium) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 200-ml pack Tomato sauce | 2 cups water (or as needed) | 1 large potato (peeled, cubed medium) | 1 large carrot (peeled, cubed medium) | 1 155-gram can green peas (drained and rinsed) | 3 regular hotdogs (sliced) | 1/4 Cup raisins | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a medium pot over medium heat, heat oil and then saute garlic and onion. | Add pork liver, and cook for 5 minutes or until just tender. Remove from the pot and set aside. Add hotdogs and cook until lightly browned if desired. Remove and set aside with liver. | Add pork chunks and stir to mix. Pour in soy sauce, tomato sauce, and water. Bring to a boil and then simmer until pork is tender, about 45 minutes. | Add potatoes, carrots, and green peas. Season with ground black pepper. Simmer until potatoes are tender and the mixture has thickened. | Add liver, raisins, and hotdogs. Cook until liver is just heated through. Season with pepper to taste. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: pork liver | pork pigue | 200 tomato sauce | potato | carrot | green pea | regular hotdog | raisin

ingredients: 1/4 Cup cooking oil (divided) | 2 medium talong (eggplant) (cubed) | 1 bundle string beans (sitaw) (cut into 3-inch pieces) | 1 medium red onion (peeled, sliced) | 750 Grams beef cubes | 1 50-gram pack shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) | water (as needed) | 1 teaspoon cornstarch (diluted in 1 tablespoon water) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat, heat half the oil. Fry talong until browned on all sides and tender. Lightly season with salt and ground pepper. Remove from the pot. Add and heat the remaining oil. Add sitaw and fry until just tender. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Remove from the pot and set aside. | Add and saute the onions until translucent. Once fragrant, add the beef. Pile the onions on top of the beef to prevent it from burning as beef sears. Flip beef as needed until all sides are seared. | Add the bagoong and stir. Add just enough water to cover the pork. Bring to a boil then lower heat to a simmer. Cover and simmer beef until tender, about 1 hour, adding water as needed until tender. Alternatively, use a pressure cooker to simmer the beef for 35 minutes. | Once the beef is tender, keep simmering until the liquid is reduced to around a fourth of its original amount. (Taste the sauce and simmer until the sauce is tasty.) | Return talong and sitaw to the pot, and stir. Pour in the cornstarch slurry, and stir to mix. Bring to a simmer and let sauce thicken slightly. Serve with steamed rice.

ingredients: 500 Grams beef brisket (cut into cubes) | 2 tablespoons Oil | 1 tablespoon ginger (minced) | 6 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 1 piece beef bouillon cube | 5 cups water | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/4 Cup white sugar | 1/4 piece cinnamon stick | 2 pieces star anise | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 2 pieces beef bouillon cubes | 4 cups water | 1 teaspoon Garlic powder | 150 Grams fresh miki noodles | 2 tablespoons spring onions (for garnish) | 2 tablespoons fried garlic (for garnish) | 1 piece Hard-boiled egg (for garnish)
instructions: Make beef pares: Season beef cubes with salt and pepper. | Add oil to a pan on medium-high heat. Sear beef until all sides are browned. Set aside. | Add garlic and ginger to the pan. Saute until fragrant. Add the onions and cook until translucent. | Put the beef back in the pan. Add beef bouillon cube and saute with the aromatics for 2 minutes. | Pour in water. Add soy sauce, white sugar, cinnamon, and star anise. Add salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil then lower down the heat to a simmer. Simmer for 1 hour to an hour and a half or until beef is fork-tender. | To make the mami: Dissolve 2 beef bouillon cubes in 4 cups boiling water. Add the garlic powder. Stir to melt. Add the egg noodles and cook until al dente. | To assemble a bowl, transfer broth and egg noodles in a serving bowl. Top with pares, spring onions, fried garlic and half of a hardboiled egg.
ingredient_names: brisket | ginger | beef bouillon cube | cinnamon | star anise | garlic powder | miki noodle | green onion | fried garlic | hard boiled egg

ingredients: 2-3 pieces tofu | 120 Grams mayonnaise | 80 Grams oyster sauce | 20 ml Calamansi Juice | 15 Grams white sugar | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 1 medium-sized white onion (minced) | 1 piece green chili (chopped) | 2 pieces siling labuyo (chopped) | 10 ml cooking oil (more for frying tofu) | 20 Grams Butter
instructions: Deep fry tofu until golden brown, cut into cubes, and set aside. | To make sauce, mix mayonnaise, oyster sauce, calamansi juice, white sugar, and black pepper. Set aside. | In a pan, saute onion, green chili, and siling labuyo. Add the sauce, mix well, and let it simmer. | Put in the tofu cubes and mix well. | In a cast iron pan or sizzling plate, put 10 ml oil and 20 grams butter until it simmers. | Arrange the tofu mixture and garnish with green chili.
ingredient_names: tofu | mayonnaise | oyster sauce | calamansi juice | green chili | labuyo | butter

ingredients: 20 pieces quail eggs | 1 Cup all-purpose flour | 1/4 teasoon orange food coloring (or achuete powder) | 1 Cup water | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper | 1/4 Cup cornstarch
instructions: Boil the quail eggs until hard. Let it cool and remove shells. Set aside. | Combine flour and achuete powder. Add water and mix thoroughly. Add additional achuete powder until you get the color you want. Add salt and pepper to taste. Set aside. | Heat oil for deep frying. Coat the quail eggs in cornstarch and dip them into the batter. Deep fry eggs until cooked.
ingredient_names: quail egg | all purpose flour | teasoon orange food coloring | cornstarch

ingredients: 1 kilo blue crabs (alimasag) (or alimango) | 1 1/2 cups ripe guava (seeds removed) | 4 cups water | 1 medium red onion (sliced) | 5 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 400 ml coconut milk or gata | 1 piece green chili | 1/4 Cup patis (fish sauce) | 3/8 Cup brown sugar | 1 8-gram pack seasoning powder (or 1 broth cube) | 2 bundles kangkong (water spinach) (tender stalks only, cut into 3 inches length) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil (or as needed)
instructions: Remove the claws and legs of raw alimasag by twisiting. | Using a blender, blend the ripe guava with 1 cup of water. Set aside. Do the same with the claws and legs with 3 cups of water in the blender, and strain to remove the shells. Set the liquid aside. | In a pan over medium heat, add 2 tablespoons vegetable oil and saute the onion and garlic. | Pour the guava and alimasag extract, gata, and add green chili. Let it simmer. | Add patis, brown sugar, and seasoning powder or broth cube. Stir and bring to a boil. | Once it starts boiling, add the alimasag. | Cook for about 5 to 10 minutes over medium-high heat or until the liquid thickens and then reduces. | Add kangkong and cook for another 3 minutes. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: blue crab | guava | coconut milk | green chili | brown sugar | broth cube | tender stalk | vegetable oil

ingredients: 1/4 kilo ground pork | 3/4 teaspoon Salt (or to taste) | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper (or to taste) | 1/2 Cup finely grated carrots | 1 teaspoon chili garlic sauce | 2 pieces siling labuyo (chopped) | 8 large Lumpia wrappers (separated) | water (as needed) | cooking oil (for deep frying) | vinegar-soy sauce dipping sauce (to serve)
instructions: In a medium bowl, combine ground pork, salt, pepper, grated carrots, chili garlic sauce, and chili peppers. Mix well. | Place lumpia wrapper on a chopping board. Place about 1 1/2 tablespoons filling onto the wrapper. Wet the edges with water and roll closed. (You can also use a beaten egg if desired.) Repeat with remaining pork filing and lumpia wrappers. Alternatively, freeze these until ready to cook. | When ready to cook, heat enough oil for deep frying in a frying pan oven medium heat. Slice each lumpia in half. Place lumpia halves in the hot oil and fry until cooked through, about 5 minutes. Drain on a rack. Serve with your choice of dipping sauce.
ingredient_names: pork | carrot | chili garlic sauce | labuyo | lumpia wrapper | deep frying | vinegar soy sauce

ingredients: 3 pieces saba bananas (cut to pieces) | 1 medium-sized potato (cut to pieces) | 1 medium-sized carrot (cut to pieces) | 1 medium-sized onion (diced) | 3 medium cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 kg Chicken (chopped up into small pieces) | 1 tablespoon tomato paste | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | ground pepper (to taste) | 1 Cup water | 1 medium-sized red bell pepper (cut into small pieces) | 1 Cup string beans (cut into 2-inch pieces) | Salt | 1 small head cabbage (chopped)
instructions: Fry the bananas, potatoes, and carrots for 2 to 3 minutes on each side in a large pot over medium heat. Remove from the pot and set aside. | Add and saute onion and garlic in the same pot. Add the chicken and cook for 3 minutes. | Mix in tomato paste, soy sauce, and ground pepper. | Add water and bring to a boil for 10 minutes on medium heat. | Stir in the fried bananas, potatoes, and carrots. | Stir in the red bell pepper and string beans. Simmer for 1 minute. | Mix in the cabbage and salt. Stir and cover the pan. Let it simmer for 1 minute. Serve with rice.
ingredient_names: saba banana | potato | carrot | chicken | tomato paste | bell pepper | sitaw | cabbage

recipe_name: Spicy Kangkong And Tofu Stir Fry Recipe
ingredients: 1 500-gram pack firm tofu (tokwa) (drained) | 3 bunches kangkong | 1/4 Cup Oil (for frying tofu) | 2 tablespoons Oil (for sauteing) | 6 large cloves Garlic (minced) | 3 pieces birds eye chili (siling labuyo) (chopped) | 2 tablespoons oyster sauce | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon cornstarch (dissolved in 1/2 cup water) | 1 teaspoon brown sugar
instructions: Cut the tofu into squares and set aside. Separate the leaves from the tender stalks of the kangkong. Cut stems in half. Wash well. Set aside. | Heat oil for frying the tokwa in a pan over medium heat. Fry tofu until golden brown. Set aside. | Meanwhile, in another pan, heat oil for sauteing over high heat. Add garlic and bird's eye chilies, and saute until fragrant. Lower heat to Medium. Add oyster sauce, soy sauce, water/cornstarch mixture, and brown sugar. Cook until slightly thick. | Add kangkong leaves and stems, mix with the sauce until slightly wilted. Add the fried tofu. Cook for 2 minutes. Take the pan off from the heat immediately so as not to overcook the kangkong. Serve.
ingredient_names: 500 firm tofu | kangkong | tofu | labuyo | oyster sauce | cornstarch | brown sugar

ingredients: 1/2 kilo lean ground pork | 1/4 kiilo shrimps (finely chopped) | 1 190-gram block mozzarella cheese (cut into thin strips) | 1 medium red onion (peeled, finely chopped) | 1/2 head Garlic (peeled, finely chopped) | 1 large carrot (shredded) | 2 large eggs (beaten) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 20 to 25 large lumpia wrapper or spring roll wrapper | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | cooking oil for deep-frying (such as vegetable, corn, canola, or peanut oil) (for frying) | water (for sealing lumpia) | Sweet chili sauce (to serve)
instructions: Make the lumpia filling: In a bowl, mix ground pork, chopped shrimps, cheese, onion, garlic, carrot, egg, and soy sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. | Assemble the lumpia: Place 1 to 1 1/2 tablespoons filling on one side of wrapper and wrap tightly, secure wrapper by lightly dabbing water on wrapper edge. | In a wok, heat oil over medium heat and deep fry lumpia at medium to low heat for 2 to 3 minutes or until wrapper turns to golden brown and filling is cooked. Serve with sweet chili sauce.
ingredient_names: lean pork | kiilo shrimp | 190 block mozzarella cheese | carrot | egg | spring roll wrapper | deep frying | lumpia | sweet chili sauce

ingredients: 1 big ampalaya (deseeded and silced thinly) | 3 cups water (for washing) | 2 tablespoons rock salt (for washing) | 1 tablespoon sugar (for washing) | 3 tablespoon cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium red onion (sliced) | 2 tablespoons bottled crab fat paste (aligue) | rock salt (to taste) | ground pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a bowl with 3 cups water, add 2 tablespoons of rock salt and 1 tablespoon sugar. Mix well. Soak the sliced ampalaya in this water-salt-sugar mixture for 30 minutes. After soaking, wash the ampalaya with running water. Set aside and drain. | Heat the oil in a pan, then saute garlic and onion add the aligue then add in the drained ampalaya. Adjust taste with salt and pepper. Let it simmer for 5 minutes. Transfer to a serving plate and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: big ampalaya | washing | bottled crab fat paste

ingredients: 1 kilo chicken breast fillets | 1 tablespoon Garlic powder | 1 tablespoon Onion powder | 1 165-gram pack Cheese (cut into strips) | 1 250-gram pack square spice ham | 1 Cup all-purpose flour | 2 medium eggs (beaten) | 2 cups panko (Japanese breadcrumbs) | Salt (to taste) | ground pepper (to taste) | vegetable oil (for deep frying)
instructions: Sprinkle the chicken breasts with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and onion powder. Toss to coat evenly. | On a cutting board, place a chicken breast and cut it in half. | Slice one side of the chicken, pound until about 1/2 inch (about 1 cm) thick with a meat mallet, rolling pin, or back of the knife. | Place 1 slice of ham on a slice of chicken, then put a stick of cheese on the ham. Evenly roll the chicken.
