Repeat with the remaining ingredients. | After the rolls are made, prepare 3 separate large, wide dishes: one with flour, the second with beaten eggs, and the last with breadcrumbs. Dredge the chicken first in the flour, then dip in the egg, and then roll in the breadcrumbs. You can use toothpicks to secure the rolls. | Meanwhile, preheat a deep pan with 2 inches (5 cm) of oil to 325 degrees F or 170 degrees C on a deep fry thermometer. | Place the breaded chicken cordon bleu in the oil and cook for about 5 minutes per side, or until the outside is an even golden brown. Discard toothpicks. | Cut each roll into 5 equal parts. Serve.
ingredient_names: chicken | garlic powder | onion powder | 165 cheese | 250 square | all purpose flour | egg | panko | vegetable oil

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 1/4 Cup white onion (sliced) | 6 cloves Garlic (whole) | 1/4 Cup tomatoes (sliced) | 1 kilogram squid (cleaned and ink removed) | 1/3 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 piece green finger chili (siling pangsigang) | 1/2 Cup water
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat, and saute the onions, garlic, and tomato until fragrant. | Add in the squid then pour the vinegar and let simmer for 2 minutes. Do not stir. | Lower the heat and add in the soy sauce, green chili, and water. Cook for another 10 to 15 minutes. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: tomato | squid | green finger chili

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 1 Small yellow onion (minced (about 1/8 cup)) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/2 kilogram ground pork | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1/3 Cup carrots (diced) | 1/3 Cup Potatoes (diced) | 1 1/2 cups Tomato sauce | 1/2 Cup water | 10 pieces quail eggs (cooked and shelled) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat saute pan over medium heat. Saute onions until translucent then add the garlic. Cook until fragrant. Add the pork and pour the soy sauce. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes or until the pork turns slightly brown. | Pour in tomato sauce and water, let simmer for another 5 to 8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add the quail eggs in last then cook for another 2 minutes. Serve while warm.
ingredient_names: pork | carrot | potato | tomato sauce | quail egg

recipe_name: Pochero Recipe With Pork And Beans
ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/4 kilo pork kasim (cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes) | 1/4 kilo beef brisket (cubed) | 1/4 kilo Chicken (cut into small pieces) | 2 pieces tomatoes (diced) | 2 tablespoons patis (fish sauce) | 2 cups water | 2 pieces Potatoes (quartered) | 1 390-gram can pork and beans | 1 200-gram pack Tomato sauce | 2 pieces saging na saba (sliced) | 1 bunch bok choy | 1 small head cabbage (quartered) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat the oil in a pot. Saute the onion and then add the garlic. Add the pork cubes, beef chunks, and chicken pieces. Stir in the tomatoes and continue to cook until all the meat have browned. | Pour in the fish sauce. Let it simmer for about 3 to 5 minutes. | Add the potatoes. Add the water and bring it to a boil. Cover the pot and let it simmer until all the meat is tender (about 30 to 40 minutes). | Add the pork and beans and the tomato sauce. Stir. Simmer again for about 5 to 6 minutes. Season with salt. | Add the sliced saging na saba and continue to cook until bananas are tender. Add the bok choy leaves and cabbage, cook for 5 more minutes. Serve.
ingredient_names: pork kasim | beef | chicken | tomato | potato | pork and beans | 200 tomato sauce | na saba | bok choy | cabbage

ingredients: 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium white onion (chopped) | 1 medium carrot (diced small) | 1 380-gram can corned beef | 1 200-gram pack elbow macaroni | 3 cups water | Salt (to taste) | ground pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat, and add garlic, onions, and carrots. Once the onions are translucent, add the corned beef. | Add the elbow macaroni and water. Season with salt and pepper and let it cook for 15 minutes or until the macaroni is cooked to your desired doneness. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: carrot | beef | 200 elbow macaroni

ingredients: 1/4 Cup cooking oil | 4 pieces Chorizo de Bilbao (cut diagonally in half) | 2 stalks Leeks (cut into 2 inch lengths, white and green parts separated) | 1 medium red onion (peeled, quartered) | 1/3 kilo beef cubes (mechado cut) | 1/2 liters water (or as needed) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) (or to taste, more to serve) | 1/4 teaspoon black peppercorns | 4 slices pork pata | 4 pieces chicken parts (breast cut in half and 2 chicken legs) | 2 medium Potatoes (peeled, quartered) | 2 pieces corn (cut into 4 each) | 1 Small cabbage (cut into 8 wedges) | 1 Small Chinese napa cabbage (quartered) | steamed rice (for serving) | siling labuyo (for serving) | calamansi (for serving)
instructions: Heat oil in a large pressure cooker over medium heat. Add chorizo and any chorizo fat to the pot and saute until the oil colors. Transfer to a plate and set aside. | Add onion and white parts of the leeks to the remaining oil, and stir to lightly saute. Add beef chunks, water, patis, and peppercorns. Increase heat to high, and bring to a boil. Remove any scum that rises to the surface. Cover and lock lid, lowering the heat to Low. Simmer for 30 minutes. (Alternatively, simmer for about 1 hour in a covered pot.) | Release the pressure, unlock the lid, then add the pork pata pieces. Bring back to a boil, removing scum as it rises to the surface. Once clear, lock the lid, lower the heat, and simmer for 30 minutes or until both the pork and the beef are tender. Release the pressure. (Alternatively, simmer for about 1 hour in a covered pot.) | Once both pork and beef are tender, add the chicken, corn cobs, and the potatoes. Simmer again, removing scum that rises again, until the chicken pieces are cooked through and potatoes and corn are tender, about 15 minutes. | Add cabbage, Chinese napa cabbage, and green parts of the leeks. Return chorizo back into the pot. Cook until the cabbage pieces are just tender. Serve with steamed rice, more patis, calamansi, and siling labuyo on the side.
ingredient_names: cooking oil | chorizo | stalks leek | beef | black peppercorn | pork pata | chicken | potato | corn | cabbage | chinese napa cabbage | steamed rice | labuyo | calamansi

ingredients: 1 head Garlic (peeled, chopped) | 1 meduim red onion (peeled, chopped) | 2 tablespoons ginger (peeled, chopped) | 1 kilogram pork (menudo cut) | 1/4 Cup brown sugar | 2 pieces star anise (or to taste) | 1 piece pork bouillon cube (or granules) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 3 cups water | cooking oil (as needed) | green onions (Chopped, for garnish)
instructions: In a medium pot over medium heat, heat just enough oil to cover the bottom of the pot. Add garlic and cook until toasted. Strain and remove toasted garlic, leaving the oil in the pot. Reserve toasted garlic, and set aside. | In the pot with the remaining oil, add onions and ginger, and saute just until onions are softened and ginger is aromatic. | Add pork. Let sear. Add brown sugar, star anise, pork bouillon, soy sauce, and water. Add about 1 tablespoon toasted garlic. Bring to a boil, lower heat to a simmer, and then remove any scum that rises to the top. | Cover, and simmer for at least 30 minutes. Remove the lid then simmer another 10 minutes to reduce the soup. Serve sprinkled with toasted garlic and chopped green onion.
ingredient_names: meduim onion | ginger | pork | brown sugar | anise | pork bouillon cube | green onion

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 Small white onion (peeled, sliced thinly) | 2 cloves Garlic (peeled, chopped) | 1 Small potato (peeled, sliced into strips) | 1 Small carrot (peeled, sliced into strips) | 1 small head cabbage (about 250 grams, cored removed, shredded) | 5 medium eggs (beaten) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | ketchup (to serve)
instructions: In an 8-inch frying pan or cast iron pan, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and garlic, and cook until justsoftened. Add potatoes and carrots, and cook until tender. | Add cabbage. Toss using tongs and cook until wilted and softened. Season with salt and ground black pepper to taste. | Season and beat eggsthen pour over thecabbage mixture, stirring if needed to fill the spaces in the pan. Lower heat to low, cover, and cook until the omelet is just set. Remove from heat, slice, and serve.
ingredient_names: potato | carrot | cabbage | egg | ketchup

ingredients: 1/2 kilo sirloin beef (cut into strips) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons brown sugar | 6 to 10 pieces calamansi (depends on the size) | 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 2 large white onions (cut into rings) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Boil the sirloin in water until tender. Transfer to a bowl. | Marinate beef in garlic, soy sauce, brown sugar, calamansi, salt, and pepper for at least 4 hours (better if marinated overnight). | When ready to cook, fry the sirloin in 3 tablespoons cooking oil until browned. Set aside. | In the same pan, saute the onions for one minute. (Onions should be a bit soft but not wilted.) | Transfer the sirloin to a serving plate and top with slightly softened onions.
ingredient_names: sirloin beef | brown sugar | calamansi

ingredients: 1/2 kilo green mussels (tahong) | 1/2 kilo fresh manila clams (halaan) | 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 4 cloves Garlic (peeled and smashed) | 1 400-ml can coconut milk | 1 teaspoon white sugar | 1 tablespoon grated ginger | 5 pieces bird's eye chili (siling labuyo) (sliced) | 3 stems Lemongrass (tied in a knot) | Salt (to taste) | ground pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a double boiler, steam the shellfish for 2to 3 minutes. Set aside. | Saute the garlic and ginger in cooking oil until lightly browned. Add the coconut milk, sugar, lemongrass, and siling labuyo. Add salt and pepper to taste. Let it simmer for 5 minutes. | Add the shellfish. Simmer again for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: green mussel | manila clam | milk | ginger | bird's eye chili | stems lemongrass

recipe_name: Creamy Chicken Mushroom with Kangkong Recipe
ingredients: 1/4 Cup canola oil | 4 pieces chicken breasts (cut in half) | 4 cloves Garlic (peeled, sliced) | 1 284-gram can mushrooms (pieces and stems, drained) | 1 1/2 tablespoons all-purpose flour | 1 1/4 cups chicken stock (or water) | 1 154-ml can evaporated milk | 1 teaspoon liquid seasoning (Optional) | 1 bundle kangkong leaves (rinsed) | Salt (to taste) | ground pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat enough oil in a skillet or saute pan for pan frying. Season chicken breasts on both sides with salt and ground black pepper, to taste. Place chicken skin side down in the oil. Fry chicken on both sides until cooked through. Transfer to a plate, and set aside. | Remove oil, leaving just enough for sauteing. Add garlic and cook until just translucent and softened. Add the mushrooms, and saute until browned about 3 minutes. Sprinkle and stir in flour. While stirring, add water and then evaporated milk. Add liquid seasoning, if using. Stir to combine, scrubbing any fond on the bottom of the pan that hasn t loosened into the sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. | Stir in kangkong leaves and cook until just wilted. Return chicken to the pan, and cook until just heated through. Adjust seasoning accordingly. Spoon sauce over the chicken, and serve while hot. READ THESE: MORE CREAMY CHICKEN RECIPES Pan-fried Chicken in Garlic Cream Sauce Recipe Pan-Fried Chicken with Calamansi Sauce Recipe
ingredient_names: canola oil | chicken | all purpose flour | chicken stock | milk | liquid | kangkong

ingredients: 2 bunches dahon ng kamote (with stalks) | 2  salted eggs | 2  ripe tomatoes | 1/2  red onion ((leave 5mins in cold water with salt), sliced thinly) | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1 tablespoon brown sugar | 1 tablespoon cane vinegar | a pinch of Pepper (to taste)
instructions: Make vinaigrette: Mix salt, brown sugar, cane vinegar, and a pinch of pepper in a small bowl. Mix until dissolved. | Boil the salted egg. | Blanch the dahon ng kamote (make sure it s washed and clean) for 30 seconds. Soak in icy cold water and then squeeze lightly. Remove excess water but do not over-squeeze. | Combine the dahon ng kamote, tomatoes, onion, and the vinaigrette sauce until flavored evenly. Place the sliced salted eggs on top. READ THESE: MORE SALAD RECIPES Pinoy Fiesta Macaroni Salad Recipe Crab Stick (Kani) Salad Recipe
ingredient_names: dahon ng | egg | tomato | cold water | brown sugar | cane vinegar | a pinch pepper

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 1 tablespoon Butter | 3 pieces Chorizo de Bilbao (sliced on the diagonal) | 1 medium red onion (peeled, chopped) | 4 pieces chicken breast fillets (cubed medium) | 1 large potato (peeled, cubed medium) | 1 large carrot (peeled, cubed medium) | 1 400-gram can whole mushrooms (drained) | 1 68-gram packet cream of mushroom soup | 500 ml water | 1 154-ml can evaporated milk | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a large saute pan over medium heat, heat oil then add butter. Once hot and melted, saute chorizo until pieces start to brown. Remove with a slotted spoon and set aside. Saute onion until softened. | Add and cook chicken cubes in batches, letting the chicken sear until just browned before stirring. Lightly season chicken with salt and ground pepper. Remove chicken from the pan, transfer to the chorizo, and set aside. | Add potatoes, carrots, and mushrooms. Cook until seared, stirring occasionally. | Dissolve cream of mushroom soup powder in water. Pour it into the pot with vegetables. Bring to a boil to thicken and then simmer until the vegetables are cooked through. Pour in evaporated milk, stirring until combined. Add chicken and chorizo back to the pot, and then simmer until chicken chunks are cooked through. Taste and season with salt and pepper to taste before serving. READ THESE: MORE CHICKEN PASTEL RECIPES WATCH: This Creamy Chicken Pastel Tastes Like Home Chicken Pastel Recipe
ingredient_names: butter | the diagonal | chicken | potato | carrot | whole mushroom | 68 cream mushroom soup | milk

ingredients: 3 tablespoons olive oil | 4 tablespoons large garlic (minced) | 1/4 teaspoon paprika | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 500 Grams Beef (tapa cut) | 1/2 Cup button mushrooms (sliced) | 4 tablespoons liquid seasoning | 3 tablespoons oyster sauce | 4 tablespoons salted butter | 4 tablespoons garlic flakes (sliced, for garnish) | green onions (Chopped, for garnish)
instructions: Mix oil, garlic, paprika, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. Add beef tapa. Marinate for 10 minutes. | Saute marinated beef tapa in a pan. Add mushroom and continue sauteing for another 3 minutes. | Add oyster sauce and liquid seasoning. Cook for 2 minutes. | Add butter. Once melted, remove from heat. Garnish with garlic flakes and green onions.
ingredient_names: olive oil | paprika | beef | button mushroom | liquid | oyster sauce | butter | garlic flake | green onion

ingredients: 1 kilogram mussels | 3 Small red bell pepper | 1 piece birds eye chili | 1/2 medium-sized red onion | 1 thumb-sized ginger | 4 cloves Garlic | 1 tablespoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper | 4 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 tablespoon oyster sauce | 1 teaspoon brown sugar
instructions: Wash mussels and soak in water for an hour. Rinse mussels. Set aside. | While soaking the mussels, prepare other ingredients. Chop bell pepper, chili, onions, ginger, and garlic into small sized pieces. | Saute ginger and garlic. Add mussels and saute together. Add salt and pepper and mix. Let it cook for 15 minutes, turn off heat, and remove leftover sauce. Let cool for 10 to 15 minutes. Remove each mussel from the shells. | In a pan with hot oil, saute chopped bell pepper and chili, add mussels, and stir. Add oyster sauce plus salt and pepper to taste. | Add onions, stir, then add sugar. Stir and let cook for another 3 minutes.
ingredient_names: mussel | bell pepper | bird | ginger | oyster sauce | brown sugar

ingredients: 1 1/3 kilograms pigs heart and lungs (boiled in 10 cups of water, 3 tablespoons of white vinegar, and 1/4 cup sliced ginger) | 1 medium-sized carrot (minced) | 1 medium-sized radish (minced) | 3 cups kangkong stalks (minced) | 1/2 Cup annatto water (diluted from 1/8 cup annatto seeds and 1/2 cup hot water) | 1/4 Cup ginger (minced) | 3 pieces siling labuyo | 3 pieces dried bay leaves | 2 pieces green chili | 3 tablespoons cane vinegar (or white vinegar) | 1/4 Cup Calamansi Juice | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 medium-sized red onion (chopped) | 1/2 Cup water | 2 tablespoons cornstarch (dissolved in 1/4 cup water) | 1 8-gram pack Maggi Magic Sarap All-in-One Seasoning | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a wok. Saute onion, garlic, and ginger. Cook until aromatic, about 30 seconds. | Put the minced pig's lungs and heart and stir. Add the dried bay leaves, siling labuyo, and green chili. Stir. | Pour in the annatto water. Cook for 20 minutes or until liquid is reduced. | Add minced carrot, radish and red bell pepper. Stir and pour 1/2 cup water. Let it simmer for 10 minutes or until liquid has evaporated. | Pour calamansi juice, stir and simmer again for another 3 minutes. | Season with salt and pepper. Add all-around seasoning and vinegar. Let it boil for 5 minutes over medium-high heat. | Add the minced kangkong stalk and let it cook for 5 minutes. | Lastly, pour in the cornstarch water to make the sauce thick. Simmer for 2 minutes. Then serve. READ THESE: MORE BOPIS RECIPES WATCH: This Is How You Make Bopis At Home Bopis Recipe
ingredient_names: pigs heart and lungs | carrot | radish | kangkong stalk | annatto water | ginger | labuyo | dried bay leave | green chili | calamansi juice | cornstarch

ingredients: 4 tablespoons cooking oil | 1/2 thumb-sized ginger (julienned) | 6 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 medium white onion (sliced) | 1 1.2 kilogram whole chicken (cut up) | 200 ml coconut milk | 1 piece green chili fingers (siling pang-sigang) | 6 tablespoons Vinegar | 4 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | Salt (to taste) | ground pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat the cooking pot over medium heat, and pour in the oil. Saute the ginger, garlic, and onion. | Add the chicken and cook until it renders its fat. | Pour in the coconut milk and bring to boil. At this point you can add green chili and vinegar. | Lower down heat setting and cover the pan. Cook for 20 to 25 minutes or until chicken is tender. | Add the fish sauce. Season with salt and pepper. | Set aside 3/4 of the sauce and reduce the remaining sauce by increasing the heat to High. Wait until sauce curdles and the coconut milk separates into curds and coconut oil. | Pour the reserved sauce back into the pot, then cook and reduce a little more until the sauce thickens. | Turn off the heat then transfer to a serving plate. Serve while hot. Best paired with hot rice.
ingredient_names: ginger | whole chicken | coconut milk | green chili finger

ingredients: 300 Grams Korean glass noodles | 250 Grams mixed vegetables (cut into bite size pieces) | 4 large eggs | 2 medium-sized red onion (sliced) | 1 clove Garlic (chopped) | 1 Small ginger (sliced) | 397 Grams Chinese pork stew | 1/2 Cup water | 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 2 tablespoons Pepper | 1 tablespoon white sugar | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon Fish sauce
instructions: Soak the noodles in warm water for 20 minutes before cooking. Set aside. | Cook the eggs, scrambled. Cut to small pieces and set aside. | Stir fry the garlic, onion, and ginger for about a minute or until garlic is slightly brown. | Add the mixed vegetables and stir fry. (I used sliced carrots, green beans, and cabbage.) Add about half a cup of water and stir for 8 to 10 minutes. | Drain noodles from its cooking water and add to the vegetables. | Add the canned stewed pork, oil, pepper, sugar, soy sauce, and fish sauce. | Add the shredded eggs. Give it a good stir and taste a bit to check if more seasoning is needed before serving.
ingredient_names: korean glass noodle | vegetable | egg | ginger | chinese pork stew

recipe_name: Air Fryer Max's-Style Fried Chicken Recipe
ingredients: 1 1.4-kilo whole Chicken | 1/4 Cup rock salt | 1 teaspoon ground black pepper (or to taste) | 2 liters water (or as needed) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis)
instructions: Cut chicken in half through the backbone and the breast. Place chicken in a container with a lid. Rub the salt all over the chicken and season with ground black pepper. Pour enough water to cover. Place a plate on top to weigh down the chicken and ensure it s completely submerged in the brine. Cover and set aside for at least 4 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. | When ready to air fry, preheat the air fryer for 5 minutes at 350 degrees F or 180 degrees C. | Remove a half chicken from the brine and pat dry as much as possible. Pour or brush the patis all over the chicken. (Reserve the other half chicken in the brine for another meal.) Place half chicken in the air fryer basket. | Air fry the half chicken for 30 minutes, checking the fat from the chicken skin has rendered and beginning to turn crispy. (Cover any parts that are browning faster than others with foil, i.e. wingtips.) | Check doneness with a meat thermometer or pierce chicken in the thigh part for clear juices before removing from the air fryer basket. (Repeat with the other half chicken if desired.) Serve with banana ketchup, Worcestershire sauce, and hot sauce.
ingredient_names: 1 4 whole chicken | rock salt

ingredients: 1 200-gram pack spaghetti noodles | 6 cups water | 1 piece chicken cube | 1 150-gram can Meatloaf | 1 Cup evaporated milk | 3/4 Cup cabbage (minced) | 3/4 Cup carrots (minced) | 3/4 Cup malunggay | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Boil water in a medium pot. Add and then cook the spaghetti. | Stir continuously then add the meatloaf, evaporated milk, and chicken cube. Add some salt to taste. | When the pasta is al dente, add all the veggies and simmer for two minutes only. Turn off heat and serve.
ingredient_names: 200 spaghetti noodle | chicken cube | meatloaf | milk | cabbage | carrot | malunggay

ingredients: 500 Grams chicken wings | 1  large onion | 3 pieces bay leaves | chili flakes (to taste) | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 1/3 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/3 Cup Vinegar | 1 tablespoon sugar | 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1  potato (sliced thinly) | Oil (for frying)
instructions: Lightly season the chicken wings with salt and pepper. Heat up your pan and pre-heat the oven to 350 degrees F or 180 degrees C. | Pour oil into the pan, and let it heat up. Pan-fry the chicken wings until slightly brown under medium-high heat, then set aside. | Saute the onions first, then garlic, then chili flakes, then the bay leaves. Saute until garlic has browned and onions have caramelized. | Add in the chicken and toss it together for 2 minutes. | Arrange the chicken in the pan, then pour in the vinegar. Let it cook for 1 to 2 minutes under medium high heat. Do not touch it. Add the soy sauce and let it cook for 1 to 2 minutes. | Add the sugar and let it dissolve. Season with pepper to taste. Once satisfied, let it simmer for 10 to 12 minutes. | Transfer the chicken into a baking dish and bake it for 15 to 20 minutes or until the sauce or gravy evaporates in the heat. | While baking, lightly season the potato slices with salt and pepper. Fry it until it s golden brown and crispy (depends on the thickness of your cut). Set aside. | When ready to serve the chicken in your serving dish, add in potato chips. Enjoy with rice or as is.
ingredient_names: chicken | bay leave | chili flake | potato

ingredients: 500 Grams Beef (cut into strips) | 2 cups water | 5 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1  medium onion (chopped) | 2 pieces thumb-sized ginger (minced) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1/4 Cup brown sugar | 3 pieces star anise | 1/2 teaspoon ground pepper | 1/4 teaspoon Salt | 1 tablespoon cooking oil | 1 tablespoon cornstarch | 1 tablespoon Butter | toasted fried garlic (Optional)
instructions: Season the beef with salt and pepper. | In a pan over medium heat, put one tablespoon of cooking oil. | Saute garlic, onions and ginger. (These aromatics bring in the savory flavor and aroma to our dish.) | Add the beef and continue to saute until it turns brown. | Pour in water and add the star anise. | Simmer for at least 30 minutes on low heat or until the meat becomes tender. | Add the soy sauce and sugar, bring it to a boil, then add the cornstarch (dissolved in water). | Cook for about 10 minutes until the sauce thickens. | Add the butter to enhance the flavor. Garnish with fried toasted garlic. Serve.
ingredient_names: beef | ginger | brown sugar | star anise | cornstarch | butter | fried garlic

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 Small red onion (peeled, quartered) | 1 Small tomato (quartered) | 1 1/2 liters water | 1 20-gram pack sinigang sa sampaloc mix | 1 small piece white radish (labanos) (peeled, sliced into rounds) | 5 pieces okra (sliced) | 1 medium talong (eggplant) (trimmed, cut into quarters) | 1/2 bunch string beans (sitaw) (cut into 3-inch lengths) | 1/2 bunch kangkong (leaves and tender stems) | siling pangsigang (Optional)
instructions: In amedium pot over medium heat, heat oil. Add onion and tomatoes andsaute until just translucent and the tomatoes softened.Pour in water and sinigang mix.Stir to dissolve. Bring to a boil. | Add labanos and simmer until almost tender. Add okra, talong, and sitaw,and simmer just until tender. Stir in kangkong leavesand tender stems. Add siling pangsigang, if using. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: tomato | 20 sinigang sa sampaloc mix | white radish | okra | quarter | sitaw | kangkong | pangsigang

ingredients: 1 liter water | 1 Small ginger (cut into 4) | 1 medium red onion (cut into 2) | 6 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 6 pieces bay leaves | 1 tablespoon dried rosemary | 1 stalk onion leek (cut into 4) | 1 tablespoon black peppercorns | 5 tablespoons Salt | 1 kilograms chicken drumsticks | 4 medium Potatoes (cut into 4) | 2 medium carrots (cut into 6) | 2 cups coconut cream (or kakang gata) | 1 Cup water | 3 tablespoons yellow curry powder | 1 tablespoon paprika | Salt (to taste) | ground pepper (to taste) | 2 medium sweet green bell pepper (cut into 1 inch strips) | 1/4 Cup coconut oil (for frying)
instructions: Prepare the poaching liquid by putting the water, ginger, onion, garlic cloves, bay leaves, rosemary, onion leek, black pepper, and 5 tablespoons salt into a medium casserole. Turn the burner to High. Bring to a boil. Put the chicken and turn down the burner to Medium. Boil again for 30 minutes. Remove the chicken from the liquid. Set aside. | In a saucepan, fry the potatoes and carrots in the coconut oil until brown. Set aside. | In a large casserole, add the coconut cream, 1 cup water, curry powder, and paprika. Mix well and bring to boil. | Add the cooked chicken. Add the potatoes and carrots. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer. | Turn off the burner and add the sweet bell pepper. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: ginger | bay leave | dried rosemary | onion leek | black peppercorn | chicken | potato | carrot | coconut cream | yellow curry powder | paprika | sweet bell pepper | coconut oil

ingredients: 1 Cup short grain rice (Dinorado) (rinsed) | 1/2 Cup Glutinous rice (malagkit) (rinsed) | 1 1/2 cups water (or as needed) | 1/4 Cup cooking oil | 1 head Garlic (chopped) | 1 500-gram pack Beef tapa (finely chopped) | 2 large eggs (beaten slightly) | 1 Cup quick-melting cheese (grated) | 1/2 Cup mayonnaise | spiced vinegar (to serve) | Pickled Vegetables (Atsara) (to serve) | banana ketchup (to serve) | Nori sheets (dried seaweed) (to serve)
instructions: Cook the rice in a rice cooker. Fluff the rice and let cool until warm. Transfer 3 cups cooked rice into a 8-inch round glass baking dish. Set aside. | Meanwhile, in alarge frying pan over medium heat, heat oil. Add garlic and cook until toasted. Remove from the heat, leaving the oil in the pan. Sprinkle half the garlic over the rice, reserving the remaining toasted garlic to serve on the side. | Add the tapa to the pan with the remaining oil. Spread out the tapa in a single layer in the pan tominimize steaming andletcook. Simmer the tapa until all the juices have evaporated and begin to fry in the oil. Saute, stirring to prevent burning, and cook until the tapa has caramelized. Remove from heat and set aside. | In the same pan, scramble and cook the eggs to your desired doneness. Remove from the heat and set aside. | Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F or 180 degrees C. | Mix the mayonnaise and cheese in a bowl.Scatter the cooked tapa and scrambled eggs over the garlic-topped rice. Coverthe tapa and eggs with thecheese-mayo mixture. Place in thepreheated oven and bake for 20 minutes or until the cheese has melted and begun to brown. Servewhile hot with seasoned crispynori sheets, atsara,vinegar, and banana ketchup.
ingredient_names: short grain rice | glutinous rice | cooking oil | 500 beef tapa | egg | quick melting cheese | mayonnaise | vegetable | banana ketchup | nori sheet

recipe_name: Spicy Sauteed Hot Dog with Ketchup Recipe
ingredients: 5 regular hot dogs (sliced diagonally) | 1 meduim white onion (peeled, sliced into rings) | 1/4 Cup banana ketchup (or to taste) | 2 tablespoons sriracha hot sauce (or to taste) | siling labuyo (chopped, as garnish) | ground black pepper (to taste) | cooking oil (as needed)
instructions: In a frying pan over medium heat, heat enough oil to coat the bottom of the pan. Add sliced hot dogs and saute until edges are just turning brown. Remove from heat. | Add onions to the remaining oil. Saute in the hot oil until just translucent and softened. Return the hot dogs to the pan. | Add ketchup, sriracha, and season with ground black pepper to taste. Stir. Cook until just heated through. Stir in siling labuyo, if using. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: regular hot dog | meduim onion | banana ketchup | sriracha hot sauce | garnish

ingredients: 1 tablespoon cooking oil (plus more for frying) | 1/2 kilogram ground pork | 6 cloves Garlic (peeled, smashed well) | 2 tablespoons paprika | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper (or to taste) | 1 1/2 teaspoons Salt (or to taste) | 1 tablespoon white vinegar (sukang puti) | 15 pieces small lumpia wrappers | water (or egg wash, for sealing) | spiced vinegar (to serve) | Garlic Mayonnaise (to serve)
instructions: In a medium pan over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the ground pork and spread out evenly in the pan. Sear the ground pork until browned. Crumble and flip to cook the pork until no longer pink, no liquid remains, and that natural fat has been rendered. | Add the garlic and saute in the pork fat until justlightly golden brown.Season with paprika, pepper, and salt to taste, and stir to mix.Add the vinegar and let simmer until evaporated. Stir. Remove from the pan, transfer to a container, and let cool. Freeze for 30 minutes. | Set up your lumpia wrapping station: separated lumpia wrappers, chopping board or plate, a small bowl of water or egg wash, and a container for the finished rolls.  | Lay a lumpia wrapper on the chopping board. Spoon about 2 tablespoons filling onto the bottom center of thewrapper and form into a loose log. Wet the edges with water. Fold the bottom of the wrapper over the chorizo filling, fold the sidestowards the center, then roll closed. Repeat with lumpia wrappers and filling. Freeze or store until ready to cook. | When ready to cook, heat enough oil in a frying pan for pan frying over medium heat. Add the chorizo lumpia and fry until the wrapper is crispy and golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with spicy vinegar or a garlic mayo. | Make an easy garlic mayonnaise: Smash 2 cloves garlic with a pinch of salt, and ground pepper each until it becomes a paste.Mix garlic paste into 1/2 cup mayonnaise and 1 teaspoon sukang puti. Seasonto taste.
ingredient_names: pork | paprika | lumpia wrapper | egg wash | garlic mayonnaise

ingredients: 1 1/4 kilogram pork pata | 2 teaspoon Salt | 1 tablespoon cooking oil | 2 pieces fresh sweet corn (cut into three pieces) | 2 medium-sized red onions (finely chopped) | 2 teaspoons whole black peppercorns | 1 piece pork bouillon cube | 1 1/2 liters hot water | 2 pieces saba bananas (cut into three pieces) | 8 pieces marble potatoes | 2 bunches native pechay | 1 medium cabbage (chopped) | fish sauce (patis) (to serve) | calamansi (to serve) | red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (to serve)
instructions: Gently rub the pork pata with salt then heat up cooking oil in a casserole or large pot. Place the pork in the pot. Sear for 3 minutes on both sides then place the pork in a pressure cooker. | Add in sweetcorn, red onion, whole peppercorns, and pork bouillon cube. | Fill with hot water then cover and tightly seal. Pressure cook for 25 minutes until the pork pata is tender. Reminder: Please make sure that the pressure is released before opening the pressure cooker for safety. | Set aside the tender pork pata. Place the sweetcorn in the casserole. Add the saba banana and marble potatoes, and pour in the remaining broth from the pressure cooker. Bring to boil and simmer for 5 minutes. | Add the native pechay then bring to boil for another 2 minutes then add the cabbage. | Cover and simmer for another 2 minutes and place the tender pork pata back in the pot on top. Serve hot with fish sauce, calamansi, and red hot chili as condiment.
ingredient_names: pork pata | sweet corn | whole black peppercorn | pork bouillon cube | hot water | saba banana | marble potato | native pechay | cabbage | calamansi | red chili pepper

ingredients: 1 kilogram chicken fillets (cubed) | 1/2 Cup all-purpose flour | 1 large Egg | 1 teaspoon coarsely ground black pepper (more to taste) | 1/2 Cup brown sugar | 1/4 Cup fish sauce (patis) | 1/4 Cup water | 1/4 Cup local white vinegar (or sukang puti) | 1/2 medium red onion (peeled, sliced) | 2 tablespoons fresh ginger (peeled, cut into matchsticks) | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 2 pieces bird's eye chili (siling labuyo) (chopped, or to taste) | 1 tablespoon green onions (Chopped, for garnish) | Oil (for frying) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: In a large bowl, season chicken fillet chunks with salt and coarsely ground black pepper and mix in the egg. Sprinkle in flour and roughly stir until chicken pieces are just coated. (Any dry spots are acceptable.) | Heat enough oil in a wok over medium heat for pan frying, about 2 inches deep in the center. Add battered chicken in batches and fry until just cooked through and turning a golden brown. Remove from the oil and repeat until all the chicken pieces are cooked. Set chicken aside. Drain the wok of oil, leaving behind about 1 to 2 tablespoons. | Meanwhile, in a saucepan over medium-low heat, combine sugar, fish sauce, vinegar, water, onion, garlic, ginger, ground pepper, and chili. Bring to a boil then simmer until sugar has dissolved and mixture has thickened to a syrup consistency. | Transfer the thickened sauce to the wok over medium heat and bring back to a simmer. Return chicken to the wok and toss with the sauce until coated. Remove from the heat and serve topped with more coarsely ground pepper, siling labuyo, and green onions.
ingredient_names: chicken | all purpose flour | egg | brown sugar | local vinegar | matchstick | bird's eye chili | green onion

ingredients: 1/4 Cup lime-flavored soda (Sprite or 7up) | 1/3 Cup brown sugar | 1/3 Cup banana ketchup | 1/4 Cup sriracha hot sauce | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 piece bird's eye chili (siling labuyo) (more to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 1/2 kilogram pork kasim with fat (cubed and sliced thinly)
instructions: Combine lime soda, sugar, banana ketchup, hot sauce, soy sauce, garlic, and siling labuyo in a bowl. Season with ground black pepper. Mix well. Reserve 1/2 cup marinade for basting and serving on the side. | Add pork to the marinade, making sure each is coated, and cover. Let marinate overnight or up to two days. Soak bamboo sticks in water overnight. | When ready to grill, prepare a charcoal grill, or use a grill pan. Thread marinated pork onto the bamboo skewers, adding first a piece of pork fat before the meatier cuts. | Grill skewers until charred. Flip, brush the cooked side with the reserved marinade, and grill until cooked through. Serve while hot and with extra marinade on the side.
ingredient_names: soda sprite | brown sugar | banana ketchup | sriracha hot sauce | bird's eye chili | pork kasim

ingredients: 1 whole Chicken (roasted) | 3 pieces laurel leaves | 4 pieces green bell pepper (or green jalapeno) | 4 pieces red bell pepper (or red jalapeno) | 1/2 teaspoon black peppercorns | 3 tablespoons brown sugar | 4 tablespoons white vinegar | 1 whole red onion (sliced into four pieces) | 4 clove Garlic | 2 cups water | 1 tablespoon cornstarch | 1 Cup lechon sauce
instructions: Chop the roasted chicken into bite-sized pieces. | Mix the laurel leaves, green bell pepper, red bell pepper, peppercorns, brown sugar, white vinegar, onion, garlic, and water together in a large pot or saucepan over medium heat. | Add the chicken. Let it simmer until the chicken is more tender than usual. | While simmering, stir the cornstarch in a half cup of room temperature water then add directly into the pan while stirring. Let the mixture become thick before serving.
ingredient_names: whole chicken | laurel | bell pepper | black peppercorn | brown sugar | whole onion | cornstarch | lechon sauce

recipe_name: Ginataang Kalabasa with Pork Luncheon Meat Recipe
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil (or as needed) | 1 340-gram can Spam (cubed) | 1 medium red onion (peeled and sliced) | 1 tablespoon shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) (or to taste) | 1/4 chunk squash (kalabasa) (seeds removed, peeled, and cubed) | 1 200-ml pack fresh coconut cream (kakang gata) | 1/2 Cup water (or as needed) | 1 bundle long beans (sitaw) (cut into 3-inch lengths) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a wok over medium heat, heat oil and fry SPAM cubes until browned on all sides. Remove from heat and set aside. | In the same wok, saute onion in the remaining oil. Add bagoong alamang and saute until heated through. Add kalabasa, gata, and water. | Bring mixture to a boil and then simmer until the kalabasa are just tender. Add sitaw and return SPAM to the wok. Mix to coat and simmer until the sitaw turns a bright green color, the gata has thickened, and the kalabasa cubes are all tender. Season with a little ground pepper to taste. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: spam | chunk kalabasa | 200 coconut cream | long bean

ingredients: 350 Grams spaghetti | 250 Grams bacon (chopped) | 1 medium red onion (diced) | 5 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 Cup kimchi (chopped) | 1 tablespoon sesame oil | 1/4 Cup salted butter | 1 Cup heavy cream | 1 Cup parmesan cheese (grated) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 1/2 Cup spring onions (Chopped, for garnish)
instructions: In a pan, boil water in a pot and cook pasta until al dente. Set aside. | In a sauce pan over medium heat, fry chopped bacon. Set aside. | Saute onion and garlic in the bacon fat. Add kimchi and sesame oil. Saute for at least 3 minutes. | Add butter to the pan and melt. Pour in heavy cream and stir. Add bacon. | Add the cooked pasta to the mixture and toss until the pasta is evenly coated with the sauce. Gradually add parmesan cheese and stir continuously. Season with saltand pepper to taste. | Serve warm. Add chopped spring onions and extra bacon on top for garnish.
ingredient_names: spaghetti | bacon | kimchi | sesame oil | butter | heavy cream | parmesan cheese | green onion

ingredients: 2 kilograms pork liempo (lechon kawali cut) | 2 pieces Onions (cut into wedges) | 1 tablespoon rock salt | 2 pieces Knorr Pork Cubes | water (enough to cover the meat) | canola oil (for deep frying) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 1/2 kilograms chicken liver (cut into small cubes) | 2-4 tablespoons Knorr Liquid Seasoning | 4 tablespoons Lady's choice real mayonnaise | 2 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 1 Cup Onions (chopped) | 3-4 pieces red and green chilies (sliced) | salt and ground black pepper to taste
instructions: In a pot with water, boil the whole pork liempo with onions, rock salt, and Knorr pork cubes. Cook until fork tender. | Set aside the pork on a tray, cool and air-dry or keep in the freezer. | Fry pork until skin is crisp and golden brown. | In a pan, saute the liver and garlic. | Mix liquid seasoning, calamansi juice, Lady's Choice Real Mayonnaise, salt, and pepper. | In a bowl, toss in onions, red and green chilies, liver, garlic, and fried pork. | Arrange the pork mixture in a plate. Season with the liquid seasoning mixture.
ingredient_names: pork liempo | rock salt | the meat | deep frying | chicken liver | lady's choice real mayonnaise | calamansi juice | chily

ingredients: 2 tablespoons mayonnaise | 1 teaspoon Garlic powder | 3 tablespoons water | 1 tablespoon liquid seasoning | 1/2 teaspoon sugar (or to taste) | 1/2 kilogram lean pork cuts | 1 500-gram block tofu (cubed, fried) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1/2 head sweet onions (or use red onion) | 2 pieces siling mahaba (long chili) (chopped) | 1/2 teaspoon red chili pepper | 3 tablespoons chicharon (crushed) | 1 tablespoon spring onions (chopped) | Oil (for frying)
instructions: Mix mayonnaise, garlic powder, water, and liquid seasoning in a bowl. Add sugar as preferred. Set aside. | Fry pork in oil in a frying pan until a little golden brown. | Add precooked tofu. | Saute garlic, onion, green chili, and red chili pepper. | Add your sauce and cook for 5 more minutes. | Add the spring onions and crushed chicharon, and serve.
ingredient_names: mayonnaise | garlic powder | liquid | lean pork cut | 500 block tofu | sweet onion | mahaba | red chili pepper | chicharon | green onion

ingredients: 1 Cup green monggo beans (whole) | 4 cups water | 2 tablespoons vegetable cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic (mashed) | 1 piece medium-sized onion (chopped) | 3 pieces medium-sized tomatoes (chopped) | 1/4 kilo pork strips | 2 pieces Knorr Pork Cubes | 1 Cup malunggay leaves | 1/2 cups crushed pork chicharon ((Optional))
instructions: Boil monggo beans in water until tender and set aside. | In a heated pan, saute garlic, onion, and tomatoes. Add the pork strips until browned. | Pour the cooked monggo beans. | Add the Knorr pork cubes. | Add the malunggay leaves. | Pour the monggo in a bowl and top with crushed chicharon.
ingredient_names: green monggo bean | vegetable cooking oil | tomato | pork | malunggay leave | crushed pork chicharon

ingredients: 1/2 kilogram breakfast steak cut of beef | 1/2 Cup water | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1  lemon (juiced (about 2 tablespoons)) | 2 Small red onions (peeled, sliced into rings) | ground black pepper (to taste) | Oil (fro frying)
instructions: In a saute pan over medium-high heat, heat enough oil to cover the bottom. Add thinly sliced beef, a few thin slices at a time, and cook until just cooked through then immediately remove from the oil. Set aside. Repeat in batches until all the beef are cooked through. Set aside. | In the same pan, pour in water, soy sauce, lemon juice, and ground black pepper to deglaze the pan. Bring to a quick boil, then lower heat to a simmer. Once simmering, return the beef and add onions to the pan and cook until just heated through. | Serve while hot with lots of steamed rice.
ingredient_names: breakfast steak beef | lemon | oil fro

ingredients: 125 Grams pork (thinly sliced) | 2 tablespoons Oil | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1  small onion (chopped) | 1/2 Cup shrimps (peeled) | 1/4 Cup chicken liver (cut into bite-sized pieces) | 1  small carrot (cut into thin strips) | 1/4 Cup chicharo (ends trimmed) | 1/4 piece cabbage (sliced into thick strips) | 2 cups water | 2 pieces knorr shrimp cubes | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | ground black pepper, to taste | 1 pack (240 grams) pancit canton noodles
instructions: Saute pork in oil and set aside. | Saute the garlic and onion until browned. | Add the shrimps and cook until it changes color. | Add the pork, then the chicken liver. | Add the carrot, chicharo, and cabbage. Saute for 10 minutes. | Take out the shrimps, meat, and vegetables. Pour the water and add the Knorr Shrimp cubes. | Let it simmer, add soy sauce, and season with black pepper. Cook the pancit canton then add 1/2 of the meat and vegetables and saute. | Transfer the pancit canton on a serving plate and top with half of the mixture.
ingredient_names: pork | shrimp | chicken liver | carrot | chicharo | cabbage | pancit canton noodle

ingredients: 1 tablespoon cooking oil | 1  small onion (chopped) | 2 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 piece (2-inch) ginger (cut into strips) | 1/2 kilo Chicken (cut into 8 pieces) | 1 liter water | 2 pieces Knorr Chicken cubes | 1 piece sayote (sliced) | 2 stalks malunggay
instructions: Saute the garlic, onion, and ginger. | Put in the chicken and cook until color turns light brown. | Pour the water, drop the Knorr chicken cubes, andsimmer for 20 minutes. | Add the green papaya or sayote wedges and simmer for 5 minutes. | Add the malunggay.
ingredient_names: ginger | chicken | sayote | malunggay

ingredients: 6 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons cane vinegar | 5-6 pieces bird's eye chili (siling labuyo) (chopped) | 1 head Garlic (crushed) | 1 tablespoon ground black pepper | 3 tablespoons brown sugar | 500 Grams beef sirloin (sliced into strips) | vegetable oil (for frying)
instructions: Combine soy sauce, vinegar, chilies, garlic, pepper, and brown sugar in a bowl. Mix well. | Add beef strips, and mix. Marinate in the refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight. (Store in the freezer if storing for longer.) | To serve, heat oil in a pan. Pan-fry tapa until just cooked. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: cane vinegar | bird's eye chili | brown sugar | sirloin | vegetable oil

ingredients: 500 Grams pork ((pork cutlet), sliced thinly) | 1/4 Cup pineapple juice | 1 tablespoon brown sugar | 5-6 pieces calamansi (juiced) | 6 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | Oil (for pan frying)
instructions: Mix pineapple juice, brown sugar, calamansi juice, garlic, soy sauce, salt, and pepper in a large bowl. | Add pork cutlets to the marinade. Mix well. Chill for at least 12 hours. | When ready to serve, pan fry in oil until sugars have caramelized. Serve with rice, fried egg, and tomatoes.
ingredient_names: pork | pineapple juice | brown sugar | calamansi | pan

ingredients: 1/4 Cup butter or margarine | 1 Cup red onions (chopped) | 1/2 Cup Garlic (chopped) | 1 Cup wood ear mushrooms (tengang daga) (chopped) | 1 Cup button mushrooms (diced small) | 1 Cup shiitake mushrooms (chopped) | 1 Cup eggplant (diced small) | 2 tablespoons liquid seasoning | 1/4 Cup Calamansi Juice | 1/4 teaspoon betsin (MSG) | 2 pieces green chili fingers (siling pang-sigang) (sliced) | 1  Egg (Optional) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Melt butter or margarine in a frying pan over medium heat. Add onions and garlic. Saute until onions turn translucent. | Add button mushrooms and wood ear mushrooms. Cook for 2 minutes. Add shiitake mushrooms and cook for another 2 minutes. | Add soy sauce, liquid seasoning, and calamansi juice. Mix well. | Add eggplant. Season with salt, pepper, and MSG. Cook for 5 minutes or until liquid has evaporated. Garnish with green chilies.
ingredient_names: margarine | wood ear mushroom | button mushroom | shiitake mushroom | eggplant | liquid | calamansi juice | betsin | green chili finger | egg

ingredients: 1 Cup all-purpose flour | 1/4 Cup sugar (plus extra to sprinkle) | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 2 tablespoons Butter (melted) | 2 large eggs | 1/2 Cup fresh coconut milk (gata) | 2 cups shredded coconut (drained) | vegetable oil (for frying)
instructions: Combine flour, sugar, and salt in a bowl. | Add butter, eggs, and coconut milk; mix well. | Add coconut meat and mix. | Heat oil in a deep pan. Pour 1/4 cup coconut mixture into the pan. Fry maruya until golden brown on both sides, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack or drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with more sugar and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: all purpose flour | butter | egg | coconut milk | coconut | vegetable oil

ingredients: 1 kilogram beef shank (bulalo) | 10 cups water | 3 medium red onions (quartered) | 100 Grams celery (sliced) | 6 cloves Garlic (peeled) | 1/2 Cup fish sauce (patis) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons cane vinegar | 2 tablespoons black peppercorns | 1 piece birds eye chili (siling labuyo) | vegetable oil (for frying) | fried garlic (for serving) | red onion (sliced into rings, for serving)
instructions: Combine beef and water in a heavy pot over medium-low heat. Add onions, celery, garlic, fish sauce, soy sauce, vinegar, pepper, and chili. Simmer until beef is very tender, about 2 to 3 hours. | Transfer beef to a bowl. Strain soup and reserve for serving. Place beef in the refrigerator to dry for at least 1 hour or overnight. | Shred beef using two forks. Heat oil in a deep pan. Deep fry beef until crispy, about 15 minutes. Strain and transfer to a serving plate. Top with fried garlic and onion rings. Serve immediately with bulalo soup and lots of rice on the side.
ingredient_names: beef | celery | cane vinegar | black peppercorn | labuyo | vegetable oil | fried garlic

ingredients: 300 Grams fresh pancit miki noodles | 2 tablespoons Oil | 4 pieces longganisa (use Vigan or Laoag longganisa, chopped) | 1 Small red onion (chopped) | 2 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 3 large eggs (beaten) | 1 Small red bell pepper (seeded, sliced) | 1 Small green bell pepper (seeded, sliced) | 2 tablespoons shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 1 tablespoon spring onion (chopped) | calamansi (to serve)
instructions: Cook noodles according to package directions. Set aside. | In a frying pan over medium heat, place oil the longganisa. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes. | Add and saute onion and garlic. Push longganisa to the side then add the beaten egg. Once the egg is cooked through and set, add the bagoong. | Add the red and green bell peppers, then stir fry for another minute before adding the noodles. Toss everything together until all ingredients are well incorporated. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with calamansi.
ingredient_names: pancit miki noodle | laoag longganisa | egg | bell pepper | green onion | calamansi

ingredients: 3 180-gram cans tuna flakes in oil (drained) | 1 Cup carrots (grated) | 1/4 Cup white onions (chopped) | 3 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 20 pieces Lumpia wrappers (small) | Oil (for frying) | water (for sealing lumpia) | spiced vinegar (for dipping) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a bowl, mix the tuna flakes, carrots, and onions. Season with salt and pepper. Add calamansi juice. | Heat oil in a deep pot for deep frying. | Make the lumpia: on a board, lay down 1 wrapper. Add 1 heaping teaspoon of filling. Fold the wrapper and seal the edges with water. Repeat with remaining tuna filling. | When ready to fry, cook the lumpia in batches. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with vinegar dipping sauce.
ingredient_names: 180 tuna | carrot | calamansi juice | lumpia wrapper | lumpia

ingredients: 1 tablespoon Oil | 5 pieces longganisa (remove from casing) | 250 ground ground pork | 1/4 Cup carrots (diced) | 2 tablespoons spring onions (chopped) | 1/4 Cup carrots (diced) | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 Small red onion (diced) | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper | 20  Lumpia wrappers (small) | 1 Small beaten egg
instructions: Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat, saute onion and garlic. Add the longganisa and ground pork then cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat then add carrots and spring onions. Mix until well combined. Season with salt and pepper. | Place about 1 tablespoon of the mixture on a lumpia wrapper then roll and brush the edges with the beaten egg. Repeat withremaining filling. | Heat oil for frying over medium-high heat. Once oil is hot, add lumpia and cook until golden brown. Remove from heat and drain on paper towels. Serve with vinegar.
ingredient_names: longganisa | pork | carrot | green onion | lumpia wrapper | egg

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 1 1/2-inch piece ginger (peeled and sliced into strips) | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 pieces tomato (chopped) | 500 Grams pork ribs | 3 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 4 cups rice washing (hugas bigas) or water | 1 medium green papaya (peeled and sliced) | 1 teaspoon black peppercorns | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper | 1 Cup chili leaves (dahon ng sili)
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Saute ginger until fragrant. | Saute onion, garlic, and tomato until cooked. | Add pork ribs and fish sauce; mix. Pour in rice washing. | Add papaya and peppercorns. Lower heat and simmer until pork and papaya and tender, about 30 minutes. Season with ground pepper. Add chili leaves. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | 1 2 ginger | tomato | pork | rice water | green papaya | black peppercorn | chili

ingredients: 3 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 Small red onion (chopped) | 5 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 2 tablespoons bagoong | 200 Grams ground pork | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1 teaspoon ground black pepper | 2 teaspoons sugar | 2 bundles water spinach (kangkong) (leaves and tender stalks, sliced)
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until fragrant. Add bagoong and saute for 2 minutes. | Add ground pork and cook for 5 minutes. Add vinegar and soy sauce. Simmer for 3 minutes. | Add pepper and sugar; mix well. Add kangkong and toss until cooked. Sprinkle fried garlic on top before serving.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | pork | kangkong

ingredients: 1 tablespoon Oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 2 tablespoons red onion (diced) | 1 Small carrot (thinly sliced) | 2 cups young coconut (buko) (thinly sliced) | 1/4 Cup kalabasa (thinly sliced) | 1 piece celery stalk (thinly sliced) | 1 Cup fresh mushrooms (sliced) | 20 Small Lumpia wrappers | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 1 Small beaten egg | Oil (for frying)
instructions: Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until fragrant. Add carrots, celery, kalabasa, and mushrooms; cook for 1 minute. | Add the young coconut meat and cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. | Place 1 tablespoon of the buko mixture on a lumpia wrapper. Roll and brush edges with egg to seal. Repeat with remaining filling. | Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat. Fry lumpia for 2 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Drain on paper towels.
ingredient_names: carrot | young coconut | kalabasa | celery stalk | mushroom | lumpia wrapper | egg

ingredients: 1/8 kilogram chicken intestine (isaw) (cut into 3-inch lengths) | 100 Grams chicken gizzard (balunbalunan) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 Small red onion (peeled, chopped) | 3 cloves Garlic (peeled, chopped) | 2 inches fresh ginger (peeled, sliced into strips) | 1/2 Cup Glutinous rice (malagkit) | 4 cups water (more as needed) | 1 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) (or to taste) | 4 pieces chicken wings | firm tofu (tokwa) (sliced and fried, to serve) | green onions (to serve) | ground black pepper (to serve) | Toasted garlic (to serve)
instructions: In a large bowl, sprinkle salt and vinegar over the chicken intestines and the gizzards. Rub the salt into the innards to thoroughly remove and clean it. Rinse well over running water, turning the intestines inside out to thoroughly clean. Set aside. | In a pot over medium heat, heat oil. Add and saute onions, garlic, and ginger. | Add the rice and stir to mix with the flavored oil. Add the chicken, isaw, and balunbalunan. Add the water and patis, bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. | Lower the heat and simmer for 30 to 40 minutes, stirring regularly. Simmer the rice and the chicken parts until the mixture thickens and chicken cooked through. Add more water to adjust the porridge to your desired consistency. | Ladle into bowls, and serve with fried tokwa, green onions, ground black pepper, and toasted garlic.
ingredient_names: chicken intestine | chicken gizzard | vegetable oil | ginger | glutinous rice | chicken | firm tofu | green onion

recipe_name: Malunggay and Corn Soup with Egg Recipe
ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 medium red onion (peeled, sliced thinly) | 5 cups chicken broth | 4 small ears white and purple corn (husked and kernels cut from cob) | 1 large Egg | 1 Cup malunggay leaves | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a medium pot. Add onion, and saute until just softened. Add thechicken stock, grated corn,corn cobs, and bring to a simmer for about 10 minutes or until the corn is cooked through and tender.Remove the corn cobs. | In a small bowl, beat the egg with a fork. While the soup is simmering, wave your fork over the soupwhile youslowly drizzle the beaten egg overthe fork. (The fork will prevent large globs of the egg to drop into the soup. This method will create the strands.) | Season with salt and pepper to taste.Stir in the malunggay leaves to become heated through just before serving. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | chicken broth | kernel | egg | malunggay leave

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 medium red onion (peeled, quartered) | 1 kilogram beef cubes | 5 cups water | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) (or to taste, more to serve) | 1/2 teaspoon black peppercorns | 4 pieces siling labuyo (halved, more to serve) | 4 medium Potatoes (peeled, cubed large) | 2 small heads cabbage (each cut into 4) | 1 bunch string beans (sitaw) (cut into 3-inch lengths) | calamansi (to serve) | steamed rice (to serve)
instructions: Heat oil in a pressure cooker over medium heat. Add onion, and stir to lightly saute. Add beef cubes, water, patis, and peppercorns. Increase heat to high, and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and remove any scum that rises to the surface as it simmers. When there is no more scum rising to the surface, cover and lock lid, lowering heat to low. | Simmer 45 minutes or until beef is tender. | Release pressure before unlocking and removing lid. Add potatoes and siling labuyo. Bring back to a simmer, and cook potatoes until tender. Add cabbage and sitaw. Cook until just tender. Serve with steamed rice, calamansi, more patis, and even more siling labuyo on the side.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | cubes | black peppercorn | labuyo | potato | cabbage | sitaw | calamansi | steamed rice

ingredients: 3/4 kilogram ground pork | 1/4 kilogram pork fat | 1/4 Cup Garlic (minced) | 1 teaspoon ground black pepper | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon annatto powder (atsuete) | 1/4 Cup Iloko vinegar (sukang Iloko) (or cane vinegar)
instructions: In a large bowl, mix ground pork, pork fat, garlic, pepper, soy sauce, atsuete powder, and vinegar until well blended. | Portion meat mixture using an ice cream scoop onto a sheet of wax paper, measuring 5 x 5 -inches. Roll until it forms into a log. Repeat with remaining meat mixtures. | Chill for at least 12 hours. | When ready to serve, heat oil in pan. Remove longganisa from the wax paper and fry till browned. Serve with garlic rice, tomatoes, and a fried egg.
ingredient_names: pork | pork fat | annatto powder | iloko vinegar

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 5 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 Small red onion (chopped) | 1 Cup coconut milk | 1 tablespoons patis (fish sauce) | 2 medium-sized blue crabs (alimasag) (washed, cut in half) | 1/4 Cup kalabasa (squash) (peeled, cubed) | 1/4 Cup okra (halved) | 2 pieces green finger chilies (siling pangsigang) | 1/4 Cup sitaw (string beans) (cut into 3-inch lengths) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | steamed rice (to serve)
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a large pan. Add then saute onions and garlic until onions are translucent. | Add coconut milk and patis, and bring to a boil. Cook for 6 minutes. | Add the crabs and cook for 5 minutes. | Add the squash and okra. Simmer until vegetables are tender. (You may also add the green finger chili at this point.) Add the string beans. | Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot with white rice.
ingredient_names: coconut milk | blue crab | kalabasa | okra | green finger chili | 3 length | steamed rice

ingredients: 1 kilogram ground pork | 1 head Garlic (cloves separated and minced) | 1 tablespoon dried oregano | 2 tablespoons paprika | 1 tablespoons sugar | 1 tablespoon rock salt | 1 tablespoon ground black pepper | 1/2 Cup cane vinegar
instructions: Combine all ingredients in a bowl: ground pork, garlic, oregano, paprika, sugar, salt, pepper, and vinegar. Mix well. | Form mixture into a log, about 3 inches long. Place on a piece of wax paper and roll tightly. Repeat to make 30 pieces. Freeze until ready to use. | To cook, thaw longganisa completely. Pan-fry until browned. Serve immediately with garlic rice and fried eggs.
ingredient_names: pork | dried oregano | paprika | rock salt | cane vinegar

ingredients: 4 pieces boneless pork chops (about 1/2-inch thick) | 5 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 5 cloves Garlic (peeled and minced) | 3 tablespoons Oil | 1 1/2 cups water | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | sugar (to taste) | 1 large white onion (peeled and sliced into rings)
instructions: Combine pork chops, soy sauce, calamansi juice, and garlic in a bowl. Marinate for at least an hour. | Heat oil in a pan. Pan fry the marinated pork chops in medium heat for 3 minutes per side. | Remove excess oil. Pour in the remaining marinade and water and let it boil. Simmer for 45 minutes or until the pork is tender. Add water as needed. | Season with salt, pepper, and sugar. Add the onions and cook for 3 more minutes. Turn off the heat and transfer to a serving plate.
ingredient_names: 1 2 thick | calamansi juice

ingredients: 3 cups coconut milk or gata | 5 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 large white onion (chopped) | 1 Cup fresh malunggay leaves | 3 pieces bird's eye chili (siling labuyo) (chopped) | 1/2 Cup smoked galunggong (tinapang galunggong) (skin and bones removed, flaked) | 3/4 Cup water | 1/2 kilogram unripe jackfruit (langka) (peeled and chopped) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat wok and pour in coconut milk. Bring to a boil. | Add the garlic and onions and cook for 3 to 5 minutes while continuously stirring the mixture. | Put in the malunggay leaves and red chilies. Continue stirring to prevent lumps from forming. | Add the tinapa and cook for 2 minutes. Pour in water and allow re-boil. | Add the young jackfruit then mix everything. Simmer for 5 to 8 minutes or until the liquid reduces. Season to taste. Transfer to a serving plate and serve while hot.
ingredient_names: coconut milk | malunggay leave | bird's eye chili | galunggong | unripe jackfruit

ingredients: 4 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 4 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 kilogram chicken pieces (thighs and wings or adodo cut) | 2 tablespoons cooking oil (for frying) | 1 medium white onion (sliced into rings) | 1/2 Cup water | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a large bowl combine soy sauce, calamansi juice, garlic, salt, and pepper then add the chicken pieces. Set aside to let marinate for at least 30 minutes. | Heat oil in a frying pan over medium-high heat, pour in oil and fry onion slices. Set aside. Lower heat to medium-low heat. | In the same pan, add chicken pieces then pour in the marinade. Add water and simmer for 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Remove from heat. Add onions before serving.
ingredient_names: calamansi juice | chicken

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 6 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 piece (1 1/2 inch) ginger (sliced into thin strips) | 3 pieces green finger chilies (siling mahaba) (sliced in half) | 3 pieces red birds eye chilies (siling labuyo) (sliced in half) | 1 1/2 tablespoons shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) | 2 cups coconut milk | 500 Grams medium shrimp (cleaned) | 100 Grams string beans (sitaw) (sliced into 2 1/2-inch pieces)
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Saute onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. | Add chilies and cook for 1 minute. Add bagoong and saute for 1 more minute. | Add coconut milk and simmer until the desired consistency is achieved. | Add shrimps and simmer until cooked. Add string beans and cook for 2 minutes. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | ginger | green finger chili | red bird | coconut milk | shrimp | bean

ingredients: 1 kilogram chicken fillets (cut into thin slices) | 1 head Garlic (minced) | 2 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 4 tablespoons Vinegar | 1 tablespoon brown sugar | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | Oil (for frying)
instructions: Place all ingredients in a lrage bowl: chicken, garlic, calamansi juice, soy sauce, vinegar, brown sugar, and pepper. Mix well and marinate for at least 30 minutes. | In a frying pan over medium heat, add oil then add the marinated chicken. Cook for about 5 minutes or until golden brown. Fry in batches. Serve while hot with garlic rice and fried eggs.
ingredient_names: chicken | calamansi juice | brown sugar

ingredients: 2 cups squash (kalabasa) (grated, squeeze to remove excess water) | 2 cups bean sprouts (togue) | 2 Small carrots (peeled, sliced into thin strips or matchsticks) | 5 pieces Ilocos longganisa (casings removed and crumbled) | 250 Grams small shrimp | 1 Cup malunggay leaves | 1 Cup cornstarch | 1/2 Cup all-purpose flour | 1 tablespoon paprika | 2 teaspoons Salt | 2 teaspoons ground black pepper | 2 large eggs | 1/2 Cup water | vegetable oil (for frying) | spiced vinegar (or vinegar with soy sauce, red onions, and chilis, to serve)
instructions: Combine squash, bean sprouts, carrots, longganisa, shrimp, and malunggay leaves in a large bowl. Mix well. Set aside. | Combine cornstarch, flour, paprika, salt, pepper, eggs, and water in another bowl. Mix well. Set aside. | Add and heat about 1-inch oil in a frying pan over medium-low heat. | Combine about 1/2 cup squash mixture and 2 tablespoons cornstarch batter in a shallow plate. Slide this mixture into the hot oil in the frying pan, forming a round patty. Fry until crisp and golden on both sides, about 5 minutes. Repeat with the remaining ingredients. | Drain okoy on paper towels. Serve okoy hot with vinegar on the side.
ingredient_names: excess water | bean sprout | matchstick | ilocos longganisa | shrimp | malunggay leave | cornstarch | all purpose flour | paprika | egg | vegetable oil

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 Small red onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 2 cups coconut milk | 2 cups water | 1 kilo kalabasa (squash) (peeled, chopped) | 200 Grams ground pork | 150 Grams Shrimp (peeled, chopped) | 2 tablespoons patis (fish sauce) | 1 tablespoon sugar | ground black pepper (to taste) | Salt (to taste) | 1/2 Cup malunggay leaves
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until fragrant. | Add coconut milk and water. Lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes. | Add squash and simmer until tender, about 15 minutes. | Mash squash using the back of a wooden spoon and stir. Add pork and shrimp; cook for 5 minutes. | Add fish sauce and sugar. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in malunggay leaves. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | coconut milk | kalabasa | pork | shrimp | malunggay leave

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Sampaloc Pods (pulp only, seeds removed) | 3/4 Cup water | 1 stalk lemongrass (tanglad) | 1/4 Cup red onions (chopped) | 1/4 Cup chili paste | 2 tablespoons curry powder | 2-3 pieces fresh curry leaves | 500 Grams pork (cubed) | 1 Cup water | 1 250-ml pack coconut milk (gata) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon sugar | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Mix sampaloc pulp with water. Squeeze and strain the sampaloc to make juice. Set aside. | Trim the lemongrass stalk 2 to 3 inches from the base. Discard the top and pound the stalk to release the lemongrass aroma. Set aside. | Heat up oil over medium heat in a medium pot. Add onions and saute until translucent. Then add remaining spices (chili paste, curry powder, and curry leaves) and cook together until the mixture is fragrant. | Add the pork cubes and continue to stir fry making sure the pork cubes are coated well with the spice mix. | After 5 minutes, pour in the tamarind juice, water, and coconut milk. Mix well and bring to a gentle boil. Season with soy sauce, sugar, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 45 minutes to an hour until pork is fork-tender. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: sampaloc pod | stalk lemongrass | chili paste | curry powder | curry leave | pork | 250 coconut milk

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 2 medium red onions (chopped) | 4 Small tomatoes (seeds removed, chopped) | 1 kilogram pork ribs (cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup water | 4 pieces red birds eye chilies (siling labuyo) | 1/2 Cup buttter | 1/2 Cup Cheese (grated) | 1 Cup green olives (pitted) | 1/2 Cup Chinese parsley (kinchay) (chopped)
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. Add tomatoes and cook for 3 minutes. | Add pork ribs and cook for 2 minutes. Add soy sauce, lower heat, and simmer for 10 minutes. Add water and chilies; simmer, stirring occasionally, for 1 hour or until pork is tender. Add more water, if needed. | Add butter and cook for 5 minutes. Add grated cheese and stir. | Add olives and kinchay. Transfer to a serving platter and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | tomato | pork | red bird | buttter | cheese | green olive | chinese parsley

ingredients: 1 kilogram pork | 1/2 Cup sweet pickle relish | 5 clove Garlic (minced) | 1 Small red onion (minced) | 3/4 Cup raisins | 1 medium carrot (minced) | 1/2 Cup evaporated milk | 3 large eggs | 1 Small red and green bell peppers | 1 Cup breadcrumbs | Oil (for frying) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 3 large hard-boiled eggs (quartered) | 1 230-gram can Vienna Sausage (sliced) | 1 227-gram block Cheese (cut into strips)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine ground pork, pickle relish, raisins, carrot, evaporated milk, bell peppers, eggs, and bread crumbs. Mix until all ingredients are well incorporated. Season with salt and pepper to taste. | Brush foil with oil, and place 1 cup of the pork mixture. Evenly flatten the mixture. Place the Vienna sausage slices, cheese sticks, and hard-boiled eggs in the middle part. Gently roll the mixture into a log then tightly tie ends of the foil. | Steam for 1 hour then set aside to cool. Slice diagonally. Serve or fry until golden then serve with the dipping sauce of choice.
ingredient_names: pork | sweet pickle relish | raisin | carrot | milk | egg | bell pepper | breadcrumb | hard boiled egg | vienna sausage | 227 block cheese

ingredients: 1/2 cup of sinamak vinegar | 1/4 cup of white vinegar | 1/4 cup of Soy Sauce | 2 stalks Lemongrass (tanglad), (pounded) | 2 teaspoons brown sugar | 1 clove Garlic (pounded) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 2 teaspoons Salt | 1 piece Knorr chicken cube | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1 kilo chicken legs | 3/4 cup of Atsuete oil (annatto oil)
instructions: Make the marinade: Combine all ingredients and Knorr chicken cube in a large bowl. Marinate chicken legs in the mixture for at least 2 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. | Make the atsuete oil: In a pan, add 2 tablespoons atsuete and 1/2 cup oil. Let it simmer until oil changes into an orange color. Strain the atsuete seeds before using. | Make the barbecue: Skewer chicken with barbecue sticks. Cook the chicken on a charcoal grill over a medium flame. Mix together atsuete oil, margarine, and Knorr chicken cube. Baste the chicken with the atsuete oil mixture every few minutes until the meat is well done. Remove barbecue sticks before serving.
ingredient_names: sinamak vinegar | lemongrass | brown sugar | chicken

ingredients: 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium-sized onion (minced) | 1 kilo Chicken (chopped) | 1 piece Knorr chicken cube | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 (250-gram pack) Tomato sauce | 1/2 teaspoon sugar | 1 to 1 1/2 cups of water | 1 medium-sized potato (cut into cubes) | 1 medium-sized carrot (cut into cubes) | 1 piece red bell pepper (sliced) | 1 piece green bell pepper (sliced) | ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a saucepan, saute garlic and onion. | Add the chicken and cook until brown, around 5 minutes. | Add the Knorr Chicken Cube then pour the soy sauce, sugar, tomato sauce, and water. Let it simmer for 20 minutes. | Add potatoes, carrots, red bell pepper, and green bell pepper, then season with salt and pepper. Stir and cook for 15 minutes.
ingredient_names: chicken | tomato sauce | potato | carrot | bell pepper

ingredients: 8 cups of water | 2 medium-sized red onions (quartered) | 4 medium-sized tomatoes (quartered) | 1 kilo pork (cubed) | 1 pack (44 grams) Knorr Sinigang sa Sampaloc Mix with Gabi | 3 pieces taro (gabi) (peeled and quartered) | 2 pieces radish (labanos) (peeled and sliced) | 1 bunch string beans (sitaw) (cut into 1-inch long pieces) | 6 to 8 pieces okra | 2 pieces eggplants (sliced) | 3 pieces green chili (siling tagalog) | 4 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1 bunch kangkong (water spinach) leaves (tender stems pinched off)
instructions: In a large pot, pour the water. Add the onions and tomatoes. | Add the pork and let it simmer for 30 minutes. Remove the scum from the pork. | Pour in one pack of Knorr Sinigang sa Sampaloc Mix with Gabi. | Add the taro and radish. Let simmer for 15 minutes or until tender. | Put the string beans, fish sauce, okra, eggplant, and green chili. | Cook until the pork is tender. Add in the kangkong leaves before serving.
ingredient_names: tomato | pork | taro | radish | sitaw | okra | eggplant | green chili | tender stem

ingredients: 1/2 Cup monggo beans | 1 1/2 cups langka (roughly chopped) | 2 cups water | 3 cups coconut milk | dried fish (as needed) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Boil monggo in water for 30 to 45 minutes in medium heat or until monggo splits. | Add langka and continue to boil until langka is tender. Throw out the water. | Add coconut milk and simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. | Add dried fish and simmer for another 2 minutes. Serve.
ingredient_names: monggo bean | langka | coconut milk | dried fish

recipe_name: Beef Menudo With Hot Dogs Recipe
ingredients: 5 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 Small red onion (chopped) | 6 Small tomatoes (diced) | 500 Grams beef sirloin (cubed) | 3-4 cups beef stock | 3 tablespoons tomato paste | 2 medium Potatoes (cubed) | 2 Small carrots (cubed) | 1 medium bell pepper (sliced) | 1 1/2 tablespoons pickle relish | 2 pieces hotdogs (sliced) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Saute garlic and onions in a large pot until browned. Add diced tomatoes.. | Add beef sirloin and brown on all sides. | Add beef stock and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer until beef cubes are tender (around 2 hours). Add more stock if needed. | Once tender, reduce the liquid to almost half. Add tomato paste, potatoes, carrots, bell pepper, and pickle relish. Simmer again until potatoes and carrots are softened. | Add hotdogs. Add salt and pepper to taste.
ingredient_names: tomato | sirloin | beef stock | tomato paste | potato | carrot | bell pepper | pickle relish | hotdog

ingredients: 3 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 kilo chicken thighs (filleted and cubed) | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 medium-sized onion (chopped) | 1 piece Knorr chicken cube | 1 Pack Knorr Mushroom Soup | 1 cup of water | 1 medium-sized carrot (cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes) | 2 medium-sized Potatoes (cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes) | 110 Grams cheddar cheese (grated) | Pepper (to taste)
instructions: Saute garlic and onion in oil. | Add the chicken thigh cubes. Cook for 10 minutes. | Dissolve the Knorr chicken cube and Knorr mushroom soup in water. Pour over the chicken and let it simmer. | Add the carrots and potatoes. Add water if sauce becomes too thick. Simmer for 15 minutes. | Top with grated cheese before serving.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | chicken | 1 2 cube | cheddar cheese

recipe_name: Easy Pork Chop With Eggplant Recipe
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 4 cloves Garlic (sliced) | 1 kilogram pork chops | 4 tablespoons oyster sauce | 1/2 Cup pork stock | 1 medium eggplant (sliced) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in frying pan over medium heat. Saute garlic until fragrant. Add in pork chop and cook until slightly brown. | Add the oyster sauce and pork stock. Let simmer for 10 mins then add in the eggplant. Cook for another 10 mins. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice.
ingredient_names: pork | oyster sauce | pork stock | eggplant

ingredients: 200 Grams ground chicken | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon sesame oil | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper | 2 tablespoons Oil | 5 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 2 stalks Leeks (white parts chopped, green parts sliced into 3-inch lengths) | 3 leaves Chinese napa cabbage (sliced) | 1 medium carrot (sliced into sticks) | 1 400-gram can sliced button mushrooms (drained) | 500 Grams dried egg noodles | 1 tablespoon oyster sauce | 1 tablespoon Light soy sauce | 1 tablespoons sweet soy sauce (kecap manis) (or dark soy sauce) | 1 teaspoon sugar | 1/2 Cup chicken stock (or water) | calamansi (to serve) | water (as needed)
instructions: Mix the chicken and the marinade ingredients together in a large bowl, and set aside. | Heat a large, heavy casserole pot until it is hot and add in the oil. Add the garlic and white part of the spring onions. Stir for a minute or two until the garlic starts to brown and then add the chicken. Fry the chicken until it starts to brown, then add the Chinese cabbage, carrot, mushrooms, and spring onion greens. Fry for a few minutes until the vegetables are softened. | In a separate small pot, boil water. Cook the noodles. Drain and set aside. | While the noodles are cooking, add the sauce ingredients and stir to combine. Bring to a simmer, and taste the sauce. Adjust for seasoning. | Add in the noodles and stir to combine. Fry for a minute or so, and remove from the heat. Allow to stand for a few moments and then transfer to a plate. Serve hot, with calamansi on the side.
ingredient_names: chicken | sesame oil | stalks leek | leaves chinese napa cabbage | carrot | button mushroom | egg noodle | oyster sauce | light soy sauce | sweet soy sauce | chicken stock | calamansi
