ingredients: 1 kilo beef brisket (sliced into 1 1/2-inch pieces) | 6 cups water | 1/2 Cup anisado or Chinese rice wine | 1 large white onion (quartered) | 1 2-inch piece ginger (sliced into ruonds) | 2 pieces birds eye chilies (siling labuyo) | 3 pieces bay leaves | 2 pieces star anise | 1 piece cinnamon bark | 1 tablespoon sugar | 2 teaspoons ground black pepper | 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce | 1/2 Cup Light soy sauce | 1/4 Cup cane vinegar | 500 Grams labanos or daikon (Korean radish) (peeled and sliced into half moons) | 2 medium carrots (peeled and sliced into rounds) | 2 tablespoons green onions (chopped) | 3 tablespoons Leeks (chopped, optional) | egg noodles (to serve) | rice (to serve)
instructions: Place beef and pour water in a pot over medium-high heat. Boil beef for 30 minutes, removing impurities that rise to the top. | Add cooking wine, onion, ginger, chilies, bay leaves, star anise, cinnamon, sugar and pepper to the pot. Lower heat and simmer until beef is almost tender, about 1 to 1 1/2 hours. | Add hoisin sauce, light soy sauce, and vinegar. Simmer for another 30 minutes to 1 hour or until beef is tender. | Add radish and carrots, and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a serving bowl. Top with green onions and leeks. Serve warm with egg noodles.
ingredient_names: beef | chinese rice wine | 2 ginger | chily | bay leave | star anise | cinnamon bark | hoisin sauce | light soy sauce | cane vinegar | half moon | carrot | green onion | leek | egg noodle | rice

ingredients: 3 tablespoons Oil | 3 pieces green bananas (sliced) | 1 Small carrots (sliced) | 1 medium potato (sliced) | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 kilogram Chicken (cut into serving pieces) | 4 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 Cup water | 2 tablespoons Vinegar | 1 Cup Tomato sauce | 2 tablespoons brown sugar (or muscovado sugar) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a medium pan over medium heat. Fry the banana, carrots and potato for 3 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat and drain on paper towels. | Using the same pan, saute onion and garlic until fragrant. Add the chicken and cook for 3 to 5 minutes each side or turns slightly brown. | Add the soy sauce and water, and let simmer for about 10 minutes. Add the vinegar (do not stir), and let cook for another 3 minutes. Add the tomato sauce and brown sugar. Simmer for another 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper. | Add in the banana, carrots, and potato. Remove from heat. Serve.
ingredient_names: green banana | carrot | potato | chicken | tomato sauce | muscovado sugar

ingredients: 500 Grams Ground beef | 1 large red onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 medium carrot (grated) | 1 medium yellow sweet potatoes (kamote) (grated) | 1 medium orange sweet potatoes (grated) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 1 large Egg (beaten) | 20 Small small lumpia wrappers | cooking oil | water (as needed) | vinegar-soy sauce dipping sauce (to serve)
instructions: Mix all the ingredients, except the wrappers, to make the filling. Take a small amount of the filling. Fry and taste, and make the needed adjustment. | Make the spring rolls: Place about 1/4 to 1/3 cup filling at the center of a lumpia wrapper. Roll and seal edges with water. Repeat with remaining ingredients. | Heat the oil medium-high in a wok or frying pan. | Fry the spring rolls, few at a time, until golden brown. Fry in batches. Scoop out and drain. | Cut the spring rolls into bite sizes or serve as is. Serve immediately with your choice of sauce.
ingredient_names: beef | carrot | yellow sweet potato | orange sweet potato | egg | lumpia wrapper | vinegar soy sauce

ingredients: 1 tablespoon Oil | 1 medium white onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1/2 kilogram Ground beef | 1 tablespoon ground cumin | 1/2 Cup black beans (rinsed) | 10-12 Small Tortilla | 6 Small tomatoes (diced) | 1 Small white onion (chopped) | 1 tesapoon sugar | 1/2 Cup cabbage (shredded) | 1/4 Cup Cheese (grated) | 1 piece lime (quartered) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a pan over medium heat, heat oil, and saute onion and garlic until fragrant. Add the ground beef, cumin, and black beans. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. | Heat tortilla wrapper in a pan over medium heat on another burner. | To make the salsa: combine tomato, onion, sugar, salt, and pepper. | To assemble, place 1 tablespoon full of the beef mixture on the tortilla wrapper. Top with shredded cabbage, salsa, and cheese.
ingredient_names: beef | cumin | black bean | tortilla | tomato | tesapoon sugar | cabbage | cheese | lime

ingredients: 1 kilogram country-style boneless ribs or pork belly | 1 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 Cup Vinegar | 1 head Garlic (finely chopped) | 2 tablespoons sugar | 2 pieces bay leaves | 1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns | 1 Cup cornstarch | cooking oil (for deep-frying) | spiced vinegar (for dipping)
instructions: In a skillet over medium heat, fry pork until browning occurs. | Add 1/2 cup water, vinegar, soy sauce, peppercorn, bay leaves, and sugar then bring to a boil and simmer for 30 to 35 minutes or until pork is tender and any liquid has dried out. | Remove pork from skillet then drain off excess liquid and let it cool. Cut into bite-size pieces. | Prepare a wok with enough oil for deep frying, and heat it to 350 degrees (180 degrees C). Dredge the pork in flour and carefully place the pork in the hot oil. Deep fry for 3 to 5 minutes or until crispy. | Using a slotted spoon remove pork from hot oil, place in a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess fat then place in a serving platter. Serve with a vinegar dipping sauce. READ THESE: MORE ADOBO RECIPES Adobo sa Atsuete (Red Adobo) Recipe Chinese-Style Pork Adobo Recipe
ingredient_names: country style rib | bay leave | whole black peppercorn | cornstarch | deep frying

ingredients: 1 kilogram ground chicken | 1/3 cup of raisins | 1 piece small onion (diced) | 4 pieces sausages (sliced) | 1 piece small carrot (diced) | 2 pieces whole pickles (diced) | 1 piece Knorr chicken cube | 1/4 cup of Knorr Liquid Seasoning | 1 piece raw egg (slightly beaten) | 1/4 cup of Flour | 2 tablespoons Oil | 2 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 pack (250gram) Italian-style tomato sauce | 1 cup of water | 1 piece Knorr chicken cube | ground pepper (to taste)
instructions: Prepare a steamer by filling it with water halfway into the pan. Let the water boil, then place all the ingredients for the embutido the ground chicken, raisins, onions, sausage, carrot, and pickles in a bowl. | Add the mashed Knorr Chicken Cube, Knorr Liquid Seasoning, egg, and flour. Mix well. | Divide the mixture into 4 to 5 portions. Wrap each portion in a piece of aluminum foil by rolling them all into a log. Secure the ends by crimping and folding. | Place the rolled embutido into a steaming basket, then steam for 40 minutes or until fully cooked. Insert a paring knife to check if the mixture is cooked. | To make the sauce, get a pan and make it nice and hot over medium heat. Pour oil and throw in the garlic. Cook until slightly brown. Add the tomato sauce, water, and Knorr Chicken Cube. Let simmer and season to taste. | Unwrap the embutido and slice diagonally. You may also pan-fry the embutido before slicing to get a nice brown color. | Chicken embutido, served with sauce on top or on the side, is just so satisfying to eat that you can have this any day, any time of the week.
ingredient_names: chicken | raisin | sausage | carrot | whole pickle | raw egg | flour | italian style tomato sauce

ingredients: 1/4 cup of cooking oil | 2 pieces medium-sized potatoes (cut into cubes) | 1 piece medium-sized carrot (cut into cubes) | 6 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 piece onion (minced) | 250 Grams pork kasim (cut into small cubes) | 250 Grams pork liempo (cut into small cubes) | 250 Grams pork liver (cut into small cubes) | 1 pack (250gram) Tomato sauce | 2 pieces Knorr Pork Cubes | 1 to 1 1/2 cups of water | 1 teaspoon sugar | ground black pepper (to taste) | 2 tablespoons raisins | 1 cup of red and green bell peppers (cubed)
instructions: Let's begin by first frying the potato and carrots in hot oil until lightly browned. Remove from oil and transfer on a plate lined with paper towels. Set aside. | In the same pan, throw in the garlic and onions. | Add the pork kasim and liempo next and fry until slightly brown in color before adding the liver. Cook for 2 minutes. | Drop in the Knorr Pork Broth Cubes and give this a nice stir to dissolve completely before adding the tomato sauce, water, sugar and black pepper. Mix this well. | Now, gently place the fried potatoes and carrots in the pan. Continue to cook over low heat until meat and potatoes are cooked through and the sauce has thickened. | Finally, add raisins and bell peppers and just allow to cook for 2 minutes longer. Here's a dish that will bring the entire family together. Pork menudo, just like home, is always close to your heart.
ingredient_names: potato | carrot | pork kasim | pork liempo | pork liver | tomato sauce | raisin | bell pepper

ingredients: 1/2 kilogram pork ribs | 3 cups of water | 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 piece onion (minced) | 2 pieces Spanish chorizo (sliced) | 1 can liver spread | 3 pieces laurel leaves | 1 pack (250gram) Tomato sauce | 1 piece Knorr pork cube | 1/2 teaspoon sugar | ground black pepper (to taste) | 1 piece medium-sized potato (cut into cubes) | 1 piece medium-sized carrot (cut into cubes) | 50 Grams pitted black olives | 1 piece red bell pepper (seeded and sliced) | 1 piece green bell pepper (seeded and sliced)
instructions: Get a pot and make it nice and hot. Fill it with 3 cups of water and the pork ribs. Boil at high heat and bring down to a simmer for 30 minutes or until meat is tender. Remove meat from pot and set aside the broth. | Get another pan ready and make it nice and hot over medium heat. Pour oil and saute garlic and onions. Add the meat, chorizo, liver spread, laurel, tomato sauce, Knorr Pork Broth Cube, sugar, pepper and broth. Bring to a boil and simmer until slightly thick in consistency. | Throw in the potato and carrots next then simmer until cooked before adding the bell peppers and olives. Cook for another 2 minutes and that's our dish!
ingredient_names: pork | spanish chorizo | liver spread | laurel | tomato sauce | potato | carrot | black olive | bell pepper

ingredients: 1 kilogram` Chicken (cut into pieces) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 2 medium white onions (sliced) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 3 pieces longganisa ((macau), sliced diagonally) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 1 Cup water | 2 medium carrots (sliced into half moons) | 300 Grams cauliflower (florets separated) | 100 Grams celery (sliced into matchsticks) | 200 Grams green beans (abitsuelas) (sliced diagonally) | 100 Grams snow peas (chicharo) | 100 Grams young corn (sliced) | 300 Grams Chinese cabbage (pechay Baguio) (sliced) | 2 tablespoons cornstarch (dissolved in 1 tablespoon water)
instructions: Marinate chicken in soy sauce for 30 minutes. | Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until fragrant. Add longganisang Macau and saute for 1 minute. Add chicken and marinade. Cook for 2 minutes. | Add fish sauce and water. Simmer for 5 minutes. | Add carrots, cauliflower, celery, green beans, snow peas, and young corn. Simmer for 3 minutes. | Add pechay Baguio. Simmer for 1 minute. | Add dissolved cornstarch and simmer until sauce is thick. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: chicken | vegetable oil | longganisa | half moon | cauliflower floret | matchstick | sitaw | pea | young corn | chinese cabbage | cornstarch

ingredients: 1 kilogram boneless pork belly, skin on (sliced into 1-inch pieces) | 4 cups water | 1 medium red onion (quartered) | 3 pieces dried bay leaves | 2 tablespoons rock salt | 1 tablespoon black peppercorns | 1 head Garlic (cloves separated) | Vinegar (to serve)
instructions: Combine pork belly, water, onion, bay leaves, salt, and peppercorn in a pot. Bring to a boil. Remove impurities that rise to the surface. | Lower heat, cover, and simmer until pork is tender and water is fully evaporated, about 2 to 2 1/2 hours. | Continue cooking pork until fat is rendered. Add garlic cloves. Fry pork in its own oil, stirring frequently, until crisp and golden. Drain on paper towels. Serve with vinegar.
ingredient_names: pork | dried bay leave | rock salt | black peppercorn

ingredients: 1/2 Cup longganisa (casings removed and crumbled) | 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 large yellow onion (sliced) | 4 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 1/2 talespoons oyster sauce | 3/4 Cup water | 1 1/2 cups cauliflower florets | 1 medium carrot (sliced crosswise into thin pieces) | 12 pieces snow peas (sitsaro) | 8 pieces young corn (cut in half) | 1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or pan. Fry the longganisa meat until cooked through. | Saute onion. Add garlic and continue to saute until the onion becomes soft. Add soy sauce and oyster sauce. Stir. Pour in water. Let boil. Cover and cook on medium heat for 15 minutes. | Add cauliflower, carrots, snow peas, and young corn. Stir. Season with black pepper. Toss to combine. Cover and cook for 5 to 7 minutes. Transfer to a serving plate. Serve.
ingredient_names: longganisa | talespoons oyster sauce | cauliflower floret | carrot | snow pea | young corn

ingredients: 1 kilogram pork pigue (cut into chunks) | 1 head Garlic (cloves separated but unpeeled) | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | water (as needed) | 2 blocks firm tofu | 1 400-gram can whole button mushrooms | crushed black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a medium-size pressure cooker over medium heat, heat oil. Sear pork cubes only until just browned. | Add soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, and just enough water to cover the meat. Season with crushed black pepper to taste. Bring to a boil. Remove the scum that rises to the surface. Cover, then lock lid. Simmer for 20 minutes or until pork is just tender, taking care to release the pressure of pot before opening. | Meanwhile, in a frying pan over medium-high heat, heat enough oil for frying. Add the tofu and fry the tofu until golden brown on all sides. Remove from the pan into a wire rack over paper towels. Repeat with remaining tofu as needed. Cut tofu in half using scissors. Set aside. | Once pork is just tender, add mushrooms and then stir in cooked tofu, then bring to a simmer without a lid. Simmer until liquid reduced and is more flavorful. Serve with steamed rice.
ingredient_names: pork pigue | firm tofu | whole button mushroom | crushed black pepper

ingredients: 2 tablespoons canola oil | 2 medium Potatoes (peeled, cubed small) | 2 medium carrots (peeled, cubed small) | 1 medium red onion (peeled, sliced) | 1/2 kilogram ground pork | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup Tomato sauce | 1 tablespoon pickle relish | 1/2 Cup water | ground black pepper (to taste) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: In a medium pot over medium heat, heat oil and then cook potatoes and carrots until tender. Remove from the pan. In the same pan, saute onion until just softened. | Add ground pork, and cook for 5 minutes or until cooked through. | Pour in soy sauce, tomato sauce, pickle relish, and water. Simmer for 5 minutes. Return potatoes and carrots, and then season with salt and ground black pepper. Simmer until mixture has thickened. Season with salt and ground black pepper to taste. Serve with garlic rice.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons canola oil | 2 Small red onions (peeled, quartered) | 4 cloves Garlic (peeled, chopped) | 1/2 kilogram chicken breast fillets (cut into strips) | 1 1/2 tablespoons bagoong alamang (or to taste) | 3 Small tomatoes (quartered) | 1 piece green finger chili (siling haba) | 2 pieces siling labuyo (chopped) | 1/2 Cup water | 1/4 Cup loosely packed fresh Thai basil leaves (leaves only, more to garnish) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a medium-sized frying pan over medium heat, heat oil. Add sliced onions and cook until just softened. Add chopped garlic saute until a bit browned. Add chicken strips and cook, stirring, until just cooked through. Season with pepper. | Add bagoong alamang, tomatoes, siling haba, siling labuyo, and water. Bring to a simmer and reduce liquid until it becomes a sauce. | Stir in Thai basil leaves, and simmer again just until the basil leaves are wilted. Remove from the heat and serve immediately with more basil.
ingredient_names: canola oil | chicken | shrimp paste shrimp paste | tomato | green finger chili | labuyo | thai basil

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic (peeled and minced) | 1 medium onion (peeled and chopped) | 1/2 kilo ground pork | 1/2 kilo Ground beef | 1  Knorr pork cube | 2 cups Sweet style spaghetti sauce | 1 medium carrot (minced) | 1 medium red bell pepper (minced) | 400 Grams cooked spaghetti | salt and pepper to taste | grated cheese
instructions: In a pot, saute garlic in cooking oil until brown. Add the onions, the ground pork, and the ground beef. Saute until the meat is cooked. | Add the Knorr Pork Cube. Mix well. | Pour the spaghetti sauce, the carrots, and the bell pepper. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. | Pour over hot pasta and serve with grated cheese.
ingredient_names: pork | beef | sweet style spaghetti sauce | carrot | bell pepper | spaghetti | salt and pepper | cheese

ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 medium red onion (diced) | 1/2 kilogram ground pork | 1/2 kilogram Shrimp (chopped) | 50 Grams dried mushrooms (dehydrated) | 1 1 1/2-inch piece ginger (grated) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon ground white pepper | 1 1/2 teaspoons Salt | 3 tablespoons sesame oil | Calamansi Juice (from 3 pieces of calamansi) | 3 tablespoons all-purpose flour | 12 to 16 large Lumpia wrappers | vegetable oil (for frying) | Sweet chili sauce (to serve)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan. Saute onions until translucent. Set aside to cool. | Combine pork, shrimp, and mushrooms in a bowl. Mix well. Add ginger and onions. | Add soy sauce, pepper, salt, sesame oil, calamansi juice, and flour. Mix well. | Place about 1/4 to 1/3 cup filling at the center of a lumpia wrapper. Roll and seal. Repeat with remaining ingredients. | Deep-fry lumpia until crisp and golden. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot with sweet-chili sauce.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 3 slices fresh ginger | 4 stalks Lemongrass (pounded, tied) | 1 330-ml can lemon-lime soda | 1 Cup water | 1 40-grams pack tom yum paste | 1 425-gram can straw mushrooms (halved) | fish sauce (patis) (to taste) | 1 kilogram green mussels (tahong)
instructions: In a pot in a medium heat, heat oil. Saute ginger and lemongrass until fragrant. About 2 minutes. | Add lemon-lime soda and water and bring to a slow boil. Add Tom Yum paste. Cook until incorporated. | Add mushroom. Simmer for 2 minutes. Season with fish sauce. | Add mussels. Mix thoroughly. Cover and cook until mussels are all open, about 5 minutes. Serve hot in a soup bowl.
ingredient_names: ginger | stalks lemongrass | lime soda | tom yum paste | mushroom | green mussel

recipe_name: Beer-Marinated Grilled Chicken Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 3 tablespoons unsalted butter (tinunaw) | 3 cloves Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 teaspoon Garlic powder | 1 tesapoon Onion powder | 1 teaspoon paprika | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 1 kilogram chicken wings | 1 330-ml can beer (gumamit ng dark beer/ale)
instructions: Paghaluin ang butter, bawang, garlic poweder, onion powder, paprika, asin, paminta, at beer sa isang mangkok. | Ihalo rito ang mga piraso ng pakpak ng manok at ibabad nang 30 minuto. | Sa isang grill pan o de-uling na ihawan, lutuin ang mga pakpak nang 5 hanggang sampung minuto ang bawat isa.
ingredient_names: butter | garlic powder | tesapoon onion powder | paprika | chicken | beer

recipe_name: Filipino Ginataan Recipe - Paano Lutuin at mga Sangkap
ingredients: 1/4 Cup small sago | 2 1/2 cups water | 1 tablespoon sugar | 1 Cup glutinous rice flour | 1/2 teaspoon ube flavoring | 1 1/2 cups water | 1/2 Cup sugar | 2 Small orange sweet potatoes (kamote) (binalatan at hiniwa) | 2  saba bananas (binalatan at hiniwa) | 1 Cup coconut cream | 1/2 Cup sweetened jackfruit (langka)
instructions: Pakuluan ang sago sa maliit na kalderong may 2 tasang tubig. Haluin ng tuluy-tuloy hanggang lumambot. Salain ang tubig at itabi ang sago. | Gumamit ng kalderong may katamtamang laki para sa pag gawa ng bilo-bilo. Pakuluan ang tubig sa mababang apoy, ihalo ang asukal hanggang matunaw. Ibuhos ang malagkit na bigas at haluin hangga't mabuo ito at kaya nang masahin. Hatiin ang galapong sa 2 mangkok. Patakan ng ube food coloring ang galapong sa isang mangkok at masahin para mag pantay ang kulay. Ihugis ng maliliit na bilog upang maging bilo-bilo at itabi. Ihugis din ang galapong na walang kulay at itabi. | Sa katamtamang apoy, paghaluin sa kaldero ang tubig at asukal. Idagdag ang saging na saba at kamote, antaying kumulo bago isa isang ihulog ang bilo-bilong may kulay at wala. | Hinaan ang apoy at ihalo ang gata. Idagdag ang sago at minatamis na langka. | Maaaring dagdagan ng asukal ayon sa iyong panlasa.
ingredient_names: sago | glutinous rice flour | ube | orange sweet potato | saba bananas binalatan | coconut cream | jackfruit

recipe_name: Pancit Lomi Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 4 cloves Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 medium red onion (tinadtad) | 1/2 Cup pork liver | 1 Cup squid balls | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper | 6 cups water | 1/4 kilogram lomi noodles | 1  carrot (hiniwa ng manipis) | 1  cabbage (hiniwa ng manipis) | 2  eggs | onion leeks (tinadtad)
instructions: Paintin ang mantika sa isang kaldero na may katamtamang laki. Igisa ang bawang at sibuyas hanggang sumingaw ang amoy. | Idagdag ang baboy, atay ng baboy, squid balls, at asin. Ipagpatuloy ang pag-gisa gamit ang katamtamang lakas ng apoy. | Timplahin ang ginigisang ulam gamit ang paminta (itim) ayon sa panlasa, at magdagdag ng tubig at hayaan lamang ito kumulo ng 10-15 na minuto. Idagdag ang pansit lomi at hayaan ulit itong kumulo ng limang minuto. | Idagdag na ang asanorya at repolyo. Isalin ang binateng itlog habang hinahalo ang ginawang gulay sa pansit. Ilipat na ang nahalong mga sangkap sa isang lalagyan para ihain. Maaaring lagyan ito ng sibuyas dahon (onion leeks) sa ibabaw upang maging lalong katakam-takam ang itsura.
ingredient_names: pork liver | squid ball | lomi noodle | carrot | cabbage | egg | onion leek

recipe_name: Pork Sisig Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: water (para sa pagkulo) | 1 kilo Pork Jowl (Face) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 large onion (tinadtad) | 3 cloves Garlic | 1 Small ginger (tinadtad) | 3 pieces green chili fingers (siling pang-sigang) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 3-5 pieces calamansi | salt (asin) (ayon sa panlasa) | ground black pepper (ayon sa panlasa)
instructions: Pakuluan ang tubig sa isang malaking kaserola. Lagyan ng tamang dami ng tubig para nakalubog ang mga laman ng baboy. | Ilagay ang tenga at pisngi ng baboy (o kaya ay tiyan ng baboy) at dahan-dahang pakuluan sa loob ng 40 minuto hanggang 1 oras (o hanggang maging malambot ang laman). Timplahan ng asin at paminta. | Tanggalin ang mga pinakuluang sangkap at itapon ang tubig. | Ihawin ang tenga at pisngi ng baboy (o tiyan ng baboy) hanggang tuluyang maluto ang mga ito. | Tadtarin ang tenga at pisngi ng baboy sa maliliit na kwadrado. | Magpainit ng mantika sa isang malapad na kawali. Igisa ang sibuyas hanggang maging malinaw ito. Isama ang luya, bawang, at siling pangsigang at igisa. | Idagdag ang tinadtad na tenga at pisngi ng baboy. Lutuin sa loob ng 10-12 minuto. Timplahan ng toyo, asin, at paminta. | Ilipat sa isang plato. Budburan ng hiniwang siling labuyo. Ihain habang mainit pa o sa isang sizzling plate.
ingredient_names: pork | vegetable oil | ginger | green chili finger | calamansi

recipe_name: Beef Papaitan Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 1/2 kilo beef tripe | 1/4 kilo Beef (hiniwa nang manipis) | 1/4 Cup beef bile or apdo | 1 medium red onion (hiniwa ng pino) | 1 head Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 Small ginger (luya) (hiniwa) | 2 pieces red chili pepper (siling labuyo) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper | 1 tablespoon Fish sauce
instructions: Hugasan at masahin ang tuwalya gamit ang sea salt para mawala ang masangsang na amoy. | Pakuluan ang tuwalya sa malaking kaldero hanggang sa lumambot, tapos alisin sa tubig at hiwain nang kwadrado na may sukat na 1/2 pulgada. Itabi. | Igisa ang luya, bawang at sibuyas hanggang sa maluto at idagdag ang tuwalya. Lagyan ng asin at paminta, ayon sa panlasa. | Igisa pa ng ilang minuto tapos dagdagan ng tubig, sapat lamang para matakpan lahat ng sangkap. | Pakuluan at idagdag ang baka hanggang sa maluto. | Ilaglag ang siling labuyo at siling haba at unti-unting ibuhos ang apdo para hindi masobrahan sa pait ang putahe. (Pwede mong i-adjust ang dami ng ilalagay mong apdo ayon sa iyong panlasa.) | Timplahan ng patis, ayon sa panlasa.
ingredient_names: beef tripe | beef | beef bile | ginger | red chili pepper

recipe_name: Pansit Palabok Recipe - Paano Lutuin at mga Sangkap
ingredients: 1 500-gram pack bihon noodles (thin rice noodles) | 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic | 1 medium red onion | 1/2 kilogram ground pork | 3 1/2 cups pork broth | 1 tablespoon Atsuete Seeds (annatto seeds) (nakababad sa 1/4 cup pork broth) | 1 piece shrimp bouillon cube | 3 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 4 tablespoons cornstarch (tinunaw sa 1/4 cup pork broth) | 1/4 kilogram Shrimp (niluto at binalatan) | 1/2 Cup tinapa (smoked fish) flakes | 1/2 Cup chicharon (tinadtad) | 3 pieces hardboiled eggs (binalatan at hiniwa) | 1-2 cups cabbage (hiniwa ng manipis) | 1 Cup squid (niluto) | Garlic (tinadtad at pinirito) | spring onions | calamansi
instructions: Lutuin ang bihon ayon sa nakasaad sa wrapper nito. Hanguin at itabi. | Magpa-init ng mantika sa isang kalan at igisa ang bawang at sibuyas. | Idagdag ang giniling na baboy at lutuin ng limang minuto o kaya'y hanggang maluto. | Ibuhos ang 3 tasang pork broth na pinagtunawan ng achuete. Hayaang kumulo. | Ihulog ang shrimp bouillon cube, ihalo ang patis at tinunaw na cornstarch. | Ihalo ang sarsa hanggang lumapot at itabi. | Ihain sa plato ayon sa pagkakasunod: bihon, sarsa, sahog at tinadtad na dahon ng sibuyas. Tabihan ng sliced kalamansi.
ingredient_names: 500 bihon noodle | pork | pork broth | seeds annatto | shrimp bouillon cube | cornstarch | shrimp niluto | fish flake | chicharon | eggs binalatan | cabbage | squid | garlic tinadtad | green onion | calamansi

ingredients: 3 tablespoons Oil | 1 kilo Chicken (cut into pieces) | 3 cloves garlic  (minced) | 1 medium onion (peeled and chopped) | 2 inch ginger (peeled and minced) | 1  Knorr chicken cube | 2-3 tablespoons curry powder | 2 cups of coconut cream | 1 cup of water | 2 medium Potatoes (cubed) | 1 large carrot (cubed) | salt and pepper to taste
instructions: In a medium-sized pot over medium heat, pour the oil. Sear the chicken pieces and brown on all sides. Remove from the pan and set aside. | In the same pot, saute the garlic until browned. Add the onions and ginger. Return the chicken to the pot. | Add the Knorr chicken cube and curry powder. Saute for a few minutes, add the coconut cream and water. Add the potatoes and the carrots. Let it simmer for 15 minutes covered. Then let it simmer again for 10 minutes until the sauce is thick. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: chicken | ginger | curry powder | coconut cream | potato | carrot | salt and pepper

ingredients: 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 3 cloves Garlic (peeled, chopped) | 1 piece bay leaf | 1/4 teaspoon ground black pepper | 1 1/4 kilogram whole chicken (cut into serving pieces) | 1 1/2 cups Flour | 1/2 Cup water | Oil (for deep frying)
instructions: Mix adobo sauce together in a large bowl: soy sauce, garlic, black pepper, vinegar, and bay leaf. Add chicken and marinate, covered, overnight. | Mix flour, salt, and pepper together. Reserve 1 tablespoon for the gravy. Set aside. | When ready to cook, heat enough oil for deep frying. Lightly drain a chicken piece from the adobo marinade. Toss into the flour mixture until completely coated. Repeat with remaining chicken pieces. | Fry chicken in the hot oil until cooked through, cooking in batches as needed. Drain on a rack over paper towels. Set aside. | To make the adobo gravy, transfer adobo marinade into a small saucepan and add water. Bring to a boil then bring to a boil. Gently boil at least 5 minutes. In a small container, mix 1 tablespoon fried chicken oil and 1 tablespoon leftover flour from coating the fried chicken together. Add to the saucepan with the adobo sauce and whisk in. Bring to a simmer again and cook until just thickened. Serve with fried chicken adobo.

ingredients: 1 to 1.5 kilo oxtail (cut up) | 2 pieces Onions (quartered) | water (enough to cover the meat) | 4 tablespoons canola oil | 2 tablespoons achuete seeds | 1 piece onion (chopped) | 10 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1/2 cup of Creamy peanut butter | 3 pieces eggplants (sliced) | 1 bundle sitaw (cut into 2-inch pieces) | 1 Pack pechay Tagalog (sliced) | 1  Knorr Beef Cubes
instructions: First, you need to tenderize the oxtail to be able to enjoy this majestic dish. Get a pot and throw in the oxtail and quartered onions in. Pour the water and just boil over high heat then reduce to a simmer until oxtail is tender. Once tender, strain the oxtail from the broth and set aside the meat and broth. | Now, get a pan and combine the oil and annatto seeds together. Cook over low heat for 3 minutes or until the color of the oil turn orange. Strain out the seeds then pour the infused oil back into the pan. Throw in the onions and garlic and saute until lightly toasted. Add the softened oxtail next and continue to saute. | Just a few more steps and this dish is done. Add the peanut butter, 1 to 1/2 cups of broth (where oxtail was softened) and Knorr Beef Cube. Mix well until peanut butter is dissolved. Simmer for 15-20 minutes until sauce has slightly thickened. | Now, add the vegetables last and cook until done. That s it! Classic kare-kare is best enjoyed with a serving of warm bagoong.

recipe_name: Cheesy Pork and Shrimp Lumpia Recipe

Fold the wrapper over and roll the wrapper sealing the edges with water. | When ready to cook, heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Place the lumpia in the hot oil, and cook for 5 to 7 minutes each side. Fry in batches. Remove from heat, and drain on paper towels. Serve with banana ketchup or sauce of choice.

Ihain kasama ng garlic rice, atsara, at sarsa na gawa sa toyo, sukang tuba, at sili, depende sa kung gusto Ang recipe na ito ay orihinal na na-publish sa Abril 2017 na issue ng Good Housekeeping Philippines.

Idagdag ang hipon, at lutuin hanggang magka-kulay ang parehong panig. | Ilagay ang piniritong tokwa at lutong rice noodles sa wok. Ibuhos ang sarsa gawa sa sampalok, at haluin. ingredients: 1 kilogram Pork belly (halved) | 8 cups water (or as needed) | 1 tablespoon Salt | 1 teaspoon black peppercorns | 1 piece dried bay leaf | 1 40-gram pack sinigang sa sampaloc mix | 1 Small radish (labanos) (peeled, cut into rounds) | 3 Small tomatoes (quartered) | 1 bunch kangkong (water spinach) (tender stems and leaves only) | 1 bunch string beans (sitaw) (cut into 3-inch lengths) | 1 piece green finger chili (siling haba)

recipe_name: Pork Hamonado Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 2 cups pineapple juice | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 5 tablespoons brown sugar | 1 kilogram pork tenderloin ((gumamit ng parteng lomo o pige), hiwain ng malapad at manipis (tapa)) | 3 tablespoons canola oil | 1 large can canned pineapples (sinala, humigit kumulang 20 onsa) | 1 Cup water | 1 teaspoon liquid seasoning | Salt (pangtimpla)
instructions: Gawin ang pangtimpla: paghaluin ang katas ng pinya, asukal na pula at soy sauce sa isang malaking mangkok. | Ibabad ang baboy sa halong katas ng pinya sa loob ng 1-3 oras. | Alisin ang karne mula sa pinagbabaran at itabi ang natitirang pangtimpla. | Painitan ang mantika sa kawali at iprito ang tinimplahang karne hanggang sa maging light brown ang kulay (humigit-kumulang 3-5 minuto). | Ibuhos ang natitirang pangtimpla kasama ang hiwang pinya, tubig at liquid seasoning at pakuluan sa loob ng 45-60 minuto. | Lagyan ng asin at paminta ayon sa panlasa. | Hiwain ang karne bago ihain. Lagyan ng mga hiwang pinya at sarsa.
ingredient_names: pineapple juice | brown sugar | hiwain ng malapad | canola oil | humigit kumulang onsa | liquid

recipe_name: Lechon Paksiw Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 500 Grams leftover lechon | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 2 tablespoons white onion (tinadtad) | 4 cloves Garlic (binalatan at dinikdik) | 1/2 tablespoon ginger (luya) (hiniwa) | 1 piraso laurel leaf ((dahon ng laurel)) | 1/2 tablespoons black peppercorns ((pamintang buo)) | 2 tablespoons vinegar (suka) | 1 Cup lechon sauce | 1/2 Cup water | 1 teaspoon brown sugar | 1 teaspoon Soy Sauce | Salt (ayon sa panlasa)
instructions: Initin ang canola oil sa isang kaserola gamit ang katamtamang lakas ng apoy. Gisahin ang mga sibuyas, bawang, luya, dahon ng laurel, at paminta nang 1 minuto. Idagdag ang suka at hayaang kumulo nang dalawang minuto. Idagdag ang lechon at lutuin pa ng 2 minuto. | Idagdag ang lechon sauce, tubig, pulang asukal, at toyo. Pakuluin. Pagakatpos kumulo ay hayaang magngitngit sa mahinang apoy nang 15 minuto. Dagdagan ng asin ayon sa iyong panlasa.
ingredient_names: leftover lechon | canola oil | garlic binalatan | ginger | piraso laurel leaf | black peppercorn | lechon sauce | brown sugar

recipe_name: Spicy Stir Fried Pusit Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 5 cloves Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 big red onion (tinadtad) | 2 pieces green chilies (siling pangsigang) | 1 tablespoon chili flakes | 1/4 Cup black beans (tausi) | 1/2 Cup peanuts | 1/2 kilo fresh squid (pusit) (nilinis at nakahiwa) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon sugar | Salt (ayon sa panlasa) | black pepper (ayon sa panlasa)
instructions: Initin ang cooking oil sa kawali at igisa ang bawang hanggang sa magkulay ito. Idagdag ang sibuyas, berdeng sili, chili flakes, itim na beans, at mani. Lutuin ng limang minuto sa katamtamang init. | Idagdag ang posit. Lagyan ng toyo, asin, paminta, at asukal at pabayaang kumulo ng limang minuto. Ihain agad.
ingredient_names: big onion | green chily | chili flake | black bean | peanut | squid nilinis

recipe_name: Chicken Afritada Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 4 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 medium onion (nakahiwa ng maliliit na kwadrado) | 4 cloves Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 kilo Chicken (nakahiwa sa serving sizes) | 1 pack (200-gram) Tomato sauce | 1 Cup water (dagdagan kung kailangan) | 1 large potato (akahiwa sa apat na piraso) | 1 large carrot (naka-slice) | 1 large red bell pepper (naka-slice) | 1 teaspoon white sugar (o ayon sa panlasa) | Salt (ayon sa panlasa) | black pepper (ayon sa panlasa)
instructions: Igisa ang sibuyas at bawang sa pinainit na kawali na may cooking oil. | Ihalo ang manok at igisa hanggang maging light brown. | Ibuhos ang tomato sauce at tubig at pakuluan ng 30 to 40 minuto. | Idagdag ang patatas at karots at lutuin ng 7 minuto o hanggang lumambot ang gulay. | Idagdag ang bell pepper. Lagyan ng asin, asukal, paminta at lutuin pa ng ilang minuto.
ingredient_names: chicken | tomato sauce | potato | carrot | bell pepper

recipe_name: Ginataang Halo-Halo Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 1 Cup glutinous rice flour | 1 tablespoon rice flour | 1/2 Cup water (maligamgam na tubig, dagdagan ng 1 teaspoon na tubig) | 4 cups fresh coconut milk (gata) | 1 Cup sugar | 1 Cup ripe jackfruit (langka) (kinalas) | 3 cups sweet potatoes (kamote) (nakahiwa ng maliliit na kwadrado) | 1 Cup taro root (gabi) (nakahiwa ng maliliit na kwadrado) | 1/2 Cup Ube (nakahiwa ng maliliit na kwadrado) | 1 1/4 Cup Banana (saba variety), (nakahiwa) | 2 cups cooked tapioca pearls (sago) | 1 Cup coconut cream ((kakang gata))
instructions: Gawin ang malagkit na bola-bola: Ipagsama ang glutinous rice flour at rice flour. Dagdagan ng mainit-init na tubig at masahin ito. Kumuha ng 1/2 tbsp ng masa at gawing bola. Ilagay sa plato. Ulitin hanggang maubos ang masa. Takpan ng plastic wrap ang mga bola-bola at itabi. | Pakuluan ang 3 tasa ng tubig, gata, asukal, at langka sa kaldero sa katamtamang init. Bawasan ang init at pakuluan ng sampung minuto. | Idagdag ang kamote, gabi, ube, at saba. Pakuluan hanggang lumambot. Idagdag ang malagkit na bola-bolang ginawa at sago. Pakuluan ng lima hanggang walong minuto. | Idagdag ang kakang gata at pakuluan pa ng limang minuto. Ihain habang mainit.
ingredient_names: glutinous rice flour | rice flour | water maligamgam na tubig | coconut milk | jackfruit | sweet potato | taro root | ube | banana | cooked tapioca pearl | coconut cream

recipe_name: Pininyahang Manok Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 2 tablespoons ginger (luya) (tinadtad) | 3 cloves Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 medium white onion (naka-slice) | 500 Grams Chicken (gumamit ng chicken thighs (hita ng manok)) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1 small can pineapple chunks | Salt (ayon sa panlasa) | black pepper (ayon sa panlasa)
instructions: Igisa sa mantika ang luya, sibuyas, at bawang. | Idagdag ang manok at patis. Gisahin ng 10 minuto o hanggang ma prito ng bahagya ang karne. | Ihalo ang tomato sauce at timplahan ng asin at paminta ayon sa iyong panlasa. Pakuluan ng 15 minuto. | Ibuhos ang pinya kasama ang syrup nito. Pakuluan ng 5  - 10 minuto.
ingredient_names: ginger | chicken | chunk

recipe_name: Pochero Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 medium white onion (nakahiwa ng maliliit na kwadrado) | 4 cloves Garlic (tinadtad) | 1/2 kilo pork (gumamit ng country-style boneless ribs or pork belly, nakahiwa sa 1/2-inch na piraso) | 1/2 kilo Beef (gumamit ng chuck or brisket, nakahiwa ng 1/2-inch na piraso) | 1/2 kilo Chicken (nakahiwa sa maliliit na piraso) | 2 pieces tomatoes (tinadtad) | 2 tablespoons patis (fish sauce) | 2 cups water | 2 pieces Potatoes (nakahati sa 4 na piraso ang bawat isa) | 1 pack (200-gram) Tomato sauce | 3-4 pieces saba | 1 bunch bok choy | 1 head cabbage | Salt (ayon sa panlasa) | 2 pieces eggplant (inihaw, opsyonal)
instructions: Sa malalim na kaldero, initin ang mantika, igisa ang sibuyas at bawang. | Ilagay ang baboy, baka at manok. Idagdag ang kamatis at hayaang maluto hangga't ma-prito ng bahagya ang lahat ng mga karne. | Ilagay ang patis at hayaang kumulo ng 3-5 minuto. | Ibuhos ang tubig at takpan ang kaldero. Pakuluan hanggang lumambot ang karne, mga 30 -40 minuto. | Ihalo ang patatas at tomato sauce at pakuluan ng 5-6 minuto. | Timplahan ng asin o patis ayon sa iyong panlasa. | Idagdag ang saging na saba at antaying lumambot. | Ilagay ang pechay at repolyo, patayin ang apoy at takpan. Hayaan ng 5 minuto sa loob ng kaldero. | Ihain ng may ka-ternong inihaw na talong (tinadtad) at bagoong.
ingredient_names: pork gumamit ng country style rib | nakahiwa ng 1 2 na piraso | chicken | tomato | potato | tomato sauce | saba | bok choy | cabbage | eggplant inihaw

ingredients: 2 tablespoons canola oil | 2 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 medium red onion (peeled, sliced) | 2 Small tomatoes (chopped) | 1 piece chicken breast fillet (cut into strips) | 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1/8 teaspoon black peppercorns (crushed) | 1/2 piece dried bay leaf | 1 bundle string beans (trimmed, cut into 3-inch lengths)
instructions: Saute the garlic in oil until golden brown. Add the onions and cook until translucent. Then add the tomatoes and chicken strips. Stir fry until the chicken is cooked. | Add the soy sauce, vinegar, ground black pepper, and bay leaf, and let the mixture simmer on Low heat for 5 minutes or until the mixture slightly thickens. Add sitaw and simmer, tossing, until the string beans are tender yet crisp. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: canola oil | tomato | chicken | black peppercorn | dried bay leaf | sitaw

ingredients: 1 medium red onion (peeled, quartered) | 1 kilogram pork pigue (adobo cut) | 6 cups water | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) (more to taste) | 1 teaspoon black peppercorns (lightly crushed) | 4 medium potaotes (peeled, quartered) | 1 small head cabbage (quartered) | 1 bunch green beans (Baguio beans) (trimmed) | calamansi (to serve) | birds eye chilies (siling labuyo) (to serve) | Oil (as needed)
instructions: Heat oil in a pressure cooker over medium heat. Add onion, and stir to lightly saute. Add pork chunks, water, patis, and black peppercorns. Increase heat to High, and bring to a boil. Remove any scum that rises to the surface. Cover and lock lid, lowering heat to Low. Simmer 30 minutes or until pork is tender. | Turn off the heat. Release the pressure from the pressure cooker before unlocking and removing the lid. Add potatoes. Bring back to a simmer, and cook potatoes until tender. Add cabbage and green beans. Cook until just tender, about 15 to 20 more minutes. Serve with steamed rice, patis, calamansi, and siling labuyo on the side.
ingredient_names: pork pigue | black peppercorn | potaote | cabbage | sitaw | calamansi | chily

recipe_name: Homemade Fish Balls Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 500 Grams fish fillet ((tilapia ang ginamit sa recipe na ito)) | 1 piece (1-inch) ginger (binalatan) | 4 cups Potatoes (hatiin nang maliliit) | 1 Cup carrot (hatiin nang maliliit) | 1 whole Garlic (hatiin nang maliliit) | 1 medium Egg (batihin) | 1 1/2 cups cornstarch | 1/2 Cup cassava flour | Salt (pampalasa) | 8 cups fish stock | Oil (para sa pagprito) | 1 Cup Vinegar | 1 Cup clear soda ((7-up o Sprite)) | 1 Cup brown sugar | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons cornstarch (tunawin sa 3 kutsara ng tubig) | chili flakes (kung nais idagdag)
instructions: Maglagay ng asin at luya sa tubig at pakuluan ito. Kapag kumukulo na ang tubig, ilubog ang isda hanggang sa maluto ito. | Kapag luto na ang isda, hiwain sa maliliit na piraso. Gawin ito hanggang may 4 na tasa ka na ng pira-pirasong isda. | Sa hiwalay na kaldero, pakuluan ang patatas at karots hanggang sa lumambot ang mga ito. | Ilagay ang pira-pirasong isda, patatas, karots, bawang, at itlog sa food processor. Pindutin ang Puree setting hanggang maging pino ang timpla. | Ilipat sa mangkok at idagdag ang gawgaw at cassava flour. Ihalo mabuti. Timplahan ng asin at paminta. | Bilugin ang timpla at gawing 1-pulgadang bola. Pakuluan ang fish balls kasama ang fish stock hanggang mamuo ang kulay nito. Alisin ang mga fish ball sa tubig. | Kapag ihahain, i-prito sa mantika hanggang maging mapula. (I-freeze ang mga hindi pa lutong fish ball kung hindi pa lulutuin.) Gawin ang sawsawan: sa isang kawali, paghaluin ang suka, soda, asukal, at toyo. Pakuluan hanggang matunaw ang asukal. Tsaka idagdag ang gawgaw (dagdagan ang gawgaw para mas lumapot ang sawdawan); pakuluan Mabuti para mawala ang lasa ng gawgaw. Para sa maanghang na sawsawan, dagdagan ng sili. Ihain ang fish balls kasama ang sawsawan.
ingredient_names: fillet | ginger | potato | carrot | whole garlic | egg | cornstarch | cassava flour | fish stock | clear soda | brown sugar | chili

recipe_name: Spicy Tuna Pasta Recipe - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 1 400-gram pack spaghetti | 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 medium red onion (nakahiwa ng manipis) | 3 medium tomatoes (nakahiwa ng manipis) | 1 180-gram can Tuna (hot and spicy flavor) | 1 180-gram can tuna flakes in oil
instructions: Magpakulo ng tubig sa kaldero. Lutuin ang spaghetti ng naaayon sa package instructions. Alisan ng tubig at itabi. | Sa isang malaking kawali, mag-init ng cooking oil. Igisa ang sibuyas pagkatapos ang bawang naman hanggang lumambot at medyo mawalan ng kulay. Idagdag ang kamatis at lutuin, haluin hanggang lumambot. | Idagdag ang dalawang klaseng tuna at lutuin hanggang uminit. Lagyan ng asin at paminta. Ihalo ang nilutong spaghetti bago ihain.
ingredient_names: 400 spaghetti | tomato | flavor | tuna

recipe_name: Ginataang Upo With Fried Fish Recipe
ingredients: 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 Small red onion (sliced) | 1/2 Cup water | 1 large upo (bottle gourd) (chopped) | 6 pieces fresh suahe/shrimps (deveined) | 1 Cup coconut milk | 2 pieces dried fish (daing or labahita fillet) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper
instructions: In a pan, heat oil and saute garlic and onions. Add water and upo. Simmer until upo is half cooked. | Add coconut milk, shrimps, and dried fish. Simmer for 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: upo | suahe shrimp | coconut milk | labahita fillet

recipe_name: Laing Recipe (Dahon Ng Gabi sa Gata) - Paano Lutuin At Mga Sangkap
ingredients: 100 Grams taro leaves (dahon ng gabi) (tuyo) | 2 slices Pork belly (hiwain sa 1/4 na pulgadang haba) | 1-2 tablespoons shrimp paste (bagoong) | 2 cloves Garlic (tinadtad) | 3 cups coconut milk (gata) | 1 thumb-sized ginger (hiwain nang pahaba) | 4 pieces green chili fingers (siling pang-sigang) | 2 pieces red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (hiwain nang manipis)
instructions: Sa isang malaking kawali, sa katamtamang init, ilatag ang mga hiwa ng baboy at lagyan ng tubig hanggang matakpan lahat ng laman. Takpan ang kawali at hayaang maluto ang laman. Hintaying matuyo ang tubig at lumambot ang taba ng baboy. | Isama ang bagoong alamang, bawang, gata, at luya sa kawali at haluin sa loob ng 2 minuto. | Idagdag ang dahon ng gabi at hayaang sipsipin nito ang gata. Huwag haluin ang mga dahon ng gabi. Hayaang kumulo ito at matuyo, aabutin ito ng kulang-kulang sampung minuto. | Idagdag ang kakang gata o coconut cream, siling pansigang, at siling labuyo. Muli, hayaan itong kumulo at matuyo ng 10 minuto. Dagdagan pa ng sili kung nais ng mas maanghang na timpla. Ihain kasama ng mainit na kanin at iba pang ulam.
ingredient_names: taro | pork | coconut milk | ginger | green chili finger | red chili pepper

recipe_name: Beef Caldereta Recipe - Mga Sangkap At Paano Lutuin
ingredients: 1 tablespoon cooking oil (para sa pag-prito) | 1 kilo beef short ribs (hiwain nang tig-dadalawang pulgada) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 Cup white onion (tinadtad) | 1 1/4 cups Tomato sauce | 2 tablespoons tomato paste | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper (ayon sa panlasa) | 2 teaspoons fish sauce (patis) (ayon sa panlasa) | 2 pieces bay leaf | 1 Cup water | 2 tablespoons peanut butter | 1 Cup coconut milk (gata) | 3 medium Potatoes (hiwain sa dalawa) | 1/3 Cup pimiento strips | 1-3 pieces birds eye chilies (siling labuyo) (Optional)
instructions: Painitin ang mantika sa isang kasirola na may makapal na ilalim sa katamtaman hanggang malakas na apoy. Unti-unting iluto ang mga hiwa ng baka. Siguraduhing luto ang bawat gilid. Itabi. | Ibalik ang laman sa kasirola. Haluin at lagyan ng asin, paminta, at patis. Ilagay ng dahon ng laurel sa dulo. | Dagdagan ng tubig, peanut butter, at gata. Kapag nagsimulang kumulo ang sarsa, ilagay sa pinakamababa ang apoy ng kalan. Takpan ang kasirola at hayaang kumulo ang kaldereta hanggang sa kaya nang tusukin ng tinidor ang laman ng baka. Kalimitang inaabot ito ng 1 1/2 hanggang 2 oras. Haluin ang kaldereta kada 15 minuto upang hindi masunog ang ilalim ng kasirola. Kung kinakailangan, dagdagan ng kaunting tubig ang sarsa upang hindi ito matuyo. | Iprito ang patatas at karots hanggang maging mapula ang mga ito. | Kapag malambot na ang laman, idagdag ang patatas, karots, pimiento slices, at siling labuyo, kung gagamit. Hayaang maluto ang mga gulay. Timplahan gamit ang asin o patis kung kinakailangan.
ingredient_names: beef short rib | tomato sauce | tomato paste | bay leaf | peanut butter | coconut milk | potato | pimiento | chily

ingredients: 2 tablespoons | 1 medium red onion (sliced) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1/2 kilogram pork kasim (cubed) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 4 cups water | 1 250-gram pack Tomato sauce | 2 medium Potatoes (quartered) | 1 medium carrot (cubed) | 1 medium red and green bell pepper, (seeded, sliced) | 1 Cup green peas | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot placed over medium heat. Saute onion and garlic until fragrant. Add in the pork, and brown on all sides. Add soy sauce, and continue to cook for 2 minutes. | Pour in the water and tomato sauce, then simmer for 30 minutes or until pork is tender. Add the potato, carrots, bell peppers, and peas. Simmer for another 5 to 7 minutes, or until the potatoes are cooked through. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: pork kasim | 250 tomato sauce | potato | carrot | bell pepper | green pea

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper | 1 tablespoon sugar | 4 cloves Garlic (roughly chopped) | 250 Grams kangkong (water spinach) (trimmed and sliced into 4-inch pieces) | 1 Small red onion (chopped) | Spicy Bagoong (to serve)
instructions: Mix together oil, soy sauce, pepper, sugar, and garlic in a bowl. Add kangkong and toss to combine. Transfer to a plate or lined steamer basket. | Steam kangkong mixture until fully cooked, about 5 minutes. Top with red onions. Serve with bagoong, if desired.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | kangkong | spicy shrimp paste

ingredients: 500 Grams squid (cleaned) | 1/4 Cup cane vinegar | 1 tablespoon Salt (divided) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 3/4 cups fresh coconut milk (gata) | 2 pieces dried bay leaves | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon ground black pepper | 1 teaspoon sugar | fried garlic (to serve)
instructions: Combine squid, vinegar, and 1 tablespoon salt in a pot. Simmer over low heat for 3 to 5 minutes or until squid is just cooked. Reserve vinegar mixture. | Heat oil in a pot over medium-low heat. Saute garlic until fragrant. Add coconut milk and simmer for 3 minutes. Add bay leaves and 1 cup vinegar mixture. Simmer until thick, about 10 minutes. | Add salt, pepper, and sugar. Simmer for 1 minute. Add squid and stir until coated. Top with fried garlic. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: squid | cane vinegar | vegetable oil | coconut milk | dried bay leave | fried garlic

ingredients: 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 Small red onion (chopped) | 1 Small tomato (chopped) | 1/2 Cup water | 5 cups sigarilyas (winged beans) (chopped) | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | Oil (for sauteing)
instructions: In a frying pan over medium heat, heat oil and saute garlic, tomato, and onions. Add ground pork and cook until browned. | Add water and sigarilyas. Bring to a boil then simmer for 10 minutes or until sigarilyas is tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: tomato | sigarilya

ingredients: 500 Grams pork (sinigang cut) | water (pang kulo) | 1 medium tomato (nakahiwa sa apat na piraso) | 1 Small white onion (nakahiwa sa apat na piraso) | 1 Cup taro (gabi) (nakahiwa) | 3-4 tablespoons Sinigang Na Gabi Mix | 1 piece green chili (siling pangsigang) | 1-2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1/2 Cup sitaw (green beans) (nakahiwa ng 2-inch na haba) | 1/4 Cup radish (labanos) (nakahiwa) | 1/2 Cup okra | 2 cups kangkong leaves or water spinach leaves (hinugasan at naka-trim) | Salt
instructions: Ilagay ang karne, kamatis, at sibuyas sa kaserola na may tubig, at ang karne ay nakalubog sa tubig. Kapag kumulo, hinaan ang apoy, at hayaan ito sa loob nang 1-1 1/2 oras o hanggang sa lumambot ang karne. Salain ang ibabaw ng tubig at alisin ang anumang dumi. Pwedeng magdagdag ng tubig kung kinakailangan. | Pagkatapos lutuin ang karne nang 30 minuto, idagdag ang hiniwang gabi. Kapag malambot na ang karne, idagdag na ang sinigang mix at siling tagalog o green chili, at pakuluan nang 5 minuto. Idagdag ang sitaw, labanos, at okra, at pakuluan ulit nang 5 minuto. | Timplahan ng patis, saka idagdag ang dahon ng kangkong, at pakuluan sa loob ng 2-3 minuto. Iayon ang timpla sa panlasa. Ihain habang mainit pa.
ingredient_names: pork | tomato | taro | sinigang na gabi mix | green chili | sitaw | radish | okra | kangkong

ingredients: 250 Grams cooked rice vermicelli noodles (bihon) | vegetable oil (pang-gisa) | 2 pieces boneless chicken thigh fillets (nakahiwa nang manipis) | 200 Grams Shrimp (nabalatan at nalinis) | 1  Chinese chorizo (naka-slice ng manipis) | 1/2 Cup fish balls (naka-slice ng manipis) | 1 Small red onion (naka-chop) | 2-3 cloves Garlic (tinadtad) | 2 large carrots (naka-slice ng manipis) | 1 Small cabbage (naka-shred) | 1 1/2 to 2 cups chicken broth | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons green onions (naka-chop)
instructions: Ibabad ang pansit bihon sa malamig na tubig sa loob nang 30 minuto at saka salain nang mabuti. | Sa isang malaking kawali, painitin ang mantika. Idagdag ang manok, habang hinahalo sa loob nang 3-5 minuto o hanggang sa maging kulay brown ito. Idagdag ang hipon at lutuin nang 2-3 minuto o hanggang sa mag-iba ang kulay. Itabi sandali. | Punasan ang kawali, at saka magdagdag ng mantika kung kailangan. Lutuin ang hiwa-hiwang chorizo habang hinahalo, hanggang sa maging kulay Idagdag ang fish ball. Itabi sandali. | Gamit ang parehong kawali, lutuin ang sibuyas at bawang. Idagdag ang carrot, at saka lutuin sa loob nang 30 segundo. Idagdag ang repolyo. Ibalik ang karneng manok, chorizo, fish balls, at hipon sa kawali. Lutuin ang gulay sa pamamagitan ng pag-toss habang hinahalo, hanggang sa maging malambot pero malutong pa rin ang gulay. | Idagdag ang bihon. Magbuhos ng kalahating tasa ng chicken stock nang paunti-unti. Idagdag din ang toyo. Marahan itong i-toss at haluin; magdagdan ng tubig kung kailangan, hanggang sa tumaba ang pancit bihon kung saan sakto ang tekstura sa pagtikim, at ang tubig ay nasipsip. Timplahan ng asin at paminta. Paibabawan ng hiwa-hiwang murang sibuyas o green onion, at ihain kasama ng calamansi.
ingredient_names: rice vermicelli noodle | vegetable oil | chicken | shrimp nabalatan | chinese chorizo | fish ball | carrot | cabbage | chicken broth | green onion

ingredients: 1 whole Maya-Maya (Grouper) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1 tablespoon Flour | cooking oil (pang prito) | 1 teaspoon Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 tablespoon ginger (naka julienne) | 2 medium red onion (naka slice) | 2 pieces green bell pepper (naka slice ng mahabang piraso) | 1 medium carrot (naka julienne) | 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 2 cups water | 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup brown sugar | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons cornstarch (tinunaw sa 3 tablespoons ng tubig)
instructions: Kuskusan ng asin at paminta ang isda. Budburan ng harina at saka i-deep-fry sa mainit na mantika. Itabi sandali. | Sa isang kaserola, igisa ang bawang, luya, sibuyas, karot at bell pepper sa mantika. | Magdagdag ng tubig, suka, asukal, toyo, at cornstarch. Pakuluan sa loob nang 5 minuto o hanggang sa maluto ang starch at maging malapot na ang sarsa. | Ilagay ang isda sa isang plato at ibuhos ang sarsa sa isda. Ihain habang mainit.
ingredient_names: whole maya | flour | ginger | ng mahabang piraso | carrot | brown sugar | cornstarch

recipe_name: Braised Beef Bulalo With Chorizo And Mushrooms Recipe
ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil | 4 tablespoons salted butter (divided) | 500 Grams beef shank (bulalo) | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 2 stalks Leeks (chopped) | 7 cups water | 2 pieces beef bouillon cubes | 2 medium carrots (sliced) | 2 medium Potatoes (sliced) | 1 210-grams can Chorizo de Bilbao (halved) | 2 cups dried shiitake mushrooms
instructions: In a deep pan, heat olive oil with half the butter over medium-high heat. Add the beef and brown on all sides. Remove from pan, and set aside. | Add the onions, garlic, and leeks. Saute until the vegetables are slightly softened. Add the rest of the butter. Turn the heat to Low, and add the broth. Bring to a simmer. | Add the beef shank, cover, and simmer for 3 to 4 hours or until beef is tender. Stir occasionally. | When beef is already tender, add sliced carrots and potatoes. When carrots and potatoes are soft, add chorizo and mushrooms. Bring the broth back to a boil, then simmer until the broth has been reduced to 1/4 of its volume. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: olive oil | butter | shank | leek | beef bouillon cube | carrot | potato | chorizo de bilbao | dried shiitake mushroom

ingredients: 1 kilogram beef shank (bulalo) | 4 liters water (divided) | 1/4 Cup fish sauce (patis) | 1 medium white onion (quartered) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 2 medium white onion (chopped) | 1 Cup Glutinous rice (malagkit) (rinsed) | 1 Cup long-grain rice (rinsed) | 12-14 cups soup (from bulalo) | 1 tablespoon kasubha (safflower) | 1/4 Cup fish sauce (patis) | 1 1/2 teaspoons ground black pepper | 2 teaspoons sugar | Salt (to taste) | fried garlic bits (to serve) | green onions (chopped, to serve) | calamansi (to serve) | fish sauce (patis) (to serve)
instructions: Make the bulalo: Combine beef shanks, 3 liters water, fish sauce, and onion in a pot. Simmer for 30 minutes, removing scum that rise to the top. | Strain broth to remove impurities. Return to pot. Add remaining 1 liter water. Simmer for 1 1/2 to 2 1/2 hours over low heat or until beef is tender. Cut beef into cubes, reserving bone marrow and soup. Set aside. | Make the lugaw: Heat oil in a pot over medium-low heat. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. | Add malagkit and long-grain rice. Stir for 1 minute. Add 12 cups bulalo soup and simmer over low heat until soup is thick and rice is cooked and tender, about 30 minutes. | Add kasubha, fish sauce, pepper, and sugar. Season with salt to taste. Simmer for 5 more minutes. | Add more bulalo soup, if needed. Add beef cubes and bone marrow. Simmer for 5 minutes. Top with fried garlic and green onions. Serve hot with calamansi and fish sauce on the side.
ingredient_names: beef | vegetable oil | glutinous rice | long grain rice | bulalo | kasubha | fried garlic bit | green onion | calamansi

ingredients: 4 large eggs | 1 Cup cornstarch | 1 1/2 to 2 cups water | 1/4 teaspoon Salt | vegetable oil | 2 cups pork stock | 1/2 Cup sugar | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | 2 tablespoons Garlic (tinadtad) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 teaspoon Garlic (tinadtad) | 1/2 Cup white onion (naka-chop) | 1/2 Cup ground pork | 1 Cup sitaw (naka-slice ng manipis) | 2 cups heart of palm (ubod) (kinalas) | 2 cups sweet potatoes (camote) (kinalas) | 2 cups carrots (kinalas) | 1 block extra firm tofu (naka-slice sa maliliit na piraso) | 2 cups cabbage (kinalas) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | green lettuce leaves | Garlic (naka-chop) | peanuts (dinurog)
instructions: Gumawa ng lumpia wrapper: Magbati ng itlog sa isang mangkok hanggang maging mabula ito. Idagdag ang cornstarch, tubig, asin, habang binabati nang walang tigil. Painitin ang isang nonstick pan sa katamtamang init. Pahiran ito ng vegetable oil. Ibubo ang 1/4 tasa ng mixture sa kawali, dahan-dahang paikutin para makasiguradong malagyan ang lapag ng kawali. Lutuin nang 1 minuto. Ilipat sa platong may mantika. Ulitin ang proseso para sa natitirang | Gumawa ng lumpia sauce: Paghaluin ang stock, asukal, toyo, cornstarch, at 1 kutsarang bawang sa isang maliit na kaserola. Pakuluin at haluin nang tuloy-tuloy hanggang sa lumapot ang sarsa. Painitin ang mantika at idagdag ang bawang. Itabi. | Gumawa ng palaman o filling: Painitin ang kawali. Igisa ang bawang at sibuyas sa loob nang 2 minuto. Idagdag ang karne hanggang maging kulay brown. Idagdag ang sitaw, ubod, kamote, karot, tofu, at repolyo. Lutuin sa loob nang 10 hanggang 15 minuto. Timplahan ng asin at paminta. Ihalo rito ang 1/4 tasa ng sarsa ng lumpia. | Ilagay ang dahon ng lettuce sa isang parte ng lumpia wrapper. Ibuhos ang 1/4 tasa ng filling. Itupi ang dulo at saka pagulungin para makasiguradong hindi aapaw ang palaman. Ihain kasama ang sarsa ng lumpia, at paibabawan ng bawang at mani.
ingredient_names: egg | cornstarch | vegetable oil | pork stock | pork | sitaw | heart palm | sweet potato | carrot | firm tofu | cabbage | green lettuce leave | peanut

ingredients: 2 500-gram packs firm tofu (tokwa) (cut into squares) | 2 tablespoons Oil | 1 head Garlic (cloves separated) | 2 pieces dried bay leaves | 1/2 teaspoon whole black peppercorns | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1/2 Cup water | 1/2 Cup coconut cream (gata) | cooking oil (for deep frying)
instructions: In a large frying pan over medium heat, cook tofu squares in enough oil for deep frying until golden brown on all sides. Drain on a rack over paper towels. Set aside and keep warm. | Meanwhile, heat about 2 tablespoons oil over in a wok over medium heat. Saute garlic, bay leaf, and whole peppercorns for 3 to 4 minutes. | Add soy sauce, white vinegar, and water. Simmer for 5 minutes or until vinegar s acidity is cooked off. | Add coconut cream and stir to mix. Add cooked tofu to the wok and toss to combine. Bring to a gentle simmer and simmer until just heated through and the tofu has absorbed some of the adobo sauce. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: firm tofu | dried bay leave | whole black peppercorn | coconut cream | deep frying

ingredients: 1 500-gram pack firm tofu or tokwa (cut into squares) | 1/4 Cup honey | 1 Cup chicken broth | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 teaspoons sesame oil | 1/2 Cup water | 2 teaspoons sesame seeds | 2 tablepoons Oil | 1 large red onion (peeled, sliced) | 3 cloves Garlic (peeled, chopped) | 1 teaspoon ginger (peeled, grated) | 1 400-gram can whole button mushrooms (quartered) | 1 Small carrot (peeled, cut into thin sticks) | 1 medium sayote (peeled, seed removed, and cut into thin sticks) | 1 bunch string beans (sitaw) (cut into 3-inch lengths) | 2 Small red bell peppers (seeded, cut into thin strips) | 1 425-gram can young corn (cut into 1-inch pieces) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a large frying pan over medium heat, cook tofu until golden brown on all sides. Drain on a rack over paper towels. Using scissors, cut each square in half. Set aside and keep warm. | Meanwhile, make the sauce: in a medium bowl, mix chicken broth, honey, sesame oil, soy sauce, water, and cornstarch until well mixed. Add sesame seeds. Set aside. | In a large wok over medium-high heat, heat oil. Add onions and saute until just translucent. Add garlic and ginger, and saute. | Add mushrooms, carrots, and sayote strips, and saute until just softened and heated through. | Add string beans, red bell peppers, and young corn. Saute until just heated through. | Create a well in the center and pour in prepared sauce. Stir until the sauce thickens then toss vegetables together. Add tofu and toss everything together. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: 500 firm tofu | honey | chicken broth | sesame oil | sesame seed | tablepoon oil | ginger | whole button mushroom | carrot | thin | sitaw | bell pepper | young corn

ingredients: 1 tablespoon cooking oil | 5 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1 kilogram Pork belly (cut into cubes) | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 2 cups water | 4 pieces bird's eye chili (siling labuyo) | 1 tablespoon black peppercorns | 4 pieces dried bay leaves
instructions: In a pot over medium heat, heat oil. Saute garlic until fragrant. Add in the pork and cook until changes in color (about 2 to 3 minutes per side). | Add soy sauce and vinegar. Let cook for 5 minutes or until the vinegar has cooked off. Add red chilies, peppercorns, bay leaves, and water. Bring to a boil then simmer for 40 to 45 minutes or until pork is fork tender. Remove from heat. Serve with hot rice.
ingredient_names: pork | bird's eye chili | black peppercorn | dried bay leave

ingredients: 1 tablespoon cooking oil | 1 Small red onion (minced) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/2 kilogram ground pork | 1 227-gram can canned pineapples (tidbits with syrup) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a medium nonstick frying pan over medium-high heat. Cook garlic and onion until fragrant. Add in the pork and cook until browned (about 7 minutes). | Add soy sauce, pineapples and its syrup. Simmer for another 5 minutes or until the sauce has reduced. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
ingredient_names: pork | pineapples tidbit

ingredients: 205 Grams pork | 100 Grams Shrimp (tinatad) | 1/2 tablespoon Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 medium white onion (tinadtad) | 1 Small carrot (naka slice na kwadrado) | 1 Small singkamas (naka slice na kwadrado) | 1 stalk celery (naka slice na kwadrado) | 4 stalks kinchay (tinadtad) | 1 medium Egg | Salt | 15 pieces lumpia wrapper | Oil (for frying) | 1/4 Cup brown sugar | 2 tablespoons Vinegar | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 Cup water | 1/2 tablespoon all-purpose flour | 2-3 tablespoons water
instructions: Pagsamahin lahat ng sangkap (maliban sa lumpia wrapper at mantika) sa isang mangkok. | Ibalot ang mixture sa lumpia wrapper. | Painitin ang mantika. Iprito ang lumpia hanggang maging golden brown ito at ihain habang mainit kasama ang sweet and sour sauce. | Gumawa ng sweet and sour sauce: Ilagay ang pulang asukal, suka, asin, at tubig sa isang kaserola na non-aluminum. | Haluin lang ito kapag nagsimula nang kumulo. Hinaan ang init ng kawali, idagdag ang slurry na gawa sa harina at tubig, at patuloy na haluin hanggang sa maging halos pino ang sarsa. Depende sa ginamit na harina, maaaring madagdagan o mabawasan ang slurry. Magdagdag lang ng pa-konti-konti hanggang makuha ang gustong lapot ng sarsa.
ingredient_names: pork | shrimp | na kwadrado | kinchay | egg | lumpia wrapper | brown sugar | all purpose flour

ingredients: 2-3 tablespoons Oil | 1 kilo pork (naka slice) | 1 clove Garlic (tinadtad) | 2 teaspoons black pepper | 1 medium white onion (naka slice) | 2 Small tomatoes (naka slice) | 1/4 Cup shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) | 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 2 cups water | 3 tablespoons white sugar (ayon sa panlasa) | Salt (ayon sa panlasa) | Salt (ayon sa panlasa)
instructions: Painitin ang mantika sa isang hindi kalahikang kawali. Ilagay ang taba mula sa tiyan ng baboy, at igisa hanggang maging kulay brown. | Idagdag ang bawang, paminta, at sibuyas. Igisa nang 5 minuto, tsaka idagdag ang kamatis. Ibubo ang bagoong at igisa nang 5 minuto. | Idagdag ang suka at hayaang kumulo nang 5 minuto. | Idagdag ang tubig at hayaan ulit kumulo hanggang mabawasan ng kalahati ang tubig. Suriin ang lambot ng karne. | Idagdag ang asukal at iayon ang timpla (kung kinakailangan) at saka hayaang kumulo ulit nang 5 minuto. Ihain kasama ng kanin.
ingredient_names: pork | tomato

ingredients: 1 kilogram bone-in beef shank (bulalo) | 1 medium red onions | 2 tablespoons whole black peppercorns | 2 ears corn (cut into 3) | 2 pieces green finger chili (siling haba) | 1 tablespoon patis (fish sauce) | 1 small head cabbage (quartered) | 1 bundle bokchoy | 2 tablespoons green onions (chopped) | water (as needed)
instructions: In a deep pot over medium heat, boil about 1 liter (4 cups) water. Add the beef shank, onions, and whole peppercorns. Simmer for 3 hours or until meat is fork tender. Replenish with more water as needed to prevent it from drying out. | Add the corn, and simmer for another 10 to 15 minutes. Add siling haba and crush them in the soup to add spice. | Add fish sauce, cabbage, bokchoy, and green onions. Serve piping hot.
ingredient_names: in beef shank | whole black peppercorn | corn | green finger chili | cabbage | bokchoy | green onion

ingredients: 1 tablespoon canola oil | 1 45-gram packet Hainanese chicken rice flavoring mix | 1 1/2 cups long grain rice (rinsed) | 1 inch fresh ginger (peeled, cut into strips) | 3 cloves Garlic (peeled, chopped) | 1 medium red onion (peeled, chopped) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) (or to taste) | 2 caups water | 1 piece sayote (peeled, cubed) | 6 pieces chicken thighs | canola oil (for frying)
instructions: In the bowl of a rice cooker, mix oil, rinsed rice, ginger, garlic, flavoring mix, patis, onions, and water. Place sayote on top. Place the lid and turn on the rice cooker. | Let cook about 5 minutes or until half the water has been absorbed. Stir then place the chicken thighs on top of the rice and replace the lid. Keep cooking until the rice is fluffy and the chicken pieces are cooked through. | Remove the chicken pieces and stir the rice. Let rice steam. | Meanwhile, if desired, heat enough oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Place chickens skins side down and fry until skins are golden brown and crispy. Flip and brown that side. Serve while hot with tinola rice.
ingredient_names: canola oil | 45 hainanese chicken rice | long grain rice | ginger | caups water | sayote | chicken

ingredients: 4 pieces white fish fillets (such as cream dory or lapu-lapu) | 1 Cup Crackers (crushed) | 1 medium red onion (peeled, chopped) | 2 cloves Garlic (peeled, chopped) | 2 tablespoons pickle relish | 1/4 Cup raisins | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | 3 regular-sized fish hotdogs (chopped small) | 2 large eggs | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Preheat a steamer. On a large plate, place fish fillets. Season with salt and pepper. Steam until flaky and cooked through. Remove from the steamer and using two forks, flake the fish. Transfer to a large bowl. | In the large bowl, combine with the flaked fish the crackers, onion, garlic, pickle relish, raisins, soy sauce, hotdogs, salt, pepper, and eggs. Mix thoroughly. (If desired, cook a small portion for seasoning.) | On a sheet of foil, place about 1 1/2 cups of the fish mixture onto the center. Fold and roll the foil over the fish and twist the ends. Repeat with the remaining fish mixture. | Place foiled fish into the steamer. Steam for about 20 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from the steamer and let cool and then chill until ready to serve. | When ready to serve, remove foil, slice into rounds, and gently fry until just lightly golden browned. Serve with ketchup, mixed vegetables, and steamed white rice.
ingredient_names: white fish fillet | cracker | pickle relish | raisin | fish hotdog | egg

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 tablespoon Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 medium white onion (tinadtad) | 2 pieces tomatoes (naka-slice) | 1/2 kilo ground pork | 1 1/2 cups water | 2 medium Potatoes (naka-slice sa maliliit na piraso) | 2 medium carrots (naka-slice sa maliliit na piraso) | 1/2 Cup green peas | Salt
instructions: Sa isang malaking kawali, mag-init ng mantika. Igisa ng ilang minuto ang bawang, sibuyas, at kamatis. Lagyan ng tubig at lutuin sa loob ng 20 minuto. | Dagdagan ng patatas at karots. Iluto ng limang minuto. Timplahan ng asin at paminta at pakuluan ng 5 pang minuto.
ingredient_names: tomato | pork | potato | carrot | green pea

ingredients: 500 Grams Chicken ((legs, thighs, and wings)) | 4 pieces calamansi | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 1 tablespoon salted butter | 2 tablespoons white onion (tinadtad) | 1 1/2 Tablespooon Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 piece laurel leaf | 2 1/2 cups tomatoes (tinadtad) | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | 2 teaspoons brown sugar | Salt (pampalasa) | 1 1/2 tablespoon achuete oil
instructions: Ibabad ang hiwang manok sa katas ng kalamansi at toyo. Ilagay sa refrigerator ng 4 na oras. | Painitin sa katamtamang apoy ang mantika at mantikilya sa isang kasirola. Iprito ang manok sa loob ng 4-5 minuto kada gilid o hanggang sa maging mapula ang balat. Hanguin ang manok at itabi. | Sa parehong kasirola, igisa ang sibuyas, bawang, dahon ng laurel, at kamatis. Hayaang kumulo ng 3-4 na minute, at lagyan ng toyo at pulang asukal at haluing mabuti. | Ibalik ang manok sa kasirola at pakuluan ng 10-12 minuto o hanggang maluto nang tuluyan ang manok. Dagdagan ng mantika ng atsuete at timplahan ayon sa inyong panlasa.
ingredient_names: chicken | calamansi | canola oil | butter | tablespooon garlic | laurel leaf | tomato | brown sugar

recipe_name: Sinigang Na Manok At Kalabasa Recipe
ingredients: 3 tablespoons canola oil | 1 medium red onion (peeled, quartered) | 4 pieces chicken quarters (leg and thigh part) (separated) | 1 Cup radish (labanos) (peeled, sliced) | 1/8 wedge squash (kalabasa) (peeled, cubed) | 2 piece green finger chilies (siling pangsigang) | 4 cups water | 1 44-gram pack sinigang sa sampaloc mix | 1 bunch kangkong (water spinach) (leaves and tender stalks only) | 1 bunch string beans (sitaw) (cut into 3-inch lengths)
instructions: In a large pot over medium heat, heat oil. Add onions and sweat until just translucent. Add chicken, labanos, kalabasa, siling pangsigang, water, and sinigang sa sampaloc mix. Stir to mix and then bring to a boil. Lower heat to a simmer. | Using a cooking spoon, remove any scum that rises to the surface. Simmer until the chicken is cooked through and the labanos and kalabasa are tender. Add the tender stems from the kangkong and sitaw, and simmer again until just heated through. Serve with steamed rice.
ingredient_names: canola oil | chicken quarter | radish | wedge kalabasa | green finger chili | 44 sinigang sa sampaloc mix | kangkong | sitaw

ingredients: 1 kilo pork kasim (cubed) | 6 cloves Garlic (whole) | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/2 tesapoon black peppercorns (lightly crushed) | 3 large eggs | 1/3 Cup coconut vinegar | 2 cups water
instructions: Place pork, garlic, peppercorns, bay leaves, soy sauce, eggs in a bowl, and marinate overnight. In a pressure cooker over medium heat, place marinated pork mixture, except the eggs, into the pot with vinegar and water. (Alternatively, combine ingredients in a large pot.) Bring to a boil then remove any scum that rises to the surface. Set aside eggs. | Close and then lock the lid. Simmer for 20 minutes. Release the pressure before unlocking the lid. (Alternatively, if using a standard pot, simmer until pork is almost tender, adding more water as needed.) | When pork is almost tender, place eggs in the sauce, ensuring that it s submerged. (Add more water as needed.) Bring back to a simmer and simmer for 8 minutes. | Remove eggs from the pot and peel eggs while still hot. Simmer pork until tender. Return eggs to the simmering adobo sauce and let simmer for 5 minutes to quickly season the egg in the adobo sauce. Turn off the heat and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: pork kasim | tesapoon black peppercorns | egg | coconut vinegar

ingredients: 250 Grams string beans (sitaw) (cut into 3-inch sticks) | 1/2 Cup all-purpose flour | 1/2 Cup cornstarch | 1 Cup soda water | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | Oil (for frying)
instructions: In a medium bowl, mix together all-purpose flour, cornstarch, and soda water. Season with salt and pepper. | Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Then, dip the sitaw in the flour mixture, then immediately fry for 3 to 5 minutes. Drain on paper towels. Serve with mayo dip.
ingredient_names: bean | all purpose flour | cornstarch | soda water

ingredients: 2 tablespoons canola oil | 2 tablespoons white onion (tinadtad) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (tinadtad) | 2 tablespoons ginger (julienned) | 1 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1/2 Cup long-grain rice | 4 cups chicken stock | 1/2 piece chicken bouillon cube | Salt (pampalasa) | 2  eggs ((hardboiled), naka-slice) | spring onions | Garlic (pinirito hanggang tostado, pang-topping)
instructions: Magpainit ng mantika sa isang kaldero. Sa katamtamang apoy, igisa ang sibuyas, bawang, at luya. Dagdagan ng patis at pakuluin. | Isalin ang kanin at haluin. | Idagdag ang pinagkuluan ng manok, haluin, at hayaang kumulo. | Pakuluan ng 30 hanggang 40 minuto. Patuloy na haluin ang lugaw hanggang maging malapot ito. | Dagdagan ng chicken bouillon cube at haluin. Timplahan ng asin ayon sa iyong panlasa. | Lagyan ng hiniwa na nilagang itlog, piniritong bawang, at sibuyas na mura (spring onions).
ingredient_names: canola oil | ginger | long grain rice | chicken stock | chicken bouillon cube | egg | green onion | garlic pinirito hanggang tostado

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic (tinadtad) | 1 medium white onion (naka-slice) | 1 kilo pork (naka-slice) | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon sugar | 3/4 Cup Tomato sauce | 1 Cup water | 2-3 pieces bay leaf | 1/4 kilo pig liver (naka-slice) | 1 Cup Potatoes (naka-slice) | 1 Cup carrot (naka-slice) | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste)
instructions: Igisa ang bawang at sibuyas sa mantika. | Ilagay ang karne. Lutuin sa loob ng 5 minuto. | Ibuhos ang toyo, asukal, tomato sauce, at tubig, at saka idagdag ang dahon ng laurel. Pakuluan nang 30 minuto o hanggang sa lumambot ang karne. | Idagdag ang atay at lutuin nang 5 minuto. | Idagdag and patatas, karot, at saka timplahan ng asin at paminta. Haluin at lutuin nang 15 minuto.
ingredient_names: pork | tomato sauce | bay leaf | pig liver | potato | carrot

ingredients: 5 cups water | 4 heads Garlic (smashed, divided) | 16 pieces birds eye chilies (siling labuyo), (chopped, dividedd) | 2  medium red onion | 2 stalks green onion leaves (divided) | 2 stalks Lemongrass (tanglad), | 4 pieces star anise | 4 pieces bay leaves | 1 1/2 tablespoons peppercorn (divided) | 2  ginger (sliced thinly, divided) | 1/4 cups Soy Sauce | 1/4 Cup Salt | 1/4 Cup sugar | 1 1/2 teaspoons Salt | 1 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 2.3 kilograms boneless pork belly, skin on | 3 tablespoons evaporated milk | 1 tablespoon water
instructions: Make your marinade: In a large pot on high heat, add water, 2 heads of smashed garlic, 8 pieces red chili peppers, 1 red onion, 1 stalk of onion leak, 1 bruised stalk of lemon grass, 2 pieces anise, 2 pieces bay leaves, 1 tablespoon peppercorn, 1 inch of ginger. soy sauce, 1/4 cup salt, and 1/4 cup sugar. When mixture start to boil, drop to medium heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Cool the mixture down. | As your mixture is cooling, prepare the pork slab: Make sure that it's shaved, that it's cut into an even rectangle, and the thickness is more or less even as well. Now, with the skin side down, using a sharp knife, score the meat diagonally 1.5 inches apart, cutting deep but taking care not to go through the skin. Make a crisscross pattern. This will allow the flavors to fully penetrate every part. | In a large enough freezer bag or big pot, place together pork and marinade. Massage the pork for 3 minutes. With the pork and marinade sealed in or covered, place in your refrigerator overnight to 3 days. | Make a dry rub: using a food processor, blender, or by chopping finely, mix together 2 heads of garlic, 8 red chili peppers, 1 medium red onion, 2 pieces star anise, 2 pieces bay leaves, 1/2 tablespoon peppercorn, and 1 inch ginger. Set aside. | After marinating, wash off marinade from the pork. Pat the pork dry with a towel. Place pork, skin side down on a clean surface. Sprinkle on salt and pepper evenly and rub into every crevice. Then, evenly distribute the dry rub through the whole slab. | Place 1 stalk of onion leak and 1 stalk of tanglad in the middle and roll. Tie twine around the pork. Place in a bowl and refrigerate for three hours to overnight, uncovered in the refrigerator. | Make basting mixture: Mix together evaporated milk and water. Brush all sides of the lechon. Completely wrap lechon in foil and place on a roasting rack. Or, simply place on the middle rack of your oven, then place a large enough baking pan or tray at the bottom rack of the oven to catch the drippings. | Preheat oven to 350 Fahrenheit or 180 Celsius then place the lechon.
