Sprinkle with cheese, if desired. Recipe originally published in the October 2016 issue of Good Housekeeping.
ingredient_names: pork | hotdog | breadcrumb | egg | spaghetti | filipino style sauce | milk | cheese

ingredients: 1 tablespoon sinigang sa sampalok paste ((we used Mama Sita)) | 1/4 Cup fresh orange juice | 2 tablespoons Light soy sauce | 2 teaspoons lemon juice | 1 tablespoon brown sugar | 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes | 20 large Shrimp (trimmed) | 1  navel orange (seedless, cut into half-moons)
instructions: Soak bamboo skewers in water to prevent burning. | Combine sinigang sa sampalok paste, orange juice, soy sauce, lemon juice, brown sugar, and red pepper flakes in a bowl. Add shrimps and marinate for 30 minutes. | Thread shrimps onto skewers, alternating with orange wedges. | Simmer remaining marinade until thick, about 5 to 10 minutes. Set aside. | Grill shrimp skewers on a grill pan until they turn pink, about 3 minutes per side. Brush occasionally with marinade.
ingredient_names: sinigang sa sampalok paste | orange juice | light soy sauce | lemon juice | brown sugar | red pepper flake | shrimp | navel orange seedless

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1  onion (sliced) | 1 medium tomato (sliced) | 1 kilo ground pork | 200 Grams luncheon meat (finely chopped) | 1/4 kilo bell pepper (sliced (set aside 1 pc for garnishing)) | 1/2 Cup raisins | 1/4 kilo pickle relish | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon Salt | 2 tablespoons Flour | 8 pieces eggs | margarine (for lining llanera)
instructions: In a pre-heated medium-sized pan with oil, saute garlic, onions and tomatoes. | Add pork, luncheon meat, pickles, raisins, soy sauce, and salt. Mix well and cook for about 10-15 minutes. | Drain, let it cool and set aside. | In a big bowl, add the meat mixture. Add eggs and flour. Blend well. | Prepare the llaneras (baking pans): spread margarine, lay down sliced hardboiled eggs and bell pepper. Add the meat mixture. | Cover the pan with aluminum foil and steam for 1 hour on low heat. Remove from llanera and serve.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | tomato | pork | luncheon meat | bell pepper | raisin | pickle relish | flour | egg | margarine

ingredients: 3 tablespoons canola oil | 600 Grams Chicken (cut into serving pieces) | 1 medium onion (quartered) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 2 medium tomatoes (quartered) | 3 tablespoons shrimp paste (or bagoong alamang) | 2 teaspoons white vinegar | 1 teaspoon white sugar | 1 to 2 pieces green chilies (siling pangsigang) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 1/2 Cup okra (sliced)
instructions: Heat oil in a wok over medium high heat. Fry chicken for 4-5 minutes per side or until light golden brown in color. Remove chicken from the wok and let drain on paper towels. Option to remove excess oil from pan and just leave about 2 tablespoons. | In the same wok, saute onions, garlic, tomatoes, and shrimp paste for 1-2 minutes. Pour in the vinegar and let simmer for one minute. Bring the chicken back to the wok, together with the sugar, and sili, mix well. Simmer further if needed. Season to taste. Place cooked chicken on a serving platter. Cook the okra in the same wok for 1 minute then place on top of chicken.
ingredient_names: canola oil | chicken | tomato | shrimp paste shrimp paste | green chily | okra

ingredients: 1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns | 2  bay leaves | 1 bunch Leeks (green part only) | 4 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1 1.2 kilo whole Chicken (washed, cleaned, patted fry, and seasoned with salt all over cavity) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) (divided) | canola oil (to deep-fry (prepare enough to cover 3/4 of the chicken)) | banana ketchup (to serve)
instructions: Fill a steamer with water. Add peppercorns, bay leaves, leeks, and garlic. Cover and bring to a boil. | Reduce heat and bring water to a slow boil. Place whole chicken on the steamer basket and cover. Steam for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until chicken is cooked through. | Remove chicken from steamer and brush all over with half of the fish sauce, including the cavity. Let cool, then brush again with remaining fish sauce. | Heat oil in a deep frying pan. Deep-fry chicken, making sure at least half of it is submerged in oil, until skin is golden brown and crispy, about 20 minutes. Drain on paper towels and serve with banana ketchup.
ingredient_names: whole black peppercorn | bay leave | leek green part | whole chicken | the chicken | banana ketchup

ingredients: 1 kilogram tanigue steaks | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste) | 1 tablespoon ginger (julienned) | 2 teaspoons Leeks (sliced) | 1/3 Cup tomatoes (sliced into strips) | 4 teaspoons shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) | 1 to 2 pieces green chilies (siling pangsigang) | 1/2 Cup coconut cream | 1/2 Cup coconut milk | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Season fish steaks with salt and pepper and set aside. | Heat oil on a pan over medium heat. Fry fish steaks for 4-5 minutes each side or until cooked and nicely brown and set aside to drain on paper towels. | Prepare the sauce by heating up oil in a saucepan over medium high heat. Sautee garlic, onions, ginger, leeks, tomatoes for one minute then add bagoong and saute for another minute or two. Add the sili, coconut cream, and coconut milk and allow to simmer for 1-2 minutes, season to taste. | Pour sauce over cooked fish. Or, you may also simmer the cooked fish in the sauce for a few minutes, if desired.
ingredient_names: tanigue steak | ginger | leek | tomato | green chily | coconut cream | coconut milk

ingredients: 1 1/2 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | ground black pepper (to serve) | 600 Grams Chicken (cut to serving pieces) | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 1 tablespoon Butter | 1 1/2 cups potato (cut into 1-inch cubes) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 1 teaspoon whole black peppercorns | 1 piece bay leaf | 1 1/2 cups Tomato sauce | 2 teaspoons white sugar | Salt (to taste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Combine calamansi juice, soy sauce, pepper and chicken. Mix well. Marinate, refrigerated, for 1 hour. | Heat oil and butter in a wok over medium high heat. Fry chicken for 4-5 minutes per side or until light golden brown in color. Remove chicken from the wok and let drain on paper towels. Option to remove excess fat from the wok. | In the same wok, fry potatoes for 2-3 minutes. Add onions, garlic, peppercorns, bayleaf, and continue to saute for 1-2 minutes. Pour in the tomato sauce and bring to a simmer, bring the chicken back to the wok and simmer for 3-6 minutes or until chicken is cooked. Season to taste with sugar, salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: calamansi juice | chicken | canola oil | butter | 1 cube | whole black peppercorn | bay leaf | tomato sauce

ingredients: 650 Grams Tamarind (Sampalok) (fresh, unripe, washed) | fish sauce (patis) | 150 Grams Shrimp (medium, trimmed) | 2 tablespoons Butter | 1 medium red onion (minced) | 2 cups red rice (uncooked) | 1 Cup taro (gabi) (peeled and diced) | 2 ripe native tomatoes (diced) | 2 cups kangkong leaves (sliced into thin strips; plus more leaves, blanced) | 1  green finger chili (siling pangsigang) (minced, plus more for garnish (optional))
instructions: Make the tamarind stock: Boil tamarind in 4 cups water. Lower heat and simmer for 30 to 40 minutes. Strain using a sieve, pressing tamarind to extract juice, into a saucepan. Add 31/2 cups water to tamarind juice. Season to taste with fish sauce. Bring to a simmer over medium heat. (You should have about 41/2 cups stock.) | Poach shrimp in tamarind stock until cooked through, about 2 to 3 minutes. Set aside. | Make the pilaf: Melt butter in a saucepan. Saute onions until translucent. Add red rice and stir to coat in butter. | Add tamarind stock, taro, and tomatoes. Simmer, covered, until rice is tender, about 40 minutes. | Add kangkong and chilies; toss to mix well. | Transfer rice to a serving platter or individual bowls. Top with shrimp, blanched kangkong leaves, and chilies.
ingredient_names: tamarind | shrimp | butter | red rice | taro | native tomato | kangkong | green finger chili

recipe_name: Baked Tahong with Garlic and Cheese Recipe
ingredients: 25 pieces green mussels (tahong) | 1/2 Cup cheddar cheese (grated) | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | spring onions
instructions: Preheat oven to 200C. | Boil the mussels for 10 minutes, until all the shells have opened. Remove residue and remove the other shell. | Arrange each tahong shell in a baking tray and top each with grated cheese. | In a separate bowl, mix the cream cheese spread and minced garlic together. Place a dollop of the cream cheese mixture on each mussel. | Bake at 200C for 10 to 15 minutes or until cheese has melted. Top each shell with spring onions before serving.
ingredient_names: green mussel | cheddar cheese | green onion

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 3 cloves Garlic (sliced) | 1 medium onion (sliced) | 3 medium tomatoes | Soy Sauce (to season) | 1/4 kilo pork (cut into strips) | 1/2 kilo upo (bottle gourd) (sliced into 1-inch pieces) | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a medium-sized pan, heat cooking oil and saute garli until golden brown. Add in the onions and tomatoes. | Add the pork strips and cook for 10 minutes or until pork is cooked. Season with soy sauce, salt, and pepper. | Add the sliced upo and cook again for 10 minutes.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | tomato | pork | upo

ingredients: 20 pieces calamansi (juice only) | 1 Cup Soy Sauce | 4 bulbs lemongrass (tanglad) (pounded) | 3 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 1 Cup Achuete Oil (annatto oil) | 1/2 Cup brown sugar | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1 Cup clear soda (we used Sprite) | 500 Grams pork (or liempo, sliced into 3-inch pieces) | 500 Grams pork ((use pork chops), sliced into 3-inch pieces) | 500 Grams Chicken (thighs and breasts, cut into 3-inch pieces) | 1 kilo Squid (Pusit) (cleaned and sliced into rings) | 500 Grams Prawns (Sugpo) (cleaned) | 3 tablespoons Achuete Oil (annatto oil) | Calamansi Juice | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 2 tablespoons chives (chopped) | 2  red finger chilies (siling haba) | 3 tablespoons Vinegar | 3 teaspoons sugar | 1 Cup olive oil | 2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 3 Small white onion (chopped) | 3 medium tomatoes (chopped) | 5 cups Spanish bomba rice (or calrose rice) | 1/2 Cup Tomato sauce | 5 to 7CUPS cups chicken stock | 1/4 Cup dry white wine (Optional) | paella seasoning (to taste) | 1 teaspoon Italian seasoning | 2 cubes chicken bouillon cube (crushed) | 1 teaspoon Spanish paprika (pimenton) | 2 teaspoons liquid seasoning (Optional) | 2 teaspoons fresh basil leaves (chopped) | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | 250 Grams mussels (cleaned and steamed) | 250 Grams clams (cleaned and steamed) | 6 pieces baby corn (sliced in half) | 2  lemon (sliced into wedges) | 2  Salted Egg (itlog na maalat) (peeled and sliced into wedges) | 1 8-ounce can pimiento (sliced into strips) | 12 pieces chicharon | 12  Cherry tomatoes (sauteed)
instructions: Make the marinade: Mix all ingredients. Marinate pork, chicken, squid, and prawns in separate bowls, covered, in the refrigerator overnight. | Make the sauce: Combine all ingredients. Transfer to a serving bowl and set aside. | Drain marinade from pork, chicken, squid, and prawns; set chicken and seafood aside. Take half of the pork belly, chop into small cubes, and set aside. Grill remaning pork, chicken, and seafood over charcoal until halfcooked. Set aside. | Preheat oven to 350 degrees. | Heat oil in a 16-inch paella pan. Saute garlic, onions, and tomatoes until tender, about 2 minutes. Add chopped pork belly and fry until golden. | Add rice and mix; cook for 2 minutes. Add tomato sauce, stock, wine, seasonings, and basil. Season to taste with salt and pepper. | rice with grilled meat. Cover with foil and bake in the oven for 30 minutes. | Remove foil and top rice with mussels, clams, squid, prawns, and baby corn. Cover with foil and bake for 15 more minutes. | When rice is almost tender, remove from oven. Allow to rest, covered, for 10 minutes. Remove foil and top with lemons, red eggs, pimiento, chicharon, and cherry tomatoes right before serving. Serve hot with sauce on the side.
ingredient_names: calamansi juice | bulbs lemongrass | achuete oil | brown sugar | clear soda | liempo | pork | thigh and breasts | squid | prawn | chive | red finger chili | olive oil | tomato | spanish bomba rice | tomato sauce | chicken stock | dry white wine | paella | italian | cubes chicken bouillon cube | spanish paprika | liquid | basil leave | mussel | clam | baby corn | wedge | strips | chicharon | cherry tomato

ingredients: 3 cloves Garlic (peeled, smashed) | 3/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon ground black pepper | 1 2 1/2 kilo Chicken (cut into 8 pieces) | 2 tablespoons canola oil (or more, for deep-frying) | 3 cloves Garlic (peeled, sliced thinly) | 1 Cup all-purpose flour | 3 tablespoons adobo flavored mix | 3/4 Cup water | 1 teaspoon Vinegar | Salt (tot aste) | ground black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a large bowl, combine garlic, soy sauce, and ground black pepper. Season chicken pieces with salt and ground black pepper. Place chicken in soy sauce mixture, turning to coat. Cover, and let marinate at least 30 minutes or overnight. | Meanwhile, make Garlic Chips: Heat oil in a frying pan over low heat. Add garlic chips, and fry until golden brown. Remove with a slotted spoon and transfer onto paper towels. Set aside until ready to serve. | Make Gravy: Whisk flour and adobo mix together. In the pan using the oil used to cook the garlic, add 2 Tbsp. of the flour mixture; set aside remaining mixture for chicken. Stir to mix. Pour in water, whisking to prevent lumps. Bring to a simmer, and let mixture thicken. Season with vinegar, salt, and more ground black pepper to taste. Keep warm. | When ready to cook chicken, heat enough oil in a deep saute pan to deep-fry chicken on medium heat. Drain marinade from chicken. Dredge chicken pieces in the seasoned flour mixture. Add chicken to the pan in batches to avoid crowding. Drain on a rack over paper towels. Sprinkle with garlic chips, and serve with gravy. Recipe originally published in the July 2016 issue of Good Housekeeping.
ingredient_names: chicken | deep frying | all purpose flour | adobo

ingredients: 500 Grams Shrimp (medium-sized, peeled and deveined, with tails left on) | Salt (tot aste) | black pepper (to taste) | 3 tablespoons canola oil | 1/2 Cup cornstarch (seasoned with salt and pepper) | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 tablespoon Butter | 4  Salted Egg (itlog na maalat) ((use yolks), mashed) | chili leaves (dahon ng sili) (fried, to garnish)
instructions: Season shrimp with salt and pepper. | Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. | Dredge shrimp in seasoned cornstarch then fry until golden brown, about 2 minutes per side. Drain on a paper towel-lined plate. | In the same pan, saute garlic in butter. Add salted egg yolks; mix well. | Add cooked shrimp and toss to coat. Cook for 2 minutes. Garnish with parsley or fried chili leaves, if desired.
ingredient_names: shrimp | canola oil | salt and pepper | butter | yolk | garnish

ingredients: 3 kilo slab pork face (use boneless pork belly) | 1 medium red onion (quartered) | 1  bay leaf | 10  peppercorns (crushed) | 5 liters pork stock (or water)
instructions: Place pork to fit snugly in a large pot. Add onions, bay leaf, and peppercorns. Cover with stock or water. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 1 hour. Drain and let pork rest for 1 to 2 hours. | Prick skin all over with a fork or metal skewer. Wipe excess oil from the surface. | Place pork on a baking dish. If desired, rub with chosen spices and flavorings, cover with plastic wrap, and marinate in the refrigerator overnight. You can also proceed to roast the pork as is. | Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. | Roast pork in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. Lower heat to 375 degrees F and continue cooking for 3 hours. The pork is done when the skin is golden and has a hollow sound when tapped. Let pork rest for at least 30 minutes before carving.
ingredient_names: slab pork face | bay leaf | peppercorn | pork stock

recipe_name: Pork Meatball and Misua Soup Recipe
ingredients: 500 Grams pork (use ground pork) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium red onion (grated) | 2 teaspoons ginger (grated) | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup Mustard Leaves (Mustasa) (finely chopped) | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1 teaspoon chili flakes | 1  Egg | 1 tablespoon sesame oil | 2 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 2 cups chicken stock | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon Vinegar | 1 Cup Mustard Leaves (Mustasa) (finely chopped) | 130 Grams misua (fine rice noodles) | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | chili flakes (Optional)
instructions: Make the meatballs: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl; mix well. | Shape 1 heaping tablespoon of the mixture into a ball using your hands. Repeat to make 17 more balls. Place on a tray, cover, and refrigerate for at least 10 minutes. | Heat sesame oil in a large pot over medium heat. Saute garlic and onions until soft. Add meatballs and cook for about 10 minutes, turning to ensure even browning. | Add 3 cups water, stock, soy sauce, and vinegar; simmer for 5 minutes. Add mustasa and noodles; simmer until noodles are cooked through. Season with salt and pepper. Add chili flakes if you want a spicier soup. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: pork | ginger | mustard leave | chili flake | egg | sesame oil | chicken stock | misua | chili

ingredients: 1/2 Cup tomato ketchup | 1/2 Cup fruit jam (pineapple or mango) | 1/4 Cup brown sugar | 2 tablespoons molasses (unsulphured) | 2 tablespoons Dijon mustard | 1/4 teaspoon Garlic (grated) | 1 teaspoon Soy Sauce (or to taste) | 1/2 teaspoon five-spice powder (or to taste) | 1/4 Cup water (or chicken stock) | 1 tablespoon coconut vinegar (or apple cider vinegar or white wine) | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | chili flakes (to taste)
instructions: Whisk tomato ketchup, pineapple or mango jam, brown sugar, unsulphured molasses, Dijon or yellow mustard, grated garlic, soy sauce, allspice, and water or chicken stock in a saucepan to combine. Bring to a boil over medium heat. | Lower heat and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes. Add coconut, apple cider, or white wine vinegar; do not whisk. Let acidity of vinegar cook off for about 1 minute. Season to taste with salt, pepper, and chilli flakes.
ingredient_names: tomato ketchup | fruit jam pineapple | brown sugar | molass | dijon mustard | powder | chicken stock | apple cider vinegar | chili flake

recipe_name: Laing (Taro Leaves in Coconut Milk) Recipe
ingredients: 100 Grams taro leaves (dahon ng gabi) ((use dried leaves), (dried gabi leaves)) | 2 slices pork (cut into 1/4 inch-thick strips) | 1 to 2 tablespoons shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) (to taste) | 2 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 3 cups coconut milk (gata) | 2 cups coconut cream (kakang gata) (or coconut cream) | 1 thumb-sized piece ginger (cut into large strips) | 4 pieces green finger chili (siling pangsigang) (cut into 1-inch pieces) | 2 pieces red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (sliced thinly)
instructions: In a large pan over medium heat, spread out your pork belly strips and pour water over until meat is covered. Place the lid on and and cook until all liquid has evaporated and the pork fat has started to render. | Combine the shrimp paste, garlic, coconut milk and ginger in the pan and stir for about 2 minutes. | Add the taro (gabi) leaves and let it absorb the coconut milk. Avoid stirring the leaves. Let this boil and dry up for about 10 minutes. | Add in the kakang gata or coconut cream, green chilies and bird s eye chilies. Again, leave to boil or dry up for another 10 minutes. Add more chillies, if preferred. Serve warm with rice and other viands.
ingredient_names: dried leaf | pork | coconut milk | coconut cream | ginger | green finger chili | red chili pepper

ingredients: 8 large pieces Pandesal (sliced in half) | 140 Grams Tomato sauce | 100 Grams kesong puti (white cheese) (crumbled) | 2  Salted Egg (itlog na maalat) (cut into half moon shapes) | 250 Grams Beef ((use beef sirloin), thinly sliced) | 1/2 teaspoon Vinegar | 1 teaspoon sugar | 1 teaspoon Soy Sauce | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste)
instructions: In a small bowl, mix the vinegar, sugar, soy sauce, salt, and pepper together. Let the beef sit in the marinade for at least one hour. | Fry the beef tapa in 2 tablespoons of oil. Set aside to cool. | Place pandesal in a flat surface, ladle 1 tablespoon tomato sauce into the center and spread it out to the edges. | Top with tapa pieces and red egg slices. Sprinkle crumbled kesong puti on top. | Toast pandesal for 8-10 minutes in a toaster oven set on medium heat. Remove from the oven then transfer to serving sheet. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: pandesal | tomato sauce | kesong puti | half moon shape | beef

ingredients: 2 big bunches kangkong (water spinach) leaves (leaves only, washed) | 2 tablespoons sesame oil | 1 tablespoon sesame seeds (toasted) | 1 teaspoon sugar
instructions: In a medium-sized saucepan, bring water to a boil. Place the kangkong leaves into the pot and cook for around 2 minutes. Drain and wring out excess water. | While the leaves are warm, place the sugar, sesame seeds, and sesame oil onto the leaves and toss.
ingredient_names: big kangkong | sesame oil | sesame seed

recipe_name: Kinunot na Isda (Flaked Fish in Coconut Milk) Recipe
ingredients: 500 Grams tanigue (Spanish mackerel) | 1 medium onion (sliced) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped, divided) | 4 pieces green finger chili (siling pangsigang) | 2 pieces red chili pepper (siling labuyo) | 1 Cup malunggay leaves (moringa) (leaves only) | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 teaspoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon black pepper | 1/4 Cup water | 1 press milk (from 1 coconut)
instructions: In a medium-sized saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Boil the tanigue and ginger for around 10 minutes. Let the tanique cool and set aside. | Once the fish has cooled, remove the skin and crumble the meat into a bowl. Season with the vinegar, salt, pepper, and 2 cloves of the chopped garlic. | In a separate saucepan over medium heat, combine the coconut milk and onion and stir for around 3 minutes. | Drain the tanigue and discard the vinegar mixture. Mix the tanigue pieces into the cocomut milk mixture. Boil until it is almost dry, then add the malunggay leaves, green peppers, the first press of milk from 1 coconut, and the bird s eye chili. Boil this mixture until the liquid is reduced to half. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: tanigue | green finger chili | red chili pepper | malunggay | press milk

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil (divded) | 2 medium onion (chopped) | 3 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 1 thumb-sized piece ginger (chopped) | 3 native tomatoes (chopped) | 1/2 Cup bottled tamarind pulp (or 1 small sachet sinigang na sampaloc mix) | 3 tablespoons miso paste (local) | 500 Grams salmon (use salmon steaks) | 1 medium radish (labanos) (sliced) | 5  green finger chili (siling pangsigang) (or to taste) | 1/2 Cup cilantro (wansoy) (chopped, plus extra to garnish) | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | fish sauce (patis) (to taste) | 2 bunches Mustard Leaves (Mustasa)
instructions: Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pot. Saute onions, garlic, and ginger just until fragrant. | Add tomatoes and saute until soft. Add 4 to 5 cups water and simmer. Add remaining ingredients except mustard greens. Simmer over low heat until fish is cooked, about 10 to 15 minutes. Season with salt, pepper, and fish sauce. | Once fish is almost cooked, add mustard greens and cook for about 2 minutes. Top with more cilantro. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | ginger | native tomato | sinigang na sampaloc mix | miso paste | salmon steak | radish | green finger chili | cilantro | mustard leave

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 500 Grams pork (diced) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 2 tablespoons ginger (cut into strips) | 2 pieces green finger chili (siling pangsigang) | 3 cups coconut cream (kakang gata) | 3 cups taro leaves (dahon ng gabi) (use dried leaves) | 2 cups pork stock | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | siling labuyo (birds eye chili) (sliced) | 1 Cup vegetable oil | 1 Cup dried shrimp (hibe) (or hibe) | 3 tablespoons sugar | 1 tablespoon Vinegar
instructions: Heat oil in a large pot. Fry pork until browned. Set pork aside. | In the same pot, saute onions, garlic, ginger, and chilies. Add coconut cream; simmer for 25 minutes. Bring mixture to a boil. Add taro leaves; mix. Add stock; simmer, stirring occasionally, for 11/2 hours or until leaves are soft and wilted. Season with salt and pepper. Mix in fried pork. | Make the crispy shrimp: Heat oil in a pan. Fry shrimp for 2 minutes. Add sugar and vinegar. Cook for 2 more minutes. Drain and set aside | Transfer laing to a serving plate. Top with crispy shrimp and garnish with chilies, if desired.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | pork | ginger | green finger chili | coconut cream | dried leaf | pork stock | labuyo | shrimp

ingredients: 1 kilo pork (whole) | 1 tablespoon rock salt | 2 teaspoons peppercorns (whole) | 2  bay leaf | vegetable oil (to deep-fry)
instructions: Place pork belly, rock salt, black peppercorns, and bay leaves in a large stockpot. Fill with water until pork is completely submerged. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and cover pot partially. Simmer for about 1 hour or until fork-tender. Reserve 1 to 2 cups pork broth to make the sauce. | Transfer meat to a wire rack; let it sit until completely dry. Wrap meat in plastic wrap and freeze overnight. | Heat vegetable oil in a deep, heavy-bottomed pot. Deep-fry frozen pork for 10 minutes. Remove from pan, pat dry, and let it sit on a wire rack for 1 hour. | Deep-fry pork again in preheated oil. Sprinkle skin with ice-cold water and let it crackle. Fry for about 5 to 8 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. | Chop into 2-inch pieces. Serve with your favorite sauce. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: pork | rock salt | peppercorn | bay leaf | vegetable oil

ingredients: 1/2 Cup onion (chopped) | 1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil (or annatto oil) | 2 teaspoons Garlic (minced) | 2 cups pork broth (reserved) | 1/4 Cup peanuts (roasted and finely chopped) | 3 heaping tablespoons peanut butter (creamy) | 1/2 tablespoon bagoong alamang | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | 1 1/2 tablespoons rice (ground and toasted)
instructions: Saute red onions in vegetable or annatto oil until translucent. Add garlic; saute until fragrant. | Add reserved pork broth, peanuts, and creamy peanut butter; mix well. Season with bagoong alamang, salt, and freshly ground black pepper. Boil then lower heat and simmer for 5 to 8 minutes. Add ground toasted rice to thicken sauce. Adjust seasoning. | Top with lechon kawali, blanched pechay leaves, blanched yard-long beans, and blanched eggplant.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | pork broth | peanut | peanut butter | shrimp paste shrimp paste | rice

recipe_name: Lechon Manok with Sisig Rice Stuffing Recipe
ingredients: 1 1.2 kilo Chicken (whole) | 2 tablespoons Salt (coarse, to taste) | 4 stalks lemongrass (tanglad) (trimmed and pounded) | 1 tablespoons Butter (melted) | 1 1/2 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 1 teaspoon sugar | 250 Grams pork face | 1 1-inch piece ginger (sliced into rounds) | 1/4 medium red onion (sliced into wedges) | 2 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1/2 tablespoons peppercorns | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 4 tablespoons onion (chopped, divided) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 1 tablespoon ginger (grated) | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 3 tablespoons white vinegar | 3 tablespoons liquid seasoning | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | 3 cups long-grain rice (cooked and cooled)
instructions: Rub chicken with salt. Rinse and pat dry with paper towels. | Make the marinade: Mix all ingredients and pour over chicken. Marinate, covered, in the refrigerator overnight. | Make the sisig: Boil pork face in a pot with ginger, onions, garlic, and peppercorns. Lower heat. Simmer for 30 to 45 minutes. Remove pork from pot and pat dry with paper towels. Chop into 1/4-inch cubes. | Make the sisig fried rice: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Saute 2 tablespoons onions, garlic, ginger, and black pepper. Add 11/2 cups sisig. Season with vinegar, liquid seasoning, salt, and pepper. Add rice and mix well. Season to taste. Turn off heat and add remaining onions. Let rice cool completely. | Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Remove chicken from the refrigerator 10 minutes before roasting. Stuff cavity with fried rice and lemongrass. Place on a wire rack set on a baking pan. | Roast chicken in the oven for 11/2 hours or until cooked through, brushing chicken with melted butter every 15 minutes. Increase oven temperature to 400 degrees in the last 5 to 8 minutes of cooking to brown the skin. Heat extra fried rice in a pan and serve on the side.
ingredient_names: chicken | salt coarse | stalks lemongrass | butter | calamansi juice | pork face | 1 ginger | peppercorn | vegetable oil | ginger | liquid | long grain rice

ingredients: 3 medium Potatoes (unpeeled) | 1 pinch Salt (to season) | vegetable oil (for frying) | black pepper (to season)
instructions: Slice potatoes into thin rounds using a mandoline with a straight blade; place in a bowl. Season with a generous pinch of salt, toss to coat, and let them sit for 5 to 10 minutes or until potatoes have begun to release moisture. Place potatoes on a clean kitchen towel; pat dry. | Heat 1 inch of vegetable oil in a deep skillet over medium-high heat. Fry potatoes until pale golden brown, making sure not to overcrowd the pan. Drain on paper towels. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: potato | season | vegetable oil

recipe_name: Sizzling Beef Tadyang (Sizzling Beef Ribs) Recipe
ingredients: 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour | 1 tablespoon sinigang sa sampalok mix | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | 600 Grams Beef ((use short ribs), fat trimmed) | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 1 tablespoon Butter | 1 medium red onion (sliced into wedges) | 4 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1 medium tomatoes (sliced into wedges) | 4 stalks Leeks (dark green part only, sliced into 2-inch lengths) | 1  green finger chili (siling pangsigang) | 3 tablespoons sinigang sa sampalok mix | 1/4 cube beef bouillon | 1 tablespoons Butter | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce (or to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | 2 1/2 tablespoons Potato starch (or cornstarch, dissolved in 2 tablespoons water) | 100 Grams winged beans (sigarilyas) (blanched) | 2 Small onion (sliced into thin wedges, sauteed) | 2 Small tomatoes (sliced into wedges) | crispy garlic chips (to garnish) | green onion (chopped, to garnish)
instructions: Make the beef: Combine flour, sinigang mix, 1 teaspoon salt, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Add beef and toss to coat. Let it sit for 10 minutes. | Heat oil and butter in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Sear beef on all sides. | Add 8 to 10 cups water, onions, garlic, tomatoes, leeks, and chili; bring to a boil then simmer for 11/2 to 2 hours or until beef is fork-tender. Remove from heat and separate beef from cooking liquid. Strain liquid. | Make the sampalok gravy: Bring 21/2 cups cooking liquid to a boil in a large saucepan. Add sinigang mix and bouillon cube; simmer, stirring gently. Add butter. Season with soy sauce and pepper. Add dissolved starch to thicken. | Heat a sizzling plate on the stove for 3 to 5 minutes or until smoking; remove from heat. Place beef on hot plate. Pour gravy over and top with sigarilyas, onions, tomatoes, garlic chips, and green onions. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: all purpose flour | sinigang sa sampalok mix | short rib | canola oil | butter | tomato | dark green part | green finger chili | cube beef bouillon | potato starch | bean | thin wedge | crispy garlic chip | green onion

ingredients: 1 Cup Vinegar | 3  siling labuyo (birds eye chili) (chopped (plus more to taste)) | 3 cloves Garlic (smashed)
instructions: Heat vinegar in a saucepot over medium heat. Once hot (but not boiling), remove from heat and add bird's eye chilies and 3 cloves garlic. | Transfer to a clean jar once cool. Allow to sit for at least 1 day.
ingredient_names: labuyo

ingredients: 3/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/4 Cup white vinegar | 3 tablespoons brown sugar | 2 tablespoons peppercorns (use whole peppercorns) | 1/8 Cup Garlic (chopped) | 2  bay leaf | 400 Grams pork (belly part (liempo), cut into 2-inch pieces) | 400 Grams Chicken (wings, legs, and thigh parts) | 1/4 Cup Achuete Oil (annatto oil) | 1/4 Cup Garlic (cloves) | Salt | Pepper | garlic chips (to garnish) | parsley sprigs (chopped, to garnish)
instructions: Make the marinade: Mix together all ingredients. | Marinate pork and chicken, covered, in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours. | Remove meat from refrigerator 10 minutes before cooking. Heat atsuete oil in a pot over medium-high heat. Sear chicken and pork in batches. | Add garlic, marinade, and enough water to cover meat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour or until pork is fork-tender. | Taste then adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Remove bay leaves. Transfer to a platter.
ingredient_names: brown sugar | whole peppercorn | bay leaf | pork | and thigh part | achuete oil | garlic chip | parsley sprig

ingredients: 1 whole Beef ((use shanks), bone-in, cut crosswise into large chucnks to expose marrow) | 500 gram Beef ((use kneecap), cut into cubes) | 5000 Grams Beef (use short ribs) | 2  white onion (sliced) | 2 bulbs lemongrass (tanglad) (trimmed and pounded) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 teaspoon peppercorns | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 2 cobs corn (cut into 1-inch thick pieces) | 2 saba banana (peeled and sliced) | 1/2 head cabbage (cut into large chunks) | 150 Grams Baguio beans (abitsuelas) | 1 bunch pechay leaves (native) | 2 large Potatoes (peeled and cut into large chunks) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Place beef shanks, kneecap, and short ribs in a large pot. Cover completely with water and boil until juices of the bones run clear. | Return meat and bones to the pot over medium heat. Add onions, lemongrass, garlic, peppercorns, and fish sauce. Cover with water then bring to a rolling boil, skimming off any impurities that rise to the surface. Lower heat to medium-low. | Simmer until beef is fork-tender, about 4 to 5 hours, making sure meat is completely covered with water at all times. (Alternatively, you can cook the meat in a pressure cooker for 11/2 hours.) | Transfer meat and bones to a bowl, then strain soup through a fine-mesh sieve. Discard solids, then return meat and bones to the strained stock. Add corn, bananas, cabbage, green beans, pechay, and potatoes. Simmer for another 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Season to taste with salt. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: whole beef | kneecap | short rib | bulbs lemongrass | peppercorn | cobs corn | saba banana | cabbage | baguio bean | pechay leave | potato

ingredients: 4 large Egg | 1 Cup cornstarch | 1 1/2 to 2 cups water | 1/4 teaspoon Salt | vegetable oil (to brush) | 2 cups pork stock | 1/2 Cup sugar | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | 2 tablespoons Garlic (chopped, divided) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 teaspoon Garlic (chopped) | 1/2 Cup white onion (chopped) | 1/2 Cup pork (use ground pork) | 1 Cup yard-long beans (sitaw) (sliced into thin, diagonal sliced) | 2 cups coconut palm (ubod) (shredded) | 2 cups sweet potato (kamote) (shredded) | 2 cups carrot (shredded) | 1 block extra-firm tofu (cut into small strips) | 2 cups cabbage (shredded) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | lettuce leaves (to serve) | Garlic (chopped, to serve) | peanuts (crushed, toasted, to serve)
instructions: Make the lumpia wrapper: Beat eggs in a bowl until foamy. Add cornstarch, water, and salt, whisking continuously. Heat a small nonstick pan over medium-low heat. Brush with vegetable oil. Pour 1/4 cup of mixture into pan, swirling to cover bottom. Cook for 1 minute. Transfer to a slightly oiled plate. Repeat with the rest of the mixture. | Make the lumpia sauce: Combine stock, sugar, soy sauce, cornstarch, and 1 tablespoon garlic in a small pot. Bring to a boil and stir continuously until sauce thickens. Remove from heat and add remaining garlic. Set aside. | Make the filling: Heat oil in a pan. Saute garlic and onions for 2 minutes. Add pork and cook until browned. Add beans, ubod, sweet potatoes, carrots, tofu, and cabbage. Cook for 10 to 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Mix in 1/4 cup lumpia sauce. | Place a lettuce leaf on one side of a lumpia wrapper. Top with about 1/4 cup filling. Fold bottom then roll to secure filling. Serve with lumpia sauce, and garlic and peanuts for topping. READ THESE: MORE LUMPIA RECIPES Chinese Fresh Lumpia Recipe Lumpiang Togue Recipe
ingredient_names: egg | cornstarch | vegetable oil | pork stock | pork | sitaw | coconut palm | sweet potato | carrot | extra firm tofu | cabbage | lettuce leave | peanut

ingredients: 8 cups chicken stock | 3  bay leaf | 2 medium white onion (diced) | 6 cloves Garlic (peeled) | 2 teaspoons Salt | 2 teaspoons peppercorns | 400 Grams Chicken ((use breast part), bone-in) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) (or more to taste) | 500 Grams pork (use ground pork) | 125 Grams Shrimp (minced) | 1/2 Cup crab fat (or taba ng talangka) | 1/2 Cup green onion (finely chopped) | 1/2 Cup white onion (chopped) | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 large Egg | 1 teaspoon sesame oil | 1/4 teaspoon Salt | black pepper (freshly ground) | 1 Pack wonton wrappers (3-inch) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 250 Grams Shrimp (shelled) | 1/4 Cup chicken liver (cooked and shredded) | 1/4 Cup chicken gizzard (balunbalunan) (cooked and shredded) | green onion (Chopped, for garnish) | Garlic (fried, to serve)
instructions: Make the broth: Bring chicken stock, bay leaves, onions, garlic, salt, and peppercorns in a large pot to a boil over medium heat. Add chicken, then add water to completely cover chicken. Simmer over medium-low heat for 1 hour. Remove chicken from broth. Set broth aside. | Once cool enough to handle, remove skin from chicken breast; discard skin. Shred meat and discard bones. Set chicken meat aside. | Make the dumplings: Combine all ingredients except wrapper. Fry a teaspoon of the mixture; taste then adjust seasoning. Place about 1 tablespoon mixture on the center of a wonton wrapper. Brush edges with water, fold into a triangle, and press to seal. Repeat with remaining mixture. | Place shredded chicken in a medium pot. Add fish sauce and saute over medium-high heat for 2 minutes. Add whole shrimp, chicken liver, and gizzard. Add about 10 cups prepared broth; bring to a boil. Add dumplings; simmer over low heat for about 15 minutes. | Divide among bowls. Top with green onions and fried garlic. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: chicken stock | bay leaf | peppercorn | breast part | pork | shrimp | taba ng talangka | green onion | egg | sesame oil | wonton wrapper | chicken liver | chicken gizzard

recipe_name: Bistek Filipino Rice (Beef Steak with Rice) Recipe
ingredients: 750 Grams Beef ((use sirloin cut), sliced thinly and pounded) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons Calamansi Juice (or juice from 1 lemon) | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 2 cups vegetable oil | 1 Cup white onion (sliced into rings) | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | 1/4 Cup Butter | 1 tablespoon Garlic (crushed) | cilantro (wansoy) (chopped, to garnish) | 3 cups white rice (cooked and cooled) | 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 3 tablespoons Butter
instructions: Marinate beef in soy sauce, calamansi juice, and pepper, covered, in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour. | Heat vegetable oil in a pan over medium heat. Toss onions in cornstarch until well coated. Fry onion rings until crisp and golden. Drain on paper towels and set aside. | Melt butter in a large pan over medium heat. Fry beef until browned. Add garlic and saute for 15 to 20 minutes. Set aside and keep warm. | Make the bistek rice: Mix rice and oil in a bowl. Add rice to the pan where the beef was cooked; toss until heated through. Add garlic, salt, and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring continuously to prevent rice from sticking to the pan. Remove from heat and mix in butter. | Divide rice among bowls. Top with beef and onions. Garnish with cilantro.
ingredient_names: sirloin | calamansi | vegetable oil | cornstarch | butter | cilantro | white rice

ingredients: 1 liter fresh coconut water (buko juice) | 2 native tomatoes (sliced into quarters) | 1 medium red onion (sliced) | 1 tablespoon ground cinnamon (sliced) | 1 Cup taro (gabi) (sliced into chunks) | 3 to 5 steaks blue marlin (or swordfish) | Salt (to taste) | 1 Cup sweet potato tops (or malunggay leaves) | 2 pieces green finger chili (siling pangsigang) | calamansi leaves (to garnish) | 8 to 10 pieces calamansi (sliced in half)
instructions: Simmer coconut juice in a pot over medium heat. Add tomatoes, onions, ginger, and taro; simmer for 1 minute. | Add fish, cover, and simmer for 5 to 7 minutes or until just cooked. Season with salt. | Add sweet potato tops and chilies; simmer for 1 minute. Top with calamansi leaves, if desired. Serve hot with calamansi on the side.
ingredient_names: coconut water | native tomato | cinnamon | chunk | steak blue marlin | sweet potato top | green finger chili | calamansi leave | calamansi

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 3 tablespoons white onion (chopped) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 2 tablespoons ginger (grated) | 1/4 Cup Leeks (thinly sliced, white parts only) | 250 Grams clams | 150 Grams Shrimp (peeled) | 100 Grams Squid (Pusit) (cleaned and sliced) | 2 tablespoons crab fat (aligue) (or to taste) | 2 cups long-grain rice (cooked) | 2 teaspoons Calamansi Juice (or lemon juice) | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | kinchay (parsley) (for garnish)
instructions: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Saute onions, garlic, ginger, and leeks. | Add clams and 1/4 cup water. Cover pot and simmer until shells open; discard shells that remain closed. Cook for 1 more minute. Remove clams from pot. Remove meat from shells; set aside. | Continue to simmer liquid in the pan until almost dry. | Add shrimp and squid; saute for 2 minutes. Add clam meat and crab fat; saute for 1 minute. | Add rice and mix well. Season with calamansi or lemon juice, salt, and pepper. | Transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with parsley leaves. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | ginger | white part | clam | shrimp | squid | crab fat | long grain rice | calamansi juice | kinchay

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 3 tablespoons white onion (chopped) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 1/4 Cup carrot (julienned) | 1/4 Cup celery (julienned) | 1 Cup Squid (Pusit) (cleaned and sliced, about 250 grams, ink reserved) | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | 2 cups bihon noodles (thin rice noodles) (raw) | 1/4 Cup cabbage (julienned) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | green onion (chopped, to garnish) | crispy mushroom chips (optional, to garnish) | calamansi (sliced, to serve) | siling labuyo (birds eye chili) (to serve)
instructions: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Saute onions, garlic, carrots, and celery. | Add squid; season with salt and pepper. Add 1/2 cup water and reserved squid ink; bring to a boil. | Add noodles and simmer until soft but still al dente. Add more water, if necessary. | Add cabbage; season to taste with fish sauce and pepper. Toss to mix. | Transfer to a serving platter. Garnish with green onions and mushroom chips, if using. Serve with calamansi and bird's eye chilies on the side.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | carrot | celery | squid | bihon noodle | cabbage | green onion | crispy mushroom | calamansi | labuyo

ingredients: 2 tablespoons longganisa | 1 medium red onion (sliced) | 2 teaspoons Garlic (minced) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 2 cups chicken stock | black pepper (to taste) | 1 Cup Shrimp (medium-sized) | 1 Cup carrot (sliced) | 1 Cup snow peas (sitsaro) (trimmed) | 1 Cup winged beans (sigarilyas) (sliced) | 1 Cup cabbage (shredded) | 500 Grams pancit Bato noodles | calamansi (to serve)
instructions: Saute minced longganisa in a wok or pot over medium heat until fat is rendered. Add onions and garlic; saute until fragrant. | Add soy sauce, fish sauce, and chicken stock. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with black pepper. | Add shrimp, carrots, and snow peas; mix well. Add sliced longganisa, winged beans, cabbage, and noodles. Stir until all liquid has been absorbed. Add water if noodles are not yet cooked. Top with green onions. Serve with calamansi.
ingredient_names: longganisa | chicken stock | shrimp | carrot | snow pea | bean | cabbage | pancit bato noodle | calamansi

ingredients: 3 long eggplant ((Asian)) | vegetable oil (to fry) | 1 Small white onion (chopped) | 3 cloves Garlic (peeled and minced finely) | 300 Grams crabmeat | Salt | Pepper | half a bunch cilantro (wansoy) (leaves picked and chopped roughly, plus more leaves to garnish) | 4  Egg (beaten, divided into 2 eggs per bowl) | green onion (sliced, to garnish)
instructions: Grill eggplants over an open flame until skin is blackened and flesh is soft. (You can do this on your stovetop.) | When cool enough to handle, peel skin away. Make a slit lengthwise down the eggplant with the tip of a knife and open it up, gently pressing it down with a fork to flatten. | Heat a couple of swirls of oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat. Saute onions and garlic until onions are soft and translucent. Add crabmeat and toss. Season with salt and pepper. (Make sure to taste the crabmeat first before seasoning, as it can already be a little salty.) Place mixture in a bowl; set aside to cool slightly. | Add chopped cilantro and 2 beaten eggs to crabmeat; mix thoroughly. | Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add enough oil to coat the bottom of the pan. When oil is hot, dip an eggplant in remaining beaten eggs then lay flat on the pan. | Place 1/3 of the crabmeat mixture on top of the eggplant and spread to cover surface. Spoon some beaten eggs on top. Fry until underside is golden brown, spooning some of the hot oil on top to make the filling firmer for flipping. When underside is deep golden brown, carefully flip the eggplant. Cook until the other side is the same golden brown color. Transfer to a plate. Repeat with remaining ingredients. | Garnish with extra cilantro leaves and green onions.
ingredient_names: long eggplant | vegetable oil | crabmeat | half a cilantro | egg | green onion

ingredients: 500 Grams squash (kalabasa) (peeled and cut into 2-inch cubes, about 3 cups) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil (divided) | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 5 medium eggplant | 1 Cup red onion (diced) | 1 head Garlic (sliced, divided) | 3 tablespoons ginger (finely chopped) | 2  siling labuyo (birds eye chili) | 200 Grams yard-long beans (sitaw) (sliced into 3-inch pieces, about 2 cups) | 1 1/2 cups coconut milk (gata) (preferably fresh)
instructions: Preheat oven to 425 degrees. | Toss squash with 1 tablespoon oil. Season with pinches of salt and pepper. Spread on a baking sheet and roast for 30 minutes or until golden brown. Set aside. | Prick eggplants all over with a fork. Grill over coal or directly on the flames of a gas stove, turning occasionally, until skin turns black. Set aside and let cool. Peel and cut into 1-inch cubes. | Heat remaining oil in a pot over medium heat. Saute onions with pinches of salt and pepper until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes. Add half the garlic, ginger, chilies; season with salt and pepper. Cook for 3 to 4 minutes. | Add beans and 1/4 cup water, scraping the bottom of the pot. Cover and cook for about 3 minutes or until beans turn vibrant green. | Add eggplant, squash, coconut milk, and 1/4 to 1/2 cup water. Bring to a simmer and season with salt and pepper. Stir in the rest of the garlic. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: 2 cube | vegetable oil | eggplant | ginger | labuyo | sitaw | coconut milk

ingredients: 2 tablespoons olive oil | 1 tablespoon white onion (chopped) | 2 cp kangkong (water spinach) leaves (packed, washed) | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | 2 large Pandesal (sliced in half, buttered, and toasted) | 4 to 8 slices bacon (fried until cooked through) | 4  Egg (poached) | parsley sprigs (chopped, optional) | 2 large Egg (yolks only) | 3 teaspoons Calamansi Juice | 2/3 Cup Butter (clarified) | Salt (to taste) | Cayenne pepper (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over high heat. Saute onions and kangkong for about 2 minutes or until slightly wilted. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside. | Make the calamansi hollandaise: Bring water to a simmer in a small pot. Combine yolks and calamansi juice in a stainless steel bowl; whisk vigorously for 2 to 3 minutes or until mixture has thickened and doubled in volume. Place the bowl over the pot of simmering water and whisk continuously. Do not allow mixture to overheat. Check by touching the bottom of the bowl from time to time; you should be able to touch it comfortably. | Gradually pour in clarified butter in a slow, steady stream, vigorously whisking until thick and smooth. Season with salt and cayenne pepper. | Place sauteed kangkong on top of each pandesal. Top each with 1 to 2 bacon slices and a poached egg. Drizzle with calamansi hollandaise and garnish with parsley.
ingredient_names: olive oil | cp kangkong | pandesal | bacon | egg | parsley sprig | egg yolk | calamansi juice | butter | cayenne pepper

ingredients: 1 kilo pork (use kasim) | 1 head Garlic (unpeeled, halved crosswise) | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 3/4 Cup white vinegar | 2 cups water | 2 tablespoons peppercorns (black) | 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 2 tablespoons brown sugar | 1  bay leaf | Pandesal (toasted, to serve) | Pickled Vegetables (Atsara) (to serve)
instructions: Place pork shoulder, garlic, soy sauce, white vinegar, water, whole black peppercorns, vegetable oil, brown sugar, and bay leaf in a slow cooker. Cover and cook on high until pork shreds easily with a fork, about 5 to 6 hours. | Remove pork from cooker; shred the meat using a fork. Return meat to cooker and coat in sauce. Serve with toasted pandesal and atchara on the side.
ingredient_names: kasim | peppercorn | vegetable oil | brown sugar | bay leaf | pandesal | vegetable

ingredients: 1 kilo tilapia ((use fillet), (or 4 whole tilapias) filleted) | 2/3 Cup all-purpose flour | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 can (250-gram) coconut milk (gata) (divided) | 2 tablespoons curry powder (or red curry paste) | 1 tablespoon brown sugar | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 2 medium bell pepper (cored, seeded, and sliced into strips) | 1  red onion (sliced into strips) | cilantro (wansoy) (Chopped, for garnish)
instructions: Pat fish fillets dry with paper towels. Cut each into quarters. | Mix flour and pepper in a shallow bowl. Coat fish, a few pieces at a time, with the flour mixture. Shake off any excess and set aside. | Heat oil in a large skillet over mediumhighheat. Fry fish in a single layer for 1 to 2 minutes per side or until crisp and brown. Work in batches, if needed. (The fish doesn't need to be cooked through at this point.) Once crisp, remove from pan; set aside. (If using whole fish, bread and fry head, if desired.) | Reduce heat to medium and wipe off any excess oil in the pan. Pour in half of the coconut milk and curry powder or paste; cook, stirring, for about2 minutes. Add remaining coconut milk, 1/4 cup water, sugar, and fish sauce. Cook, stirring, for 1 more minute. | Return fish to the pan.Spoon currysauce over fish. Add bell peppers and onions, reduce heat to low, and simmer until fish is cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes. Garnish with cilantro before serving.
ingredient_names: whole tilapias | all purpose flour | vegetable oil | coconut milk | red curry paste | brown sugar | bell pepper | cilantro

ingredients: 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/4 Cup muscovado sugar (or white sugar) | 2 tablespoons Calamansi Juice (or vinegar) | 1 head Garlic (crushed or chopped finely) | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 500 Grams oyster mushrooms (separted (about 6 to 7 lightly packed cups)) | vegetable oil | Garlic (sliced and fried, to serve) | garlic rice (to serve) | tomatoes (sliced, to serve)
instructions: Combine soy sauce, 1/4 cup water, sugar, calamansi juice, garlic, and pepper in a large bowl. Add mushrooms and mix. Set aside and allow to marinate for 5 to 10 minutes. | Warm 1 tablespoon oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Drain mushroom tapa; reserve marinade. Cook mushrooms in batches until deep brown on both sides, stirring occasionally to allow sugar to caramelize. Transfer mushrooms to a serving dish. | Add reserved marinade to the skillet and bring to a simmer. Pour marinade over mushrooms. | Top tapa with fried garlic bits. Serve with garlic rice and sliced tomatoes.
ingredient_names: muscovado sugar | calamansi juice | garlic crushed | oyster mushroom | vegetable oil | garlic rice | tomato

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (sliced) | 1/2 kilo pork (use ground pork) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon oyster sauce | 2 bunches kangkong (water spinach) leaves (cleaned and drained) | Salt (to season) | Salt (to season)
instructions: Pre-heat a medium-sized pan, add oil and saute garlic. | Add the onions and saute for 2 minutes. | Toss in the ground pork and cook well for 5 minutes. | Add the soy sauce and oyster sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add in the kangkong and cook for 1 minute. Turn off heat immediately to avoid overcooking the kangkong.
ingredient_names: pork | oyster sauce | kangkong | season

recipe_name: Sauteed Baguio Beans with Bacon Recipe
ingredients: 1/4 kilo bacon (sliced) | 1 medium onion (sliced) | 2 cloves Garlic | 1/2 kilo long beans (sitaw) (sliced into 2-inch pieces) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste)
instructions: Saute the bacon on a preheated pan until fat is rendered or the bacon is crispy. | Saute onion and garlic for 2 minutes. Add the green beans and soy sauce and cook for another 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.
ingredient_names: bacon | long bean

ingredients: 1 Small white onion (thinly sliced) | 6 to 7 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 tablespoon cooking oil | 100 Grams Chicken (sliced into 1/4-inch-thick strips) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1/2 Cup water | 1 bundle kangkong (water spinach) leaves | 1 native red tomatoes (diced) | 1/2 Cup kesong puti (white cheese) (cubed) | 1  Salted Egg (itlog na maalat) (diced (optional))
instructions: Saute white onion and garlic in oil in a saucepot until browned and fragrant. Add chicken thigh fillets; cook for 1 minute. | Add soy sauce, vinegar, and water; simmer until reduced to half. Add stems (3-inch lengths) from 1 bundle kangkong; cook for 1 minute. Add leaves; cook for a few seconds. | Top with native tomato and kesong puti. You can add 1 salted egg, if desired.
ingredient_names: 1 4 thick | kangkong | native red tomatoes | kesong puti | egg

ingredients: 500 Grams Chicken | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 3 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1/4 Cup sweet paprika | 2 teaspoons Salt | 1 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: Preheat a turbo broiler to 350 degrees. | Combine chicken legs, garlic, vegetable oil, sweet paprika, salt, and ground black pepper in a bowl. | Place seasoned chicken in the turbo broiler fitted with a dripping rack and roast for 20 to 25 minutes, or until juices run clear when pierced with a fork.
ingredient_names: chicken | vegetable oil | sweet paprika

ingredients: 2 bundles kangkong (water spinach) leaves (about 30 pieces) | 1/2 Cup all-purpose flour | 1/2 Cup cornstarch | 1  Egg | 1 Cup water (ice-cold) | Oil (for deep-frying) | 3/4 Cup water | 1 tablespoon dashi granules | 1/4 Cup mirin (japanese sweet rice wine) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | sesame oil | ginger (grated)
instructions: Pick leaves from kangkong. Mix all-purpose flour, cornstarch, and 1 egg. Mix in ice-cold water. Heat oil in a deep pan. Dip a leaf in batter; sprinkle with sesame seeds. Deep-fry until lightly browned, about 1 minute; drain. Repeat with remaining leaves. | Make the sauce: Simmer water, dashi granules, mirin, and soy sauce for 5 minutes. Add a few drops of sesame oil and 1 teaspoon grated ginger.
ingredient_names: kangkong | all purpose flour | cornstarch | egg | deep frying | dashi granule | mirin | sesame oil | ginger

ingredients: 2 tablespoons canola oil | 1 tablespoon Garlic | 1 tablespoon ginger (grated) | 2 tablespoons red onion (chopped) | 2 teaspoons fish sauce (patis) | 400 Grams Prawns (Sugpo) (peeled and deveined) | 2 tablespoons Thai chili sauce | 1/2 Cup tomato ketchup | 1 tablespoon brown sugar | Salt | 1 Small Egg | siling labuyo (birds eye chili)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Saute garlic, ginger, and onions for 1 minute. Add fish sauce. Once boiling, add prawns and cook for 1 minute on each side. | Add chili sauce, ketchup, and sugar; mix well. Taste then adjustseasoning with salt and pepper. Add up to 1/4 cup water to thin out the sauce depending on your preference. | Turn off heat, add egg, and stir. Garnish with bird's eye chilies, leeks, and cilantro.
ingredient_names: canola oil | ginger | prawn | thai chili sauce | tomato ketchup | brown sugar | egg | labuyo

ingredients: 2 cups Fresh Coconut (buko) (grated) | 1/2 Cup coconut vinegar (or rice vinegar, or coconut sap) | 2 cups fresh coconut milk (gata) | 8 cloves Garlic (peeled) | 1 tablespoon ginger (sliced) | 2 medium onion (sliced) | 3 to 4 pieces red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (Optional) | 6 quarters Chicken ((use leg and thigh), separted) | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | coconut (buko) (toasted, grated, to garnish (optional))
instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees. | Combine grated coconut and coconut vinegar in a bowl. Transfer mixture to a piece of cheesecloth; squeeze liquid into a bowl. Set aside. | Spread squeezed grated coconut on a baking sheet. Roast in the preheated oven, stirring occasionally, until dark brown, about 8 minutes. Switch setting to broil (or the highest temperature) and roast coconut until slightly burned, about 2 minutes. Set aside. | Combine burned grated coconut, extracted coconut vinegar mixture, coconut milk, garlic, ginger, onions, and chilies, if using, in a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower heat and simmer for 10 minutes. | Strain mixture into a pot. Set aside and keep warm. | Season chicken with salt and pepper. Grill or pan-fry chicken until browned, about 10 minutes. (If grilling, you can wrap them in banana leaves first.) | Place chicken on a platter. Pour coconut sauce over. Garnish with bird s eye chilies and toasted grated coconut, if desired. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: coconut | coconut vinegar | coconut milk | ginger | red chili pepper | quarters chicken

ingredients: 1/2 Cup char siu sauce | 1/4 Cup hoisin sauce | 1 teaspoon sesame oil | 3/4 kilo pork inasal | 12  cuapao buns | pickled cucumber (for topping) | green onion (for topping) | peanuts (for topping)
instructions: Combine char siu sauce, hoisin sauce, and sesame oil in a saucepot over low heat. Add 1 portion pork inasal (sliced into thin strips or shredded) and simmer until slightly thick. | Steam cuapao buns according to package directions. Divide pork mixture among buns. Top pork with cucumber strips or pickled cucumbers, green onions, and chopped peanuts.
ingredient_names: char siu sauce | hoisin sauce | sesame oil | pork inasal | cuapao bun | cucumber | green onion | peanut

ingredients: 2 cups leftover adobo meat | 2 tablespoons leftover adobo sauce | 2 tablespoons canola oil | rice (to serve)
instructions: Remove meat from the sauce and shred the meat with your fingers, gently pulling apart the meat fibers. Set aside. | Heat oil over medium heat on a frying pan. Add shredded adobo meat and adobo sauce and saute. Fry meat until brown and crispy. Let drain on paper towels before serving. Serve with rice, fried garlic, tomatoes, spring onions.
ingredient_names: leftover adobo meat | leftover adobo sauce | canola oil | rice

ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 3/4 kilo portion pork inasal (minced) | 1 Cup white onion (finely chopped) | 1 teaspoon Garlic (finely chopped) | 2  Egg (slightly beaten) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1 teaspoon Pepper | 1 tablespoon Calamansi Juice | 1 teaspoon liquid seasoning | rice (to serve)
instructions: Heat a nonstick pan until smoking. Add vegetable oil and pork inasal. Cook until slightly crisp. | Add white onions; cook until translucent. Add chopped garlic; saute for 2 minutes. Whisk in eggs; mix well. Season mixture with salt, pepper, calamansi juice, and liquid seasoning. Serve with rice.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | portion pork inasal | egg | calamansi juice | liquid | rice

ingredients: 5 tablespoons cooking oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 5 pieces eggplant (sliced lengthwise) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon sugar | Salt (to taste)
instructions: In a medium-sized frying pan, saute garlic in preheated oil until golden brown and set aside. | In a medium-sized mixing bowl, combine soy sauce, sugar, salt and pepper. Marinate sliced eggplant for 10 minutes. | In the same pan where garlic was sauteed, fry the eggplant slices until browned. | Transfer to a serving dish and top eggplant with garlic bits. Serve warm.
ingredient_names: eggplant

ingredients: 5 tablespoons ginger (grated) | 1 1/2 cups onion | 5 tablespoons Garlic (finely-chopped) | 5 cups coconut sap vinegar (sukang tuba) | 1/2 Cup sugar | 1/4 Cup Salt | 1 tablespoon black pepper | 6 kilos pork ((use kasim), sliced)
instructions: Mix ginger, onions, garlic, vinegar, 1 cup water, sugar, salt, and pepper in a large glass or stainless steel container. Brine pork in mixture, covered, in the refrigerator for 4 hours or overnight. Make sure pork is fully submerged in brine. | Preheat oven to 350 degrees. | Preheat a charcoal grill. Grill pork until charred, about 4 to 5 minutes per side. Transfer to a baking dish. Cover with foil and roast in the oven for 1 hour. Serve with rice.
ingredient_names: ginger | coconut sap vinegar | kasim

ingredients: 500 g leftover lechon | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 2 tablepoons white onion (chopped) | 4 pieces Garlic (peeled and crushed) | 1/2 tablespoon ginger (sliced) | 1 piece laurel leaf | 1/2 tablespoon peppercorns | 2 tablespoons Vinegar | 1 Cup lechon sauce | 1/2 Cup water | 1 teaspoon brown sugar | 1 teaspoon Soy Sauce | Salt (to season)
instructions: Heat canola oil over medium heat in a pot. Saute onions, garlic, ginger, laurel leaf, and peppercorns for 1 minute. Add the vinegar and allow to boil for 2 minutes. Add the lechon and cook for another 2 minutes. | Add the lechon sauce, water, brown sugar, and soy sauce. Bring to a boil. Simmer over low heat for 15 minutes. Season to taste as desired.
ingredient_names: leftover lechon | canola oil | tablepoons onion | ginger | laurel leaf | peppercorn | lechon sauce | brown sugar | season

ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 head Garlic (sliced, divided) | 500 Grams pork (sliced into 1-inch pieces) | 1/2 Cup white vinegar | 7  native tomatoes (chopped) | Salt | 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 Cup white onion | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 500 Grams Banana Blossoms (Puso ng saging) (outer covering removed, chopped, and soaked in cold salted water) | 5 cups native tomatoes | Salt | 500 Grams fettuccine noodles (cooked according to package directions) | chili leaves (dahon ng sili) (to garnish (optional))
instructions: Make the adobo sakamatis: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Saute half the garlic until crunchy; set aside. | Add pork to the pan and fry until golden. Add vinegar and cook for 3 minutes; set aside. | Add tomatoes and remaining garlic to the pan. Simmer for 5 minutes or until cooked. Return pork to the pan and simmer for 3 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. | Make the banana blossom pasta: Heat oil in another pan over medium heat. Saute onions and garlic until fragrant. Add banana blossom and saute for 1 minute. Add tomatoes and juices. Simmer until slightly thick, about 15 to 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Add pasta; toss. | Divide pasta among plates. Top with adobo sakamatis. Garnish with fried garlic and chili leaves.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | pork | native tomato | banana blossom | fettuccine noodle | garnish

ingredients: 1/4 Cup coconut sugar | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1 1/2 tablespoons Light soy sauce | 2 1/2 teaspoons Calamansi Juice | 1/2 teaspoon Baking soda | black pepper (to taste) | 1 1/2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 500 Grams Beef ((use sirloin cut), sliced into thin strips)
instructions: Combine beef sirloin, brown or coconut sugar, Thai fish sauce, light soy or tamari soy sauce, calamansi juice, baking soda, black pepper, and minced garlic in a bowl. | Marinate, covered, in the fridge overnight. Stir-fry meat in oil over high heat.
ingredient_names: coconut sugar | light soy sauce | calamansi juice | soda | sirloin

ingredients: 1/2 kilo pork ((use pork tenderloin), sliced thinly) | 2 1/2 teaspoons Salt | 1/2 Cup coconut sugar | 1/2 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1/3 Cup pineapple juice | 1/4 teaspoon ground star anise | black pepper (to taste) | 1/4 Cup water
instructions: Combine pork tenderloin, salt, brown or coconut sugar, minced garlic, pineapple juice, ground star anise, and black pepper in a bowl. Marinate, covered, in the refrigerator overnight. | Simmer pork and marinade in a pan with about water. When pan is almost dry and marinade is syrupy, stir frequently to allow meat to caramelize evenly. (You can add 1 to 2 tablespoons vegetable or coconut oil since meat is lean.) Once meat has caramelized, remove from heat. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: pork | coconut sugar | pineapple juice | star anise

ingredients: 2 tablespoons lemongrass (tanglad) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 2 tablespoons sugar | Pepper | lime juice | 2 tablespoons sesame oil (divided) | 500 Grams pork ((use pork steaks), sliced into       1/2-inch strips) | 2 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 2 cups bean sprouts (togue) (washed) | cilantro (wansoy) (leaves) | lime wedges (to serve) | sesame oil
instructions: Combine lemongrass, fish sauce, sugar, pepper, lime juice, and 1 tablespoon sesame oil in a bowl. Add pork. Marinate in the refrigerator, covered, for at least 1 hour. | Heat remaining sesame oil in a wok or frying pan over medium-high heat. Saute garlic until fragrant. Add pork and cook for 6 to 8 minutes or until done (do not overcook), tossing frequently for even cooking. | Place pork on a bed of bean sprouts and allow sprouts to wilt. Top with cilantro. Serve with lime wedges on the side and a dipping sauce of sesame oil, salt, and pepper.
ingredient_names: lemongrass | lime juice | sesame oil | pork | bean sprout | cilantro | lime wedge

ingredients: 1 Cup dried shiitake mushrooms | 2 300-gram blocks firm tofu (tokwa) (rinsed and drained) | 3/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 3/4 Cup cane vinegar | 20 cloves Garlic (peeled and minced, divided) | 1 teaspoon black pepper | vegetable oil | 2  bay leaf | 1 teaspoon peppercorns
instructions: Place mushrooms in a bowl and pour in hot water. Place a smaller bowl or plate on top to keep the mushrooms submerged. Soak for 30 to 45 minutes, or until completely rehydrated. Reserve the soaking liquid for the marinade. Squeeze mushrooms and slice into quarters. Set aside. | Slice each block of tofu into thick slabs then sandwich tofu between several paper towels and press gently to remove excess water. | Mix soy sauce, vinegar, half of the garlic, pepper, and 3/4 cup reserved soaking liquid in a large bowl. Add mushrooms and tofu carefully; press down to keep submerged (make sure tofu doesn't break). Marinate for at least 1 hour. | After 1 hour, carefully remove tofu from marinade and place between paper towels to drain excess liquid. Slice tofu into 1/2-inch-thick rectangular pieces, then halve into squares. | Heat oil on a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook remaining garlic until golden brown. Set aside. | On the same pan, fry tofu until dark brown, about 3 to 4 minutes per side. Transfer tofu to a platter. Set aside. | Increase heat to high. Add mushrooms, adobo marinade, bay leaves, and peppercorns. Cook until simmering. Taste then adjust seasoning. Remove from heat. | Pour mushrooms and sauce over fried tofu. Top with fried garlic.
ingredient_names: shiitake mushroom | firm tofu | cane vinegar | vegetable oil | bay leaf | peppercorn

ingredients: 10 medium Shrimp | 1/2 medium squash (kalabasa) (peeled and sliced into squares) | 3 medium native tomatoes (sliced in half) | 1 medium red onion (sliced into rings) | 1 medim bittermelon (sliced) | 5 Small eggplant (sliced in half) | 5 Small okra | 1 bunch winged beans (sigarilyas) (sliced into bite-sized pieces) | lima beans (patani) | olive oil (to drizzle) | Salt (to taste) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 small bunch corkwood tree flowers (katuray) (Optional) | 2 tablespoons bottled bagoong alamang | 1 tablespoon Calamansi Juice | 1  green finger chili (siling pangsigang) | 5 tablespoons olive oil | 2 tablespoons bottled bagoong alamang | 1 tablespoon Calamansi Juice | 1  green finger chili (siling pangsigang) | 5 tablespoons olive oil | 1 Cup plain yogurt
instructions: Toss shrimps and vegetables (except corkwood tree flowers, or katuray) with olive oil, salt, pepper, and ginger. Heat vegetable oil on a griller or grill pan. Grill shrimps and vegetables until just cooked. Make sure vegetables are not soggy. | Make the bagoong vinaigrette: Mix all bottled bagoong alamang, calamansi juice, green finger chili, and olive oil in a bowl. | Make the bagoong-yogurt dressing: mix bottled bagoong, calamansi juice, green finger chili, olive oil, and yogurt in a bowl. | Place shrimps, vegetables, and katuray on a platter. Drizzle with desired dressing or serve dressings on the side.
ingredient_names: shrimp | squares | native tomato | medim bittermelon | eggplant | okra | bean | lima bean | olive oil | vegetable oil | corkwood tree | bottled shrimp paste shrimp paste | calamansi juice | green finger chili | plain yogurt

ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 thumb-sized knob ginger (peeled and sliced into sticks) | 2 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 2 cups kangkong (water spinach) leaves ((stalks), diced into thin rounds) | 2  finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (deseeded and diced) | 1/4 Cup mussels (out of the shell) | 1/4 kilo Shrimp (peeled) | 1/4 kilo crabmeat | 1 1/4 Cup coconut milk (gata) | 1/2 tablespoon fish sauce (patis)
instructions: In a skillet over medium heat, heat oil. Add ginger and garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Add shrimp, mussels and coconut milk and bring to a boil. Simmer for about 10 minutes. | Add kangkong stalks, chili peppers, patis and crab meat and continue to cook for another 5 minutes. Serve hot with rice.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | knob ginger | kangkong | finger chili | the shell | shrimp | crabmeat | coconut milk

recipe_name: Sinigang na Hipon sa Sampaloc Recipe
ingredients: 6  Tamarind (Sampalok) | 4 cups water | 1/2  onion (sliced) | 2  tomatoes (deseeded and quartered) | 1  radish (labanos) (sliced into 1-inch rounds) | 750 Grams Shrimp (debearded) | 2  finger chilies (siling pangsigang) | 1 bunch chili leaves (dahon ng sili)
instructions: In a small saucepan, boil 1 cup of water with the unripe tamarind for about 10 minutes. Once soft, crush the tamarind in the pan and strain with water. Set the strained water aside. | In another saucepan, boil 3 cups of water with the onion and tomatoes. Simmer for about 5 minutes, and then add the radish. | Add strained water, bring to a boil and simmer for another 5 minutes. Add shrimp, bring to a boil and simmer for 5 minutes. Add green finger chilies and simmer for 2 minutes. Turn off heat and add chilli leaves (dahon ng sili). Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: tamarind | tomato | radish | shrimp | finger chili | chili

ingredients: 1/2 kilo mussels (in the half shell) | 1 Cup Japanese breadcrumbs (Panko) | 1/4 Cup parmesan cheese (grated) | 2 tablespoons Butter | 3 tablespoons spring onions (minced finely)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 F. In a small mixing bowl, combine Japanese breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese, butter and spring onions in a bowl. | Lay the mussels on a baking sheet, place bread crumbs mixture over each shell and press down slightly. Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: the half shell | japanese breadcrumb | parmesan cheese | butter | green onion

ingredients: 1/2 kilo store-bought roasted pork belly slab (liempo) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1/2 Cup white onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 2 teaspoons ground cumin | 1 Cup fresh orange juice | orange zest | lemon zest | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1 teaspoon Pepper | 4  banana ((saba variety), sliced in half lengthwise) | 4 tablespoons sugar | 3 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1/2 medium white onion (sliced thinly) | 3 cups cabbage (shredded) | 1  red bell pepper (cored and sliced into strips) | white rice (to serve)
instructions: Remove crispy skin from pork. Break skin into 4 pieces and set aside. | Heat oil in a skillet. Add onions and garlic; saute until fragrant. Add cumin, orange juice and zest, lemon zest, salt, and pepper. Mix for 1 minute. | Add 5 cups water and bring to a boil. Add pork belly slab. Lower heat and simmer until liquid has reduced by 1/4. Slice pork and set aside. | Make the sweetened bananas: Roll bananas in sugar. Heat oil in a frying pan. Fry bananas until golden. Set aside. | Make the sauteed vegetables: Heat oil in a skillet over high heat. Add onions, cabbage, and bell peppers. Saute for 4 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. | Serve pork, bananas, and vegetables on top of rice.
ingredient_names: pork | vegetable oil | cumin | orange juice | orange zest | lemon zest | banana | cabbage | bell pepper | white rice

ingredients: 1 kilo pork (use pork chops or spare ribs) | 1 Cup water | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup brown sugar | 1 tablespoon Salt | 1 tablespoon peppercorns | 2 pieces bay leaf | 5 cloves Garlic (minced) | 3 pieces star anise
instructions: In a big pot, boil pork and ingredients and let it simmer until pork is tender and cooked. | Boil over low fire until sauce thickens for about 30 minutes. Let the meat rest for around 10 minutes. | Slice the pork pieces and transfer to a serving plate. Pour sauce over the pork pieces and serve warm.
ingredient_names: spare rib | brown sugar | peppercorn | bay leaf | star anise

recipe_name: Pork and Beans with Crispy Bacon Recipe
ingredients: 8  bacon (use bacon strips) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1/4 Cup onion (chopped) | 2 teaspoons Garlic | 2 cans baked beans ((400-gram cans)) | 2 cans pork and beans ((400-gram cans)) | 1 Cup barbecue sauce ((we used Hunt's Hickory))
instructions: Fry bacon strips until crisp. Drain and set aside. | Heat oil in a pot. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add garlic and saute for 1 minute more. | Add baked beans, pork and beans, and barbecue sauce. Lower heat and simmer for 10 minutes. | Transfer pork and beans to a serving platter. Top with crispy bacon. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: bacon | vegetable oil | baked bean | pork and beans | barbecue sauce

ingredients: 1 1-inch knob ginger (sliced into rounds) | 1/2  white onion | 1/4 teaspoon peppercorns | 4 cups Rice Washing (Hugas Bigas) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 kilogram salmon head | 1/2 kilogram salmon (use belly) | 1 bunch pechay leaves (about 1 cup) | 1/2 head cabbage (cut into quarters) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) (to serve) | calamansi (to serve)
instructions: In a large saucepan, combine ginger, onion, salt and pepper in the rice wash. Bring to a boil, about 5-8 minutes. | Once boiling, place the salmon head and belly in the soup. Bring to a boil again and simmer for 5-8 minutes. | Place cabbage and pechay in the soup and simmer for another 3 minutes. Serve hot, with patis and calamansi on the side.
ingredient_names: 1 knob ginger | peppercorn | rice water | salmon | pechay | quarter | calamansi

ingredients: 1 kilo pork (use pork spare rib (rib tips)) | 2 tablespoons black bean sauce | 2 teaspoons cornstarch | 1/2 teaspoon ginger (grated) | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/4 teaspoon black pepper | 1 teaspoon sesame oil | 1 teaspoon sugar
instructions: Put spareribs and black bean sauce in a shallow, heatproof pan that will fit inside your wok (a pie plate or 9 " cake pan works great.) | Make the marinade: in a medium-sized bowl, mix the cornstarch, ginger, garlic, black pepper, sesame oil, and sugar. Pour over the spareribs and let it marinate for atleast 30 minutes at room temperature. | Set a steaming rack inside of the wok and fill with water almost up to height of rack. Turn heat to high and when the water is boiling, turn heat to medium-high. Set pan with spareribs on top of a steaming rack inside the wok. | Steam using medium high heat for 18-20 minutes until ribs are no longer pink. Make sure that you don t run out of water in the wok. Add water if needed. | Remove from the steamer and serve. Garnish with spring onions or sliced bird s eye chilies.
ingredient_names: pork spare rib | black bean sauce | cornstarch | ginger | sesame oil

ingredients: 2 cups pork stock | 6 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 2 large onion (chopped) | 1 teaspoon peppercorns | 8 pieces dried bay leaf | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 kilo lechon kawali ((leftovers may be used)) | 3/4 Cup Vinegar | 3/4 Cup sugar | 3 cups store-bought lechon sauce | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat a medium-sized pot and pour in the pork stock. Bring to a boil. | Add the garlic and onions then cook until the texture becomes soft. | Add in the whole peppercorns, dried bay leaves, and soy sauce. Add the lechon kawali pieces and let it simmer for 20 minutes. | Pour in the vinegar and bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the sugar and lechon sauce, then simmer for another 5 minutes. Season with salt and simmer for 5 minutes. Serve warm.
ingredient_names: pork stock | peppercorn | dried bay leaf | lechon kawali | lechon sauce

recipe_name: Adobong Sugpo sa Taba ng Talangka Recipe
ingredients: 8 large Prawns (Sugpo) (about 500 grams) | 1 1/2 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1  bay leaf | 1 tablespoon peppercorns | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1/4 Cup crab fat (aligue) | Salt (to garnish) | 1 teaspoon Vinegar | green onion (Chopped, for garnish)
instructions: This adobong sugpo recipe is extra rich with its crab fat sauce. | Remove prawns from marinade. Heat oil in a wok or on a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Add prawns and sear for 1 to 2 minutes. | Add marinade and simmer until prawns are almost cooked, about 1 to 2 minutes. Remove prawns from pan and set aside. | Add crab fat to pan and mix well. Let sauce simmer until reduced to half. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add vinegar. | Return prawns to pan and mix well. Transfer to a serving platter and garnish with green onions. Serve with ensaladang labanos on the side.
ingredient_names: prawn | bay leaf | peppercorn | vegetable oil | crab fat | garnish | green onion
