ingredients: 2 500-gram whole tilapia (scaled and gutted) | 1  white onion (sliced) | 1 (1-inch) fresh ginger (peeled and sliced) | 2 cloves Garlic (sliced) | 2 tablespoons Shaoxing wine (Chinese rice wine) | 2 teaspoons sesame oil | 1 bunch cilantro (wansoy) (divided) | 5  green onion (sliced thinly) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon Chinese rice wine | 2 tablespoons water | 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil | white pepper | 2 tablespoons brown sugar | 4 tablespoons canola oil | 10 cloves Garlic (finely chopped)
instructions: Clean the fish and pat dry with paper towels. | Line a steamer with a double thickness of parchment paper or aluminum foil. Lay the onion slices, and a few slices of the garlic and ginger on the parchment or foil; put the fish on top of the aromatics.  Stuff the cavity of the fish with the remainder of the garlic and ginger. Grab a few sprigs of the cilantro, roughly tear it, and stuff it into the cavity as well. Top the fish with the soy sauce, Shaoxing wine, and sesame oil. | Steam the fish for about 30 minutes or until just cooked. You can test for doneness by inserting the tip of a small knife into the flesh. It should flake easily when cooked. | Make the sauce: Place all the ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a simmer; let bubble for about a minute. Remove from heat and set aside, but keep warm. | When the fish is done, remove the fish from the steamer and transfer to a plate. Tent the fish with foil to keep it warm. | Make the garlic oil:  Heat the oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the chopped garlic and fry until golden. | Uncover the fish and pour the prepared sauce over it. Top generously with the remaining cilantro sprigs and spring onions. Take the pan of garlic oil and, while still sizzling, pour over the fish. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: 500 whole tilapia | ginger | wine | sesame oil | cilantro | green onion | chinese rice wine | white pepper | brown sugar | canola oil

ingredients: 1 200-gram pack frozen chicken nuggets | 3 tablespoons vegetable oil (plus extra for frying) | 4 cubes Japanese curry | 1/2 Cup white onion (chopped) | 1 teaspoon Garlic (minced) | 1/4 Cup red bell pepper (chopped) | 1 Cup coconut cream (kakang gata) | 3 cups water | 2  carrot (cubed) | 2  Potatoes (quartered)
instructions: Heat oil in a skillet. Saute onion, garlic, and red bell pepper until fragrant. | Add coconut cream and water. Bring to a boil. Lower heat and add Japanese curry cubes one at a time, adding more to achieve preferred spiciness. Mix until dissolved. | Add potatoes and carrots. Simmer until vegetables are cooked. | Deep-fry chicken nuggets until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. | Transfer curry to a serving platter. Top with chicken nuggets. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: chicken nugget | vegetable oil | cubes japanese curry | bell pepper | coconut cream | carrot | potato

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 1  white onion (sliced) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 3  red native tomatoes (sliced) | 2 210-gram cans corned beef | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 2 teaspoons sugar | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 2  eggplant (sliced into 2-inch pieces) | 1 Small cabbage (quartered)
instructions: Heat oil in a skillet. Add onions and saute until tanslucent. Add garlic and tomato and saute for 3 minutes more. | Add corned beef; mix well. Add fish sauce, sugar, and pepper. Lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes. | Add eggplants and cabbage, cover, and simmer until vegetables are cooked.
ingredient_names: red native tomato | beef | eggplant | cabbage

recipe_name: Tinapa and Tocino Fried Rice Recipe
ingredients: 1 whole tinapang bangus (flaked) | 1/4 Cup white onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 4 cups white rice (cooked) | 1/4 cup plus 2 tablespoons vegetable oil (divided) | 3 tablespoons green onion (chopped) | 150 Grams tocino (cooked and sliced) | 2  Salted Egg (itlog na maalat) (peeled and quartered) | Mango Relish (to serve)
instructions: Combine rice and ¼ cup oil in a bowl; mix until rice is well coated. Set aside. | Heat remaining oil in a skillet. Saute onion and garlic until fragrant. Add tinapa flakes, rice, and green onions. Toss to mix well. | Transfer rice to a serving platter. Top with cooked tocino, salted egg, and mango relish.
ingredient_names: whole tinapang bangus | white rice | vegetable oil | green onion | tocino | egg | mango relish

ingredients: 1 whole, about 700 to 800 grams betilya (emperor snapper) (gutted, scaled, and cleaned) | Pepper (to taste) | vegetable oil (to deep-fry) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium white onion (minced) | 2 medium red native tomatoes (seeded and diced) | 1  red bell pepper (cored and diced) | 1/4 stalk celery (diced) | 1/4 Cup pineapple juice | fish sauce (patis) (to taste) | 4 tablespoons cornstarch (dissolved in 1/2 cup water) | 2  Egg (beaten) | Leeks (sliced, for garnish)
instructions: Season fish with salt and pepper. | Heat oil in a deep pan. Deep-fry fish until brown on both sides, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain and set aside. | Heat oil in a saucepan. Saute garlic, onions, tomatoes, bell peppers, and celery until fragrant. | Add pineapple juice and 1 cup water. Season with fish sauce and pepper to taste. | Add cornstarch mixture, 1 tablespoon at a time, until desired consistency is achieved (you may not use all the cornstarch). Add beaten eggs; stir mixture for 1 minute or until egg streaks form. Turn off heat.
ingredient_names: betilya | vegetable oil | red native tomato | bell pepper | stalk celery | pineapple juice | cornstarch | egg | garnish

ingredients: 2 blocks, around 300 grams each` firm tofu (tokwa) (rinsed and patted dry) | 2  onion (diced, divided) | 10 cloves Garlic (minced, divided) | 1  siling labuyo (bird's eye chili) (minced) | 1  red bell pepper (seeded and diced) | vegetable oil (as needed) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon ginger (grated or finely minced) | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 1 teaspoon coarse salt | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 3 tablespoons cane vinegar | 1 tablespoon muscovado sugar | 1 tablespoon Calamansi Juice
instructions: Slice one 300-gram tofu block into 1/4-inch cubes. Place in a bowl and toss with marinade ingredients. Let sit for at least 10 minutes. | Slice the other 300-gram tofu block into 1/4-inch thick slabs. Rub both sides with the dry rub ingredients. Warm a thin layer of vegetable oil in a large frying pan over medium-high heat. Fry the dry rubbed tofu slabs until crispy and golden brown on both sides, about 7 minutes. Drain on a paper towel-lined dish; when cool enough to handle, chop into 1/4-inch cubes and set aside. | Warm another tablespoon of oil in the same frying pan over medium-high heat. Saute 1 diced onion, 5 minced garlic cloves, and the sili labuyo until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the marinated tofu and bell pepper; stir-fry, mixing occasionally, until the tofu browns and and the bell pepper softens, about 7 minutes. | Remove from heat and add the remaining 1 onion, 5 garlic cloves, fried tofu, and sauce ingredients. Mix well and serve with sliced calamansi and brown rice.
ingredient_names: firm tofu | labuyo | bell pepper | vegetable oil | ginger | coarse salt | cane vinegar | muscovado sugar | calamansi juice

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 1-inch knob turmeric (luyang dilaw) (minced or grated) | 1 head Garlic (peeled and minced) | 1/2 teaspoon peppercorns | 1 kilo Beef ((use brisket or short ribs), cut into chunks) | 1/2 Cup white vinegar | 1 Cup water | 1/2 teaspoon sugar | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Saute turmeric , garlic, and whole peppercorns for about 3 to 4 minutes. | Add beef brisket or short ribs; cook for 10 minutes. Add white vinegar, water, and sugar; simmer for 45 minutes or until beef is tender. Add beef stock, a little at a time, if mixture dries out. Season with salt.
ingredient_names: 1 knob turmeric | peppercorn | short rib

ingredients: 30 medium Shrimp (peeled and deveined) | 1/2 Cup coconut milk (gata) | lime juice | 1/4 to 1/2 teaspoon chili powder | Salt (to season) | Oil (for deep-frying) | 10 4-inch wheat flour tortillas (deep-fried) | 5  pineapple rings (grilled and sliced in half) | 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 2 teaspoons ginger (grated) | 8 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 large red onion (minced) | 2  red finger chilies (siling haba) (chopped) | 4 teaspoons bagoong alamang | 1/2 Cup coconut milk (gata) | 2 packed cups pepper leaves (dahon ng sili) | 4 tablespoons coconut cream (kakang gata)
instructions: Combine shrimp, coconut milk, lime juice, brown sugar, and chili powder in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Marinate in the refrigerator for 30 minutes to 1 hour. | Meanwhile, heat oil in a deep pan. Deep-fry tortillas until crisp and golden, about 3 minutes. Drain and set aside. | Make the ginataang dahon ng sili: Heat cooking oil in a casserole. Saute ginger, garlic, onion, and chilies until fragrant. Add bagoong alamang and cook for 1 minute. | Add coconut milk and simmer for 3 minutes. Add dahon ng sili and stir until wilted. Simmer for another 3 minutes. Add coconut cream and simmer until thick and oil has rendered, about 8 minutes. Set aside. | Drain shrimp and discard marinade. Preheat a griller or a stovetop grill. Grill shrimp until cooked and its color turns pink-orange, about 1 minute per side. | Grill pineapples until slightly charred. Set aside. | To serve, place about 2 tablespoons ginataang dahon ng sili on the center of a tostada. Top with 3 shrimp and a pineapple. Repeat with remaining ingredients.
ingredient_names: shrimp | coconut milk | lime juice | chili powder | season | deep frying | 4 wheat flour tortilla | pineapple | ginger | red finger chili | shrimp paste shrimp paste | packed pepper | coconut cream

recipe_name: Alimasag sa Hibe at Gata (Crab with Shrimp and Coconut Milk) Recipe
ingredients: 500 to 600 grams, about 3 pieces Spider Crab (Alimasag) (washed and cleaned) | 1 tablespoon Salt | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1/4 Cup dried shrimp (hibe) | 2 tablespoons white onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 2 tablespoons ginger (sliced into thin strips) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 2 cups coconut milk (gata) | 1 Cup coconut cream (kakang gata) | Salt (to taste) | 100 Grams kangkong (water spinach) leaves
instructions: Place crabs in a pot; add salt and enough water to cover. Bring to a boil then simmer until crabs are cooked, about 8 to 10 minutes. Set aside. | Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Saute hibe for 1 to 2 minutes. Add onions, garlic, and ginger; saute for 2 more minutes. | Add patis. Once patis starts to boil, add coconut milk and coconut cream. Simmer for 2 minutes. Add crabs. Allow crabs to simmer in the sauce for about 5 minutes. | Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add kangkong leaves and cook for 1 more minute. Remove from heat.
ingredient_names: spider crab | vegetable oil | shrimp | ginger | coconut milk | coconut cream | kangkong

ingredients: 8 whole, about 500 grams Hasa-Hasa (Mackerel) (gutted and cleaned) | Salt (to taste) | 1 bundle native pechay (blanched) | vegetable oil (to saute) | 1/2 tablespoon turmeric (luyang dilaw) (minced) | 1 medium red onion (minced) | 1/2 tablespoon ginger (minced) | 3 medium red native tomatoes (seeded and diced) | 1/2 Cup Shrimp (peeled and chopped) | 1 Cup coconut milk (gata) | fish sauce (patis) (to taste) | Cherry tomatoes (to garnish)
instructions: Season fish with salt. Wrap each piece in pechay. Set aside. | Heat oil in a pan. Saute turmeric until oil turns yellow. Add onions, ginger, tomatoes, and shrimp; saute until cooked. | Add 1/2 cup water and coconut milk. Season with fish sauce and pepper to taste. | Add wrapped fish to the pan. Lower heat and simmer until cooked, about 20 minutes. | Garnish with cherry tomatoes.
ingredient_names: hasa | native pechay | vegetable oil | turmeric | ginger | red native tomato | shrimp | coconut milk | cherry tomato

ingredients: 1 400 gram to 600 gram tilapia (gutted, scaled, and cleaned) | Salt (to taste) | Oil (to deep-fry and saute) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 2 tablespoons white onion (minced) | 1 tablespoon ginger (minced) | 4 green native tomatoes (quartered) | 1/2 piece (about 15 to 20 grams) tahure (fermented soy cake) (crumbled) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons native vinegar | 1/2 tablespoon brown sugar | 1 bunch Bok Choy (Chinese leafy cabbage) (blanced, to serve)
instructions: Season fish with salt and pepper. | Heat oil in a deep pan. Deep-fry fish until brown on both sides, about 8 to 10 minutes. Drain and set aside. | Heat oil in a pot. Saute garlic, onions, and ginger until fragrant. Add tomatoes and tahure; stir for 1 minute. | Add soy sauce, vinegar, and 1/2 cup water. Season with sugar, salt, and pepper. Cook for 3 minutes. | Add fried fish, making sure fish is submerged in sauce. Cook for 5 more minutes. Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary. | Serve immediately with blanced bok choy on the side.
ingredient_names: tilapia | deep fry | ginger | green native tomato | soy cake | native vinegar | brown sugar | bok choy

ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/2  white onion (chopped) | 500 Grams Beef (use ground beef) | 1 can (400 grams) red kidney beans | 1 can (400 grams) tomatoes (peeled) | 1 can (420 grams) Canned Whole Kernel Corn | 1 Cup Tomato sauce | 1 pack (40 grams) taco seasoning | 1 1/2 cups water | nacho chips (to serve)
instructions: Turn on rice cooker and add vegetable oil. Once hot, add garlic and onion. Add ground beef and cook until slightly browned. | Add red kidney beans, peeled tomatoes, and whole kernel corn. Add tomato sauce, 1 pack taco seasoning, and water. Simmer until rice cooker automatically switches off. Serve with nacho chips and sour cream.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | beef | red kidney bean | tomato | canned whole kernel corn | tomato sauce | taco | nacho chip

ingredients: 500 Grams Beef ((use brisket), sliced into 11/2-inch cubes) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | Calamansi Juice | 3  red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (chopped) | 2 teaspoons Pepper | 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/4 large red onion (minced) | 2  red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (chopped) | 1  bay leaf | 1 tablespoon tomato paste | 1/2 can (400 grams) canned diced tomatoes | 1/2  beef bouillon cube (dissolved in 1 cup water) | 1 can (85 grams) liver spread | 1/2 tablespoon sugar | Salt (to season) | 15 4-inch wheat flour tortillas (warmed) | 1/3 Cup green mango (to serve) | queso de bola (to serve) | 15  pitted green olives (to serve) | kinchay (parsley)
instructions: Combine beef, soy sauce, calamansi juice, chilies, and pepper in a bowl. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 4 hours or overnight. | Drain meat and set aside marinade. Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a casserole over high heat. Sear beef in batches until browned. Set aside. | In the same casserole, add remaining oil. Saute garlic, onion, chilies, and bay leaf until fragrant. Add tomato paste and cook for 1 minute. | Add beef and stir for 1 minute. Add tomatoes, bouillon mixture, and reserved marinade. Lower heat and simmer for 21/2 to 3 hours or until beef is very tender and sauce has thickened. | Add liver spread, sugar, salt, and pepper; stir to combine. Remove from heat. Transfer beef to a plate; reserve sauce. Shred beef using two forks. Return to sauce and mix. | To serve, place about 1/4 cup kalderata on the center of a tortilla. Top with 1 teaspoon mango, queso de bola, and 1 olive. Garnish with kinchay leaves. Repeat with remaining ingredients.
ingredient_names: 11 2 cube | calamansi juice | red chili pepper | bay leaf | tomato paste | tomato | beef bouillon cube | liver spread | season | 4 wheat flour tortilla | green mango | queso | green olive | kinchay

ingredients: 1 Cup squash (kalabasa) (sliced) | 1 Cup patola  (sliced) | 1/2 Cup okra (sliced) | 1 Cup eggplant (sliced) | 1/3 Cup string beans (sitaw) | 1 bundle saluyot | 1 piece red onion (quartered) | 1 piece tomatoes (quartered) | 4 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) (divided) | 100 Grams Shrimp (trimmed and cleaned, head-on, shell-on) | 1/2 Cup water | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Prepare a small pot and layer the vegetables in this order: squash at the bottom, then patola, okra, eggplant, sitaw, half of the fish sauce, saluyot, onions, tomatoes, garlic, shrimp, and the rest of the fish sauce. | Gently pour water into the pot, along the sides of the pan. Place the pot over medium heat, covered. Once it boils, lower the heat and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until vegetables are cooked to desired doneness. Season to taste. Serve warm.
ingredient_names: kalabasa | patola | okra | eggplant | sitaw | saluyot | tomato | shrimp

ingredients: 1 medium red onion (quartered) | 1 thumb-sized piece ginger (sliced into strips) | 4 medium red native tomatoes (quartered) | 500 Grams Maya-Maya (Grouper) (gutted, scaled, cleaned, and cut into serving pieces) | Pepper (to taste) | 1 medium head cabbage (quartered) | 1 Small Patola (Chinese Okra) (sliced into 1-inch-thick rounds) | 2  green finger chili (siling pangsigang) | 1 bundle sayote tops (washed)
instructions: Place 6 cups water in a pot. Add onions, ginger, and tomatoes; bring to a boil. | Add maya-maya and cook for 5 minutes. Season with fish sauce and pepper to taste. | Add cabbage, patola, and chilies; cook for 3 more minutes. Remove from heat and add sayote tops. Serve hot.

ingredients: 2 to 3 whole catfish (hito) (gutted, cleaned, and scored) | Salt (to taste) | vegetable oil (to deep-fry, plus 4 tablespoons, to saute) | 1 bundle yard-long beans (sitaw) (cut into 4-inch lengths) | 4  Japanese eggplant (quartered) | 1 bundle native pechay | 2 tablespoons white onion (minced) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1 teaspoon Achuete Powder (annatto powder) | 1 tablespoon Butter | 4 tablespoons all-purpose flour | 2 to 3 cups beef stock | 4 tablespoons peanut butter | bagoong alamang (to serve)
instructions: Season fish with salt and pepper. | Heat oil in a deep pan. Deep-fry fish until brown and crisp, about 10 to 12 minutes. Drain and set aside. | Bring a pot of water to a boil. Season with salt. Blanch beans, eggplant, and pechay just until cooked. Drain and set aside. | Heat remaining vegetable oil in the same pot. Saute onions and garlic until fragrant. Add annatto powder, butter, and flour; cook for 1 minute. | Slowly add stock, mixing continuously, until smooth. Add peanut butter; mix. Add more stock if sauce is too thick. Season with salt and pepper. | Arrange fried fish and vegetables on a serving platter. Top with kare-kare sauce. Serve with bagoong.

ingredients: 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 1/4 Cup Achuete Seeds (annatto seeds) | 1 head Garlic (peeled and minced) | 1 kilo pork ((use pork belly or shoulder), cubed) | 3 to 4  dried bay leaf | 1/2 Cup white vinegar | 1 Cup water | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Saute annatto (atsuete) seeds for 2 to 3 minutes; strain oil and return to pan. | Saute garlic in oil for 3 to 5 minutes. Add pork belly or shoulder and dried bay leaves; cook for 10 minutes. Cook until pork fat is rendered and meat is browned. | Add white vinegar and water; simmer for 45 minutes or until meat is tender. Season with salt.
ingredient_names: achuete seed | pork | dried bay leaf

ingredients: 500 Grams Chicken (use different parts) | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 1 tablespoon onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon ginger (julienned) | 1 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1/2 Cup bigas malagkit (sticky rice) (rinsed) | 1/2 Cup long-grain rice (rinsed) | 4 cups water | 1 pinch kasubha (safflower) | Salt (to taste) | Sping Onions (to garnish)
instructions: Heat oil over medium heat in a pot, then saute onions, garlic, and ginger. Add chicken and fry for 1-2 minutes per side. Pour in the patis and let it simmer. Add the rice and stir well. Pour in the water and bring to a boil then let it simmer for 20-30 minutes while stirring constantly until desired consistency is achieved. | Add kasubha and stir well. Season to taste. Serve with fried garlic and spring onions.
ingredient_names: different part | canola oil | ginger | bigas malagkit | long grain rice | kasubha | garnish

recipe_name: Sinigang na Hipon sa Bayabas Recipe
ingredients: 6 cups water | 8 pieces Guava (bayabas) (halved) | 1 piece tomatoes (quartered) | 1 piece long green chilies (siling pangsigang) | 1 piece red onion (quartered) | 1 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1/4 Cup radish (labanos) (thinly sliced) | 1/2 Cup okra (sliced) | 1/2 Cup sitaw (string beans) | 1/2 Cup eggplant (sliced) | 1 bundle kangkong (water spinach) leaves | Salt (to taste) | 500 Grams Shrimp (cleaned and trimmed, head on, shell on)
instructions: Place water, bayabas, tomatoes, chili, and onions in a pot and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and let it simmer for 20 minutes. Mash the bayabas a little bit with the back of a wooden spoon. | Add the shrimps, fish sauce, radish, okra, eggplant, and sitaw then simmer for 2-3 minutes. Add the kangkong leaves and simmer for another minute. Season to taste. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: guava | tomato | long green chily | radish | okra | sitaw | eggplant | kangkong | shrimp

ingredients: 500 Grams Chicken (use different parts) | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 1 1/2 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 1 1/2 tablespoons onion (chopped) | 2 pieces laurel leaf | 3 cups tomatoes (chopped) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 1 1/2 teaspoons tomato paste | 1/4 Cup water | 1/4 Cup peas | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Saute onions, garlic, laurel leaves, and tomatoes until tomatoes are softened. Add tomato paste and continue to saute for a minute, then pour in the patis and add the chicken. | Cook the chicken for 3-4 minutes while turning the pieces. Pour in the water and let simmer for 10-15 minutes or until chicken is cooked. Add the peas in the last 2 minutes of cooking. Season to taste.

ingredients: 1/3 Cup yellow monggo beans (mung beans) (dry roasted on a pan) | 1 1/2 cups coconut milk (gata) | 1/2 Cup coconut cream (kakang gata) | 1/2 Cup bigas malagkit (sticky rice) (rinsed) | 3/4 cups white sugar | 1/4 to 1/2 Cup water (as needed)
instructions: Pound beans on a mortar and pestle until roughly ground. | Boil coconut milk and coconut cream together in a pot. Add the sticky rice and the ground monggo beans and let simmer, while constantly stirring, for about 30 minutes or so, or until the rice and the monggo are cooked as desired.. | Sweeten with sugar. Water may be added if consistency gets too thick. Serve hot
ingredient_names: yellow monggo bean | coconut milk | coconut cream | bigas malagkit

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 1-inch ginger (sliced) | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium red onion (sliced) | 1 kilo Chicken (cut into small pieces) | 2 cups coconut cream (kakang gata) | 3 pieces lady finger green chilies | 2 pieces siling labuyo (bird's eye chili)
instructions: In a pre-heated medium-sized pan, saute the ginger, garlic and onion until browned. | Add the chicken pieces. Saute until cooked through or about 10 minutes. | Add the coconut cream. Let it simmer for 10 minutes. | Add the lady finger chillies and bird's eye chilies and cook for 10 more minutes.
ingredient_names: 1 ginger | chicken | coconut cream | lady finger green chilies | labuyo

ingredients: 1 Cup ampalaya (bitter melon) (sliced into thin crescents) | 2 tablespoons Salt (divided) | 2 cups eggplant (sliced into long, thin slices) | 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 tablespoon white onion (chopped) | 1/2 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 1/2 Cup native tomaties (chopped) | 300 Grams pork (use ground pork) | 3/4 Cup shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) | Pepper (to taste) | 1 Cup squash (kalabasa) (thinly sliced) | 1 Cup okra (sliced) | 1 Cup winged beans (sigarilyas) (thinly sliced)
instructions: Mix ampalaya and 1 tablespoon salt in a bowl; let ampalaya sit for 30 minutes. Squeeze out water. Rinse ampalaya twice under running water. Squeeze out water again. Set aside. | Mix together eggplant and remaining salt in a bowl; let eggplant sit for 30 minutes. Squeeze out water. Rinse eggplant under running water. Squeeze out water again. Set aside. | Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Saute onions and garlic for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes; cook for 3 to 4 minutes. Add ground pork; cook for 5 to 7 minutes. Add bagoong; saute for 3 minutes. Season with pepper. Set aside. | Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. | Place half of the squash on the bottom of a 5x7-inch baking dish. Top with a thin layer of meat. Layer with ampalaya, eggplant, okra, and sigarilyas, ending with meat. Top with remaining squash. Cover with foil. Bake for 20 minutes.

ingredients: 1/2 teaspoon ground coriander seeds | 1/2 teaspoon ground cumin seeds | 1/2 teaspoon ground fennel seeds | 1 teaspoon paprika | 3 cloves Garlic (minced finely) | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | saffron | 2 tablespoons hot water | 1 teaspoon dried oregano | 1  bay leaf (crushed) | 2 teaspoons sherry vinegar | 2 teaspoons extra virgin olive oil | 500 Grams pork (use pork tenderloin)
instructions: Combine ground coriander seeds, ground cumin seeds, ground fennel seeds, paprika, garlic, salt, a pinch of saffron, hot water, dried oregano, bay leaf (crushed), sherry vinegar, and extra virgin olive oil in a large bowl; mix well. | Slice pork tenderloin into 1-inch cubes and marinate in the mixture, covered, for 2 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. Thread pork through skewers. Grill for 10 to 12 minutes, or until tender, basting often with the marinade.

ingredients: 5 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 3 tablespoons white vinegar | 2 tablespoons brown sugar | 2 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 1  dried bay leaf | 1 1/2 tablespoons peppercorns | 2  siling labuyo (birds eye chili) (sliced, plus more if desired) | 8 whole Chicken (use wings) | 2 tablespoons Butter | Salt | green onion (Chopped, for garnish)
instructions: Make the marinade: Mix together all ingredients in a bowl. Marinate chicken in the refrigerator, covered, for 1 hour. | Remove chicken from marinade 10 minutes before cooking. Set aside 2 tablespoons marinade for basting; place the rest in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil then simmer for 3 to 5 minutes or until syrupy. Add butter and mix well. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside. | Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Turn on the broiler function. | Place chicken wings on a baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 13 to 17 minutes, basting and turning twice during the first 10 minutes. To achieve a deeper color, turn up heat to 400 degrees F in the last minute of cooking. | Remove chicken from oven and toss in thickened sauce. Top with green onions and more chilies, if desired.
ingredient_names: brown sugar | dried bay leaf | peppercorn | labuyo | whole chicken | butter | green onion

ingredients: 15  finger chilies (siling pangsigang) | 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 2 tablespoons white onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 1 tablespoon ginger (grated) | 250 Grams pork (use ground pork) | Salt (to taste) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 3 tablespoons white onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 2 tablespoons ginger (grated) | 1 1/2 tablespoons shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) | 3/4 Cup coconut cream (kakang gata) | 3/4 Cup coconut milk (gata)
instructions: Make a slit along the length of each chili pepper, making sure they can sit with slit side facing up. Seed and rinse. Set aside. | Heat oil in pan over medium-high heat. Saute onions, garlic, and ginger for 2 minutes. Add pork; cook for 8 to 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside to cool. | Stuff each chili pepper with pork, just enough so stuffing peeks out of chilies. | Make the sauce: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Saute onions, garlic, and ginger for 2 minutes. Add bagoong; saute for 1 minute. Add coconut cream and coconut milk; simmer for 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. | Place chilies, slit side up, one by one in the pan. (Sauce should not cover chilies; slits should be exposed.) Simmer for 5 to 7 minutes or until cooked.

ingredients: 1/3 Cup water | 1/2 Cup Japanese soy sauce | 1/3 Cup sugar | 1 tablespoon ginger (grated) | 1 1/2 tablespoons mirin (japanese sweet rice wine) | 180 Grams Beef (use U.S. beef tenderloin) | 1 medium carrot | 2 stalks Leeks
instructions: Combine water, Japanese soy sauce (we used Kikkoman), sugar, grated ginger, and mirin in a saucepan. Bring to a boil, then lower heat and simmer until sugar is dissolved and sauce is thick. | Slice U.S. beef tenderloin into 1-inch cubes, slice carrot into 1-inch-long sticks, and leeks into 1-inch-long pieces. Thread beef, carrots, and leeks alternately on skewers. Grill for 2 minutes on each side, regularly basting with sauce.
ingredient_names: japanese soy sauce | ginger | mirin | u s beef tenderloin | carrot | leek

ingredients: 30 Grams Tamarind Fruit (Sampalok) (skin left on) | 1 65-ml pack coconut cream (kakang gata) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 2 80 to 100-gram Chicken ((use skinless chicken breast fillet), sliced into 3-inch long, 3/4-inch wide pieces) | Salt (to taste) | 1 Cup all-purpose flour (seasoned with salt, pepper, and 1 tablespoon sinigang sa kamias powder mix) | 1  Egg (beaten and seasoned with salt and pepper) | 1 Cup breadcrumbs (seasoned with 1 tablespoon sinigang sa kamias pwder mix) | 2 cups vegetable oil (to deep-fry) | cilantro (wansoy) (to garnish, optional)
instructions: Make the sinampalukang gata: Boil sampaloc in 3/4 cup water for 20 to 30 minutes or until soft. Mash sampaloc and strain through a sieve. Combine 1/4 cup strained sampaloc pulp, coconut cream, and fish sauce in a bowl; season to taste. Refrigerate until ready to use. (You can make this the day before.) | Lightly season chicken with salt and pepper. | Place flour, egg, and breadcrumbs separately in 3 shallow bowls. | Dredge chicken in flour, shake off excess, dip in egg, then coat with breadcrumbs. | Heat oil in a deep or heavy-bottomed pan. Deep-fry chicken in hot oil for 6 to 8 minutes or until cooked and light golden brown in color. | Serve with sinampalukang gata and garnish with cilantro, if desired.

ingredients: 1 Cup coconut milk (gata) | 1/4 teaspoon turmeric powder | 1 teaspoon ginger (grated) | 1 teaspoon Garlic (minced) | 1 tablespoon curry powder | 2 tablespoons dark brown sugar | 400 Grams Chicken | 1/8 Cup vegetable oil | peanut sauce (to serve) | peanuts (to garnish)
instructions: Combine coconut milk, turmeric powder, grated ginger, minced garlic, curry powder, and dark brown sugar in a bowl; mix well. Set aside. Slice chicken thigh fillets into 1x1-inch cubes. Marinate chicken in mixture, covered, for 3 hours or overnight in the refrigerator. | Drain chicken, and mix together marinade and vegetable oil. Thread chicken onto skewers and grill for 10 to 12 minutes, or until chicken is cooked through, basting with the marinade. Serve with peanut sauce and garnish with chopped peanuts, if desired.
ingredient_names: coconut milk | turmeric powder | ginger | curry powder | brown sugar | chicken | vegetable oil | peanut sauce | peanut

ingredients: 200 Grams bacon (sliced into thin strips) | 1 medium white onion (chopped) | 1 Small green bell pepper (seeded and diced) | 3 400-gram cans brown pinto beans (drained and rinsed) | 1 1/2 cups barbecue sauce (we used Hunts Original) | 1 to 2 tablespoons white vinegar
instructions: Cook bacon in a large saucepan over medium-low heat until fat is rendered; set aside. | Add white onion and green bell pepper to the same pan; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened. Add brown pinto beans, barbecue sauce (we used hunt's Original), and white vinegar. | Add cooked bacon and bring to a simmer. Lower heat and simmer for another 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

recipe_name: Yellow Chicken Adobo (Adobo sa Dilaw) Recipe
ingredients: 4 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 head Garlic (minced) | 1  white onion (sliced) | 1 knob turmeric (luyang dilaw) (sliced) | 750 Grams Chicken (adobo cut) | fish sauce (patis) (to taste) | 1/2 teaspoon peppercorns | 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 1 400-gram can coconut milk (gata) | 1  bay leaf | 1 to 2  green chili (siling tagalog) (Optional)
instructions: Heat oil in a saucepan over high heat. Saute garlic, onion, and turmeric. Add chicken and stir-fry for about 5 minutes. | Season with fish sauce and add peppercorns. Lower heat and cook until chicken renders its own liquid. Stir-fry until chicken is partially cooked and no longer pink | Add vinegar and simmer, making sure not to stir, until acid cooks off, about 5 to 7 minutes. | Add coconut milk and bay leaf; simmer until thick and chicken is cooked through. Add chilies, if using, and season with more fish sauce if desired.

ingredients: 1 4-inch stalk lemongrass (tanglad) (sliced, plus 8 stalks) | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 4 pieces coriander root | 2 stalks green onion | 500 Grams pork (use ground pork) | 1 1/2 tablespoons sugar | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1/4 teaspoon black pepper | vegetable oil (for brushing) | Sweet chili sauce (to serve)
instructions: Pound (or whiz) together sliced lemongrass, garlic, coriander root, and green onions until a paste forms using a mortar and pestle (or a food processor). | Mix together lemongrass mixture and ground pork in a large bowl. Add sugar, fish sauce, and black pepper. | Divide mixture into 8 portions; form each into a ball using your hands. (Moisten your hands to prevent meat from sticking.) | Insert a lemongrass stalk halfway into each meatball. Mold meat around lemongrass stalk to form logs. Brush with oil. | Preheat a charcoal grill or grill pan. Grill skewers for 4 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Serve with sweet chili sauce.

ingredients: 3 tablespoons Butter | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 500 Grams Shrimp (peeled) | 1/2 Cup barbecue sauce | 1 1/2 cups snow peas (sitsaro) | 1/4 Cup young corn | Salt (to season) | mango ((flesh part), diced) | cilantro (wansoy) ((leaves), for garnish)
instructions: Melt butter in a wok over high heat. | Saute garlic until light brown. Add peeled shrimp and cook until pink. | Add barbecue sauce, snow peas, and young corn; stir-fry for 2 minutes more. Season with salt and pepper. | Turn off heat and stir in diced mango flesh. Garnish with cilantro leaves.

recipe_name: Roast Chicken in Coconut Milk Recipe
ingredients: 2 1-kilo Chicken (each cut into 8 pieces) | 2 cups coconut milk (gata) | 4 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 3 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 1 teaspoon ground turmeric | 1 teaspoon ginger (grated) | 1/4 Cup cilantro (wansoy) (chopped) | chili flakes (to taste) | 1 tablespoon Salt | vegetable oil (for brushing)
instructions: Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and marinate overnight in the refrigerator. | Preheat oven to 420 degrees. Brush baking sheet with oil. Drain marinade from chicken then arrange chicken on prepared baking sheet. Bake in the oven for about 30 minutes or until golden brown. | Alternatively, you can grill the chicken: preheat charcoal grill to medium-high heat. Brush grill with oil to prevent chicken from sticking. Arrange chicken on the grill, skin side down, 1 inch apart. Grill each side for 8 to 10 minutes. Check for doneness by piercing the thickest part of each piece; they're cooked when the juices run clear.

ingredients: 1 kilo pork hocks | 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 large onion (chopped) | 1 large can pork and beans | 1 Cup Tomato sauce | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup water | 1 tablespoon brown sugar | Salt (to taste)
instructions: In a big pot over medium heat, cook pork hocks for 5-10 minutes. | Saute garlic and onions in the same pot until onions are translucent. | Add pork and beans, brown sugar, tomato sauce, soy sauce, and water. | Simmer for 45 minutes to an hour over low heat until meat is tender. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper.

ingredients: 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 3 tablespoons light brown sugar | 1 kilo tilapia (cleaned) | 1 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder
instructions: Combine soy sauce, garlic, and brown sugar in a bowl. | Sprinkle both sides of tilapia with five-spice powder. | Heat a large nonstick pan over medium-high heat. Add tilapia and cook until edges are opaque, about 5 minutes. Reduce heat to medium and turn fish over. Add soy sauce mixture; simmer until fish is completely cooked and the sauce has thickened, about 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

ingredients: 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 2 tablespoons Oil | 2 medium tomatoes (quartered) | 1 kilo Beef (use shank with bone marrow) | 2 pieces tanglad (lemongrass) | 3-4 pieces batwan (or kamias (you can find Batuan powder or Preserved batuan in specialty stores)) | 1 tablespoons Achuete Extract (annatto extract) | 1/2 kilo green langka (jackfruit) | sea salt (to taste) | 1-2 pieces siling labuyo (birds eye chili) (to serve (optional))
instructions: In a pressure cooker, saute garlic in oil then add the tomatoes. | Add the beef shank. Add water to cover the meat, close the lid of the pressure cooker and cook for around 30 minutes. | After 30 minutes, check the beef shank if it s tender. Take out the scum that's floating on the top. | Add the lemongrass and kamias or batuan. Add the atsuete extract. | Close the pressure cooker again and continue cooking until the beef is fall-off-the-bone tender for another 30-40 minutes. | Add the langka and continue cooking until tender. Serve warm.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1/4 kilo pork (sliced) | 2 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 medium onion (sliced) | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 5 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 tabespoon oyster sauce | 2 cups cabbage | 1 Cup carrot (julienned) | 1 kilo miki noodles
instructions: Heat oil in a wok. Add the pork belly and cook until the fat comes out. Stir in the garlic and onions and cook until slightly brown. | Add salt, pepper, soy sauce, and oyster sauce. Stir and cook for 6 to 8 minutes. Add a bit of water if sauce is too dry. | Add the cabbage and carrots. Cook vegetables for 3 to 5 minutes. | Add the miki noodles, and then saute. Cook for another 3 minutes. Then transfer to a serving dish.

recipe_name: Sinigang na Baboy sa Bayabas Recipe
ingredients: 2-3 cups water | 1 kilo pork (chopped to serving pieces) | 2 pieces tomatoes (quartered) | 1/2 kilo Guava (bayabas) (quartered) | 2 pieces red onion (sliced) | 3 pieces gabi (taro root) (peeled and quartered) | 1 piece labanos (radish) (quartered) | Salt (to taste) | 2 cups sitaw (string beans) (sliced into 1 1/2-inch pieces) | 5 pieces okra (sliced) | 2 Small eggplant (sliced diagonally) | 1 bunch kangkong (water spinach) leaves (leaves removed from stems) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis)
instructions: In a medium-sized stainless steel pot, boil 2 to 3 cups water. Water should slightly more than enough to cover the meat. | While the water is boiling, put the pork ribs one by one until every piece of meat is in the pot. Add the tomatoes and guava and cook for about 30 to 40 minutes or until the meat is tender. | Add the onions, gabi, labanos, salt and pepper then cook for another 8 minutes. | Then add the sitaw, okra and eggplants and simmer for another 6 minutes. Add in the kangkong and fish sauce, then let simmer for 5 minutes more. Serve hot. [ArticleReco:{"articles":["14904"]}]

ingredients: 1 tablespoon honey | 2 tablespoons sriracha hot sauce | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | Calamansi Juice | 200 Grams pork (sliced thinly) | 1 tablespoon vegetable oil (divided) | 2 bundles Mustard Leaves (Mustasa) (washed and stems removed) | Salt (to taste) | 4  mantou buns (steamed according to package directions then sliced lengthwise)
instructions: Combine honey, Sriracha, soy sauce, calamansi juice, and pork belly in a bowl. Marinate for 45 minutes. | Heat 1/2 tablespoon oil in a pan over medium heat. Saute mustard leaves until wilted, about 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside. | Heat remaining oil in a frying pan. Pan-fry pork until browned, about 4 minutes on each side. | Sandwich mustard leaves and pork between mantou buns. Serve immediately.

ingredients: cooking oil (for sauteeing) | 1/2 head Garlic (chopped) | 1 medium-sized white onion (sliced thinly) | 1/2 medium-sized cabbage (shredded) | 200 Grams grilled pork belly (cut into thin strips) | 1 large Chicken ((use breast part), pre-boiled, shredded) | 2/3 Cup fish sauce (patis) | white pepper (to taste) | 4 to 6 cups pork broth | 400 Grams bihon noodles (thin rice noodles) (rinsed) | 200 Grams Shrimp (pre-boiled, shelled) | 1 small bundle spring onions (Chopped, for topping) | chicharon (roughly chopped, for topping) | sesame oil (to taste) | calamansi (to taste)
instructions: Heat your wok until it starts to smoke, Add in 3 to 4 tablespoons of cooking oil and saute garlic until light brown. Remember to not over fry. Remove from the wok and set aside. | Using the same wok and oil, cook the onions for about half a minute. Add the cabbage and cook for another minute. Remove the vegetables from the wok and set aside. | Using the same wok (you can add more oil if necessary), add the pork and chicken and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add in 1/2 cup of the fish sauce and season with white pepper powder. Stir for 1 minute. Add in 3 to 4 cups of broth, bring to a boil, then let simmer for 2 minutes. | Add the noodles and stir for 2 to 3 minutes until the broth is absorbed. If necesary, add the remaining broth and fish sauce and stir until the noodles are cooked. | Reduce heat to low, then add the shrimp, vegetables, half of the fried garlic, sesame oil, and stir for another 1 or 2 minutes. Serve hot with spring onion, fried garlic, and chicharon baboy garnish. Drizzle with calamansi or lemon juice.

ingredients: 1 Cup fresh tuna (cut into 1/4 inch thick slices) | 2 tablespoons Barbecue marinade (, we used a mix of soy sauce, ketchup, and lemon juice) | 2 large onion (chopped) | 5 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1/2  bell pepper (chopped) | 1 ear finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (chopped) | black pepper (to taste) | white pepper (to taste) | 2 to 3 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | Salt (to taste) | mayonnaise (for garnish) | fish skin chicharon (for garnish)
instructions: Flake the tuna. Heat oil under medium heat and cook the garlic. Toss in half the onions and bell peppers and cook for about 1 minute. | Add the tuna and stir fry for about 1 minute. Season with lime juice, salt, white pepper, black pepper, and barbecue sauce. Continue stirring until the liquid has reduced completely. | Remove from heat and cool down. Mix in the remaining onions and mayonnaise. Adjust seasoning, if needed, then garnish with fish skin chicharon.
ingredient_names: thick | barbecue marinade | bell pepper | finger chili | white pepper | calamansi juice | mayonnaise | fish skin chicharon

ingredients: 6 pieces shallots (sibuyas Tagalog) | 1 1/2 inch ginger (slice into strips) | 3 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 8 pieces dried red chilies (seeded and soaked) | 2 tablespoons ground coriander | 1 tablespoon cumin | 3 tablespoons Oil | 1 1/2 Cup coconut milk (gata) | 4  kaffir lime leaf | 2 stalks lemongrass (tanglad) | 4 slices ginger | 1 tablespoon muscovado sugar | 1  Chicken (cut into halves)
instructions: To make the spice paste: pound the shallots, ginger, garlic, dried red chili, ground coriander, and cumin in a mortar and pestle until you get a fine paste. | Heat oil in a pan. Add the spice paste and stir-fry for 10 minutes until fragrant. | Add coconut milk, lime leaves, lemongrass, ginger, salt, and sugar. Stir well. | Add the chicken and cook for 10 minutes over low heat; turn the chicken a few times until the chicken is half-cooked. | Transfer chicken to a turbo broiler and pour sauce all over the chicken. Roast chicken at 275 degrees F for 15 minutes or until browned.
ingredient_names: shallot | ginger | dried red chily | coriander | cumin | coconut milk | kaffir lime leaf | lemongrass | muscovado sugar | chicken

ingredients: 1/4 kilo Beef (tripe) | 1/4 kilo Beef (use shanks) | 1/4 kilo Pork Intestine | 1/4 kilo beef or pork kidney | 1 1/2 cups Vinegar (divided) | 1/4 kilo Beef | 2 heads Garlic (1 head crushed, 1 head minced) | 1  onion (minced) | 2 thumb-seized pieces ginger (julienned) | 1 teaspoon Achuete Powder (annatto powder) (or 1 tablespoon annato seeds in 1 tablespoon of water) | 2 teaspoons cooking oil | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Clean beef, tripe, and innards by rinsing well under running water. Rub with rock salt and soak in a cup of white vinegar for 20 minutes. Then, rinse again under running water. | Parboil the beef, tripe, and innards for 30 minutes, discard water, rinse, and drain. In a pot, place 15 cups of water along with the beef, tripe, innards, and jelly blood. Season with 1 teaspoon of rock salt and bring to a boil over medium heat until scum appears on the surface. Remove all the scum or brown bubbles that form on top of the broth. Cook until tender. | Remove all the beef, tripe, entrails and blood and cut into bite sized pieces. Set the broth aside. | In a large pan, saute the beef, tripe, entrails, and blood with garlic, onions, and ginger. Add the annato powder or annato seeds for added flavor and color. Add 1/2 cup of vinegar and stir for 2 to 3 minutes. | Add the broth, boil on medium heat, and season with salt and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with steamed rice, hot chili, and calamansi.
ingredient_names: beef | shank | pork intestine | pork kidney | ginger | powder

ingredients: 2 cups tapioca flour | 1 Cup water (boiling) | 500 Grams Shrimp (peeled and deveined) | 500 Grams pork ((use pork loin), sliced into thick matchsticks) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | lemon juice | 1/4 teaspoon Salt | 1 tablespoon sugar | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | lemon juice | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 1 tablespoon honey | 1 clove Garlic (minced or grated) | Crispy Fried Garlic (for garnish)
instructions: Make the wrapper: Combine ingredients in a bowl. Mix until  dough comes together. Knead until elastic and no longer sticky, about 5 to 6 minutes. Let dough rest for 30 minutes. | Marinate shrimp and pork in fish sauce, lemon juice, salt, sugar, and pepper for 30 minutes in the refrigerator. | Make the dipping sauce: Combine all ingredients in a bowl and set aside. | Take 1 tablespoon dough and form into a ball. Flatten using your fingers. Place a shrimp and a slice of pork on the center. Fold circle over and press edges lightly to seal. Repeat with remaining ingredients. | Bring a pot of water to a boil. Boil dumplings until they float to the surface. Remove from water. The dough should be translucent and the filling fully cooked. | Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with fried garlic and green onions. Serve with dipping sauce on the side.
ingredient_names: tapioca flour | shrimp | thick matchstick | lemon juice | honey | crispy fried garlic

ingredients: 36  Tiger Prawns (Sugpo) (peeled and deveined with tails left on) | Salt (to taste) | 3 cups Japanese breadcrumbs (Panko) | vegetable oil (to fry) | Japanese rice (to serve) | Wasabi Mayonnaise (to serve)
instructions: Season prawns with salt and pepper. Dredge prawns inbreadcrumbs. | Fill a large frying pan with vegetable oil until 1/2 inch deep; heat to 350 degrees F. Fry coated prawns until golden brown. Drain on a wire rack. | Serve with steamed rice and wasabi mayonnaise or tonkatsu sauce.
ingredient_names: tiger prawn | japanese breadcrumb | vegetable oil | japanese rice | wasabi mayonnaise

ingredients: 200 Grams pork (use ground pork) | 2 bundles kangkong (water spinach) leaves (stems only, sliced into 1/2-inch pieces) | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 2 tablespoons white onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 2 tablespoons ginger (grated) | 2 tablespoons Bagoong (Shrimp Paste) | 1/2 Cup coconut milk (gata) | 1/4 Cup coconut cream (kakang gata) | 1 to 2 pieces finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (sliced) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat and saute the onions, garlic, ginger and bagoong. Add the ground pork and cook until slightly brown. | Add coconut milk and coconut cream and allow to simmer for about 2-3 minutes. | Add sliced chilies and kangkong stems and cover to simmer for another 3 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. More green chilies may be added if desired.
ingredient_names: pork | kangkong | canola oil | ginger | coconut milk | coconut cream | finger chili

ingredients: 500 Grams Chicken (we used legs, thighs, and wings) | 4 pieces calamansi | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 1 tablespoon Butter | 2 tablespoons white onion (chopped) | 1 1/2 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 1 piece laurel leaf | 2 1/2 cups tomatoes (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | 2 teaspoons brown sugar | Salt (to taste) | 1 1/2 tablespoons Achuete Oil (annatto oil)
instructions: Marinate chicken pieces in calamansi juice and soy sauce. Keep chilled for about 4 hours. | Heat oil and butter in a pot over medium high heat. Sear the chicken pieces for 4-5 minutes per side or until lightly golden brown. Remove the chicken from the pan and set aside. | In the same pan, saute onions, garlic, bay leaf and tomatoes. Allow to simmer for 3-4 minutes then add soy sauce and brown sugar and mix well. | Return the chicken back to the pan and simmer further for 10-12 minutes or until chicken is cooked. Add atsuete oil and season to taste.
ingredient_names: chicken | calamansi | canola oil | butter | laurel leaf | tomato | brown sugar

ingredients: 500 Grams salmon (use belly) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 2 tablespoons ginger (julienned) | 1/3 Cup red onion (sliced into wedges) | 3 Small tomatoes (sliced into wedges) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1 liter water | 1/2 Cup gabi (taro root) (peeled) | 2 pieces finger chilies (siling pangsigang) | 1 20-gram pack sinigang mix | 1/2 Cup radish (labanos) (sliced) | 1 bunch okra (trimmed) | 1 cip string beans (sitaw) (sliced) | 1/2 Cup eggplant (sliced) | 1 bunch kangkong (water spinach) leaves (leaves only) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat and saute garlic, ginger, onions, tomatoes, and fish sauce. | Add water and gabi and allow to simmer for 6-8 minutes. Add green chilies and salmon belly. More water may be added, if necessary, then bring to a boil. Add sinigang mix and radish and mix well. | Bring back to a boil, then add okra, sitaw, and eggplant. Simmer further for about 3 minutes, and once salmon is cooked, add kangkong and cover the pot and let cook for another 1-2 minutes. Season to taste and serve while hot.
ingredient_names: salmon | vegetable oil | ginger | tomato | gabi | finger chili | 20 sinigang mix | radish | okra | cip sitaw | eggplant | kangkong

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 small can Spanish-style sardines ((about 155 grams)) | 2 cups water | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1 medium Patola (Chinese Okra) (sliced) | 1/8 teaspoon black pepper | 1/8 kilo misua (fine rice noodles)
instructions: Heat oil in a medium pot, then saute garlic and onions. | Add the sardines including the oil and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. | Add water and patola let it boil for about 5 minutes. Adjust taste by adding fish sauce and ground black pepper. | Add in the misua and cook for 5 minutes on medium heat. Serve warm.
ingredient_names: sardine | patola | misua

ingredients: 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 5 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (diced) | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 1/4 kilo pork (use ground pork) | 1 medium upo (bottle gourd) (cut into cubes) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a medium-sized pan and saute garlic and onion. | Add the ground black pepper and ground pork, then cook for 3 to 5 minutes. | Add the upo and cover the pan. Simmer for 6 minutes. | Season with salt to taste.
ingredient_names: pork | cubes

recipe_name: Ginataang Tanigue (Spanish Mackerel in Coconut Milk) Recipe
ingredients: 3 pieces tanigue (Spanish mackerel) (use tanigue steaks) | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 1 tablspoon Garlic (chopped) | 1 1/2 tablespoons white onion (chopped) | 1 1/2 tablespoons ginger (sliced) | 1/4 Cup Leeks (sliced into 1 1/2-inch sticks) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 1 piece green chili (siling tagalog) | 1/2 Cup coconut milk (gata) | 1/2 Cup coconut cream (kakang gata) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil on a pan over medium heat, then saute garlic, onions, ginger and leeks. Add patis (fish sauce) and green chili then bring to a boil. | Pour in coconut milk and coconut cream and bring to a simmer. Add the fish steaks and cook for 5-6 minutes per side or until cooked through. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: tanigue steak | canola oil | tablspoon garlic | ginger | leek | green chili | coconut milk | coconut cream

ingredients: 500 Grams miki lucban (or fresh miki noodles) | 3 tablespoons canola oil | 2 tablespoons white onion (sliced) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 3/4 Cup pork (sliced) | 1/2 Cup Shrimp (peeled) | 1/3 Cup sayote (chayote) (julienned) | 1/4 cups carrot (julienned) | 1/4 Cup peas | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1/4 Cup cane vinegar | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 1/4 Cup Bok Choy (Chinese leafy cabbage) (sliced) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: If using fresh miki noodles, rinse noodles in hot water before using. | Heat oil on a wok over medium high heat and saute onions and garlic. Add the pork belly to the wok and cook until lightly browned, then add shrimps and cook for another 2 minutes. | Add the sayote, carrots, chicharo, soy sauce, vinegar and patis and stir well and bring to a simmer. Add the noodles and bok choy and toss well then season to taste. [ArticleReco:{"articles":["10440"]}]

ingredients: 1 Cup elbow macaroni | 5 cups water | 1/2 kilo Chicken ((use fillet), cut into cubes) | 1 medium onion (peeled and quartered) | 1 teaspoon peppercorns | 4 cloves Garlic (peeled and minced) | 2 pieces bay leaf | 10 cups water | 1 tablespoon Butter | 1 medium onion (peeled and chopped) | 2 medium carrot (peeled and diced) | 2 stalks celery (diced) | 1 can evaporated milk ((around 12 ounces)) | Salt
instructions: In a pot over medium heat, cook macaroni in about 5 cups of salted boiling water for about 7 to 8 minutes or until firm to bite. Remove from pot, rinse and drain well. Set aside. | In a large pot over medium heat, combine chicken, quartered onions, peppercorns, 2 cloves of the garlic, bay leaves and about 10 cups water. Bring to a boil, skimming scum that may float on top. Once the broth clears, lower heat and cover. Continue to cook for about 20 to 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and fork-tender. With a slotted spoon, remove chicken from the broth. Set aside chicken to cool. Once the chicken is cool to the touch, cut it into cubes. | In another pot over medium heat, add butter. When it begins to melt, add the chopped onions and the remaining 2 cloves of garlic. Cook, stirring regularly, until limp. Add carrots and celery and cook, stirring occasionally. | Add the broth used to cook the chicken and bring to a boil. Add pasta and chicken. Add evaporated milk. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Lower heat and continue to cook for about 7 to 8 minutes or until heated through.Serve warm.
ingredient_names: elbow macaroni | chicken | peppercorn | bay leaf | butter | carrot | celery | milk

ingredients: 2 cups pineapple juice | 3 tablespoons soy sauce | 5 tablespoons brown sugar | 1 kilo pork tenderloin or butt (pigue) (sliced into large, thin slices (tapa)) | 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 large can pineapple (sliced and drained (around 20 ounces)) | 1 Cup water | 1 teaspoon liquid pork seasoning | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Make the marinade: combine pineapple juice, sugar, and soy sauce in a large bowl. | Marinate pork with the pineapple-soy sauce mixture for 1-3 hours. | Remove the pork from the marinade and set the remaining marinade mixture aside. | Heat the oil in a pan and fry the marinated pork until the meat turns light brown (approximately 3 to 5 minutes). | Pour in the remaining marinade mixture together with the pineapple slices, water, and liquid pork seasoning and simmer for 45 to 60 minutes. | Add salt and pepper to taste. | Slice the pork loin before serving and serve with pineapple slices and sauce.
ingredient_names: pineapple juice | brown sugar | pork | pineapple | liquid pork

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1/2 tablespoons Garlic | 1 medium onion (chopped) | 1 kilo Chicken (cut into 8 pieces) | 500 Grams Tomato sauce | 1 85-gram can liver spread | 1/2 Cup cheddar cheese (grated) | 1/2 kilo Potatoes (peeled and quartered) | 1 medium carrot (sliced) | 2 pieces red bell pepper (seeded and sliced) | 1/2 Cup green peas | Salt (to taste)
instructions:
Preheat medium pot and add cooking oil. Saute garlic ang onion until translucent. | Add the chicken and saute for about 10 minutes until browned. | Add the tomato sauce and liver spread and let it simmer for 10 minutes. | Add the grated cheese, potatoes, carrots, green peas, and bell pepper. Adjust taste by adding salt and pepper. Cover and let it simmer for 10 minutes.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 4 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1/4 kilo Chicken ((use breast part, cooked), shredded) | 8 cups chicken stock ((or 2 chicken cubes to be dissolved in 8 cups of water)) | 1/4 Cup Achuete Powder (annatto powder) | 1 kilo flat rice noodles ((you can use any pre-made noodles from the market to save time)) | Salt (to taste) | Bagnet (for topping) | 1  Egg (boiled)
instructions: Saute crushed garlic in preheated oil and add shredded chicken. | Add chicken stock. Bring to a boil. | Add annato powder and simmer until it boils. (If using annatto seeds, boil in hot water and strain the liquid over the broth.) | Add the noodles and cook for 3 to 5 minutes. | Ladle some soup and noodles in a bowl then top with bagnet and a whole egg.

ingredients: 400 Grams Beef ((use beef striploin), sliced into 1-inch strips) | 1 medium red onion (sliced into 16 wedges) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | cilantro sprigs (for garnish) | 1/4 Cup fish sauce (patis) | 1/4 Cup lemon juice | 2 1/2 tablespoons brown sugar | 2 teaspoons Garlic (chopped) | 200 ml coconut milk (gata) | 3 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 3 tablespoons lemon juice | 3 tablespoons brown sugar | 2 teaspoons Garlic (chopped) | 1 bulb lemongrass (tanglad) (pounded (optional))
instructions: Skewer beef strips and onion wedges onto 16 (5-inch) barbecue sticks, placing 1 onion wedge at the bottom of each stick. Lay sticks on a shallow dish. | Make the marinade: Combine all ingredients in a small bowl. Pour over beef and marinate for at least 30 minutes. | Make the coconut sauce: Combine all ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Mix well and bring to a slow boil. Take off heat, remove lemongrass, and set aside. | Heat vegetable oil in a pan or stovetop grill over high heat. Cook beef skewers for about 1 minute on each side or until desired doneness is achieved. Serve with coconut sauce and garnish with cilantro.
ingredient_names: beef striploin | vegetable oil | cilantro sprig | lemon juice | brown sugar | coconut milk | bulb lemongrass

ingredients: 300 Grams pork (use ground pork) | 2 tablespoons carrot (grated) | 2 tablespoons white onion (chopped) | 2 teaspoons Garlic (minced) | 1 medium Egg | Salt (to taste) | 1 kilo Squid (Pusit) (cleaned, with ink sacs left on) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 2 medium onion | 6 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 3  bay leaf | 1 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup water | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1 teaspoon Salt
instructions: Make the meat stuffing: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Fry 1 teaspoon of stuffing to check seasoning. Adjust as needed. | Stuff each squid with 1 to 2 tablespoons meat stuffing, depending on the size of the squid. Seal the opening with a toothpick. | Heat oil in a pot or wok over medium heat. Saute onions until translucent. Add garlic and bay leaves; saute just until fragrant. Add remaining ingredients and stuffed squid. Cover pot, lower heat, and simmer for 5 to 6 minutes. | Mix well. Simmer for 6 to 10 more minutes or until sauce is reduced to 1/4, making sure the sauce doesn't dry out. Discard bay leaves and remove toothpicks. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: pork | carrot | egg | ink sac | vegetable oil | bay leaf

ingredients: 500 Grams Chicken ((use skinless chicken breast fillet), minced) | 200 Grams Chicken ((use chicken thigh fillet), minced) | 1 teaspoon Garlic (minced) | 1/4 Cup onion (grated) | 1 tablespoon low-sodium soy sauce | 1 1/2 tablespoons muscovado sugar | 3/4 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon Pepper | coconut oil (for brushing)
instructions: Mix well all ingredients except coconut oil. | Scoop out mixture into 2½-inch balls; roll into 3-inch logs. Wrap each in plastic wrap, if needed, to hold shape. Chill for at least 45 minutes. | Heat a pan over high heat. Brush with coconut oil. Pan-fry longganisa until cooked, about 2 minutes on each side.
ingredient_names: chicken | low sodium soy sauce | muscovado sugar | coconut oil

ingredients: 1 thumb-sized piece ginger | 4 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 1 2-inch piece turmeric (luyang dilaw) | 6 stalks lemongrass (tanglad) (white, fleshy part only) | 2 tablespoons sea salt | 1/2 teaspoon Achuete Powder (annatto powder) | 1 1/2 teaspoons black pepper | 2 tablespoons coconut oil (plus extra for brushing) | 1 tablespoon Calamansi Juice | 3 tablespoons pure vinegar (sukang tuba) | 4  Chicken ((use fillets), bone-in, skinless)
instructions: Combine ginger, garlic, turmeric, lemongrass, salt, annatto powder, and pepper in a food processor; whiz into a paste. | Transfer paste to a large bowl. Add coconut oil, calamansi juice, and vinegar; mix well. Marinate chicken in mixture for at least 1 hour in the fridge. | Heat a grill pan. Brush with coconut oil. Remove excess marinade from chicken to prevent it from burning while cooking. Grill chicken over high heat until grill marks appear. Move to the cooler part of the grill; continue cooking for 8 to 10 minutes until cooked through, turning once or twice.
ingredient_names: ginger | 2 turmeric | stalks lemongrass white | sea salt | powder | coconut oil | calamansi juice | pure vinegar | chicken

ingredients: 3 cups violet sticky rice | 2 tablespoons coconut oil | 5 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/2 large white onion (chopped) | 1/4 kilo Beef ((use sirloin cut), sliced into strips and marinated in soy sauce and calamansi for 30 minutes) | 1/4 kilo Chicken ((use fillets), sliced into strips and marinated in soy sauce and calamansi for 30 minutes) | 2 cups squash (kalabasa) (cubed) | 8 dried fresh shiitake mushrooms (rehydrated in hot water and sliced thinly) | 2 tablespoons low-sodium soy sauce | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Wash rice and soak in water for 1 hour. Drain and set aside. | Heat coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant and translucent. | Add beef, chicken, squash, and mushrooms. Add soy sauce and rice. Season with salt and pepper. Add 8 cups water. Cover and simmer, stirring occasionally, until rice is soft and cooked, about 40 minutes. If rice is still tough, add 1 cup water, 1/2 cup at a time, until rice is thoroughly cooked.
ingredient_names: violet sticky rice | coconut oil | soy sauce and calamansi | kalabasa | dried shiitake mushroom | low sodium soy sauce

ingredients: 1 300 gram pack tofu (tokwa) (sliced) | 1/3 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/3 Cup white vinegar | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 2 pieces bay leaf | 1 tablespoon peppercorns | 2 teaspoons brown sugar | 2 tablespoons water (Optional) | 1 to 2 teaspoons Potato starch (diluted in water) | kinchay (parsley) (for garnish)
instructions: Fry the tokwa in oil until light golden brown. Set aside to drain on paper towels. | Place soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, bay leaves, peppercorns and sugar in a saucepan. Place over medium heat and simmer for 1-2 minutes. Adjust seasoning as desired and some water may be added to dilute the sauce a little if needed. Thicken the sauce with potato starch slurry, then pour sauce over tokwa and garnish with kinchay leaves and fried garlic. | Thicken the sauce with potato starch slurry, then pour sauce over tokwa and garnish with kinchay leaves and fried garlic.
ingredient_names: tofu | bay leaf | peppercorn | brown sugar | potato starch | kinchay

ingredients: 1 kilo pork (sliced into 2-inch pieces) | 2 heads Garlic (cloves separated) | Salt (to taste) | 1 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce
instructions: Place pork and garlic in a wok. Season with salt and pepper. | Add 1 cup water, vinegar, and soy sauce. Simmer over low heat until pork is tender and liquid is reduced by half. | Allow pork to render its fat and cook until brown and crisp on the side.
ingredient_names: pork

ingredients: 3 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1  red onion (chopped) | 1 1-inch piece ginger (sliced) | 2 bulbs lemongrass (tanglad) (trimmed and pounded) | 1 teaspoon turmeric (luyang dilaw) (grated) | 500 Grams Beef ((use shin shanks), cubed) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1 tablespoon brown sugar | 10 to 12 cups beef stock | 1 large sweet potato (kamote) (peeled and sliced into 2-inch pieces) | 2  finger chilies (siling pang-sigang) | 1 bundle alugbati (Indian spinach) (leaves only, washed and drained)
instructions: Heat oil in a large, heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat. Saute onions, ginger, and garlic until fragrant but not browned. Add lemongrass, turmeric, and beef. Season with fish sauce and brown sugar. | Add stock. Increase heat to high and bring to a boil. Lower heat, cover, and simmer for about 21/2 to 3 hours or until beef is tender. | Add sweet potatoes and chilies. Simmer for about 15 minutes or until sweet potatoes are cooked. | Add alugbati leaves. Cook until wilted. Adjust seasoning with fish sauce and brown sugar. Transfer to a serving bowl and serve hot.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | 1 ginger | bulbs lemongrass | turmeric | shin shank | brown sugar | beef stock | sweet potato | finger chili | alugbati

recipe_name: Ginisang Sitaw at Kalabasa (Sauteed Green Beans and Squash) Recipe
ingredients: 1 Cup green beans (sitaw) (sliced into 1 1/2-inch strips) | 1 1/2 cups squash (kalabasa) (cut into 1 inch cubes) | 2 tablespoons canola oil | 1 1/2 tablespoons dried shrimp (hibe) | 1 tablespoon white onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 1/4 Cup water | 1/2 teaspoon fish sauce (patis) | Pepper (to taste) | Leeks (for garnish)
instructions: Heat oil over medium heat on a wok and saute hibe, onions, and garlic. | Add the kalabasa and saute for 1 minute. Add water and cover and allow to simmer until kalabasa is cooked, about 5 minutes, more water may be added if necessary. | Once the kalabasa is almost cooked, add the sitaw and season with patis and pepper, cover. Allow to steam for 1-2 minutes, then turn off heat and leave the cover on for another minute to allow the sitaw to cook more.
ingredient_names: sitaw | kalabasa | canola oil | dried shrimp | garnish

ingredients: 1 tablespoon Oil | 1 Small red onion (sliced thinly) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 4 tablespoons fresh ginger (minced) | 1 1/4 kilo Chicken (use breast part) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 7 cups water | 1 Cup rice (uncooked) | Salt (to taste) | 4  Egg ((hardboiled), peeled and halved) | fried garlic bits ((we used 1 head of garlic, peeled and minced)) | 1/4 Cup green onion (chopped) | calamansi (cut into wedges) | fish sauce (patis)
instructions: In a pot over medium heat, heat oil then add onions, ginger and garlic. Saute for 5 minutes or until the onions are translucent. | Add the chicken and cook, stirring constantly, until lightly browned and have rendered juices. Add fish sauce and continue to cook for around 1 to 2 minutes. Remove the chicken and set aside. | Add the 7 cups of water and bring to a boil. Add the rice and let it boil then simmer under medium heat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir occasionally until the rice is softened. | While waiting for the rice to cook and soften, shred the chicken into pieces. Place the shredded chicken back into the pot. Stir and simmer for around 5 minutes. | Ladle onto bowls. Add boiled egg and garnish with green onions and toasted garlic. Serve hot with calamansi and additional fish sauce on the side.
ingredient_names: ginger | breast part | rice | halved | fried garlic | green onion | calamansi

ingredients: 1 clove Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (sliced) | 2 tablespoons Oil | 1 whole Chicken (sliced into 8 pieces) | 2 medium-sized Potatoes (cut into cubes) | 4 cups water | 1 piece chicken bouillon cube
instructions: Saute the garlic and onion in oil then add the chicken and brown for 5 minutes. | Add the potatoes and cook for 2 more minutes. Pour in the water and add the chicken cube. Let it boil then turn down the heat and let it simmer for 30 minutes. | Skim the water of residue from the chicken to make the broth clear. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: whole chicken | potato | chicken bouillon cube

ingredients: 1/4 Cup unsalted butter | 1 large red onion (chopped) | 3 pieces green chili (siling tagalog) (sliced) | 2 teaspoons ginger (minced) | 1 large boneless bangus  (milkfish) ((fried), bones removed and flaked) | 1/2 tablespoon mayonnaise | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1 tablespoon red chili pepper (siling labuyo) ((labuyo or Thai chili, optional))
instructions: Melt butter in a large pan. Add the onion and cook for 3 minutes. Add the green chili and ginger and saute for 2 minutes. | Add the bangus flakes then saute until cooked. | Add the mayonnaise then season with soy sauce, salt, and black pepper. | Transfer to a serving plate. Then top with red chili, if desired.
ingredient_names: butter | green chili | ginger | bangus | mayonnaise | red chili pepper

recipe_name: Ginisang Togue (Sauteed Mung Bean Sprouts) Recipe
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 2 cloves Garlic | 1 medium Onion | 1/4 kilo Pork | 1/4 kilo Monggo Sprouts | 2 tablespoons Fish Sauce (Patis) | Salt
instructions: Saute garlic and onion in oil. Add the ground pork and cook until the meat is cooked through. | Add the monggo sprouts and cook for 5 minutes. Season with fish sauce, salt and pepper.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 Small onion (chopped) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 whole Chicken (cut into 8 pieces) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon sugar | 3/4 Cup Tomato sauce | 1 Cup water | 3 pieces dried bay leaf | 1/4 kilo pig liver | 3 medium Potatoes (sliced into big chunks) | 1 medium carrot (sliced into big chunks) | 1  red bell pepper (sliced) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: In a medium saucepan, heat oil and saute garlic and onion. | Add the chicken. Cook for 5 minutes. | Pour in soy sauce, sugar, tomato sauce and water and then add the bay leaves.
