ingredients: 4 cups water | 3 pieces bay leaf | 3 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1  Chicken | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon Pepper | peanut oil (for frying)
instructions: Fill a pot with water, bay leaves, and fish sauce. Let it simmer for a few minutes then place the spring chicken in the pot. Let it simmer over medium heat for thirty minutes or until the chicken is cooked. | Drain the chicken and cool. | Place the chicken in a tray and let it dry out in the freezer or refrigerator for three hours or overnight. | Fry the chicken in hot oil until golden brown. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: bay leaf | chicken | peanut oil

recipe_name: Ginisang Okra (Sauteed Okra with Pork) Recipe
ingredients: 2 tablespoon Oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium-sized onion (chopped) | 1 medium-sized red tomatoes (chopped) | 1/4 kilo pork (use pork cubes (kasim)) | 1/2 kilo okra (washed and cut 1 inch long) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon Pepper
instructions: Saute the garlic in oil until golden brown. Add the onions and cook until translucent. Then add the tomatoes and pork cubes. Simmer for 10 minutes or until the pork is cooked. | Add the okra and let the mixture simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: red tomato | pork | okra

ingredients: 1 Cup Flour | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | 1/2 teaspoon Pepper | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1 kilo tilapia (use fillet) | peanut oil (for frying) | chili sauce (served on the side (optional))
instructions: Make the coating: Mix the flour, cornstarch, salt and pepper. Set aside. | Dredge the tilapia fillet in the flour mixture. | Fry the fillets one by one in oil until golden brown. Remove from the pan and drain the excess oil using paper towels. | Serve with sweet chili or spicy chili sauce.
ingredient_names: flour | cornstarch | tilapia | peanut oil | chili sauce

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (chopped) | 1 medium red tomatoes (chopped) | 1/4 kilo pork (use pork cubes (kasim)) | 1/2 kilo sitaw (string beans) (washed and cut into 2 inch long pieces) | 1/3 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon Pepper
instructions: Saute the garlic in oil until golden brown. Add the onions and cook until translucent. Then add the tomatoes and pork cubes. Simmer for 10 minutes or until the pork is cooked. | Add the sitaw and the soy sauce and let the mixture simmer for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: red tomato | pork | sitaw

ingredients: 1 can Canned Spicy Tuna Flakes In Oil | 1  onion (sliced)
instructions: In a nonstick wok over medium heat, heat about 3 tablespoons oil from the tuna. Watch out for the splatters. Once splattering stops, saute onions until translucent. Add garlic and cook until softened. Add half the tomatoes and saute until softened. Add tuna flakes and saute. | Add remaining tomatoes, green bell pepper, and tuna chunks and cook only until heated through. Dump in rice and toss until coated with the tuna mixture. Season with salt and ground black pepper to taste, and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: spicy tuna

ingredients: 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/8 Cup white vinegar | 1 teaspoon sugar | 1 teaspoon Garlic (chopped) | 1 piece bay leaf | 1/2 teaspoon peppercorns | 250 Grams pork (use ground pork) | water (as needed) | 1/2 Cup tomatoes (chopped) | 1-2 tablespoons red onion (chopped) | fish sauce (patis) (to taste) | black pepper (to taste) | 1/4 Cup cheese sauce | 1/8 Cup Whole milk | 2 packs (180gram) tortilla chips | green onion (chopped (for garnish))
instructions: Make the ground pork adobo: Combine soy sauce, vinegar, sugar, garlic, bay leaf, and peppercorns in a bowl. Add ground pork and marinate for 10 minutes. Transfer mixture to a pot and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer until pork is tender, about 30 minutes. Add some water to help tenderize pork, if necessary. | Meanwhile, make the salsa: Combine tomatoes, fish sauce, and black pepper, in a bowl. Mix well and season to taste. Store in the chiller until ready to use. | Make the cheese sauce: Combine cheese and milk in a bowl. Mix well. | Assemble the nachos: Arrange tortilla chips on a serving plate. Top with ground pork adobo,salsa, and cheese sauce. Garnish with green onions.
ingredient_names: bay leaf | peppercorn | pork | tomato | cheese sauce | whole milk | tortilla chip | green onion

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 teaspoon Garlic (minced) | 1 medium red onion (diced) | 1 teaspoon peppercorns | 1 kilo Ham Hock (Pata Front) (sliced into 2-inch thick pieces) | 3 cups pineapple juice | 2 cups water | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 3 pieces bay leaf | 3 tablespoons brown sugar | 1 teaspoon Salt
instructions:
Heat oil in a deep pot. Saute garlic and onion until garlic is fragrant and onion is translucent. Add peppercorns; mix well.
 | Add pata; sear on all sides for about 5 minutes. Pour in pineapple juice and water; bring to a boil.
 | Once boiling, add soy sauce and bay leaves. Lower heat, cover, and simmer for 60 to 90 minutes. Add more water, if needed.
 | Add brown sugar, stirring well to combine; season with salt. Allow some of the liquid to evaporate until sauce is thick and fat frompatahas been rendered.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | peppercorn | ham hock | pineapple juice | bay leaf | brown sugar

ingredients: 4 tablespoons olive oil (divided) | 2 pieces white onion (sliced into thin half-moons) | 7-8 cloves Garlic (finely chopped) | 1 can (800-gram) tomatoes (chopped) | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 2 pieces (250-gram) white fish ((use sole fillet), (or fillets of any white-fleshed fish)) | 1/4 Cup mayonnnaise
instructions:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
 | Heat a saucepan or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add 3 tablespoons olive oil. When the oil is hot, add onions and garlic. Saute until the onions are soft and translucent.
 | Add tomatoes and cook until much of the liquid has evaporated, the sauce is thick and pulpy, and the oil has separated from the tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside.
 | Pat fish fillets dry and place them in a baking dish. Drizzle remaining olive oil on top. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon tomato sauce over the fillets until covered. Top with dollops of mayonnaise. Slightly swirl the mayonnaise and tomato sauce together.
 | Bake fish in the preheated oven for 30 minutes or until fish is done. You'll know your fish is done when the flesh flakes easily when pierced with a knife.
ingredient_names: olive oil | thin half moon | tomato | sole fillet | mayonnnaise

ingredients: 2 kilos pork (use kasim) | 3 tablespoons paprika | 1 Table Spoon Garlic powder | 1 Table Spoon brown sugar | 1 Table Spoon ground cinnamon | 2 tablespoons coarse salt | 2 tablespoons french mustard | 2 cups chicken stock | 1 1/2 Cup store-bought barbecue sauce ((we used Hunt's BBQ Sauce)) | 24 - 30 pieces dinner rolls (split in half) | 3/4 Cup mayonnaise | 300 Grams cabbage (shredded) | 3 tablespoons cider vinegar | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | chips (to serve (optional))
instructions: Rub pork shoulder with paprika, garlic powder, brown sugar, cinnamon, salt, and mustard. Place the pork in a large, heavy casserole or Dutch oven, fat side up. Add chicken stock. Cook over low heat, covered, for 4 hours. Increase heat to medium and cook for another 2 hours until pork is fork-tender. | Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Take the meat from the pot and transfer it to an oven-proof dish or roasting pan. Roast in the preheated oven for 45 minutes. | Remove meat from the pan and let it rest for 10 minutes. While still warm, use two forks to shred meat into bite-sized pieces, discarding any large pieces of fat. | Combine shredded pork and barbecue sauce in a saucepan. Cook over medium-high heat until warmed through and dry. Set aside. | Heat buns or rolls in a toaster oven until warmed through. Spread mayonnaise on the insides of the buns. Place a heaping spoonful of pulled pork on the bottom bun. Top with shredded cabbage. Drizzle with a little vinegar and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover with the top bun. Secure sliders with toothpicks. Serve sliders with chips, if desired. *Tip: The shredded pork filling can be prepared 3 days ahead and refrigerated in a covered container, or made 2 weeks ahead and frozen.
ingredient_names: kasim | paprika | table spoon garlic powder | table spoon brown sugar | table spoon cinnamon | coarse salt | french mustard | chicken stock | hunt's bbq sauce | dinner | mayonnaise | cabbage | cider vinegar | chips

recipe_name: Fish Curry with Dried Mango Chutney
ingredients: 1 pack (250gram) dried mangoes (sliced) | 1/2 Cup sugar | 1/4 Cup water | 1 Cup unsalted peanuts | 1 piece red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (sliced (optional)) | 1 Table Spoon vegetable oil | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 2 medium onion (sliced) | 2 cups coconut milk (gata) | 1/2 Cup water | 2 tablespoons curry powder | 500 Grams tulingan (cleaned) | 2 pieces carrot (cut into big cubes) | 3 pieces Potatoes (cut into big cubes)
instructions: Make the dried mango chutney: combine dried mangoes, sugar, and water in a small saucepot. Simmer until sauce is thick. Once cooked, add peanuts and chilies, if using. Set aside. | Heat oil in a wide saucepan. Saute garlic and onions until translucent. | Add coconut milk, water, and curry powder. Simmer for 5 minutes. | Add tulingan, carrots, and potatoes. Simmer for 10 minutes or until potatoes are cooked. Serve warm with dried mango chutney on the side.
ingredient_names: mango | peanut | red chili pepper | table spoon vegetable oil | coconut milk | curry powder | tulingan | big cube

ingredients: 1/2 kilo sashimi-grade tuna | 1 medium red onion (cubed) | 5 pieces finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (sliced) | 1/4 Cup Coconut Palm Vinegar | 1/4 Cup Calamansi Juice | 1 teaspoon brown sugar | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 1 piece red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (chopped)
instructions: Combine tuna, onions, and chilies in a bowl. | Add palm vinegar, calamansi juice, and brown sugar, then season with salt and pepper to taste. add chopped chilies, if using. | Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving.
ingredient_names: sashimi grade tuna | finger chili | coconut palm vinegar | calamansi juice | brown sugar | red chili pepper

ingredients: 600 Grams fresh shiitake mushrooms (chopped into 1/4-inch cubes) | 50 Grams dried shiitake mushrooms (, rehydrated in hot water and chopped into 1/4-inch cubes) | 1 large white onion (finely chopped) | 3 pieces finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (chopped) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 Table Spoon liquid seasoning | Calamansi Juice | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1 teaspoon Pepper | 3 pieces bay leaf | 1/4 Cup Butter | red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (for garnish (optional))
instructions:
Mix fresh and rehydrated mushrooms together in a bowl. Add onions, finger chilies, soy sauce, liquid seasoning, calamansi juice, salt, pepper, and bay leaves. | Melt butter in a pan, then add the mushroom mixture. Stir-fry for about 3 to 5 minutes. Mix well to prevent the small bits from burning.

 | When ready to serve, add the mushroom mixture to a heated sizzling plate. Serve immediately while sizzling. Garnish with bird's eye chilies, if desired.
ingredient_names: shiitake mushroom | finger chili | table spoon liquid | calamansi juice | bay leaf | butter | red chili pepper

ingredients: 1 Table Spoon vegetable oil | 1 Table Spoon Garlic (minced) | 1 large onion (chopped) | 1 Small puso ng saging (banana blossom) | 4 pieces eggplant (sliced) | 1 bundle string beans (sitaw) (cut into 2-inch pieces) | 1/2 Cup Achuete Seeds (annatto seeds) (soaked in 1 cup water) | 1/2 Cup peanut butter | 2 kilos salmon head (cleaned) | 4 cups water | 1 Cup peanuts ((use ground peanuts), peanuts) | 1/2 Cup rice flour | 1 bundle pechay leaves | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 1/2 Cup shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) (to serve) | white rice ((steamed), to serve)
instructions: Heat oil in a large saucepot. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. | Add puso ng saging, eggplant, and string beans. | Strain annatto seeds and discard. add annatto water and peanut butter to the pot. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes. | Add salmon heads, water, ground peanuts, and ground rice. Stir gently and simmer until thick. | Once salmon heads are cooked, add pechay or bok choy. Season to taste. Serve with bagoong and rice.
ingredient_names: table spoon vegetable oil | table spoon garlic | puso ng | eggplant | sitaw | achuete seeds annatto | peanut butter | salmon | peanut | rice flour | pechay leave | white rice

ingredients: 1/4 Cup mayonnaise | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 3 teaspoons liquid seasoning | 250 gram Chicken | 250 Grams Chicken (use fillets) | 1 1/2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 piece red onion (chopped) | 1/2 piece white onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 2 pieces finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (sliced diagonally)
instructions: Make the garlic sauce: Combine 1/4 cup mayonnaise, 3 cloves garlic (chopped), and 3 teaspoons liquid seasoning in a bowl; set aside. | Boil 250 grams chicken thigh fillets and 250 grams chicken breast fillets for 8 to 10 minutes or until meat is half cooked; let cool. | Shred chicken breasts and chop chicken thighs into cubes; combine in a bowl and set aside. | Heat 11/2 tablespoons oil in a pan over medium heat. | Saute 1 red onion (chopped), 1/2 white onion (chopped), and 4 cloves garlic (chopped) until fragrant. | Add 2 finger chilies (sliced diagonally) and cook for 1 minute. | Add chicken and saute until fully cooked. | Add 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 1 tablespoon vinegar, juice from 2 pieces calamansi, and 2 tablespoons garlic sauce. | Mix to combine, remove from heat, and transfer to a bowl. | To serve, warm 6 to 8 tortilla wraps. Top with shredded cabbage or lettuce, chicken sisig, garlic sauce, crushed chicharon, and cilantro leaves; fold tortillas to close. Serve with lime wedges on the side.
ingredient_names: mayonnaise | liquid | chicken | finger chili

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 2 tablespoons ginger (thinly-sliced) | 1 Small red onion (sliced thinly) | 1 Table Spoon Garlic (minced) | 1/4 kilo clams (scrubbed and soaked in water) | 1/4 kilo mussels (scrubbed and soaked in water) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 3 cups water | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1/4 kilo Prawns (Sugpo) | 1 Cup All-purpose cream | 100 Grams sili tops
instructions: Heat a wok or pan over medium heat. Add oil; saute ginger, onions, and garlic until translucent and aromatic. | Add clams and mussels. Stir until shells start to open. Add fish sauce and mix well. | Add water and simmer until clams and mussels have all opened. Discard shells that remain closed. Season with pepper. | Add prawns. Once prawns start to turn pink, add cream and mix. Adjust seasoning to taste. | Add sili tops and serve immediately. | Heat a wok or pan over medium heat. Add oil; saute ginger, onions, and garlic until translucent and aromatic. | Add clams and mussels. Stir until shells start to open. Add fish sauce and mix well. | Add water and simmer until clams and mussels have all opened. Discard shells that remain closed. Season with pepper. | Add prawns. Once prawns start to turn pink, add cream and mix. Adjust seasoning to taste. | Add sili tops and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | ginger | table spoon garlic | clam | mussel | prawn | all purpose cream | chili top

ingredients: 1 300-gram lapu-lapu (scaled and gutted) | 2 large banana leaf ((about 20x25 inches), ribs removed, cleaned, and passed over a hot flame) | 1 stalk Leeks (sliced into 2-inch pieces, divided) | 100 Grams ginger (sliced, divided) | 1 Small red onion (sliced, divided) | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce ((we used Kikkoman)) | 3 tablespoons sesame oil (plus more for drizzling) | cilantro sprigs (for garnish (optional))
instructions:
Clean the fish thoroughly under water. Score the fish by making 3 diagonal slices on the thickest part of the lapu-lapu. Place the fish on top of washed banana leaves. | Stuff fish with half the ginger, leeks, and red onions. Place a slice of ginger on the scored parts of the fish. Scatter remaining aromatics on top. Season with salt and pepper. | Drizzle soy sauce and sesame oil all over the fish. | Place another banana leaf on top, and wrap the fish securely using banana leaf strips or cooking twine. You can wrap the fish in another layer of banana leaves to make sure the juices will not spill during the cooking process. | Place fish in a steamer on top of a wok filled with boiling water. Steam for about 15 to 20 minutes. | Remove some of the banana leaves and reserve the juices from the fish. Transfer banana leaves and fish to a serving platter. Drizzle sesame oil and reserved juices all over the fish. Garnish with more leeks, chopped onions, and cilantro, if desired. Serve withsteamed rice on the side.

Tips:Cooking for two? usefish filletsinstead. Wrap each fillet in banana leaves and steam for 8 to 10 minutes until cooked through.
ingredient_names: 300 lapu | over a hot flame | leek | ginger | sesame oil | cilantro sprig

ingredients: 1/2 kilo mussels (scrubbed and debearded) | 1/2 Cup Butter (divided) | 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour | 1 Cup milk | 1 Cup malunggay leaves (moringa) | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 2 Table Spoon Garlic (minced) | 1 Cup quick- melting cheese
instructions: Steam mussels in a pot filled with water until shells open. Drain and set aside to cool. Once cool enough to handle, remove the other half of the shell and discard. Arrange on a baking tray and set aside.  | Make the topping: Melt 1/4 cup butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and whisk for about 3 minutes or until flour is cooked through and mixture turns golden brown. Slowly add milk, continuing to whisk to prevent lumps. Season with salt and pepper. | Gently fold malunggay leaves into the mixture. Set aside and let cool. | In another pot, melt 1/4 cup butter and saute garlic until fragrant. Set aside. | Spoon malunggay sauce on top of each mussel. Add grated cheese and drizzle garlic butter on top. | Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until cheese is bubbly and golden brown.
ingredient_names: mussel | butter | all purpose flour | milk | malunggay | table spoon garlic | quick melting cheese

ingredients: 500 Grams Squid (Pusit) ((around 10 to 12 pieces), cleaned and tentacles reserved) | lemon juice | vegetable oil (for frying) | Squid (Pusit) | 500 Grams Scad (Galunggong) (fried and flaked) | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/2 medium onion (minced) | 1 medium tomatoes (diced) | 1/2 Cup malunggay leaves (moringa) (blanched) | 1/4 Cup malunggay seeds (scraped from pods (optional)) | lemon juice | 1 Table Spoon Soy Sauce | 1 large Egg | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste)
instructions: Combine squid and lemon juice in a bowl. set aside. | Make the stuffing: heat oil in a skillet. Fry squid tentacles until opaque and cooked through. remove from heat. Mince tentacles and set aside. Let cool. | In a bowl, combine squid tentacles, flaked galunggong meat, garlic, onions, tomatoes, malunggay, lemon juice, soy sauce, egg, salt, and pepper. | Spoon mixture into squid, making sure not to add too much. secure ends with toothpicks. | Using a grill pan over medium heat, grill squid for about 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Slice into rings before serving, if preferred.
ingredient_names: tentacle | lemon juice | vegetable oil | squid | scad | tomato | malunggay | malunggay seed | table spoon soy sauce | egg

ingredients: 2 tablespoons fennel seeds | 1 tablespoon pink peppercorns | 1-2 tablespoons red pepper flakes | 1 tablespoon basil leaves (minced) | 1 tablespoon rosemary leaves (minced) | 1 head Garlic (minced) | 2 kilos pork (use boneless pork belly) | 750 Grams pork ((use pork loin), trimmed to fit inside pork belly) | Salt (to season)
instructions:
Toast fennel seeds, pink peppercorns, and red pepper flakes in a dry frying pan over low heat. Grind toasted spices in a coffee grinder or pound using a mortar and pestle. Transfer to a small bowl. Add sage or basil, rosemary, and garlic. Set aside.
 | Poke the skin of the pork belly all over using a paring knife. Turn it over and score the flesh in a diamond pattern. Liberally rub the belly and pork loin with salt. Rub both belly and loin with the prepared spice mixture. | Place the pork loin in the center of the belly. Roll the belly and secure tightly with kitchen twine. Wrap with foil or plastic wrap and leave in the refrigerator overnight.
 | Preheat oven at 300 degrees. Remove foil or plastic wrap. Place pork on a wire rack set on a baking sheet or roasting pan. Roast for about 1 1/2 hours or until the internal temperature of the roast registers 150 degrees on a meat thermometer.
 | Increase heat to 500 degrees and continue roasting until skin is crisp and blistered, about 20 more minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes at room temperature before slicing.
ingredient_names: fennel seed | pink peppercorn | red pepper flake | basil leave | rosemary | pork | inside pork belly | season

ingredients: 1 Table Spoon vegetable oil | 1  onion (chopped) | 1 40-gram pack tamarind base powder (sinigang mix) | 1 Cup water | 4 tablespoons sugar | 2  onion (chopped) | 5  red tomatoes (chopped) | 2 tablespoons ginger (minced) | Salt | 1 kilo tilapia (cleaned) | 2 pieces calamansi (juiced) | 2 stalks lemongrass (tanglad) (smashed) | atsara
instructions:
Make the tamarind sauce: heat oil in a saucepot and saute onions until fragrant. In a bowl, combine sinigang mix and water; mix until dissolved. Pour mixture into the pot. Add sugar; mix well. Simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until reduced by half. Set aside. | Combine onions, tomatoes, and ginger in a bowl. Season with salt and pepper.
  | Season tilapia with calamansi, salt, and pepper. Stuff with the onion-tomato mixture and lemongrass.
  | Wrap fish in foil. Grill over hot coals until cooked, about 10 minutes, depending on the size of the fish. Serve with tamarind sauce and atsara on the side.
ingredient_names: table spoon vegetable oil | 40 tamarind base powder | red tomato | ginger | tilapia | calamansi | stalks lemongrass | atsara

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 3-4  red chili pepper (siling labuyo) | 1 kilo Shrimp (peeled and deveined) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 1 tablespoon Thai soy sauce | 1/4 Cup cashew nuts (roasted) | 1/2 Cup Thai basil leaves (divided) | 1 medium carrot (julienned)
instructions: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Saute garlic and chilies until fragrant. Add shrimp. Season with Thai fish sauce and soy sauce. Add cashews and half of the basil; mix well. Adjust seasoning as necessary. | Make the dressing: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Mix well and season to taste.3 Combine carrots, remaining basil, and dressing; mix well. Toss with shrimp mixture.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | red chili pepper | shrimp | thai soy sauce | cashew nuts | thai basil leave | carrot

ingredients: 400 Grams Beef (use tenderloin) | 3 tablespoons tamarind concentrate | 4 teaspoons fish sauce (patis) | 2 teaspoons brown sugar | 1-2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1  white onion (sliced) | 3 stalks lemongrass (tanglad) (sliced diagonally) | 2  green finger chili (siling pangsigang) (sliced diagonally) | 3  kaffir lime leaf (each leaf sliced diagonally into four)
instructions:
Slice beef tenderloin across the grain into 1/2-inch strips. | In a bowl, mix together tamarind concentrate, patis, and brown sugar. Add sliced beef, turn to coat evenly, and marinate for 30 minutes. | Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok orfrying panover high heat. When the oil is hot, drain beef from marinade and lay the strips in the hot oil. set aside marinade. Fry beef just until done, flipping to cook both sides. Remove from pan and set aside. This should happen fairly quickly, 2 to 3 minutes. Do not overcook the meat or it will get tough.
 | Bring the pan back to high heat. Add more oil if it has become dry. When hot, add onions, lemongrass, and chilies. Saute until onions are soft and translucent. Add remaining marinade and saute further until marinade bubbles up rapidly (to make sure it is completely cooked). Add kaffir lime leaves and beef to the pan and toss until beef is just heated through. Remove from heat and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: tenderloin | tamarind concentrate | brown sugar | vegetable oil | stalks lemongrass | green finger chili | kaffir lime leaf

ingredients: 1 kilo Beef (use shank with bone marrow) | Oil (for sauteing) | 1  onion (quartered) | 1 Cup Leeks (sliced) | 10 cloves Garlic (smashed) | 4 stalks lemongrass (tanglad) (smashed) | 1 (1-inch) piece ginger (peeled) | 2 ears fresh sweet corn (sliced into 2 cobs) | 1 Cup Fresh Bamboo Shoots | 1  beef bouillon cube | 1  Potatoes (peeled and sliced in half) | 2 bunches pechay leaves | 1  cabbage (quartered) | Salt (to taste) | Soy Sauce (to serve)
instructions: Boil the beef shank in a pot of water for 5 minutes. Skim off any impurities that rise to the surface. Strain and set beef aside. | Heat oil and saute onions, leeks, garlic, lemongrass, and ginger in a pot over medium heat. | Add the beef shanks and enough water to cover. Add corn and bamboo shoots, if using. | Simmer for 2 to 3 hours or until the beef is tender. | When beef is tender, strain broth into a bowl. Discard grit accumulated in the strainer. Return the clear broth to the pot and add beef bouillon cube (if using), potato, pechay, and cabbage. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Season with salt and pepper. | Serve hot with a dipping sauce of soy sauce,siling labuyo,andcalamansi.
ingredient_names: bone marrow | leek | stalks lemongrass | ginger | sweet corn | bamboo | beef bouillon cube | potato | pechay leave | cabbage

ingredients: 4 tablespoons Butter (divided) | 1 Small onion (finely chopped) | 1 250-gram can button mushrooms (sliced and liquid reserved) | 2 tablespoons all-purpose flour | 1 Cup canned chicken stock | 3 tablespoons heavy cream | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | sea salt (to taste) | 1 (500-gram) pack deboned and unseasoned baby daing na bangus | 1/4 Cup all-purpose flour | 3 tablespoons vegetable oil | 3 tablespoons store-bought toasted garlic chips
instructions: Melt 2 tablespoons butter in a small saucepan. Add chopped onions and sliced mushrooms; cook for 5 minutes. | Stir in flour. Slowly pour in stock and reserved liquid (from canned mushrooms) while stirring continuously. Simmer for 5 minutes. | Add cream and soy sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and keep warm over very low heat. | Lightly seasonbanguswith salt and pepper. Coat each piece in flour. | Heat oil in a frying pan. Frybangusin batches over high heat until crisp. set aside. | Brush sizzling plate with oil and remaining butter. Preheat over a hot flame for about 2 to 3 minutes. | Once very hot, place friedbanguson the sizzling plate and pour mushroom sauce over. Top with garlic chips. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: butter | button mushroom | all purpose flour | chicken stock | heavy cream | sea salt | na bangus | vegetable oil | garlic chip

ingredients: 2  Egg | 3/4 Cup Whole milk | 1/2 Cup water | 2 tablespoons Butter (melted) | 1 Cup all-purpose flour | 1 pinch Salt | 2 tablespoons green onion (chopped) | vegetable oil (for frying) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 Small onion (thinly sliced) | 1 clove Garlic (crushed) | 1 Cup pork (use ground pork) | 4 tablespoons Shrimp (peeled and chopped) | 1/4 kilo coconut palm (ubod) (shredded and placed in a bowl of water until ready to cook) | Salt (to taste) | 2 cups chicken stock | 2 teaspoons sugar (or to taste) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon Salt (or to taste) | 1 tablespoon cornstarch (dissolved in 3 tablespoons cold water) | 6-8  lettuce leaves | 12 stalks green onion | store-bought toasted garlic chips | roasted peanuts (crushed)
instructions:
Make the green onionlumpiawrappers: whisk eggs in a medium bowl. Mix in milk, water, and melted butter. Add flour and salt; mix until smooth. Mix in green onions. | Lightly brush a frying pan with oil. heat on low to medium heat. Pour in 1/8 cup batter to make a thin wrapper. Tilt and rotate pan to spread the batter evenly. Let cook until set, about 1 to 2 minutes. Do not flip and do not allow the wrapper to brown. Repeat to make a total of 6 to 8 wrappers. Set aside. | Make theubodfilling: heat oil in a frying pan. Saute onions until translucent. Add garlic; saute until fragrant.
 | Add pork and saute until fat has been rendered. Add shrimp and cook until it turns pink. | Drainubodand add to the pan. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Cover and simmer until tender, about 2 minutes. Drain, cool, and set aside. | Make the sauce: Place stock or water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Add sugar, soy sauce, and salt. Add dissolved cornstarch and whisk until integrated. Simmer, stirring for 2 to 3 minutes, until the sauce thickens. Set aside.
 | To assemble, place alumpiawrapper on a plate or chopping board. Arrange a lettuce leaf on the center of the wrapper. Top with 2 green onion stalks. Add a few tablespoons ofubodfilling. Fold sides in and roll tightly. Drizzle sauce over thelumpiaor serve sauce on the side. Sprinkle with toasted garlic chips and crushed peanuts.
ingredient_names: egg | whole milk | butter | all purpose flour | green onion | vegetable oil | pork | shrimp | coconut palm | chicken stock | cornstarch | lettuce leave | garlic chip | peanut

ingredients: 4 large eggs | Salt | 2 large eggplant | 3 tablespoons vegetable oil (divided) | 1 medium Potatoes (peeled and cubed) | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/2 Cup smoked bangus (tinapang bangus) (flaked) | 1/2 teaspoon Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon Vinegar | Salt | 2 ripe native tomatoes (chopped) | 1  Salted Egg (itlog na maalat) (chopped) | 1 stalk green onion (cut into 1-inch pieces)
instructions: Make the grilled eggplant: Lightly beat eggs, then season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Divide among two small bowls. | Grill eggplants over an open flame until skin is charred. Set aside and let cool. | Once cooled, peel off skin but retain the crown and stem. Place grilled eggplants on a large plate, then flatten using a fork. Pour half the beaten egg mixture over the flattened eggplants and soak for about 8 to 10 minutes. Set aside. | Make the smoked bangus stuffing: heat 1 tablespoon oil in a frying pan. Add potatoes and cook halfway through. | Add garlic and onions; stir-fry for about 2 to 3 minutes. Add smokedbangusflakes, soy sauce, and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cook over low-medium heat until potatoes are tender. Transfer mixture to a bowl; set aside and let cool. | Once cooled, pour remaining beaten egg over smokedbangusmixture. Mix well. | Heat remaining oil in a large pan. Place soaked eggplants (together with the eggs) in the pan, then pour the smokedbangusmixture (together with the eggs) on top. Fry until the underside is golden, then flip to cook the other side. Drain on paper towels. | Garnish each eggplant with tomatoes, salted egg, and green onions.
ingredient_names: egg | eggplant | vegetable oil | potato | bangus | native tomato | green onion

ingredients: 1 kilo Beef (use ribs) | 1 stalk baby leeks (sliced) | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 4 cups beef stock | 1/3 Cup brown sugar | 4 tablespoons sesame oil | 4 tablespoons sesame seeds (toasted) | 1 piece star anise | 1 whole Garlic (minced) | 1  red onion (minced) | 1 teaspoon Cayenne pepper | fish sauce (patis) (to season) | black pepper | spring onions (to garnish) | chilies (siling labuyo) (sliced (optional))
instructions: Saute garlic then add onions and cook until translucent. | Add and brown the beef. | Pour in the soy sauce then add the beef stock just enough to cover the beef. If 4 cups is not enough, add water. | Add the star anise and brown sugar. Bring to a boil and simmer for 45 minutes or until beef is really tender. | Add sesame oil, sesame seeds, leeks, cayenne pepper. Simmer for additional 5 minutes. | Flavor with fish sauce and season with black pepper. Garnish with spring onions.
ingredient_names: beef | baby leek | beef stock | brown sugar | sesame oil | sesame seed | star anise | whole garlic | cayenne pepper | green onion | chily

ingredients: 1 kilo Beef (use ground beef) | 1 tablespoon Salt | 1 tablespoon black pepper | 1 large Egg | 1/2 Cup all-purpose flour
instructions: Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl. | Form into 3-inch-wide, 1/2-inch-thick patties and keep refrigerated for 20 minutes to 1 hour. | Pan-fry or grill burgers for about five to seven minutes or until cooked through.
ingredient_names: beef | egg | all purpose flour

recipe_name: Grilled Stuffed Squid with Eggplant Salsa
ingredients: 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/2 kilo Beef (use ground beef) | 1/2 Cup dried shrimp (hibe) (crushed) | 1/4 Cup raisins | Salt (to season) | 4 large pieces Squid (Pusit) (cleaned with head, tentacles, and skin removed) | 2 1/2 tablespoons olive oil | 2  yellow onion (chopped) | 2 medium eggplant (peeled, grilled, and chopped) | 1/2 Cup kesong puti (white cheese) (cubed) | 2 tablespoons balsamic vinegar | Salt (to taste)
instructions:
Heat olive oil in a medium pan. Saute garlic, followed by ground beef. Add crushed dried shrimps and raisins. Season to taste. When beef is cooked, transfer to a bowl and set aside to cool. | When cool enough to handle, scoop spoonfuls of stuffing and place inside squid until almost full. Secure ends with a toothpick. Brush squid with olive oil and season. | Preheat a charcoal grill. Place squid on the grill and cook until opaque throughout and slightly golden, about 2 to3minutes on each side. Transfer to a plate and carefully remove the toothpicks.

 | Make the grilled eggplant salsa: Heat oil in a frying pan. Saute onions until slightly golden. Place in a bowl together with grilled eggplants and kesong puti. Drizzle with reduced balsamic vinegar and toss. Season to taste with salt and pepper. | Serve grilled squid with eggplant salsa.

TIP: To make reduced balsamic vinegar, heat four times the amount needed in a pan. Bring to a boil, then simmer until the mixture thickens and becomes syrupy. Do this in a well-ventilated kitchen as the vinegar fumes tend to be strong.
ingredient_names: extra virgin olive oil | beef | shrimp | raisin | season | tentacle | olive oil | eggplant | kesong puti | balsamic vinegar

ingredients: 1 275-gram can sardines in tomato sauce | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 2 tablespoons onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon ginger (minced) | 1/2 Cup tomatoes (chopped) | Salt (to season) | 1 teaspoon paprika | 2 cups short-grain rice (washed 5 times and drained for 10 minutes) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 3 cups vegetable stock | 1/2 Cup green peas | 1/4 Cup bell pepper | 2  Egg (hard-boiled, shelled, and sliced into rounds) | 3  calamansi (sliced in half)
instructions: Drain tomato sauce from the sardines; set both aside. | Heat oil in a paellera or a wide, shallow pan. Saute garlic, onions, ginger, and tomatoes until fragrant; season with salt and pepper. Add paprika. | Add rice and toast until every grain is coated in oil. Once rice is toasted, add soy sauce and tomato sauce from the sardines; mix until well combined. | Add stock and let it boil until rice grains rise to the top. | Lower heat. Arrange green peas, bell peppers, and sardines on top. | Cover with a lid or foil and cook until all the liquid is absorbed, about 10 to 15 minutes. Turn off heat and let it sit for another 5 minutes. | Top with hard-boiled eggs and serve withcalamansi.
ingredient_names: tomato sauce | vegetable oil | ginger | tomato | season | paprika | short grain rice | vegetable stock | green pea | bell pepper | rounds | calamansi

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (diced) | 1 kilo Chicken (use bone-in chicken thighs) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 200-gram pack Tomato sauce | 2 tablespoons sugar | 1/2 teaspoon five-spice powder | 4 pieces star anise | 2 cups water | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
instructions:
Heat the cooking oil in a cooking pot. Saute garlic and onion until browned. | Add the chicken thighs and cook until browned. | Pour the soy sauce and tomato sauce, while stirring constantly. Add the 5-spice powder, star anise, and sugar. | Add 1 to 2 cups of water and let it boil over low heat for about 30 minutes or until the sauce thickens. | Season with salt and ground black pepper. Serve with warm rice.

TIP: Do you have a lot of packets of ketchup from fastfood take-outs? You can use this to replace the tomato sauce in this recipe.
ingredient_names: bone in chicken thigh | 200 tomato sauce | powder | star anise

ingredients: 2 cups shrimp stock | fish sauce (patis) (to taste) | 2 tablespoons Achuete Powder (annatto powder) | 3 tablespoons cornstarch (diluted in water) | 20 Grams spring onions (divided into two) | 250 Grams smoked fish (tinapa) | 1/4 kilo Shrimp (boiled and peeled) | cooking oil (for frying) | 15 Grams vermicelli (sotanghon) noodles | 1-2  Egg (soft-boiled)
instructions:
Make thepalaboksauce: boil shrimp stock, add fish sauce and anato oil. After a minute, add cornstarch and half of the chopped spring onions. Cook for 2 minutes then turn off heat. | Remove skin and bones of smoked fish (tinapa) and shred to pieces. Set aside. | Fry vermicelli noodles in cooking oil until crispy then immediately remove from the pan (will take just a few seconds to cook). Place crispy vermicelli in a large serving container.
 | Top vermicelli with smoked fish, soft boiled egg and sprinkle with remaining spring onions. | Pour thepalaboksauce on top of the vermicelli just before serving.
ingredient_names: shrimp stock | powder | cornstarch | fish | shrimp | vermicelli noodle | egg

ingredients: 1 kilo pork (use pork knuckle (front part)) | 50 Grams star anise | 10 pieces dried bay leaf | 10 Grams black peppercorns | Salt (to taste) | cooking oil (for deep-frying) | 1/2 Cup mayonnaise | 3 tablespoons liquid seasoning | Pepper (to taste) | Garlic (chopped and fried to a crisp) | 2 medium white onion (finely chopped) | 1  red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (chopped (optional))
instructions: Prepare the pork knuckles: Put all ingredients in a pot and boil until for two hours or until meat is tender. | Remove from heat, cool down and keep in the freezer for 5 hours (this process guarantees that the pork knuckle is crispy outside and juicy inside when deep-fried). | In a deep cooking pan or pot, heat enough cooking oil to cover the whole pork knuckle when frying. Once the oil is very hot, immerse and cook the frozen pork knuckle until golden brown, then remove and let it rest for 5 minutes. | Remove the crispy pata meat from the bone and chop into bite size portions. Set aside. | In a bowl, mix the chopped meat together with the mayonnaise, liquid seasoning, ground pepper, garlic, onions, and red pepper (if using). | Serve on a sizzling plate.
ingredient_names: pork knuckle | anise | dried bay leaf | black peppercorn | deep frying | mayonnaise | liquid | a crisp | red chili pepper

recipe_name: Pork Stew in Aligue and Gata
ingredients: 6 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 3 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 Small onion (sliced) | 500 Grams pork ((use pork kasim), sliced into strips) | 5 native tomatoes (each sliced into 8 pieces) | 3  green finger chili (siling pangsigang) (sliced diagonally) | 1/2 Cup crab fat (aligue) | 2 cups water | 1 Cup coconut milk (gata) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1 tablespoon sugar | 1 teaspoon Calamansi Juice | rice ((steamed), to serve)
instructions: Saute garlic in vegetable oil until fragrant. Add onion and cook until softened. | Add pork kasim strips and cook until brown on all sides. | Add tomatoes and chilies; cook for 2 minutes. Add crab fat; stir-fry for 1 minute. | Add water, coconut milk, fish sauce, sugar, and calamansi juice. Simmer until meat is tender, about 20 minutes. Serve with steamed rice.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | pork kasim | native tomato | green finger chili | crab fat | coconut milk | calamansi juice | rice

ingredients: vegetable oil | 1 medium white onion (chopped) | 5 cloves Garlic (chopped finely) | 30 Grams ginger (peeled and sliced) | 2-3 tablespoons bagoong alamang | 4-5  green finger chili (siling pangsigang) (sliced on the diagonal, plus more for garnish) | 300 Grams Chicken (sliced into chunks) | 1 250-ml can coconut milk (gata)
instructions: Heat a wok over medium-high heat. Add a couple of swirls of oil. When oil is hot, add onions, garlic, and ginger. Saute until onions are soft, translucent, and fragrant. | Addbagoongand chilies to the pan. Saute for about 2 to 3 minutes to allow the flavors to blend. | Add chicken to the pan and fry until seared, about 1 to 2 minutes. | Add coconut milk and simmer for 20 to 30 minutes or until chicken is tender and sauce is thick. Adjust seasoning, if needed, by adding a little morebagoong. Garnish with sliced chilies, if desired.TIP: Instead of chicken, try fish or shrimp if you want a seafood version, or vegetables if you want a vegetarian option. Don't forget to adjust the cooking time accordingly.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | ginger | shrimp paste shrimp paste | green finger chili | chicken | milk

ingredients: 350 Grams Beef ((use sirloin cut), sliced into 1-inch cubes) | 2 1/2 tablespoons dark soy sauce | 1 tablespoon dark soy sauce | 1 tablespoon Calamansi Juice | 2 teaspoons Garlic (minced) | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 200 Grams Indian mango (peeled) | 200 Grams green mango ((use overripe green mango), peeled) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 2 tablespoons green onion (chopped) | 2 tablespoons cilantro (wansoy) (chopped) | 2 tablespoons peanuts (chopped coarsely) | 2 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil | Toasted garlic (for topping) | rice ((steamed), to serve)
instructions:
Make thebistek: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Marinate in the refrigerator for 1 hour. | Make the ensaladangmangga: shred mangoes into thin strips. Place in a bowl and mix with the rest of the ingredients. Taste to adjust seasoning.
 | Heat oil in a frying pan. Fry beef in batches with the marinade until beef is cooked through. Transfer to a serving platter and top with toasted garlic. Serve bistek with ensaladangmangga and steamed rice.
ingredient_names: sirloin | dark soy sauce | calamansi juice | indian mango | overripe green mango | green onion | cilantro | peanut | vegetable oil | rice

ingredients: 1/2 Cup Tomato sauce | 1 85-gram can liver spread | 1/2 Cup water | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 5 tablespoons coconut oil (divided) | 1 medium red onion (minced) | 1 medium red bell pepper (minced) | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 800 Grams Beef (use ground beef) | 1 tablespoon tomato paste | 1  red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (minced (optional)) | 1/4 Cup green peas | 1/2 Cup quick-melting cheese (grated) | 40  gyoza wrappers | microgreens (for garnish (optional))
instructions:
Prepare the kaldereta sauce: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Set aside. | Make the filling: heat 2 tablespoons coconut oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Saute onion and bell pepper for 2 minutes. Add garlic and continue to stir for another minute. Add ground beef; saute until brown. Add tomato paste; stir. Mix in kaldereta sauce; simmer for 10 minutes over low heat. Add chili (if using), green peas, and cheese. Simmer for another 5 minutes.
 | Pour cooked beef mixture into a bowl through a sieve, separating sauce and beef. Skim off excess fat from sauce. Allow beef to cool and keep sauce warm.
 | Make the gyoza: have a small bowl of cold water ready. Lay a wrapper on a dry work surface. Spoon 1 1/2 tablespoons filling on the middle of the wrapper. Wet the edges of the wrapper with water using a pastry brush or your fingers. Fold gyoza in half and crimp to seal the edges. Chill for 15 minutes.
 | Bring water seasoned with salt to a full boil in a saucepot. There should be enough water to cover the gyoza. At the same time, heat 3 tablespoons coconut oil in a nonstick pan. | Drop gyoza in boiling water and let cook for 2 minutes or until they start to float to the surface. Remove from pot and drain excess water.
 | Immediately transfer cooked dumplings to hot pan and fry only the flat side for at least 90 seconds or until the bottom of the dumplings become crisp and golden. Serve with kaldereta sauce and garnish with microgreens, if desired.
ingredient_names: tomato sauce | liver | coconut oil | bell pepper | beef | tomato paste | red chili pepper | green pea | quick melting cheese | gyoza wrapper | garnish

recipe_name: Lechon Manok with Grilled Corn Salad
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 1 tablespoon ginger (minced) | 2 tablespoons bottled tamarind paste | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon Pepper | 1  Chicken ((use whole chicken), cleaned) | 4  Lemongrass Bulb (Tanglad) (pounded) | 2  white onion (sliced in half) | 6 cloves Garlic (smashed) | 1 330-ml can clear soda | 4 ears Japanese corn | 2 medium bell pepper | 2 medium white onion | 1/4 Cup water | 1/2 Cup cilantro (wansoy) (chopped) | 2 tablespoons lime juice | 2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil | Salt (to taste) | lettuce leaves
instructions:
Make the lechonmanok: Combine garlic,ginger, tamarind, salt, and pepper. Pound to a paste using a mortar and pestle.
 | Rub paste all over chicken. Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 hours. | Stuff chicken with lemongrass, onions, and garlic. Tie legs with kitchen twine. Place chicken on a roasting pan. Pour soda over chicken. Roast chicken in a turbo broiler or in an oven preheated to 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until cooked through.
 | Meanwhile, make the grilled corn salad: Preheat a charcoal or stovetop grill. Grill corn, bell peppers, and onions. Baste corn with seasoned water to keep it from drying out. Grill vegetables until tender and slightly charred. | Dice bell peppers and chop onions. Remove kernels from cobs.
 | Mix together corn, bell peppers, onions, cilantro, lime juice, and olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Transfer corn salad to a shallow serving bowl lined with lettuce leaves. | Slice chicken meat from bone and slice into strips. Top salad with roasted chicken slices. Serve warm or at room temperature.
ingredient_names: ginger | bottled tamarind paste | whole chicken | lemongrass bulb | soda | japanese corn | bell pepper | cilantro | lime juice | extra virgin olive oil | lettuce leave

ingredients: 1 Cup cane vinegar | 1/3 Cup brown sugar | 2 teaspoons Salt | 1/4 Cup red onion (chopped) | 2 tablespoons ginger (chopped) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 1 1/2 tablespoons calamansi concentrate | 500 Grams Chicken (use boneless chicken breast with skin on) | 3/4 Cup lechon sauce | 1 85-gram can liver spread | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 1/2 teaspoon Pepper | Achuete Oil (annatto oil) (for basting) | 8  Flour tortillas (warmed) | 1 medium Cucumber (sliced into 3-inch sticks) | 1 stalk Leeks (chopped)
instructions:
Make the marinade: Combine all ingredients in a blender. Process until smooth. | Pour marinade over chicken. Cover and marinate in the refrigerator for 3 hours.
 | Make the sauce: place all ingredients in a blender. Process until smooth. set aside. | Preheat a charcoal grill. Drain chicken from marinade. Grill chicken until cooked through, about 10 to 12 minutes per side, while basting once in a while with atsuete oil. Remove from grill and slice into 3-inch strips.
 | To assemble, place 2 to 3 strips of chicken on a tortilla. Top with 2 cucumber sticks and some leeks. Drizzle with prepared sauce. Fold sides and roll to wrap the filling. Serve with extra sauce on the side.
TIP: To make atsuete oil, heat 1/3 cup vegetable oil in a small frying pan until very hot. Turn off heat and add 1 tablespoon atsuete seeds. Let sit until oil turns orange. Strain seeds and let oil cool.
ingredient_names: cane vinegar | brown sugar | ginger | calamansi concentrate | chicken | lechon sauce | liver | flour tortilla | cucumber | leek

ingredients: 4 cups shrimp stock | 1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 tablespoon ginger (minced) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1 tablespoon green onion (chopped) | 5 pieces kamias (sliced into rounds) | 100 Grams Patola (Chinese Okra) (sliced into rounds) | 100 Grams Shrimp (shelled and deveined with heads and tails left on) | 100 Grams mussels (cleaned and beards removed) | 100 Grams clams (cleaned) | 100 Grams squid rings | 500 Grams dried misua noodles | Salt (to taste)
instructions:
Heat seafood or shrimp stock in a saucepot. Set aside. | Heat oil in a medium pot. Saute ginger, garlic, and green onions until fragrant.
 | Add hot stock, kamias, and patola; bring to a boil.
 | Add all seafood and simmer for about 8 minutes or until shrimp turns pink, squid turns white, and mussels and clams open. Discard any shells that remain closed. | Turn off heat and add misua noodles. Allow noodles to soften. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: shrimp stock | vegetable oil | ginger | green onion | kamias | patola | and tail | mussel | clam | squid ring | misua noodle

ingredients: 2 120-gram packs ready-made ramen noodles | 5 pieces longganisa ((we used Vigan Longganisa), chopped into medium-sized bits) | 2 cloves Garlic (sliced into slivers) | 1/4 Cup Cherry tomatoes (halved) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 1/4 Cup dashi | 2 eggs Egg (cooked sunny side-up) | 3 tablespoons Pickled Watermelon Rind | Togerashi (Japanese Chili Powder)  (for garnish)
instructions: Heat noodles in boiling salted water for 2 minutes. Drain noodles and set aside. Reserve 2 tablespoons of ramen water. | Cooklongganisawith ramen water in a pan over medium heat, allowinglongganisato render its fat untillongganisastarts to become crispy. Lower heat; add garlic and cherry tomatoes. Cook for 5 minutes. | Add cooked ramen noodles. Season with soy sauce,calamansior yuzu juice, and dashi. Increase heat to medium and allow noodles to absorb some of the sauce. | Divide noodles between 2 bowls. Top each bowl with an egg and pickled watermelon rind, if using. Sprinkle togerashi and green onions on top.
ingredient_names: ramen noodle | vigan longganisa | sliver | cherry tomato | calamansi juice | dashi | eggs egg | watermelon rind | togerashi

ingredients: 300 Grams Beef ((use sirloin cut), sliced into 1-inch cubes) | 1 240-ml can pineapple juice | 1/4 Cup vegetable oil (divided) | 1 medium Potatoes (peeled and sliced into 1-inch cubes) | 1 large carrot (peeled and sliced into 1-inch cubes) | 1/2 Cup white onion (chopped) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 1 Cup beef stock | 4  dried bay leaf | 2 380-ml cans Tomato sauce | 1 140-gram can liver spread | 1 large red bell pepper (cored and sliced into strips) | 1 large green bell pepper (cored and sliced into strips) | Salt (to taste) | 500 Grams short-grain rice | 2 1/2 cups chicken stock | 1/4 Cup ginger (sliced) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 4  Lemongrass Bulb (Tanglad) (smashed) | Salt (to taste) | Toasted garlic (for topping)
instructions:
Make the beef kaldereta: Combine beef and pineapple juice in a bowl. Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or overnight. | Heat 2 tablespoons oil in a large pot. Fry potatoes and carrots until light brown. Transfer to a bowl and set aside.
  | Add remaining oil to the same pot and saute onions until translucent. Add garlic and saute until fragrant.
  | Drain meat and discard marinade. Add beef to the pot and cook until light brown, about 5 minutes. Add beef stock and bay leaves. Cover the pot and cook for 30 minutes over medium heat or until beef is tender. Add water in the middle of cooking if the sauce is too dry. | Add tomato sauce, liver spread, and bell peppers. Simmer for 6 minutes. | Add fried potatoes and carrots; continue to simmer for 8 minutes or until sauce thickens. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside and keep warm. | Make the arroz caldo: place all ingredients in a medium pot. Let cook over medium heat until rice becomes soft and mushy. Season with salt and pepper.
  | Fill bowls with arroz caldo and top with beef kaldereta. Sprinkle tops with toasted garlic, green onions, and leeks, if desired.
TIP: To make your own chicken stock, heat oil in a large pot. Saute ginger, garlic, and leeks. Add chicken bones and cook until brown. Add 4 cups water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 1 hour. Strain and discard bones and vegetables.
ingredient_names: sirloin | juice | vegetable oil | potato | 1 cube | beef stock | dried bay leaf | 380 tomato sauce | liver | bell pepper | grain rice | chicken stock | ginger | lemongrass bulb

ingredients: 1  pork (cleaned and stray hairs removed) | 1 250-ml bottle clear soda | 3  bay leaf | 5 cloves Garlic (smashed) | 1 tablespoon sea salt (for seasoning) | 1 teaspoon peppercorns | Garlic powder (to season) | vegetable oil (for shallow-frying) | 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce (or to taste) | 1 teaspoon sugar | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 1 tablespoon red onion (chopped) | 1  red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (chopped)
instructions:
Make 3 deep slits on pork. Place pork in a deep casserole, together with soda, bay leaves, garlic, 1 tablespoon salt, and black peppercorns. Fill with water to cover pork. Bring to a boil then reduce to a simmer. Cook for 1 hour or until pork is fork tender.
 | Remove pork from casserole and discard water. Let pork cool on a wire rack. | Dry pork thoroughly with paper towels. Season generously with salt and garlic powder. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap and freeze overnight.
 | When ready to cook, heat oil in a deep, heavy-bottomed pot until oil registers 350 degrees on a thermometer. Carefully place frozen pork in pot. Cover pot with a lid or splatter guard (the oil will bubble and splatter). Fry 1 side for 10 minutes or until golden and crisp. | Meanwhile, make the dipping sauce: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Stir until sugar dissolves. Taste to adjust seasoning.
 | Carefully turn pork to cook the other side. Cover pot and fry for another 10 minutes or until golden and crisp. | Drain crispy pata on paper towels to remove excess oil. Transfer to a platter and serve whole or remove crispypatafrom the bone and slice into 2-inch pieces. Serve immediately with dipping sauce on the side.
ingredient_names: stray hair | 250 bottle clear soda | bay leaf | sea salt | peppercorn | garlic powder | shallow frying | red chili pepper

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (chopped) | 1/4 kilo Shrimp (shelled and chopped) | 1 medium carrot (sliced into strips) | 3/4 Cup Baguio beans (abitsuelas) (chopped) | 1 1/2 cups togue (bean sprouts) | 200 Grams firm tofu (tokwa) (chopped and fried) | 1/4 Cup cilantro (wansoy) ((leaves), chopped) | 1 1/2 cups young coconut (buko) (strips) | 20 pieces lumpia wrapper
instructions: Heat oil in a pan. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. | Add shrimp; cook until pink. Add carrots, chopped Baguio beans, and togue; cook for 2 minutes. | Add fried tofu, cilantro leaves, and coconut strips; mix until well combined and season with salt. | Remove from heat. Place a lumpia wrapper on a clean surface and top with about 1/4 cup filling. Roll, seal edges, and deep-fry until golden.
ingredient_names: shrimp | carrot | baguio bean | togue | tofu | cilantro | young coconut | lumpia wrapper

recipe_name: Lechon Kawali Binagoongan sa Gata Recipe
ingredients: 1 kilo pork (sliced into 2inch pieces) | 1 tablespoon salt | corn oil (for deep-frying) | 2 tablespoons corn oil | 1 medium red onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon garlic (minced) | 5  native tomatoes (chopped) | 1/2 cup shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) | 1/2 cup pork stock | 3 tablespoons cane vinegar | 2 medium eggplant (sliced into 2inch lengths) | 1/2 cup coconut cream (kakang gata) | 1  green finger chili (siling pangsigang) | black pepper (to taste)
instructions:
Make thelechon kawali: Place pork belly and salt in a large stockpot. Fill with water, enough to submerge pork. Bring to a boil then lower to a simmer. Simmer for 1 hour or until pork is fork tender. Remove pork from liquid and pat dry. Reserve 1/2 cup pork stock. | Make thebinagoongansauce: Heat oil in a wok. Saute onions and garlic until fragrant over medium heat. Add tomatoes and saute until soft. Add shrimp paste and cook for 1 minute.
 | Add pork stock and vinegar. Cook, without stirring, over medium heat for 5 minutes or until the acidity of the vinegar has evaporated (sauce should no longer be overpoweringly sour). | Add eggplants, coconut cream, and chili. Simmer until mixture is thick, about 8 minutes. Season with pepper. | Heat oil in a heavy bottomed pot. Deep-fry pork belly in batches until golden and crispy. Drain on paper towels to remove excess oil. | To serve, place half of the sauce on a serving platter. Arrangelechonkawali on top. Pour in remaining sauce.
ingredient_names: 2inch | deep frying | corn oil | native tomato | pork stock | cane vinegar | 2 length | coconut cream | green finger chili

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 Small onion (chopped) | 1 kilo pork | 1/4 kilo pork liver | 1 large Potatoes (diced) | 1 medium carrot (diced) | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon white sugar | 1 Cup Tomato sauce | 1 Cup water | Salt (to taste)
instructions:
Heat oil in a pan. Saute garlic and onion. | Add the pork. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes, then add the pork liver.
 | Pour in tomato sauce, sugar, soy sauce and water. Let it simmer for 30 minutes to an hour or until meat is tender. Add water as necessary. | Add the potatoes and carrots. Season with salt and pepper. Let it simmer again for 5 to 10 minutes.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | pork | pork liver | potato | carrot | tomato sauce

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 10 bulbs onion (sliced) | 1 kilo Beef ((use brisket or mechado cut), cubed) | 2 cups Tomato sauce | 1 Cup water | 1 large Potatoes (cubed) | 1 large carrot (cubed) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | Salt (to taste)
instructions:
Heat cooking oil in a pan then saute the garlic and onions. | Add the beef and saute for about 3 minutes or until color turns light brown. | Add the tomato sauce and water then simmer until the meat is tender. Add water as needed. | Add the soy sauce, ground black pepper, and salt then simmer until excess liquid evaporates.
 | Add the potatoes and carrots then cook until the potatoes are tender (about 15 to 25 minutes).
ingredient_names: bulbs onion | brisket | tomato sauce | potato | carrot

ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1 large onion (chopped) | 1 Small puso ng saging (banana blossom) | 4  eggplant (sliced) | 1 bundle string beans (sitaw) (cut into 2-inch pieces) | 1/2 Cup Achuete Seeds (annatto seeds) (soaked in 1 cup water) | 1/2 Cup peanut butter | 1 1/2 kilos ox tripe (washed with salt and boiled) | 4 cups water | 1 Cup peanuts | 1/2 Cup rice ((ground), toasted) | 1 bundle pechay leaves | Salt (to taste) | 1/2 Cup shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) (to serve)
instructions: Heat oil in a large saucepot. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. | Add banana blossom, eggplants, and string beans. | Strain annatto seeds and discard. Add annatto water and peanut butter to the pot. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes. | Add ox tripe, water, ground peanuts, and ground rice. Stir gently and simmer until sauce thickens. | Add pechay or bok choy. Season to taste. Serve with bagoong and rice.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | puso ng | eggplant | sitaw | achuete seeds annatto | peanut butter | ox tripe | peanut | rice | pechay leave

ingredients: 1 Cup canned pineapples (crushed) | 1  red bell pepper (seeded and diced) | Salt (to taste) | 1 Cup all-purpose flour | 1 medium Egg (beaten) | 1 Cup Japanese breadcrumbs (Panko) | 1 kilo lapu-lapu ((use fillet), cleaned and sliced) | vegetable oil (for pan-frying) | white rice ((steamed), to serve)
instructions:
Make the pineapple-pepper relish: combine crushed pineapples (including juices) and red bell peppers in a bowl. Season with salt. Transfer to a covered container and chill in the refrigerator until ready to use.
  | Prepare the breading by putting all-purpose flour, egg, and breadcrumbs in separate bowls. Dip a fish fillet in egg, dredge in flour, dip again in egg, and coat with Japanese breadcrumbs. Repeat with remaining fillets.
  | Heat oil for pan-frying. Fry lapu -lapu fillets by batches until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve on top of rice and with chilled pineapple-pepper relish.
ingredient_names: pineapple | bell pepper | all purpose flour | egg | japanese breadcrumb | lapu | vegetable oil | white rice

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 2 tablespoons ginger (minced) | 2 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1 medium onion (minced) | 1 kilo Beef ((use brisket), cut into cubes) | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1/4 Cup sugar | 4 cups water | 1 piece beef cube | 2 pieces star anise | 3 tablespoons green onion (finely chopped) | Salt
instructions: In a pot, saute garlic and ginger until brown. Add the onions and cook until translucent. | Stir in the beef and cook for 5 minutes. | Add water, soy sauce, sugar, star anise, beef cube and bring to boil. Let it simmer for about 20 minutes on low heat or until meat is tender. | Season with salt and pepper. Let it simmer again until the sauce thickens. | Garnish with scallions. Serve atop a bowl of hot rice, if preferred.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | ginger | brisket | beef cube | star anise | green onion

ingredients: 1 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons sesame oil | 1 teaspoon chili bean paste | 3 tablespoons brown sugar | 1/8 teaspoon black pepper | 400 Grams pork ((use pork loin), sliced thinly into strips) | 3 tablespoons peanut oil | 3 cloves Garlic (sliced) | 1 1/4-inch piece ginger (cut into thin strips) | 1 Small red bell pepper (cut into strips) | 1 Small green bell pepper (cut into strips) | 1/4  yellow bell pepper (cut into strips) | 1/2  eggplant (cut into strips and deep-fried) | 1/4 Cup water | 1 teaspoon Knorr SavorRich Pork | roasted sesame seeds (for garnish (optional)) | green onion (for garnish)
instructions: Combine soy sauce, sesame oil, chili bean paste, brown sugar, and black pepper in a small bowl. Add pork and mix well. Marinate for 10 to 15 minutes. | Heat peanut oil in a wok. Saute garlic and ginger until fragrant. Add marinated pork and stir-fry until opaque. Add bell peppers, eggplant, and water, Knorr Savorrich pork; simmer for a few seconds until cooked. Transfer to a plate. | Garnish with sesame seeds and chopped green onions.
ingredient_names: sesame oil | chili bean paste | brown sugar | pork | peanut oil | ginger | bell pepper | eggplant | garnish | green onion

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 2 pieces onion (chopped) | 1 kilo pork (cut into cubes) | 2 medium Potatoes (cubed) | 1 big carrot (cubed) | 3 pieces Hotdog (sliced diagonally) | 1 Pack Tomato sauce | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1 Cup pork broth | 1-2 Cups water | 1 medium red bell pepper (sliced) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat the cooking oil in a pan and saute the garlic and onions until browned. | Add the pork and saute until the pork is browned on all sides. | Pour the pork broth, water, and tomato sauce. Stir and simmer until the pork is tender (around 30 to 40 minutes). | Add the potatoes, hotdogs, and carrots and cook for 5 to 8 minutes. | Add the bell peppers and cook for 3 minutes. | Season with salt and pepper to taste.
ingredient_names: cubes | potato | big carrot | hotdog | tomato sauce | pork broth | bell pepper

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 5 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 large onion (chopped) | 1 kilo Beef ((use brisket), sliced into chunks) | 1 200-gram pack Tomato sauce | 3 pieces dried bay leaf | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 3-5 pieces star anise | 3 medium bell pepper (sliced thinly) | 1 Cup water | Salt (to taste)
instructions: In a pre-heated pot with oil, saute the garlic until brown then add the onions and cook for 3 to 5 minutes. | Add the beef and cook until all sides of the meat are brown. | Once the meat is browned, add the tomato sauce, soy sauce, bay leaves, and star anise and simmer for 10 minutes. | Add water to make the meat tender and season with salt and pepper. | Once the meat is tender and the sauce is thick (approximately cooking it for 30-40 minutes), add the bell peppers and cook for another 10 minutes.
ingredient_names: brisket | 200 tomato sauce | dried bay leaf | star anise | bell pepper

ingredients: 3 tablespoons canola oil (for sauteeing) | 1 clove Garlic (crushed) | 1/2 tablespoon peppercorns (cracked) | 1 whole Chicken (cut into pieces) | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | water (to cover meat)
instructions: In a medium-sized pot with preheated oil, saute garlic and black peppercorns until brown. | Add the chicken pieces andsear until the chicken skin is browned. | Pour in the vinegar, soy sauce, and water. Simmer until oil is expressed from the chicken. Serve warm.
ingredient_names: canola oil | peppercorn | whole chicken

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1  onion (chopped) | 3  tomatoes (diced) | 500 Grams Beef (use ground beef) | 1 Cup water | 1 200-gram pack Tomato sauce | 1 cups Potatoes (diced) | 1 medium carrot (diced) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Saute onions, garlic and tomatoes. Add ground beef and cook until brown. | Add tomato sauce and water. Add potatoes and carrots and bring to a simmer until vegetables are cooked. | Season with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | tomato | beef | 200 tomato sauce | potato | carrot

ingredients: 1 whole Chicken (cut into 12 to 15 pieces) | 2/3 Cup Vinegar | 1/2 Cup brown sugar | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 pieces bay leaf | 1 tablespoon peppercorns (whole) | 1 1/2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 2-3 cups water | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste)
instructions:
Combine all ingredients except the water in a deep casserole. Marinate for 30 minutes to 1 hour. | Add water and mix thoroughly. Let mixture boil for 10 to 15 minutes. Remove the impurities that form on the surface.
 | Simmer for 30 to 45 minutes more or until chicken is tender. Season to taste with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: whole chicken | brown sugar | bay leaf | peppercorn

recipe_name: Tilapia Fingers with Green Mango Sauce
ingredients: 1 Cup green mango (pureed) | 1/2 Cup brown sugar | 1 Cup water | 1 tablespoon ginger (grated) | 1  onion (julienned) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | Pepper | 2 tablespoons Butter | 5  tilapia ((use fillets), cut into strips) | 1/4 teaspoon Pepper | 3/4 Cup all-purpose flour | Toasted garlic
instructions: Make the green mango sauce: Put all ingredients in a saucepot and allow to simmer for 5 minutes. Set aside. | Season tilapia fillets with salt and pepper and dredge in flour. Deep-fry until golden brown. | Serve tilapia fingers with green mango sauce as dip or poured over fillets and topped with cilantro and toasted garlic, if desired.
ingredient_names: green mango | brown sugar | ginger | butter | tilapia | all purpose flour

ingredients: 1 head Garlic (minced) | 1/2 tablespoon Achuete Powder (annatto powder) | 2 tablespoons ginger (chopped) | 2 tablespoons brown sugar | 1/3 Cup coconut vinegar | 3 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 2 stalks lemongrass (tanglad) (trimmed and chopped finely) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon Pepper | 1 kilogram Chicken ((use wings), with a slit on each piece) | 2 tablespoons margarine | 2 tablespoons Achuete Oil (annatto oil) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1 Cup sweetened calamansi concentrate | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon Calamansi Juice | 3 tablespoons cornstarch | 1 tablespoon water
instructions: Combine garlic, annatto powder, ginger, brown sugar, coconut vinegar, calamansi juice, lemongrass, salt, and pepper in a bowl. | Add chicken wings. Marinate in an airtight container overnight in the refrigerator. | Combine margarine, annatto oil, and salt in a bowl; mix well. | Heat a grill pan; add chicken, basting with margarine mixture. Cook chicken until done, about 25 to 30 minutes. | Make the toyomansi glaze: Simmer calamansi concentrate, soy sauce, and calamansi juice in a saucepan. Thicken with cornstarch dissolved in water. | Drizzle over chicken and serve with atsuete oil.
ingredient_names: powder | ginger | brown sugar | coconut vinegar | calamansi juice | stalks lemongrass | chicken | margarine | calamansi concentrate | cornstarch

recipe_name: Fideos Negra with Grilled Prawns Recipe
ingredients: 12  Prawns (Sugpo) (peeled and deveined with tails left on) | 1 1/2 teaspoons paprika (divided) | Salt (to season) | 3 tablespoons olive oil (divided) | 1 medium red onion (minced) | 1 clove Garlic (minced) | 1 Cup pimiento strips | 1/4 Cup dry white wine | 2 tablespoons squid ink | 3 to 4 cups vegetable stock | 230 Grams angel hair spaghetti (uncooked and cut into 3-inch lengths) | lemon (to serve) | 12  Prawns (Sugpo) (peeled and deveined with tails left on) | 1 1/2 teaspoons paprika (divided) | Salt (to season) | 3 tablespoons olive oil (divided) | 1 medium red onion (minced) | 1 clove Garlic (minced) | 1 Cup pimiento strips | 1/4 Cup dry white wine | 2 tablespoons squid ink | 3 to 4 cups vegetable stock | 230 Grams angel hair spaghetti (uncooked and cut into 3-inch lengths) | lemon (to serve) | 12  Prawns (Sugpo) (peeled and deveined with tails left on) | 1 1/2 teaspoons paprika (divided) | Salt (to season) | 3 tablespoons olive oil (divided) | 1 medium red onion (minced) | 1 clove Garlic (minced) | 1 Cup pimiento strips | 1/4 Cup dry white wine | 2 tablespoons squid ink | 3 to 4 cups vegetable stock | 230 Grams angel hair spaghetti (uncooked and cut into 3-inch lengths) | lemon (to serve) | 12  Prawns (Sugpo) (peeled and deveined with tails left on) | 1 1/2 teaspoons paprika (divided) | Salt (to season) | 3 tablespoons olive oil (divided) | 1 medium red onion (minced) | 1 clove Garlic (minced) | 1 Cup pimiento strips | 1/4 Cup dry white wine | 2 tablespoons squid ink | 3 to 4 cups vegetable stock | 230 Grams angel hair spaghetti (uncooked and cut into 3-inch lengths) | lemon (to serve)
instructions: Season prawns with 1/2 teaspoon paprika, salt, and pepper. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and toss to combine. Grill on a charcoal grill or grill pan until half-cooked, about 2 minutes. Set aside. | Preheat oven to 350 degrees. | Heat remaining olive oil in a paellera over low heat. Saute onions for 2 minutes. Add garlic, pimiento, and remaining paprika. Saute until fragrant. Add white wine and cook for 2 minutes. Add squid ink and stir. Add 3 cups stock and bring to a simmer. Season with salt. Add pasta and cook for 2 minutes. Add more stock if pasta is dry. Add prawns on top. | Bake in the preheated oven for 5 minutes or until pasta is completely cooked. Serve with grilled lemons for drizzling. | Season prawns with 1/2 teaspoon paprika, salt, and pepper. Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and toss to combine. Saute onions for 2 minutes. Add garlic, pimiento, and remaining paprika. Saute until fragrant. Add white wine and cook for 2 minutes. Add squid ink and stir. Add 3 cups stock and bring to a simmer. Saute onions for 2 minutes. Add garlic, pimiento, and remaining paprika. Saute until fragrant. Add white wine and cook for 2 minutes. Add squid ink and stir. Add 3 cups stock and bring to a simmer. Serve with grilled lemons for drizzling.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Flour | 1/4 Cup carrot (grated) | Salt | 1  Egg | 1 Table Spoon Oil | 4 pieces Hamburger Bun | 1 Small Iceberg lettuce | 3 large tomatoes (sliced) | 4 slices Cheese
instructions: In a bowl, combine ground chicken, flour, grated carrots, salt and pepper, and egg. Mix well. Form into 1?2-inch thick patties. | Heat nonstick pan and drizzle 1?2 tablespoon oil. Pan-fry chicken patties for 5 to 7 minutes, then flip and cook for another 3 minutes. | Slice burger buns and assemble your burger in this order: bread, lettuce leaf, chicken patty, sliced tomatoes, cheese, and bread.
ingredient_names: flour | carrot | egg | table spoon oil | hamburger bun | iceberg lettuce | tomato | cheese

ingredients: 1/4 Cup extra virgin olive oil | 2 whole heads Garlic (unpeeled and sliced in half crosswise)
instructions: Heat olive oil in a pan over medium heat. Saute garlic until fragrant. | Add chicken, bay leaves, peppercorns, balsamic vinegar, and dried rosemary. Bring to a boil. | Add soy sauce and white wine. Once boiling, lower heat and simmer for 40 to 45 minutes or until chicken is tender and cooked through.
ingredient_names: extra virgin olive oil | whole garlic

recipe_name: Kinamatisang Buto-buto (Pork Bones and Tomato Stew) Recipe
ingredients: 3 to 5 tablespoons vegetable oil | 750 Grams tomatoes (diced) | 250 Grams white onion (diced) | 2 to 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1 kilogram pork (use pork ribs (buto-buto)) | 1  Daikon (Korean Radish) (sliced into 2/3-inch-thick pieces) | 1 1/2 liters water | 2 to 3 bunches pechay leaves | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 3 to 5 tablespoons vegetable oil | 750 Grams tomatoes (diced) | 250 Grams white onion (diced) | 2 to 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1 kilogram pork (use pork ribs (buto-buto)) | 1  Daikon (Korean Radish) (sliced into 2/3-inch-thick pieces) | 1 1/2 liters water | 2 to 3 bunches pechay leaves | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis)
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a stockpot over medium heat. Saute tomatoes, onions, and garlic just until everything is tender; do not allow to brown. Add salt. | Add pork ribs and cook until no trace of blood remains, about 3 to 5 minutes. | Add radish and cook for 2 minutes. | Add water and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes or until meat is tender. Uncover and simmer for 5 more minutes. | Add pechay or bok choy, and season with fish sauce. Serve hot. | Heat vegetable oil in a stockpot over medium heat. Saute tomatoes, onions, and garlic just until everything is tender; do not allow to brown. Add salt. | Add pork ribs and cook until no trace of blood remains, about 3 to 5 minutes. | Add radish and cook for 2 minutes. | Add water and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer, covered, for 15 minutes or until meat is tender. Uncover and simmer for 5 more minutes. | Add pechay or bok choy, and season with fish sauce. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | tomato | pork | 2 3 thick | pechay leave

ingredients: cooking oil (for sauteing) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 2 medium onion (1 minced, and the other quartered) | 1 1-inch piece ginger (sliced and pounded) | 1 1.2 kilogram Chicken (cut into serving pieces) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 2 medium coconut (buko) (juice reserved and meat scraped) | 1 cube chicken bouillon cube | 1 Cup All-purpose cream | 1 stalk lemongrass (tanglad) (chopped, plus extra for garnish) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a casserole over medium heat. Saute garlic, onions, and ginger. | Add chicken and fish sauce; stir. Pour in fresh coconut juice and bring to a boil. | Add bouillon cube, all-purpose cream, chopped lemongrass, and coconut meat. Boil for another 10 minutes. | Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with lemongrass and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: onion 1 | 1 ginger | chicken | coconut | chicken bouillon cube | all purpose cream | lemongrass

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Butter | 2 cups leftover chicken (flaked) | 6 to 8 pieces Cherry tomatoes (halved) | 8 to 10 pieces canned whole mushrooms (sliced) | 1 Cup leftover adobo sauce | 1 1/2 cups heavy cream | Salt | 400 Grams linguine noodles (cooked) | 100 Grams queso de bola (grated) | 100 Grams kesong puti (white cheese) (chopped roughly) | fresh basil leaves (for garnish (optional))
instructions: Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add adobo flakes, tomatoes, and mushrooms. Stir-fry until meat is slightly crisp, about 5 to 8 minutes. | Add adobo sauce, cream, salt, and pepper. Lower heat and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes. | Toss cooked pasta into the sauce. Mix for 2 minutes. | Divide pasta among serving bowls. Top with cheeses and garnish with basil, if desired. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: butter | leftover chicken | cherry tomato | whole mushroom | leftover adobo sauce | heavy cream | linguine noodle | queso | kesong puti | garnish

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 3 cloves Garlic (sliced) | 1 medium sized onion (sliced) | 1 kilo heart of palm (lumpiang ubod) (julienned and blanched) | 2 medium-sized carrot (julienned) | Salt (to taste) | 1 piece chicken bouillon cube (Optional) | 25 pieces spring roll (lumpia) wrappers | 3 tablespoons cornstarch | 2 tablespoons water | Oil (for frying) | Vinegar (for dipping (optional))
instructions: Preheat oil in a wok and saute the garlic and onion until transparent. | Add the ubod and the carrots and saute for 5 minutes. | Season with salt and pepper or if you wish, add one chicken bouillon cube for added flavor. Set aside and let it cool. | On a plate, place the spring roll wrapper and scoop two tablespoons of the ubod and carrots mixture onto the wrapper. Fold the sides and roll until it reaches the end of the spring roll. Mix the cornstarch and water to make a paste. Use it to seal the edge of the wrapper. Repeat the process until you use up all the ubod mixture. | Heat oil in a pan or wok, about 2 to 3 inches deep. Fry each ubod roll for 3 to 5 minutes or until golden brown. Serve immediately with vinegar dipping sauce.
ingredient_names: heart palm | carrot | chicken bouillon cube | spring roll wrapper | cornstarch

ingredients: 1/2 kilo pork (use ground pork) | 1 Small onion (minced) | 1  Egg | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 1/8 Cup all-purpose flour | 2 tablespoon Oil (for frying meatballs) | 2 tablespoons Oil | 6 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 3 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 5 cups water | 1 medium Patola (Chinese Okra) (sliced) | 1 250-gram pack misua (fine rice noodles)
instructions: Make the meatballs: In a large mixing bowl, combine the ground pork, half of the onion, egg, salt, ground black pepper, and flour. Mix thoroughly until all the ingredients are well incorporated. Set aside. | Preheat oil in a medium-sized pan and fry each meatball until cooked. Set aside. | Heat cooking oil in a medium-sized pot and saute the garlic and remaining onions. Season with fish sauce and cook for a minute. Pour-in water and let boil. | Add the patola and cook for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the misua noodles and cooked meatballs and simmer for 1 to 2 minutes or until noodles are cooked. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: pork | egg | all purpose flour | meatball | patola | 250 misua

ingredients: 6 tablespoons all-purpose flour | 1 1/2 Cup cornstarch | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon peppercorns | 1 large Egg | 1 3/4 Cup water | 2 cups mung bean sprouts (togue) | 1 1/2 cups dried shrimp (hibe) | 2 cups cooking oil (for frying)
instructions:
In a bowl, combine flour, cornstarch, salt, pepper, egg and water. Beat with a whisk or fork until ingredients form a smooth batter. | Add shrimps and bean sprouts and mix thoroughly. | In a deep frying pan, heat cooking oil.
 | Using a ladle, slowly drizzle the mixture onto the pan until it forms a round disk. Cook each side for 3 to 5 minutes or until golden brown and crispy. Repeat process until you finish cooking the shrimp batter.
