ingredient_names: all purpose flour | cornstarch | peppercorn | egg | mung bean sprout | dried shrimp

ingredients: 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1 medium-sized onion (chopped finely) | 1 tablespoon cooking oil | 1 kilo pork ((use pork belly or pork loin), cut into cubes) | 1 Cup water | 1 Cup Vinegar | 1 kilo pork blood | Salt (to taste) | 2 tablespoons brown sugar | 2 pieces long green chilies (siling pangsigang)
instructions: Saute the garlic and onion in pre-heated oil until translucent. | Add the pork and cook until some of the fat from the pork has rendered. | Add water, vinegar and the pork blood. Simmer until thick or for 30 minutes. | Season the pork dinuguan with salt and pepper then add some sugar and the long green peppers. Let it simmer over low flame for 15 minutes. Serve warm.
ingredient_names: pork | pork blood | brown sugar | long green chily

ingredients: 3 pieces boneless bangus (milkfish) (butterflied with skin-on) | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon black pepper (freshly ground) | 4 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 4 tablespoons cooking oil
instructions: Marinate the boneless bangus in vinegar, salt, black pepper and crushed garlic for about an hour or overnight. | Heat oil in a medium-sized frying pan. Pan-fry the fish, skin side first for 4 to 5 minutes before turning the milkfish on the other side. Fry the other side for 4 to 5 minutes. Serve warm.
ingredient_names: bangus

recipe_name: Puso ng Saging Sa Gata Recipe
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (sliced) | 1 1-inch piece ginger (sliced) | 2 pieces puso ng saging (banana blossom) (sliced into strips) | 1 400-ml can coconut milk (gata) | Salt (to taste) | 2 to 3 pieces finger chilies (siling pang-sigang) (Optional)
instructions: Heat oil in a medium-sized pan and saute garlic, onion and ginger. | Add the puso ng saging and coconut milk. Let it simmer for 10 minutes. | Season with salt and pepper. Allow to simmer again for 10 minutes until the coconut milk is reduced by half. | Add chillies before serving, if using.
ingredient_names: 1 ginger | puso ng | milk | finger chili

recipe_name: Ginataang Tilapia Recipe (Fish Cooked in Coconut Milk)
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (sliced) | 1 1-inch knob ginger (sliced) | 3 to 4 pieces tilapia | 1 400-ml can coconut milk (gata) | 1 teaspoon fish sauce (patis) | 2 to 3 pieces finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (Optional) | 2 to 3 pieces red chilies | Salt (to taste)
instructions:
Heat oil in a medium-sized pan and saute garlic, onion and ginger. | Add the tilapia and coconut milk. Let it simmer for 10 minutes. | Add fish sauce and adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Let is simmer again for 10 minutes.
 | Add chillies before serving.
ingredient_names: 1 knob ginger | tilapia | milk | finger chili | red chily

ingredients: 2 to 3 cups water (with 1 teaspoon salt`) | 2 tablespoons Oil | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (chopped) | 1/2 kilo Beef (use ground beef) | 2 medium pieces ampalaya (bitter melon) (sliced) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | Salt (to season)
instructions: Soak ampalaya in water with 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside. | Heat oil in a medium-sized frying pan. Saute garlic and onion in oil. Cook until onions are translucent. | Add the ground beef and cook until meat turns brown, around 5 minutes. | Season with soy sauce and salt and pepper. Drain the ampalaya from the water and add into sauteed vegetables and cook for 5 more minutes.
ingredient_names: beef | ampalaya | season

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 8 pieces Shrimp | 2 pieces Squid (Pusit) (cleaned and sliced into rings) | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 1 teaspoon dark soy sauce | 2 teaspoons Palm sugar | green onion (chopped, to serve) | 3 tablespoons vegetable oil (divided) | 1 tablespoon Thai shrimp paste | 3 cups rice ((cooked), cooled) | 2 cloves Garlic (sliced) | 1 teaspoon fish sauce (patis) | Salt (to season)
instructions: Heat oil in a saucepan over high heat. Add shrimp, squid, garlic, fish sauce, dark and sweet soy sauces, and palm sugar; mix well. Bring to a boil then simmer. Cook until dry. | Meanwhile make the fried rice: Combine 1 tablespoon vegetable oil, shrimp paste, and rice; mix until grains are coated well. Heat remaining vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium heat and fry garlic. Stir in rice. Add sugar and fish sauce; mix well. Season with salt and pepper; transfer to a serving dish. | Top fried rice with seafood and sprinkle with green onions, cilantro, green mango, egg, and chili. Serve with lime wedges on the side.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | shrimp | squid | dark soy sauce | palm sugar | green onion | thai shrimp paste | rice | season

ingredients: 2 to 3 tablespoons Oil | 1 kilo pork (cut into 1-inch cubes) | 1 clove Garlic (minced) | 2 teaspoons black pepper | 1 medium onion (chopped) | 2 Small tomatoes (sliced) | 1/4 Cup shrimp paste (bagoong alamang) | 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 2 cups water | 3 tablespoons sugar (to taste) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat oil in a medium-sized pan. Render the fat from the pork belly, saute until a bit browned. | Add garlic, black pepper and onion saute for 5 minutes then add the tomatoes. | Pour in the shrimp paste and saute for 5 minutes. | Add the vinegar and let it simmer for 5 minutes. | Add water and let it boil until the liquid has decreased by half. Check for the tenderness of the pork. | Add sugar and adjust seasoning (if needed) and let it simmer again for 5 minutes. Best served warm with rice.
ingredient_names: 1 cube | tomato

ingredients: 1/4 kilo Chicken (use breast part) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 5 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (chopped) | 1 medium carrot (julliened) | 1 medium Baguio pechay (sliced) | 5 cups chicken stock | 1/2 kilo egg noodles (pancit canton) | Salt (to taste) | Egg ((boiled), sliced for garnish)
instructions: Boil the chicken until tender or for 30 minutes. Skim the stock from impurities to create a clear stock. | Remove the chicken from the stock and remove from the bones and shred. | Saute garlic and onion, add the vegetables and chicken. Pour in the chicken stock then let it boil. | Add the egg noodles and cook for 10 minutes. Season, if needed. | Ladle the soup and noodles in a bowl then garnish with boiled eggs.
ingredient_names: breast part | vegetable oil | carrot | baguio pechay | chicken stock | egg noodle | garnish

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 5 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1  onion (crushed) | 1/4 kilogram pork (sliced thinly) | 3 pieces chayote (peeled, seed removed, and sliced) | 1 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: Heat the cooking oil in a pan. Saute the garlic and onion. | Add pork and then cook for 6 to 8 minutes. | Add the chayote. Stir. Cover. Let simmer for 7 to 10 minutes. | Add salt and ground black pepper, to season. Stir and simmer for 5 more minutes. Serve.
ingredient_names: pork | chayote

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 2 tablespoons white onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 1 1/2 tablespoons ginger (minced) | 1 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 250 Grams bamboo shoots (julienned, boiled until tender, and drained) | 1 can canned coconut cream | 12 pieces Prawns (Sugpo) | Salt (to taste) | 1 bunch malunggay leaves (moringa) (leaves picked) | finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (sliced, for garnish (optional)) | rice ((steamed), to serve (optional))
instructions: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Saute onions, garlic, and ginger. Add fish sauce and bring to a boil. | Add bamboo shoots; saute for 2 minutes. Add coconut cream; bring to a simmer. Add prawns; simmer until prawns are cooked. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Add malunggay; simmer until malunggay is cooked, about 3 to 4 minutes. | Garnish with finger chilies and serve with steamed rice, if desired.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | ginger | bamboo | coconut cream | prawn | malunggay | finger chili | rice

ingredients: 1/4 Cup vegetable oil | 1/2 kilogram pork (cut into thin strips) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1  onion (chopped) | 1  carrot (sliced) | 1/2 Cup red bell pepper (chopped) | 15 to 20 pieces snow peas (sitsaro) (trimmed) | 1  sayote (chayote) (sliced) | 1  cabbage (sliced) | 1 can baby corn (drained) | 1  cauliflower (sliced) | 1 to 1 1/2 Cup chicken broth | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | 2 tablespoons oyster sauce | 1/2 teaspoon sugar
instructions: Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Saute pork for about 3 to 5 minutes. Add garlic and onion and cook until soft and translucent. Stir in carrots, red bell pepper, snow peas and cook for about 1 minute. Add the rest of the vegetables, stir-frying for a minute or two after each addition. | Meanwhile, make the cornstarch mixture: whisk together broth, cornstarch, oyster sauce and sugar. Add the cornstarch mixture into the wok and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and continue stirring until the mixture coats the pork and the vegetables. Cook until the sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper. Serve.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | pork | carrot | bell pepper | snow pea | sayote | cabbage | baby corn | cauliflower | chicken broth | cornstarch | oyster sauce

recipe_name: Sinigang na Panga ng Tuna Recipe (Tuna Jaw in Sour Broth)
ingredients: 1 kilogram Tuna ((use tuna jaw (panga ng tuna)), cut into serving pieces) | 2 to 3 cups water (for boiling) | 1 20 gram sachet sinigang na sampalok mix | 2 thumb-seized pieces ginger (sliced) | 2 pieces tomatoes (sliced) | 1  onion (sliced) | 5 pieces finger chilies (siling pang-sigang) | 1 bundle kangkong (water spinach) leaves | 1 bunch long beans (sitaw) (cut into 3-inch length pieces) | 1  radish (labanos) | fish sauce (patis) (to taste)
instructions: Fill a pot with water and let it boil. Add the tuna and let it simmer for 5 minutes. Take out the brown residue from the fish and let it boil again. | Add the sampaloc mix then let it simmer. | Add the tomatoes, ginger, radish, onion, garlic, finger chilies, long beans and radish. | Cook the vegetables for a few minutes then add the kangkong before serving. | Adjust seasoning with salt or patis.
ingredient_names: tuna jaw | sinigang na sampalok mix | ginger | tomato | finger chili | kangkong | long bean | radish

recipe_name: Sarciadong Isda (Fried Fish with Sauce) Recipe
ingredients: 2 pieces tilapia (cleaned and scaled) | 3 teaspoons Flour | 1 Cup Oil (for frying) | 1  red onion (sliced) | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1  carrot (julienned) | 1 tablespoon ginger (julienned) | 1  red bell pepper (sliced) | 1 200 gram pack sweet tomato sauce | 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | Salt (to taste) | Leeks (for garnish (optional))
instructions: Dredgetilapiain flour and set aside. | Preheat vegetable oil in a medium-sized pan and fry fish until cooked through and crispy. | Saute onions, garlic, ginger, carrots and bell pepper. | Add tomato sauce. Season with fish sauce, salt and pepper. | Serve by pouring sauce on plate and placing tilapia on top. Garnish with leeks, if desired.
ingredient_names: tilapia | flour | carrot | ginger | bell pepper | sweet tomato sauce | garnish

ingredients: 1 kilogram Chicken | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 5 pieces calamansi (juiced) | 1 teaspoon Pepper | Salt (to taste) | 10 to 12 cloves Garlic | 2 cups cooking oil
instructions: Marinate chicken legs in fish sauce, pepper and calamansi juice for a few hours. Prick the chicken legs with a fork so the chicken will absorb the marinade. | Heat the oil in a frying pan and place the chicken with the skin side down and fry for about 5 minutes. Add the cloves of garlic and fry until golden brown. | Turn the chicken on the other side after 5 minutes and fry until chicken is cooked through. Remove the garlic from the pan once color turns golden brown and set aside. | Once cooked, remove chicken from the pan and place them on paper towels to absorb excess oil. To serve, transfer to a serving plate and top with the pan-fried garlic.
ingredient_names: chicken | calamansi

recipe_name: Ginataang Hipon, Sitaw at Kalabasa Recipe (Shrimp in Coconut Milk)
ingredients: 1 tablespoon Oil | 1  onion (chopped) | 3 cups squash (kalabasa) (peeled and cubed) | 1/2 kilogram Shrimp | 2 cups string beans (sitaw) (cut into 2 1/2-inch pieces) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 1 1/2 cups coconut milk (gata) | 3 pieces Green Chili Pepper
instructions: In a wok, saute chopped onion and minced garlic in oil over a medium heat and cook until the onions are transluscent. | Add the peeled and cubed kalabasa and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in shrimp and sitaw, then continue cooking for another 3 minutes before adding the fish sauce and pepper. | Pour in the coconut milk, bring it to a boil and then add the green chili. Cover the wok and continue simmering until vegetables are cooked and coconut milk becomes a little thick.
ingredient_names: kalabasa | shrimp | sitaw | coconut milk | green chili pepper

recipe_name: Grilled Pork Chops with Banana Chutney Recipe
ingredients: 3 to 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 teaspoon dried oregano | 1 tablespoon paprika | 2 tablespoons brown sugar | 1/4 teaspoon Salt | 2 pieces pork (use pork chops) | canola oil (for grilling) | 2 teaspoons canola oil | 1/2 piece red onion (minced) | 1 piece red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (seeded and minced) | 2 pieces banana ((Senorita variety), sliced) | 1 Cup pineapple chunks | 1/4 Cup unsweetened pineapple juice | 1/4 Cup brown sugar | 1/2 teaspoon curry powder | 1/4 Cup dried cranberries
instructions: Mix together garlic, oregano, paprika, brown sugar, and salt into a paste; rub all over pork chops. Marinate, covered, in the refrigerator for 1 to 2 hours. | Make the chutney: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Saute onion and chili until fragrant. Add bananas, pineapple chunks and juice, brown sugar, and curry powder. Bring to a gentle boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 45 minutes or until reduced, stirring occasionally. Stir in cranberries and let cool. | Heat oil in a grill pan over medium heat. Grill pork chops until golden, about 8 to 10 minutes per side. Serve topped with chutney.
ingredient_names: dried oregano | paprika | brown sugar | pork | canola oil | red chili pepper | banana | pineapple chunk | pineapple juice | curry powder | cranberry

recipe_name: Adobong Hipon sa Gata Recipe (Shrimp Adobo in Coconut Milk)
ingredients: | 2 tablespoons Oil | 6 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/2 tablespoons Pepper (ground) | 1 kilogram Shrimp (shells intact) | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 350 ml can coconut milk (gata)
instructions: Heat the oil in a medium-sized pan and saute garlic and pepper in oil. Add the shrimp and cook until its color turns orange. | Add the vinegar and soy sauce. Let it simmer until the vinegar is thoroughly cooked. | Pour in the coconut milk and let it simmer until thick. Serve while hot.
ingredient_names: shrimp | milk

ingredients: 200 Grams pork ((use kasim), cubed) | 1/4 Cup dark soy sauce | 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 8 to 10 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1 teaspoon peppercorns (freshly cracked) | 2 tablespoons water | 1/4 Cup cooking oil | 1/4 Cup cooking oil | 8 pieces banana ((saba variety), peeled and sliced crosswise into 3 rounds each) | 1/4 Cup all-purpose flour | Salt (to season) | 2 pieces red tomatoes (diced, for garnish) | cilantro (wansoy) ((leaves), for garnish)
instructions: Make the adobo: Combine pork, soy sauce, vinegar, garlic, peppercorn, and water in a bowl. Marinate, covered, in the refrigerator for 1 hour. | Place pork and marinade in a pot over medium heat. Simmer, uncovered, for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until sauce has caramelized. | Preheat oven to 165 degrees. Flake pork into long shreds using two forks. Place on a baking tray and air-dry for 10 minutes. Oven-dry adobo in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden. | Heat cooking oil in a pan, add dried pork, and fry for 3 to 5 minutes or until crisp and golden. Drain on paper towels. Let cool. | Make the patacones: heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry banana rounds for 3 minutes or until golden. Drain on paper towels. | Place a banana round between 2 pieces of wax paper. Gently flatten banana using your palm until about 1/4 inch thick. Repeat with remaining bananas. | Dredge flattened banana in flour; sprinkle with salt and sugar. Deep-fry bananas in the same pan until both sides are golden brown. Drain on paper towels. | To serve, top each fried banana with 1 tablespoon adobo flakes, diced tomatoes, and a cilantro leaf.
ingredient_names: kasim | dark soy sauce | peppercorn | cooking oil | banana | all purpose flour | season | red tomato | cilantro

recipe_name: Salt and Pepper Squid Ring Recipe
ingredients: canola oil (for deep-frying) | 2 pieces Egg (beaten) | 1 Cup Potato starch | Salt (to taste) | 200 Grams squid rings (cleaned) | lemon (to serve)
instructions: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or deep frying pan over medium heat. | Place eggs in a bowl. Combine potato starch, salt, and pepper in another bowl. | Dip squid rings in egg, then coat in seasoned potato starch. | Deep-fry squid until cooked and golden brown. Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve immediately with lemon wedges.
ingredient_names: deep frying | egg | potato starch | squid ring | lemon

ingredients: 1 kilo boneless bangus (milkfish) ((use belly), cleaned) | 350 Grams eggplant (sliced into rounds) | 370 Grams ampalaya (bitter melon) | 200 Grams Garlic (peeled) | 60 Grams ginger (sliced) | 2 1/2 cups water | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/4 Cup fish sauce (patis) | 1 1/2 cups Vinegar | 3/4 piece fish bouillon cube | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1 teaspoon Pepper
instructions: Arrange fish on the bottom of a casserole. Add eggplants, ampalaya, garlic, and ginger. Pour in water, soy sauce, fish sauce, and vinegar. Season with bouillon cube, salt, and pepper. | Cook over medium heat until fish is just cooked (slightly firm and flakes easily), vegetables are cooked, and liquid is slightly reduced, about 10 to 15 minutes; do not overcook.
ingredient_names: bangus | eggplant | ampalaya | ginger | fish bouillon cube

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 5 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 1 kilo pork (sliced) | 1 Cup Tomato sauce | 3/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 3 tablespoons brown sugar | 1 Cup water | 3 pieces dried bay leaf | 1 tablespoon peppercorns | 1 1/2 Cup carrot (sliced) | 1 Cup Potatoes (sliced into half-inch thick pieces) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Saute garlic in a pan with oil. | Add the pork and cook for 10 minutes. | Add the tomato sauce, soy sauce, brown sugar, water, bay leaves and whole peppercorns. Reduce to a simmer for 20 minutes or until pork is tender. | Add the carrots and potatoes, cook for another 10 to 15 minutes. | Season with salt and let it simmer for 5 minutes.
ingredient_names: pork | tomato sauce | brown sugar | dried bay leaf | peppercorn | carrot | half thick

ingredients: 1 1/2 kilogram pork (use pork belly) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | Salt (to season)
instructions:
Season the pork belly with fish sauce, salt and pepper. | Marinate for 20 minutes.
  | In a turbo broiler, place the pork in the middle of the pot with the skin side on top. | Set the timer to 40 minutes at 200C. | Check the pork from time to time. Once the pork is cooked, set the timer again to 20 minutes then increase the temperature to 250C. This will make the skin pop and crispy.
  | Chop while still hot and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: pork | season

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1  onion (chopped) | 1 kilo pork | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 teaspoon sugar | 3/4 Cup Tomato sauce | 1 Cup water | 2 to 3 pieces dried bay leaf | 1/4 kilo pig liver | 1 Cup Potatoes (diced) | 1 Cup carrot (diced) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: In a saucepan, saute garlic and onion in oil. | Add the pork. Cook for 5 minutes. | Pour in soy sauce, sugar, tomato sauce and water and then add the bay leaves. Simmer for 30 minutes or until the pork is tender. | Add the the liver and cook for 5 minutes. | Add potatoes, carrots, then season with salt, and pepper. Stir and cook for 15 minutes. ingredient_names: pork | tomato sauce | dried bay leaf | pig liver | potato | carrot

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1  onion (chopped) | 1/2 Cup pork liver | 1 Cup squid balls | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon black pepper (ground) | 6 cups water | 1/4 kilo lomi noodles | 1  carrot (julienned) | 1  cabbage (chopped) | 2  Egg (beaten) | onion leeks (chopped, for garnish (optional))
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a medium-sized pot. Saute the garlic and onion until fragrant. | Add the pork, pork liver, squid balls, and salt. Continue stir-frying over medium heat for 5 minutes. | Season with black pepper, add water and simmer for 10-15 minutes. Add the lomi noodles and let it simmer for another 5 minutes. | Add carrots and cabbage. Pour in the beaten eggs stirring continuously. Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with onion leeks.
ingredient_names: pork liver | squid ball | lomi noodle | carrot | cabbage | egg | onion leek

ingredients: 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 1/2 large red onion (chopped) | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 kilo Beef ((use brisket), cut into large chunks) | 2 cups Tomato sauce | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 cups beef stock | 3  Potatoes (quartered) | 1  carrot (cut into 1-inch chunks) | 2  bell pepper (sliced) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a pot then saute the onion and garlic. | Add the beef and saute until lightly browned. | Pour in the tomato sauce, soy sauce, beef stock and let it boil for a few minutes. | Cover and continue to simmer everything over low heat until the beef is tender, approximately 1 hour. Check the pot from time to time if you need to add more stock or water. | Once the beef is tender, add in the potatoes, carrots and cook for about 10 minutes. | Add the bell pepper and cook for about 5 minutes just before serving.
ingredient_names: brisket | tomato sauce | beef stock | potato | 1 chunk | bell pepper

ingredients: 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1  white onion (finely chopped) | 1 kilogram Squid (Pusit) (sliced with squid ink set aside) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 4 tablespoons Vinegar | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Saute garlic and onions in a wok with cooking oil. | Add the sliced squid along with the squid ink and water. Boil until the squid is cooked through, around 2 minutes. | Add the soy sauce and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper. | Let it simmer for up to 2-3 minutes or until the sauce is thick.
ingredient_names: squid ink set

ingredients: 1/2 Cup Oil | 1/2 Cup Garlic (crushed) | 1/4 kilo chicken liver (chopped) | 2 tablespoons ginger (thinly sliced) | 1 tablespoon kasubha (safflower) | 1/2 Cup red onion (thinly sliced) | 1 kilo Chicken (use adobo cut) | 1/4 Cup fish sauce (patis) | 4 pieces chicken bouillon cube | 1 1/2 teaspoons black pepper | 1 Cup Jasponica rice (washed) | 1 Cup miponica rice (washed) | 16 cups water | 1/2 cups green onion (chopped, for toppings) | 8 pieces calamansi (to serve)
instructions: Heat oil in a deep stockpot over medium heat. Fry garlic until browned and crispy; set aside for topping. | Add chicken liver and stir until half cooked; set aside. | Saute ginger, kasubha, and onions in the same pot until browned. | Add chicken parts and cook until browned. Season with fish sauce, bouillon cubes, and pepper. | Stir in rice and cook for 2 minutes. Add water. Cover and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for 45 minutes. Add chicken liver and cook for 2 more minutes. | Divide among bowls and garnish with crispy garlic and green onions. Serve hot withcalamansi on the side.
ingredient_names: chicken liver | ginger | kasubha | chicken | chicken bouillon cube | jasponica rice | miponica rice | green onion | calamansi

ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 2 tablespoons red onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 1 tablespoon ginger (chopped) | 2 cups Chicken Inasal (cut into 1/2-inch cubes) | 2 tablespoons Vinegar | 1 teaspoon Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon liquid seasoning | black pepper (to season) | Green Chili Pepper  (for garnish) | garlic rice (to serve)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan. Saute onions, garlic, and ginger. Add chicken and mix. | Add vinegar, soy sauce, and liquid seasoning, adding more of each according to taste. Season with pepper. Remove from heat. | Toss in green chilies, green onions, and red onions. Serve with garlic rice, calamansi, and bird's eye chilies on the side.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | ginger | chicken inasal | liquid | green chili pepper | garlic rice

ingredients: 5 cloves Garlic | 1/8 kilogram shallots (sibuyas Tagalog) (chopped) | 1/4 kilogram tomatoes (chopped) | 2 tablespoons fermented fish (bagoong isda) | 3 tablespoons ginger (sliced thinly) | 1/4 kilogram eggplant (cut into half) | 1/4  kamote (sweet potato) (cut into big cubes) | 1/4 kilogram sitaw (string beans) (sliced into 3-inch pieces) | 1/4 kilogram okra (trimmed and sliced into 3-inch pieces) | 1/8 kilogram Chili Pepper (Siling Pangsigang) | 1/8 kilogram Ampalaya (Bittermelon) (cut into half)
instructions: Add garlic, shallots, tomato in a pan and saute until the juice from the tomatoes dries out and the oil separates. | Add the bagoong isda. Continue to cook to reduce the liquid. | Layer the vegetables in the palayok or pot in this order: ginger, eggplant, kamote, sitaw, okra, siling duwag. Ampalaya should be on top. | Lower heat for the vegetables to sweat without browning and leave the pot covered until the vegetables are cooked. | Hold the pot on both sides, begin to toss the pot in a circular motion to move vegetables around. | Cook until the sauce thickens. The sauce should not be too thick. It is ready once you see the oil starts to separate from the sauce.
ingredient_names: shallot | tomato | fish | ginger | eggplant | big cube | sitaw | okra | chili pepper | ampalaya

ingredients: 2 cups cooking oil | 1/4 kilo firm tofu (tokwa) (sliced into blocks) | 1 1/2 cups white vinegar | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 4 tablespoons sugar | 2 tablespoons Salt | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1 Cup water | 1 piece red onion (diced) | 2 cloves Garlic (sliced) | 2 to 3 pieces green finger chili (siling pangsigang) (sliced) | 1/2 kilo Store-Bought Roasted Pork Belly (Liempo) (cubed)
instructions: Heat cooking oil in a deep frying pan and deep-fry tofu until golden brown. Slice tofu into small cubes; set aside. | Combine vinegar, soy sauce, sugar, salt, black pepper, and water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil. Cook for 10 minutes. | Add onion, garlic, and chilies to the vinegar mixture; mix until well combined. | Combine tofu and liempo in a bowl. Heat a sizzling plate until smoking. Turn off heat and place tofu and liempo on plate. Pour vinegar mixture over and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: firm tofu | green finger chili | store bought roasted pork belly

ingredients: 1/4 Cup tomatoes (chopped) | 1 tablespoon onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon kamias (chopped) | 1 tablespoon ginger (chopped) | 1/2 teaspoon lemongrass (tanglad) (chopped) | Salt (to taste) | 2 pieces tilapia (cleaned and gutted)
instructions: Make the stuffing: Combine all ingredients in a bowl; season well with salt and pepper. Stuff into the cavity of the whole fish. Season fish well with salt and pepper. | Preheat a charcoal grill. Grill fish until cooked through, about 3 to 5 minutes on each side. Transfer to a platter. Serve grilled fish with salsa (optional).
ingredient_names: tomato | kamias | ginger | lemongrass | tilapia

ingredients: 1 tablespoon lemongrass (tanglad) (minced) | 3 tablespoons shallots (sibuyas Tagalog) (minced) | 1 1/2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 1/4 Cup sugar | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 1/2 tablespoon dark soy sauce | 1/2 tablespoon Pepper | 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 8 pieces pork ((use pork steaks), cut into 1/3-inch-thick slices)
instructions: Make the marinade: Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Add pork and marinate for at least 3 hours or up to overnight in the refrigerator. | Preheat a charcoal grill. Place steaks on grill and cook until cooked through, about 4 minutes. (Cook each side for 2 minutes, at most.) | Make the cucumber salad: Toss cucumber with salt in a colander, and leave in the sink to drain for 30 minutes. Rinse with cold water, drain, and pat dry with paper towels. Whisk together sugar, sweet chili sauce, and vinegar in a mixing bowl until sugar is dissolved. Add cucumbers, chilies, shallots, red bell pepper, carrots, and cilantro; toss to combine. Serve with grilled steaks.
ingredient_names: lemongrass | shallot | dark soy sauce | pork

ingredients: 4 round slices pineapple | 2 tablespoons Wansoy (Cilantro) (chopped) | 3 tablespoons fresh lime juice | 1 to 2 pieces red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (seeds removed and chopped, or 1/2 teaspoon chili flakes) | Salt (to taste) | 1/2 Cup Butter | 1/3 Cup Achuete Seeds (annatto seeds) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 2 tablespoons lemongrass (tanglad) (minced) | 3 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | Salt (to taste) | 16 pieces Prawns (Sugpo) (shelled and deveined with tails left on)
instructions: Make the grilled pineapple salsa: Grill pineapple on a preheated charcoal grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Cook for about 2 to 3 minutes per side. Remove from heat. Slice into 1-inch chunks. Combine pineapple, cilantro, lime juice, and chilies. Season with salt. Keep warm. | Make the inasal sauce: melt butter or margarine in a small saucepan. Add annatto seeds and cook until butter or margarine turns deep red-orange in color. Turn off heat and strain sauce. | Put butter or margarine back in the pan. Saute garlic and lemongrass over low heat just until fragrant. Turn off heat and add calamansi juice. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Divide sauce between 2 bowls. | Grill shrimp on a charcoal grill over medium heat, an indoor griller, or grill pan, brushing frequently with inasal sauce. Cook shrimp for 1 to 2 minutes per side, depending on size. (You can skewer the shrimp onto soaked wooden barbecue sticks before grilling, if desired.) | Arrange shrimp on a platter and drizzle with remaining sauce or serve sauce on the side. Serve with fresh pineapple salsa.
ingredient_names: pineapple | wansoy | lime juice | red chili pepper | butter | achuete seed | lemongrass | calamansi juice | prawn

ingredients: 250 Grams Chicken ((use fillets), cubed) | Salt | 1 teaspoon yellow curry powder | 1 can pineapple chunks (drained)
instructions: Season chicken with salt and pepper; sprinkle with curry powder and mix well. Let stand for 20 minutes. | Skewer chicken pieces onto barbecue sticks, alternating with pineapple chunks. Grill skewers on a grill pan or a griller. Serve with yellow rice (optional).
ingredient_names: chicken | yellow curry powder | pineapple chunk

ingredients: 1 kilo oxtail (washed and sliced into 1-inch-thick pieces) | 2 tablespoons Butter | 1/4 Cup olive oil | 1 head Garlic (chopped) | 1 piece white onion (chopped) | 3 pieces red bell peppers (roasted, seeded, and sliced into strips) | 1/2 tablespoon Spanish paprika (pimenton) | 1/2 Cup ham (cubed) | 1/2 Cup Chorizo de Bilbao (sliced) | 1/2 Cup Tomato sauce | 1 tablespoon tomato paste | 1/2 Cup chickpeas (garbanzos) | 3 tablespoons brandy | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Place oxtail in a stockpot with enough water to cover. Cook meat for 1 1/2 to 2 hours or until tender. Alternatively, you can cook oxtail in a pressure cooker for 25 to 30 minutes or until tender. Set oxtail and cooking water aside. | Heat butter and olive oil in a heavy-bottomed casserole. Saute garlic and onions until tender and fragrant. Add red bell peppers and Spanish paprika. Saute for 2 to 3 minutes. | Add oxtail, ham, chorizo, tomato sauce, and tomato paste; cook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add cooking liquid and simmer over low heat for about 20 minutes. | Add chickpeas and brandy. Season to taste with salt and pepper; mix well. | Transfer to a platter and serve hot.
ingredient_names: 1 thick | butter | olive oil | bell pepper | spanish paprika | ham | chorizo de bilbao | tomato sauce | tomato paste | chickpea | brandy

ingredients: 1 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 whole Garlic | 1 piece red onion (minced) | 1 kilo Beef (use boneless beef ribs or beef brisket) | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 4 cups beef stock | 1 piece star anise | 1/3 Cup brown sugar | 4 tablespoons sesame oil | 5 tablespoons roasted sesame seeds (divided) | 1 stalk baby leeks (sliced) | 1 teaspoon Cayenne pepper | 1 teaspoon fish sauce (patis) (or to taste) | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 1 head lettuce leaves (separated, cleaned, and dried) | 1 piece red bell pepper (sliced into strips) | 1 stem green onion (chopped)
instructions: Heat vegetable oil in a casserole over medium-high heat. Saute garlic; add onions and cook until translucent. | Add beef; cook until browned. Add soy sauce and stock to cover beef. Add water if beef stock is not enough. | Add star anise and brown sugar; bring to a boil. Lower heat; simmer for 45 minutes or until beef is tender. | Add sesame oil, 4 tablespoons sesame, leeks, and cayenne pepper; simmer for 5 minutes more. Season with fish sauce and pepper. Slice beef into strips. | To serve, place beef in lettuce cups. Spoon sauce over and garnish with bell peppers, green onions, and remaining sesame seeds.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | whole garlic | beef | beef stock | star anise | brown sugar | sesame oil | sesame seed | baby leek | cayenne pepper | lettuce leave | bell pepper | green onion

ingredients: 500 Grams Shrimp (peeled and deveined) | 2 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 2 tablespoons orange juice | orange zest | 2 to 3 pieces red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (minced (remove seeds for less heat)) | navel orange (peeled) | 1 piece mango (diced) | 1 piece avocado (diced) | 2 tablespoons cilantro (wansoy) (chopped) | Salt (to season)
instructions: Blanch shrimps in simmering salted water for 1 minute. Plunge in ice-cold water to stop the cooking process. Drain well. | Marinate shrimps in calamansi juice, orange juice, orange zest, and chopped chilies for 30 minutes in the chiller. Toss in orange segments, mangoes, avocados, and cilantro. Season to taste with salt. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: shrimp | calamansi juice | orange juice | orange zest | red chili pepper | navel orange | mango | avocado | cilantro | season

recipe_name: Munggo Rice Recipe (Mung Bean Fried Rice)
ingredients: 2 tablespoons refined coconut oil (divided) | 200 Grams Shrimp (peeled and deveined) | 1/4 Cup onion (chopped) | 2 teaspoons ginger (minced) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1 1/3 Cup Munggo (Mung Beans) | 1 Cup tomatoes (seeds removed and chopped) | 1 Cup string beans (sitaw) (sliced into 1-inch pieces and blanched) | 1 1/3 Cup brown rice | 1 Cup malunggay leaves (moringa) | 2 teaspoons fish sauce (patis) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: In a nonstick pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. | Saute shrimp until pink for about 2 minutes. Transfer to a plate. In the same pan, heat theremaining oil. Saute onion, ginger, and garlic until fragrant. Add tomatoes and cook until soft. | Add munggo, string beans, and brown rice. Cook for 1 minute. | Stir in shrimp, malunggay leaves, and fish sauce. Cook just until the leaves turn bright green. | Season with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: refined coconut oil | shrimp | ginger | munggo | tomato | sitaw | brown rice | malunggay

ingredients: 1 kilo heart of palm (ubod) | 2 tablespoons coconut oil | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 2 cups kangkong (water spinach) leaves (thinly sliced) | 1 Cup tinapa (smoked fish) flakes | 1 Cup tomatoes (chopped) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon black pepper | 2 pieces Salted Egg (itlog na maalat) (peeled and quartered) | 2 tablespoons spring onions (chopped)
instructions: Chop ubod or pulse in a food processor until it is the the size of rice grains. | lanch ubod for 1 minute in boiling water and drain in a strainer. | Wrap ubod in a clean kitchen towel and wring out all the excess water. | In a nonstick skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Saute garlic until fragrant. | Add kangkong leaves, tinapa flakes, and ubod. Saute for 2 minutes. Turn off heat. | Stir in tomatoes, salt, and pepper; mix well. Garnish with sliced salted eggs and spring onions.
ingredient_names: heart palm | coconut oil | kangkong | fish flake | tomato | egg | green onion

ingredients: 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon black pepper | 1 1/2 tablespoons coconut sugar | 1/3 Cup pineapple juice | 1 teaspoon Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon banana ketchup | 200 Grams Chicken ((use skinless chicken breast fillet), sliced into small strips) | 1 tablespoon refined coconut oil | 1 tablespoon refined coconut oil | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 2 tablespoons onion (chopped) | 2 cups brown rice | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: In a bowl, combine garlic, salt, black pepper, coconut sugar, pineapple juice, soy sauce, and ketchup. Marinate the chicken for 2 hours or overnight, covered in plastic, in the refrigerator. | In a nonstick skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Pan-fry the chicken until fully cooked and toasted on the edges. Set aside. | Make the fried rice: In the same skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil. Saute garlic and onion until fragrant. Add brown rice and vegetables. Cook for 2 minutes. | Stir in the scrambled eggs and chicken tocino. Season with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: coconut sugar | pineapple juice | banana ketchup | chicken | refined coconut oil | brown rice

ingredients: 200 Grams cellophane noodles (sotanghon) | 100 Grams Shrimp (peeled and deveined) | 100 Grams Squid (Pusit) (cleaned and sliced into rings) | Salt (to taste) | 2 tablespoons refined coconut oil (divided) | 1/4 Cup onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (chopped) | 1 Cup long beans (sitaw) (halved diagonally and blanched) | 1 Cup red bell pepper (sliced into strips) | 1 Cup Bok Choy (Chinese leafy cabbage) (sliced thinly) | 1 Cup chicken broth | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
instructions: Soak sotanghon in warm water for 15 minutes. Drain and cut with scissors to desired length. | Season shrimp and squid with salt and pepper. In a nonstick skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Saute the shrimp until pink and transfer to a plate. In the same pan, saute squid until opaque and transfer to the same plate. | Add remaining oil and saute onion, garlic, and red bell pepper until soft. Add green beans and bok choy. Cook for 1 minute. | Stir in chicken broth, soy sauce, red bell pepper, and noodles. Cook until sauce is completely absorbed by the noodles. | Top with shrimp and squid.
ingredient_names: cellophane noodle | shrimp | squid | refined coconut oil | long bean | bell pepper | bok choy | chicken broth

ingredients: 150 Grams Shrimp (peeled, deveined and chopped) | Salt (to taste) | 2 tablespoons coconut oil (divided) | 1/4 Cup onion (chopped) | 1 1/2 cups coconut milk (gata) | 1/4 Cup Thai green curry paste | 2 cups winged beans (sigarilyas) (trimmed and sliced to 1/4-inch pieces) | 2 cups kangkong (water spinach) leaves (chopped) | 2 pieces long green chilies (siling pangsigang) (sliced diagonally in half) | 2 pieces kaffir lime leaf (torn in half (optional)) | 2 teaspoons fish sauce (patis) (or more to taste) | 1 piece red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (chopped)
instructions: Season shrimp with salt and pepper. In a nonstick skillet, heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Saute shrimp until pink for about 1 minute. Remove from pan and set aside. | Heat remaining oil. Saute onion and garlic until soft. Add coconut milk and Thai green curry paste; mix until well combined then bring to a simmer. | Add winged beans and cook for 5 minutes, or until half cooked. Stir in the kangkong stems and kaffir lime leaves , if using. Simmer for 5 minutes. | Return shrimp to the pan. Season with fish sauce and garnish with chopped bird s eye chili.
ingredient_names: shrimp | coconut oil | coconut milk | thai green curry paste | bean | kangkong | long green chily | kaffir lime leaf | red chili pepper

recipe_name: Pininyahang Manok Recipe (Chicken in Pineapple Sauce)
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 2 tablespoons ginger (minced) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 piece onion (sliced) | 500 Grams Chicken (use chicken thighs) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | Salt (to taste) | 1 Cup Tomato sauce | 1 small can Canned Pineapple Chunks | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste)
instructions: Saute ginger, garlic, and onion in oil. Add chicken and patis, then saute for 10 minutes or until the chicken turns slightly brown. | Add the tomato sauce and season with salt and pepper. Bring to boil then let simmer for 15 minutes. | Add the can of pineapple chunks along with the syrup. Simmer for 5 to 10 minutes. Serve with steamed rice.
ingredient_names: ginger | chicken | tomato sauce | canned pineapple chunk

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 1 kilo pork (pork cubes (kasim)) | 1 head Garlic (minced) | 1 teaspoon black pepper (crushed) | 1 piece bay leaf | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 Cup lechon sauce | 1 teaspoon white sugar | 1/2 Cup water
instructions: Saute the garlic and black pepper in oil. Add the pork cubes then let it brown. | Add the bayleaf, vinegar, soy sauce, sugar and lechon sauce and let it simmer for 15 minutes. Stir once in awhile. Add water and let it simmer for 5 more minutes until the sauce thickens and the pork is tender. | Serve warm with rice.
ingredient_names: pork | bay leaf | lechon sauce

ingredients: 1 Cup banana ketchup | 2/3 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon Knorr SavorRich Pork | 1 whole Garlic (minced) | 1/4 Cup Calamansi Juice | 1/2 Cup lemon-lime soda | 1/2 teaspoon hot sauce | 1/2 Cup brown sugar | black pepper (to taste) | 1 kilo pork kasim (cut into 1-inch cubes) | 1/4 Cup vegetable oil
instructions: Make the marinade: In a large bowl, mix banana ketchup, soy sauce, Knorr Savorrich pork, garlic, calamansi juice, pepper, sugar, lime-flavored soda, and hot sauce. | Thread meat onto barbecue sticks, securing them well. Add a piece of fat at the end of each skewer, if desired. | Arrange skewers in 2 layers in a wide container. Set aside 1 cup of the marinade for basting, then pour remaining marinade over the skewers. Marinate overnight in the refrigerator. | Make the basting sauce: In a small bowl, mix reserved marinade with oil. | Place barbecue on a preheated grill. Baste pork often to keep the meat from drying out. Grill until pork is cooked through. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: banana ketchup | whole garlic | calamansi juice | lemon lime soda | hot sauce | brown sugar | pork kasim | vegetable oil

ingredients: 2 strips Sea Vegetables | 1/4 Cup bonito flakes | 2 cups hot water | 2 tablespoons Japanese soy sauce | 2 tablespoons mirin (japanese sweet rice wine) | 1 teaspoon brown sugar | 1 teaspoon ginger (grated) | 500 Grams lapu-lapu ((use fillet), sliced into 4 pieces) | 8 pieces asparagus (spears) | 150 Grams enoki mushrooms (cut at the roots) | 1 pieces red radish (sliced thinly)
instructions: Soak kombu and bonito flakes in hot water for 15 to 20 minutes in a large bowl. Strain broth and pour into a wide, shallow pan. Let simmer very gently. | Add soy sauce, mirin, sugar, and ginger. Add lapu-lapu fillet and asparagus. Cover and cook for 2 minutes. Add mushrooms, and red radish; cover and turn off heat. Serve in a shallow bowl with the broth.
ingredient_names: sea vegetable | bonito flake | hot water | japanese soy sauce | mirin | brown sugar | ginger | lapu | asparagus | enoki mushroom | radish

ingredients: 3 pieces Chicken (use leg quarters) | 1 to 2 pieces white onion (quartered) | 2 cloves Garlic (peeled and smashed but left whole) | 6 cups water | 1 to 2 teaspoons sea salt | black pepper (to taste) | 2 pieces carrot (peeled and cubed) | 2 pieces Potatoes (peeled and cubed) | 1 piece squash (kalabasa) (peeled and chopped) | 120 Grams long beans (sitaw) (cut into roughly the same size as the carrot cubes)
instructions:
Place chicken, onions, garlic, and water in a pot. bring to a boil. Skim off any scum that forms on the surface. Lower heat and simmer. Add salt and pepper; continue simmering for 10 minutes.
 | Add carrots and potatoes; simmer for 10 minutes. | Add squash; simmer for 10 minutes. | Add green beans; simmer for 10 minutes. | Check and adjust seasoning, adding more salt if necessary. Check doneness of chicken and vegetables. They should be tender, but the vegetables shouldn't be mushy. Cook for a few more minutes, if needed.
 | Once done, remove pot from heat and place chicken on a plate. Using a fork and knife, remove meat from bones in fat shreds. Return chicken meat to the pot. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: leg quarter | sea salt | carrot | potato | kalabasa | the carrot cube

ingredients: 4 cloves Garlic (sliced thinly) | 1/3 Cup olive oil | 300 Grams fresh dulong (rinsed and drained) | 1 to 2 teaspoons white wine vinegar | Salt (to taste) | crostini (to serve)
instructions: Saute garlic in olive oil in a large frying pan over medium-low heat. Increase heat to medium and add dulong. | Stir carefully and add vinegar; let simmer for about 10 minutes or until fish is opaque. Remove from heat and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature with crostini.
ingredient_names: olive oil | dulong | white wine vinegar | crostini

ingredients: 250 Grams Shrimp | 10 cups water | 500 Grams rice stick noodles (luglug) | cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic | 1 piece onion | 100 Grams firm tofu (tokwa) (diced) | Salt (to taste) | 3 cups water | 2 tablespoons Achuete Powder (annatto powder) (dissolved in 1/2 cup of water) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) (or to taste) | 1/4 cups Flour (dissolved in 1 cup of water) | 4 pieces Egg ((hardboiled), sliced) | 1/2 Cup smoked fish (Tinapa) flakes | 1/2 Cup pork crackling (chicharon) (crushed) | 2 stalks spring onions
instructions: Remove the shells and heads of the shrimp. Pound the shrimp heads using a mortar and mash in 3 cups of water. Strain the shrimp liquid and set aside. | In a large casserole, bring 10 cups of water to a boil. Cook the noodles according to package instructions or until soft . | Heat oil in a pan. Add the garlic and onion, saute for a few minutes. Add shrimp, tofu, and season with salt and pepper, saute until shrimps are done. Set aside. | In another sauce pan, put 3 cups of water, add annatto water, ground pepper, fish sauce and flour dissolved in water. Simmer over medium-low heat, stir constantly for about 3 minutes or until liquid starts to thicken. | Pour the shrimp sauce over the noodles and top with stir-fried shrimp and tofu. Sprinkle with smoked fish flakes and crushed pork crackling. Garnish with spring onion and add the sliced hard-boiled eggs.
ingredient_names: shrimp | rice noodle | tofu | powder | flour | egg | fish | pork | green onion

ingredients: 1 tablespoon Oil | 1 piece onion (peeled and sliced thinly) | 4 to 5 cloves Garlic (peeled and minced) | 1 kilo pork ((use pork tenderloin), cut into 1/2 inch strips) | 8 to 10 pieces peppercorns (cracked) | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 Cup water | 1/2 kilo pork ((use liver), cut into 1/2 inch strips) | 1/2 Cup green peas (thawed) | 1 piece red bell pepper (cored, seeded and sliced into strips) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: In a pre-heated pan, add oil and saute garlic and onion. Add the pork and cook for 5 minutes. | Season with black peppercorns, soy sauce and vinegar. Add the water, simmer for about 10 minutes or until pork is tender. | Add liver, stirring gently, and continue to cook for about 4 to 5 minutes or until liver is cooked through and sauce is thickened. Add green peas and bell peppers and continue to cook for about 2 to 3 minutes. Season with salt to taste.
ingredient_names: pork | peppercorn | liver | green pea | bell pepper

ingredients: 4 pieces eggplant | 4 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 clove Garlic (minced) | 2 pieces onion (roughly chopped) | 3 pieces tomatoes (roughly chopped) | 4 pieces Egg (lighty beaten) | Salt (to taste)
instructions: Grill the eggplants, then peel off the charred skin. Chop the eggplants. | Preheat the pan with oil, then saute the garlic, onion and tomatoes. | Add the eggplants and saute and season with salt and pepper. | Add the beaten egg mixture and mix all the ingredients. Transfer to a platter and serve.
ingredient_names: eggplant | vegetable oil | tomato | egg lighty

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 piece onion (diced) | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/2 kilo pork ((use country-style boneless ribs or pork belly), cut into 1-1/2 cubes) | 1/2 kilo Beef ((use chuck or brisket), cubed) | 1/2 kilo Chicken (cut into small parts) | 2 pieces tomatoes (diced) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 2 cups water | 2 pieces Potatoes (quartered and then halved) | 1 can Tomato sauce | 3-4 pieces banana (plantain) | 1 bunch Bok Choy (Chinese leafy cabbage) (baby or regular-sized) | 1 head cabbage | Salt (to taste) | 2 pieces eggplant (grilled)
instructions: Heat the oil in a deep pot. Saute the onion for a minute and then add the garlic. Add the pork cubes, beef and chicken. Stir in the tomatoes and continue to cook until all the meat have browned. | Pour in the fish sauce. Let it simmer for about 3-5 minutes. | Add the water and bring to a boil. Simmer while the pot is covered until all the meat is tender (about 30 to 40 minutes). | Add the potatoes and tomato sauce. Stir. Simmer again for about 5-6 minutes. Season according to your taste by adding either salt or more fish sauce. | Add the sliced saba and continue to cook until bananas are tender. Add the Bok choy leaves and cabbage, turn off the heat and cover. Let it stand for about 5 minutes. | Serve with diced eggplant and fish bagoong on the side.
ingredient_names: country style rib | brisket | chicken | tomato | potato | tomato sauce | banana | bok choy | cabbage | eggplant

ingredients: 1 Pack bihon noodles (thin rice noodles) | 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic | 1 piece onion (chopped) | 1/2 kilo pork (use ground pork) | 3 1/2 cups pork broth | 1 tablespoon Atsuete (annatto) (dissolved in 1/4 cup pork broth) | 1 piece shrimp bouillon cube | 3 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 4 tablespoons cornstarch (dissolved in 1/4 cup pork broth) | 1/4 kilo Shrimp ((cooked), shelled) | 1/2 Cup smoked fish (Tinapa) flakes | 1/2 Cup pork chicharon (ground) | 3 pieces Egg ((hardboiled), sliced) | 1-2 cups cabbage (shredded and blanched) | 1 Cup Squid (Pusit) (cook) | Garlic (fried and minced) | spring onions | calamansi
instructions: Cook the bihon or palabok noodles according to package directions. Drain and set aside. | Heat cooking oil in a saucepan and saute garlic and onion. | Add the ground pork and cook for 5 minutes or until the pork turns brown. | Add the pork broth (3 cups) and the dissolved annato. Let it boil | Add shrimp bouillon cube and fish sauce then add the dissolved cornstarch. | Cook until sauce becomes thick. Set aside. | To assemble, arrange the noodles then top with the sauce. Arrange all the toppings on top of the noodles and sauce and garnish with spring onions. Serve with sliced calamansi.
ingredient_names: bihon noodle | pork | pork broth | shrimp bouillon cube | cornstarch | shrimp | fish | pork chicharon | egg | cabbage | squid | green onion | calamansi

ingredients: 3 tablespoons cooking oil | 1/2 kilo pork (sliced thinly) | 2 pieces ampalaya (bitter melon) (cleaned, seeds removed and cut into thin slices) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1 piece tomatoes (sliced) | 1 piece onion (sliced) | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 2 tablespoons Salt
instructions: Place the sliced ampalaya in a large bowl. Add salt and lukewarm water then leave for 5 minutes. | Drain the amplaya and squeeze out the juices. Set aside. | Heat the pan and cooking oil and saute the garlic, onion, tomato and pork belly. Saute for a few minutes until the pork is cooked. | Add the ampalaya, mix well and season with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: pork | ampalaya | tomato

ingredients: 1 1/2 cups brown rice | water | 2 cups coconut cream (kakang gata) | Salt | 100 Grams fish (use fillets) | 1/4 teaspoon cumin | 1/4 teaspoon curry powder | 4 pieces young okra | vegetable oil
instructions: Wash and drain brown rice. Put washed rice in a small heavy bottomed pot and pour enough water to reach one inch above rice. Bring to a boil, then lower heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Mix with a wooden spoon. | Add gata and simmer until done, about 10 more minutes. Mix and season with salt. Set aside. | Season fish fillet with cumin, curry powder, and salt; pan-fry in vegetable oil until cooked.
ingredient_names: brown rice | coconut cream | fillet | cumin | curry powder | young okra | vegetable oil

recipe_name: Sinigang na Bangus sa Bayabas Recipe (Stewed Milkfish in Guava Soup)
servings: 2 to 3   if using 1 bangus; 6 to 8 if using 2
ingredients: 1/2 kilo Guava (bayabas) (very ripe) | 3 pieces tomatoes (quartered) | 1 piece onion (peeled and sliced) | 1/2 Table Spoon rock salt | 1 to 2 large boneless bangus (milkfish) (cut in 3 pieces) | 1/2 bundle sitaw (string beans) (cut 2 inches long) | 3 pieces finger chilies (siling pangsigang) | 1 bundle kangkong (water spinach) leaves | 1/4 kilo kamias
instructions: Place guava in a medium size pot and cover with water. Boil until guava softens, about 5 to 10 minutes. Remove boiled guava from the pot and place in a strainer. Mash with the back of asandok over the stockpot, letting juice from guava pulp drip back into the stockpot. Set aside broth. | In a large stockpot, boil water. Add tomatoes, onions, and salt. | Put in bangus and sitaw, and boil. | When almost cooked, add the rest of the vegetables. | Season with patis (fish sauce).
ingredient_names: guava | tomato | table spoon rock salt | bangus | sitaw | finger chili | kangkong | kamias

recipe_name: Ginataang Alimasag Recipe (Crabs Cooked in Coconut Milk)
ingredients: 1 piece red bell pepper (chopped) | 100 Grams crabmeat | 1/2 Cup coconut milk (gata) | Salt | 3 pieces Egg | crab shells
instructions: Saute red and green bell pepper. | Add crabmeat and coconut milk. Add salt and pepper to taste. | Place mixture into the crab shells. | Beat eggs and coat crab shells. Fry and serve.
ingredient_names: bell pepper | crabmeat | coconut milk | egg | crab shell

ingredients: 1 piece Chorizo de Bilbao (sliced) | 3 large Egg | 2 tablespoons milk | Salt
instructions: In a medium size nonstick pan, fry chorizo in its own fat for about 3 minutes over medium high heat. | In a small bowl, combine egg, milk, and a dash of salt and pepper. Whisk with a fork. | Pour over chorizo and scramble using a wooden spoon until eggs become fluffy. | Remove from fire and serve at once.
ingredient_names: chorizo | egg | milk

recipe_name: Sinigang na Salmon sa Miso Recipe (Salmon in Tamarind Miso Soup)
ingredients: 1/2 kilo sampalok na hilaw (green tamarind) | 5 slivers ginger | 1 Cup red tomatoes (cubed) | 1 Cup white miso (ground soy beans) | 1 Table Spoon vegetable oil | 5 to 6 cups water | 1 kilo salmon | 2 heads mustasa leaves | 1/2 bundle sitaw (string beans) (cut 2 inches long) | 2 pieces Eggpplant (cut 1 inch long) | 1 piece puso ng saging (banana blossom) (cut 2 inches long)
instructions:
Makesampalokbroth: Put sampalok in a small pot and cover with water. Boil until tender, about 10 minutes. Removesampalokfrom water. Place in a strainer or colander and mash using the back of asandokback into the pot of water. Set broth aside. | Saute ginger, tomatoes, and miso in vegetable oil. Add water and let boil. | Put in salmon and return to a boil.
 | Pour insampalokbroth and add vegetables.Simmeruntil fish and vegetables are cooked.
 | Season withpatis(fish sauce).
ingredient_names: sampalok na hilaw | slivers ginger | red tomato | white miso | table spoon vegetable oil | salmon | mustasa leave | sitaw | eggpplant | puso ng

ingredients: 1 large boneless bangus  (milkfish) | 2 pieces red onion (sliced thinly) | 1 piece Potatoes (peeled, diced small) | 1/2 Cup frozen peas (thawed) | 1 piece carrot (peeled, diced small) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1 piece Egg | 1 Table Spoon Flour | black pepper | Oil (for frying)
instructions:
Placebanguson a chopping board. With a spoon, scrape out meat, careful to not scrape holes into the skin. Remove any stray bones in the meat or scales on the skin, if necessary. Set aside. | Make Filling: In a nonstick wok over medium heat, heat oil and then saute onions until softened. Add diced potatoes and stir fry until almost cooked through. Add carrots and then peas, sauteing until all vegetables are cooked through. | Addbangusmeat and saute until cooked. Season with patis and ground black pepper; stir. Sprinkle in flour to further bind the meat and keep it from spilling out. Stir to evenly coat the bangus mixture and cook the flour. Remove from heat. Let cool slightly before breaking egg into filling mixture and stir to coat.
 | To assemble: Place a sheet of aluminum foil on a chopping board and lay downbangusskin-side down. Spoon filling onto one side of thebangusskin, spreading mixture towards the tail and head. Foldbangusclosed. | Tie four pieces of string along the bangus to secure filling.Then gently roll the bangus in the aluminum foil, scrunching the ends closed. Bake in a 350 degrees oven until cooked through, opening the aluminum foil towards the end to brown the skin. Serve with steamed rice.
ingredient_names: bangus | potato | pea | carrot | egg | table spoon flour

recipe_name: Bangus with Coconut Ginger Sauce Recipe
ingredients: 4 pieces boneless bangus (milkfish) (marinated, thawed) | 1 Cup coconut cream (kakang gata) | 2 inch ginger (peeled, sliced) | 1 teaspoon ginger powder | 1 Table Spoon fish sauce (patis) | 1 teaspoon cornstarch | 1/8 teaspoon Salt (or to taste) | 1/4 Cup Oil (for pan frying) | ground white pepper | rice (steamed)
instructions: Ginger and a little patis balance out the sweetness of coconut.In a nonstick oval frying pan over medium heat, heat about 2 tablespoons oil. Pan fry bangus on both sides until cooked through. | Meanwhile, in a small saucepan over medium heat, mix coconut cream, ginger, and ginger powder, stirring to prevent scorching. Bring to a simmer and lower heat. | Mix cornstarch in patis until dissolved. While stirring, pour into coconut mixture and cook until thickened. Season with white pepper to taste before removing from heat. Strain out ginger. Serve immediately with bangus, steamed rice, and a tomato and onion salad.
ingredient_names: bangus | coconut cream | ginger | ginger powder | table spoon fish sauce | cornstarch | white pepper | rice

ingredients: 1 Cup Potatoes (grated, in water) | 2 cloves Garlic (finely chopped) | 1 Cup carrot (grated) | 1 Cup cabbage (shredded) | 2 cans Canned Tuna In Water (drained) | 20 pieces lumpia wrapper | Salt | Oil (for sauteing)
instructions: In a large nonstick frying pan over medium heat, heat about 2 tablespoons oil. Add drained potatoes and saute until cooked. Remove from heat, transfer potatoes to a bowl, and set aside. | In the same pan over medium heat, heat another tablespoon of oil. Add garlic and saute until softened. Season with a little salt. Add and quickly saute carrots, then cabbage. Add in drained tuna and flake. Return potatoes to the pan and stir to combine. Season with salt and ground black pepper. Remove from heat, transfer to a bowl, and set aside to cool. | Meanwhile, make Garlic Mayo: In a bowl, mix 1 teaspoon granulated garlic powder, 1?2 cup mayonnaise, 1 teaspoon soy sauce, and finely ground black pepper, to taste. Sprinkle with finely chopped parsley. Set aside until ready to serve.
ingredient_names: potato | carrot | cabbage | tuna in water | lumpia wrapper

ingredients: 1/4 Cup patis (fish sauce) | 3 tablespoons brown sugar | 2 teaspoons red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (minced) | 3 pieces Lemongrass Bulb (Tanglad) ((use heart), sliced crosswise) | 4 cloves Garlic | 1/2 kilo Chicken ((use chicken meat), deboned and cut into 3/4-inch cubes) | 1 Cup peanut butter | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 teaspoons red curry paste | 2 tablespoons dark brown sugar | 1 Table Spoon Calamansi Juice | 1/4 Cup water
instructions: Make the lemongrass marinade by combining fish sauce, brown sugar, minced red chili peppers, lemongrass hearts, and garlic. Mix well. | Marinate the chicken meat in lemongrass mixture for at least two hours. | Grill and serve with peanut sauce: Combine peanut butter, soy sauce, red curry paste, dark brown sugar, and calamansi juice in blender. Puree to combine. While blender is running, drizzle in about 1/4 cup hot water to thin out the sauce.
ingredient_names: brown sugar | red chili pepper | lemongrass bulb | chicken meat | peanut butter | red curry paste | table spoon calamansi juice

ingredients: 1 bunch lemongrass (tanglad) | 1 piece ginger (peeled and sliced thinly) | 3 to 4 pieces red siling labuyo | 1 bunch spring onions (chopped) | 1 kilo lapu-lapu (gutted and cleaned) | Salt
instructions: Discard the green part of lemongrass. Slice the white part in half and crush. | In a small bowl, combine lemongrass, ginger, siling labuyo, and spring onion. Stuff into fish cavity. Season fish with salt and pepper. | Place fish in a steamer with boiling water and steam for about 20 minutes. | Serve with soy sauce and calamansi dip.
ingredient_names: lemongrass | ginger | red chiling labuyo | green onion | lapu

recipe_name: Grilled Prawns with Carrots and Singkamas Recipe
ingredients: 2 cups water | 2 pieces carrot (cut into large chunks) | 1/2 kilo Prawns (Sugpo) (peeled and deveined, with tails left intact) | Salt | 1 Table Spoon Oil | 2 teaspoons turmeric powder | 2 pieces jicama (singkamas) (peeled and cut in large chunks)
instructions: In a small pot, bring water to a boil. Put carrots and cook for a couple of minutes to lightly blanch them. Take them out of the pot. Set aside. | Season prawns with salt and pepper. Drizzle with oil. Toss. Sprinkle with turmeric powder and toss lightly. | Alternately thread prawns, singkamas, and carrots through a skewer. | Fire up grill. Lightly brush grilling surface with oil to prevent prawns from sticking. | Grill skewered prawns and vegetables for 2 to 3 minutes on each side.
ingredient_names: carrot | prawn | table spoon oil | turmeric powder | jicama

recipe_name: Pork Chop Barbecue with Apple Juice Recipe
ingredients: 1 kilo pork (use pork chops) | Salt | 1 1/2 cups apple juice | 1/4 Cup brown sugar | 1/2 Cup catsup | 3 tablespoons Oil
instructions: Season pork chops with salt and pepper. Place pork in a bowl and pour apple juice. Marinate for a couple of hours. | In a saucepan, put pork chops and apple juice marinade. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook for about 20 minutes. Take pork chops out of the pan and drain off liquid. Set aside. | In a small pan, make barbecue sauce. Combine brown sugar, catsup, and half a cup of apple juice. Stir and let simmer for about 5 minutes. | Grill pork chops over charcoal, brushing with barbecue sauce on both sides every so often.
ingredient_names: pork | apple juice | brown sugar | catsup

ingredients: 1/2 piece kalabasa (squash) (peeled, cut into 1 inch cubes 500 grams potato marbles, scrubbed clean) | Potatoes (halved) | 3 cloves Garlic (peeled, sliced) | 2 tablespoons Oil | Salt
instructions: Preheat oven to 375?F. Place kalabasa and potatoes in separate bowls. | Heat garlic in the oil in a small saucepan over low heat until garlic is aromatic. Pour over kalabasa and potatoes and toss to coat. Season generously with salt and ground black pepper. Place in a baking pan and bake until browned and tender, about 20 minutes for the kalabasa, 40 minutes for the potatoes.
ingredient_names: potato marble | potato

ingredients: 1 kilo Chicken (use drumsticks) | Salt | 1 Pack Korean barbecue mix | 1/2 Cup water | 1 Table Spoon sesame seeds (toasted)
instructions: Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper. | Sprinkle Korean barbecue mix onto chicken, making sure each piece is well coated. Place in the refrigerator for a couple of hours. | Place chicken in a deep baking dish. Gently pour water into the dish (this will keep the chicken moist while baking). Cover with foil. Bake for 35 minutes. Take out of the oven. | Bake again for another 15 minutes uncovered. Sprinkle with toasted sesame seeds before serving.
ingredient_names: drumstick | korean barbecue mix | table spoon sesame seed

ingredients: 6 cups water | 1 large onion (quartered) | 5 cloves Garlic (peeled and crushed) | 1 kilo pork (use pork ribs) | 2 tablespoons Salt | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | barbecue sauce
instructions: In a large pot, pour water. Put onion and garlic in the pot. Add salt and pepper. Add pork ribs. Boil meat in seasoned water for 35 to 40 minutes. | When tender, take meat out of the pot, put in a large stainless strainer and drain excess water. | Meanwhile, prepare charcoal in barbecue grill. Set pork ribs on the grill. Brush both sides of pork ribs with barbecue sauce. Flip. Brush several times with sauce while grilling.
ingredient_names: pork | barbecue sauce

ingredients: 4 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 medium onion (diced) | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 kilo Chicken (cut into serving pieces) | 1 pack (200-gram) Tomato sauce | 1 Cup water | 1 large Potatoes (quartered) | 1 large carrot (sliced) | 1 large red bell pepper (sliced) | 1 teaspoon white sugar | Salt (to taste) | black pepper (to taste)
instructions:
Saute the onion and garlic in a preheated pan with cooking oil. | Stir in the chicken until the color turns light brown. | Pour-in tomato sauce and water then simmer for 30 to 40 minutes. | Add the potato and carrots then cook for 7 minutes or until the vegetables are soft.
 | Put-in the bell pepper slices. Season with salt, sugar, and ground black pepper then cook for a few minutes. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: chicken | tomato sauce | potato | carrot | bell pepper

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable cooking oil | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium sized white onion (chopped) | 1/2 kilo pork (sliced thinly) | 1 Cup green bell pepper (sliced) | 1 Cup red bell pepper (sliced) | 1 Small cauliflower (cut into small pieces) | 1 Cup carrot (sliced) | 1 piece Chinese cabbage (Baguio pechay), (sliced) | 1 1/2 Cup snow peas (sitsaro) | 1 Table Spoon oyster sauce | 1 Table Spoon Soy Sauce | 1 1/4 Cup water | 1 teaspoon cornstarch | Salt
instructions:
Saute the onion and garlic in a preheated pan with cooking oil. | Stir in the pork and cook for 15 minutes. | Add the green and red bell pepper, cauliflower, carrots and cook for a few minutes. | Add the Chinese cabbage and snow peas.
 | Stir in the oyster sauce and soy sauce and simmer for 2 minutes. Season with salt. | Dilute the cornstarch in 1/4 cup of water then pour mixture in the pot. Mix well and simmer for a few minutes. Serve.
ingredient_names: vegetable cooking oil | pork | bell pepper | cauliflower | carrot | chinese cabbage | snow pea | table spoon oyster sauce | table spoon soy sauce | cornstarch

ingredients: 2 cups Potatoes (roasted) | 2 cups kalabasa (squash) (roasted) | 250 Grams leftover ham | Salt | 4 pieces Egg | Oil (for frying)
instructions:
Chop potatoes, kalabasa, and ham into bite-sized pieces. Season vegetables with salt and black pepper, if desired. Set aside.
 | In a deep saute pan over medium heat, fill pan halfway up the sides with oil. Once hot, slip in potatoes, kalabasa, and ham. Deep fry until pieces start to brown, stirring occasionally to avoid sticking. Drain on paper towels. Divide equally among four plates. Set aside. | Break an egg into a bowl, and then slide into the hot oil. Baste the egg with hot oil. Slide on top of a plate of hash when cooked. Season with salt and ground black pepper, if desired. Repeat with remaining eggs. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: potato | kalabasa | leftover ham | egg

ingredients: 1 Cup hot water | 1 Table Spoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon Garlic | 1/4 teaspoon Onion powder | 450 Grams tofu (tokwa) (cubed) | 1/4 Cup red bell pepper (seeded, chopped) | 1 medium white onion (chopped) | Oil (for deep-frying)
instructions: Make brine solution: Mix together hot water, salt and garlic and onion powder. Stir until ingredients have dissolved. Set aside. | Deep fry tofu until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Transfer to a bowl. Pour brine solution over tofu and let stand for at least 10 minutes. Drain and set aside. | Meanwhile, make dressing: Mix together 2 tablespoons mayonnaise, 1?4 cup cream, 1?4 teaspoon garlic powder, 1?4 teaspoon onion powder, and 3 chopped siling labuyo. Season to taste. Set aside. | Meanwhile, saute bell peppers and onions. Remove from heat. Stir in tofu, sauteed vegetables, and dressing. Season to taste. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: hot water | table spoon salt | onion powder | tofu | bell pepper | deep frying

ingredients: 2 whole Chicken ((use spring chicken), (800 grams each), neck and giblets removed) | 1/4 Cup rock salt | 20  pandan leaf | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1 teaspoon black pepper | Oil (for deep-frying) | banana ketchup (to serve (optional)) | atsara (to serve (optional))
instructions: Wash chicken thoroughly. Rub cavity and flesh with rock salt. Wash to remove salt and drain. Stuff cavity of each chicken with 10 pandan leaves. | Arrange chicken in a preheated steamer and steam for 20 minutes. Remove chicken from steamer and let cool. | Rub each chicken with 1 tablespoon fish sauce and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper. Let stand for 15 minutes in the refrigerator. | Heat oil in a large wok or deep fryer. Deep-fry chicken for 5 to 8 minutes per side, until skin is golden brown. For extra crispy chicken, chill the chicken in the refrigerator after frying. When ready to serve, re-fry for 2 to 3 minutes per side. Serve with banana ketchup and atchara, if desired.
ingredient_names: neck and giblets | rock salt | pandan leaf | deep frying | banana ketchup | atsara

ingredients: 400 Grams whole-wheat spaghetti | 1 bulb Garlic | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 1 bottle Canned Sardines In Oil (drained, oil reserved) | 1 Cup black olives (sliced) | 1 piece lemon | red pepper flakes | Salt
instructions:
Boil a stockpot of water seasoned with salt and cook pasta according to package directions.
 | Meanwhile, peel and chop garlic cloves. Zest the lemon and cut into thin slivers. Set aside.
 | Heat the oil from the sardines and the olive oil in a large saute pan. Add garlic, olives, and then lemon zest, stirring after each addition. Add sardines and mash into the oil. Cut the zested lemon and squeeze the juice from one half into the sauce. Reserve the other half as garnish. | Drain pasta and toss with the sauce in the saute pan. Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes, if desired. Remove from heat and transfer to a plate. Top with a slice of lemon and serve immediately.
ingredient_names: whole wheat spaghetti | bulb garlic | olive oil | canned sardine in oil | black olive | lemon | red pepper flake

ingredients: 1 kilo pork ((use pork pata), sliced) | 1/2 teaspoon peppercorns | 3 pieces onion (peeled, quartered, divided) | 250 Grams chicken liver (chopped) | 1 piece finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (sliced) | 3 pieces siling labuyo (birds eye chili) (chopped, or to taste) | 1/3 Cup liquid seasoning (or to taste) | 2 tablespoons Calamansi Juice (or to taste) | black pepper | Oil (for frying)
instructions: Place pata in a pressure cooker. Add enough water to cover the meat. Add black peppercorns and 1 onion. Bring to a boil, removing scum as it rises to the top, and then seal. Lower flame and simmer 20 minutes or until tender. Release pressure before opening and remove pata from the stock. Let cool, and chop meat into small pieces. Discard bones, and reserve pork stock for another use. | Meanwhile, finely chop 1 onion, and quickly saute in a large saute pan over medium heat. Increase heat to high, add chicken livers, and stir fry until browned. | Add pata meat and season with liquid seasoning, calamansi juice, siling pangsigang and labuyo, and ground black pepper to taste. Chop remaining onion, and stir in until heated through before removing from heat. Immediately transfer to a plate and serve with more calamansi, liquid seasoning, sili, and rice.
ingredient_names: pork pata | peppercorn | chicken liver | finger chili | labuyo | liquid | calamansi juice

recipe_name: Three-Bean, Beef, and Tomato Soup Recipe
ingredients: 1 Cup pasta shells | 1 piece onion (peeled, sliced) | 2 cloves Garlic (peeled, sliced) | 250 Grams Beef (cut into small cubes) | 1/2 Cup garbanzo beans (canned, rinsed) | 1/2 Cup green peas (thawed) | 1/4 Cup Tomato sauce | 1 piece beef bouillon cube (dissolved in 4 cups water) | Salt | Oil (for sauteing)
instructions: In a large stockpot over high heat, bring about 2 liters water to a boil. Add pasta shells and cook for 7 minutes. Drain and set aside. | Meanwhile, in another stockpot over medium heat, heat oil and then saute garlic and onions until softened. Add beef and saute until cooked. Add garbanzos, green peas, and black beans, and cook until heated through. Add beef stock and tomato sauce, and bring to a boil. Add pasta shells and cook until al dente. Season with salt and ground black pepper to taste.
ingredient_names: pasta shell | cubes | garbanzo bean | green pea | tomato sauce | beef bouillon cube

ingredients: 1 large eggplant (chopped) | 1 Table Spoon green curry paste | 1 can coconut milk (gata) | 2 pieces kaffir lime leaf | 1 bundle long beans (sitaw) (trimmed) | 500 Grams Squid (Pusit) | Salt | Oil
instructions: In a large saute pan over medium heat, heat oil and pan fry eggplant until softened. Set aside. | In the same pan, add green curry paste and cook until aromatic. Pour in coconut milk and stir to dissolve paste into the milk. Add kaffir lime leaves and bring to a simmer. | Add in squid and green beans and cook until heated through. Return eggplant to the pan and stir to combine. Once heated through, remove from heat, and serve immediately with steamed rice.
ingredient_names: eggplant | table spoon green curry paste | coconut milk | kaffir lime leaf | long bean | squid

ingredients: 1 Table Spoon tamarind base powder (sinigang mix) | 1 1/2 cups water | 1 piece onion (peeled, quartered)
instructions: In a stockpot over low heat, dissolve the mix into the water. Bring to a boil and then lower heat to a simmer. Add onions then labanos, and simmer until just about cooked. Add in shrimps, and simmer again until just heated through. | Slowly pour in cornstarch mixture, stirring continuously to prevent lumps. Add in okra and strings beans, and cook until sauce thickens and vegetables are heated through. Spoon over steamed white rice and serve.
ingredient_names: table spoon tamarind base powder

ingredients: 1/4 Cup Butter | 3 cloves Garlic (chopped) | 1 kilo Prawns (Sugpo) (deveined, shelled, tails intact, if desired) | 2 tablespoons white wine | 3 tablespoons cream | 1 piece Egg (yolks only) | 1/4 teaspoon Cayenne pepper | Salt | Oil
instructions: In a large saute pan over medium heat, melt butter. Add a little oil to prevent burning. Lightly saute garlic and prawns in melted butter. Add white wine and simmer a few minutes before adding the cream. | Crumble in the cooked egg yolk and add to the pan to create a thickened sauce. Season with cayenne pepper, salt, and ground black pepper, to taste. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: butter | tail intact | white wine | cream | egg yolk | cayenne pepper

ingredients: 1 Table Spoon brown sugar | 1/2 Cup lemon-lime soda | 2 teaspoons Calamansi Juice | 1 teaspoon ground turmeric | 1/4 teaspoon Salt | 1/8  black pepper | 3 pieces boneless bangus (milkfish) | 1/2 Cup banana ketchup | 1 Table Spoon Oil | Oil
instructions: Make the Marinade: Mix the brown sugar, soda, calamansi juice, turmeric, salt, and ground black pepper in a bowl. Pour over boneless bangus, and let marinate for at least 15 minutes. | Heat 1?4 cup oil in a non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Drain marinade from bangus, slather on ketchup and oil on both sides, and place skin-side down into the hot oil. Fry until crispy, flip and cook the other side. Remove from heat and serve with steamed rice. Alternatively, fry fish first and then slather on ketchup mixture to avoid oil splatters.
ingredient_names: table spoon brown sugar | lemon lime soda | calamansi juice | turmeric | bangus | banana ketchup | table spoon oil

ingredients: 3 tablespoons Oil | 1 piece onion (chopped) | 6 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1/4 kilo chicken liver (cubed) | 1/2 kilo Chicken ((use fillet), cubed) | 1/4 kilo chicken gizzard (balunbalunan) (chopped) | 1 piece finger chilies (siling pangsigang) | 1/2 Cup water | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | 1 Cup Vinegar | 4 teaspoons patis (fish sauce)
instructions: In a large pot over medium heat, heat the oil, and sweat the onions until transparent. Add in the garlic, and saute until softened. Increase the heat to high, add in the chicken livers and cook until browned. Add in the chicken gizzards and fillets, and saute until cooked through. | Add the siling pangsigang, water, and ground black pepper. Stir to combine. Pour in the vinegar and cover without stirring. Bring to a boil, lower flame, and simmer until chicken pieces are tender and the liquid is reduced to half. Season with patis, and serve with steamed rice.
ingredient_names: chicken liver | chicken | chicken gizzard | finger chili

recipe_name: Black Pepper and Ginger Seared Tuna Recipe
ingredients: 4 tablespoons black pepper | 2 tablespoons ginger (peeled and finely grated) | 300 Grams sashimi-grade tuna (kept chilled) | Oil
instructions: Mix black pepper and ginger in a small bowl. Pat this mixture on all sides of the tuna. Set aside. | Over high heat, heat a non-stick pan with 2 tablespoons oil until almost smoking. Using tongs, place tuna in the searing hot pan and sear for about 2 seconds, or until the tuna side that's in the oil turns opaque. Turn the tuna on its other side and sear again for 2 seconds. Repeat until all sides have been seared in the hot oil. Immediately remove from heat. Let cool then refrigerate before slicing. | Make dipping sauce: Mix 3 tablespoons soy sauce and the juice of 1 calamansi. Place in a small bowl. Serve with the sliced seared tuna and a pat of wasabi, if desired.
ingredient_names: ginger | sashimi grade tuna

ingredients: 1 kilo Beef ((use sirloin), sliced thinly) | 5 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce | 3 tablespoons Garlic powder (minced) | 2 tablespoons sugar | 1/4 teaspoon Salt | 1/4 teaspoon black pepper | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil
instructions: In a bowl, combine soy sauce, Worcestershire, garlic, salt, pepper, and sugar and mix well. Marinate the beef in the mixture and keep it in the refrigerator for atleast 3 hours. | To cook, pre-heat the oil in a pan and brown the marinated beef until done. Serve with rice and fried egg (optional).
ingredient_names: sirloin | worcestershire sauce | garlic powder | vegetable oil

ingredients: 4 pieces chinese eggplant | 2 pieces Egg | 2 teaspoons Salt | 4 tablespoons cooking oil | 1/2 kilo pork (use ground pork) | 1 clove Garlic (minced)
instructions: Grill the eggplant until the color of its skin turns almost black. Let the eggplant cool for a while then peel off the skin. Set aside. | Saute the ground pork and garlic.
