Simmer until ground pork is cooked, season with salt, then set aside. | Place the eggplant on a flat surface and flatten using a fork. | Add 4 tablespoons of cooked ground pork in the middle of the eggplant. | Slide the eggplant and pork in a non-stick skillet. Add 1/4 of the egg mixture. | Fry the eggplant. Makes sure that both sides are cooked. Cook for 5 minutes on each side.
ingredient_names: chinese eggplant | egg | pork

recipe_name: Longganisa Hash with Tomato Scrambled Eggs
ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 1 large white onion (finely chopped) | 2 large Potatoes (diced) | Salt | 8 to 10 pieces longganisa (cooked and crumbled) | 6 pieces Egg | 2 large tomatoes (chopped) | 3 tablespoons Oil | 3 tablespoons Garlic (finely chopped) | 4 to 6 cups day-old rice
instructions:
In a skillet, heat oil then saute onions. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Stir in the cooked longganisa. Season with salt and pepper. | Beat the eggs then season with salt and pepper. | In the same skillet used for cooking the hash, heat more oil. Saute tomatoes until slightly soft. | Pour in the beaten eggs. Scramble until set. | For the garlic fried rice, heat oil in a wok. Lightly brown the garlic then add the rice. Stir-fry until fragrant. Season lightly with salt.
To serve, fill a plate with longganisa hash, scrambled eggs, and garlic fried rice. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: potato | longganisa | egg | tomato | day old rice

ingredients: 300 Grams white fish ((use fillets), sliced into 6 pieces) | Salt | 6 pieces taro leaves (dahon ng gabi) | 1 1/2 teaspoons vegetable oil | 1/2 medium onion (finely chopped) | 1 teaspoon ginger (grated) | 1 piece tomatoes (diced) | 1 piece finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (sliced diagonally) | 2 cups coconut milk (gata) (first press) | 1 Table Spoon crab fat paste (taba ng talangka) | fish sauce (patis) | 5 to 6 pieces Prawns (Sugpo) (peeled and deveined, with tails left on)
instructions: Season fish with salt and pepper; wrap in taro leaves. Set aside. | In a wok or frying pan, heat oil. Saute onions and ginger until fragrant. Add tomatoes and let cook until tender. Add finger chili. | Arrange fish packets over vegetables. Pour coconut milk and bring to a simmer. Add crab fat and mix well. Allow to cook until coconut milk has reduced to half. Season to taste with fish sauce and pepper. Add prawns and cook just until prawns turn pink. Transfer to a platter and serve hot.
ingredient_names: white fish | taro | vegetable oil | ginger | tomato | finger chili | coconut milk | table spoon crab fat paste | prawn

ingredients: rice | Nori (dried seaweed) | Cherry tomatoes | Cheese | Fish fingers | Tartar Sauce
instructions: Using a sandwich bag or cling wrap, mold rice into a triangular shape. | Cut strips of nori to make car details. | Cut 1 cherry tomato into two halves. Assemble the tomato halves as car wheels. Add cheese circles (use a straw or small circle cutter) for wheel details. | Serve with fish fingers and tartar sauce, with cherry tomatoes served as sides.
ingredient_names: rice | seaweed | cherry tomato | cheese | fish finger | tartar sauce

ingredients: white rice (steamed) | Nori (dried seaweed) (sheets) | Chicken Tinola | Cheese (sliced) | Cherry tomatoes
instructions: In a sandwich bag, roll half a cup of rice to make rice balls or "onigiri". Pack well then remove from bag. Set aside. Repeat and make another rice ball. | Cut two long and thin (about 1/2") strips of nori (dried seaweed) and wrap around rice ball once. Secure with mayo "glue". | Using a paring knife or a small heart cookie cutter, cut out two small hearts out of thinly-sliced tomato flesh. "Glue" on heads of rice balls. | Punch out four nori (dried seaweed) circles for eyes using a single hole puncher. Cut out two triangles out of cheese for the beaks. Put together face details on the onigiri balls. Punch out four circles out of tomato skin for cheek details. | Slice a piece of green papaya or sayote. Decorate to make it look like a chick. Nori (dried seaweed) can be used for eyes while cheese can be for the beak. | Assemble chicken and rice balls in box. Put papaya and malunggay in a separate silicon cup. Serve soup in an airtight container.
ingredient_names: white rice | seaweed | chicken tinola | cheese | cherry tomato

ingredients: 2 pieces Chicken (use fillets) | 3 tablespoons Cajun seasoning mix | 2 teaspoons vegetable oil | 3 tablespoons mayonnaise | 1/4 Table Spoon Garlic (minced) | 4 pieces Lettuce | 4 pieces Pandesal
instructions: Cut chicken breasts into 1-inch strips and place in a small bowl. Mix in Cajun seasoning and vegetable oil; let stand for 10 minutes. | Pan fry or grill chicken. | In a small bowl, mix mayonnaise and garlic. | Cutpandesalin half (you may opt to toast it); spread garlic mayonnaise on both sides. Lay a lettuce leaf on one side and put a generous amount of grilled chicken.
ingredient_names: chicken | cajun | vegetable oil | mayonnaise | table spoon garlic | lettuce | pandesal

ingredients: 1/2 kilo Chicken ((use fillets), with or without skin) | 6 tablespoons Vinegar | 4 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 1 piece bay leaf | 1/2 teaspoon peppercorns (crushed) | 3 cloves Garlic (finely chopped)
instructions: Marinate the chicken in a mixture of vinegar and soy sauce with the bay leaf, garlic, and peppercorns for at least 2 hours. | Drain the chicken. Put the marinade in a small pan and add 1/2 cup water. Simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt if needed. If you want a slightly thicker sauce, add some cornstarch dispersed in water. | Heat a grill over medium heat. Cook the chicken until completely done. Serve with theadobo sauce. TIP: Marinate and grill the chicken with the skin on to make the meat moist and flavorful. Just remove it after cooking so your dish has a lower fat content.
ingredient_names: chicken | bay leaf | peppercorn

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (chopped) | 2 pieces tomatoes (chopped) | 1/2 kilo pork (use ground pork) | 1 1/2 cups water | 2 medium Potatoes (diced) | 2 medium carrot (diced) | 1/2 Cup green peas | 1/2 Cup Tomato sauce | Salt
instructions: In a large pan, heat oil and saute garlic, onion, and tomatoes for a few minutes. Add ground pork, stir. Pour in water and cook for 20 minutes. | Add potatoes and carrots. Cook for 5 minutes. Add frozen peas, then stir in tomato sauce. Season with salt and pepper. Let simmer for 5 minutes. READ THESE: MORE GINILING RECIPES Pork Giniling with Pineapples Recipe Tortang Giniling Na Baboy Recipe
ingredient_names: tomato | pork | potato | carrot | green pea | tomato sauce

recipe_name: Cabbage Soup with Ground Pork Recipe
ingredients: 1 Table Spoon Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (minced) | 1 Table Spoon cooking oil | 1/4 kilo pork (use ground pork) | 5 cups pork stock | 1/2 head cabbage (cut into thin strips) | Salt | 1 Table Spoon Garlic (minced)
instructions: In a saucepan, lightly saute garlic and onion in cooking oil for a few minutes. Add pork and stir. Cook for about 8 minutes. | Add pork stock and bring to a boil. Cook for another 20 minutes in medium high heat. | Add green cabbage and cook for 5 minutes. Add pechay Baguio and cook for another two minutes. | Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle parsley then immediately turn off the heat.
ingredient_names: table spoon garlic | table spoon cooking oil | pork | pork stock | cabbage

ingredients: 2 pieces Chicken ((use breast part), cubed) | 1 large white onion (chopped) | 2 inches ginger (peeled and sliced) | 4 pieces sayote (chayote) (peeled, seed removed, quartered, chopped) | 1/4 Cup cream
instructions: In a stockpot over medium heat, heat 2 tablespoons oil. Add onions, and saute until soft and translucent. Add in the ginger and saute for another minute until aromatic. Season chicken with salt and ground black pepper and add to the hot pan. Panfry until cooked through. Remove from pan and set aside. | Pour in 6 cups of water to deglaze the pan. Add sayote and bring to a boil. Lower heat to simmer and cook until sayote is cooked through. Remove from heat. Remove and discard ginger. | Using a blender or food processor, puree sayote soup until smooth. Return to the pot and add cream. Heat through. Season with salt and ground white pepper to taste. Place chicken cubes in a bowl and ladle sayote soup over it. Sprinkle with chopped parsley and serve.
ingredient_names: breast part | ginger | sayote | cream

ingredients: 6 cloves Garlic (finely chopped) | 1 Table Spoon Spanish paprika (pimenton) | 500 Grams pork (cut into small cubes) | 1 Cup Vinegar | 1/2 teaspoon peppercorns
instructions: Mix all the ingredients in a large bowl. Let marinate overnight or at least 15 minutes. | In a large saute pan over medium heat, heat about 2 tablespoons oil. Drain pork cubes, reserving marinade, and add to the pan, searing all sides. Add the marinade and 1 cup water. Bring to a boil, lower flame to simmer, cover, and cook until pork is tender. | Once tender, reduce any liquid. Season with salt to taste. Remove from heat and serve with garlic rice or with garlic bread.
ingredient_names: table spoon spanish paprika | cubes | peppercorn

ingredients: 2 packs silken tofu | 1/4 kilo pork (use ground pork) | Salt | 1 1/2 tablespoons Flour | 1 Table Spoon Oil | 1 packet Mapo Tofu Mix | 2 pieces red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (finely chopped) | 1/2 Cup green onion (chopped)
instructions: Gently slice the bean curd or silken tofu into small cubes. Set aside. | Season ground pork with salt and pepper. Sprinkle flour onto the pork and mix well. | In a pan, heat oil and saute ground pork, about 15 minutes or until just cooked through. | Add mapo tofu mix and stir well, making sure the ground pork is well coated with the sauce. | Add the sliced tofu and it let simmer for a couple of minutes. Stir, being careful not to break the tofu. Add chili and green onions. Heat through, and serve hot.
ingredient_names: tofu | pork | flour | table spoon oil | mapo tofu mix | red chili pepper | green onion

ingredients: 1/2 kilo Prawns (Sugpo) | 1 Table Spoon Oil | 2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 1 Pack tomato garlic prawns sauce mix
instructions: Wash the prawns, and cut off the feelers (antennae) with kitchen shears. Place them in a large strainer to drain off water. Set aside. | Heat oil in a pan. Saute the garlic until it's golden brown. | Add prawns, and pan-fry on medium-high heat until they turn orange in color, which should take about 5 minutes. Turn the heat to medium low. Add the tomato garlic prawns sauce; stir.Cook for about 3 minutes more, or until heated through. | Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: prawn | table spoon oil | tomato garlic prawns sauce mix

ingredients: 6 pieces banana (saba variety) | 1 Cup brown sugar | 2 cups water | 1/2 Cup Sago (Tapioca) | 3 cups water | 2 stalks pandan leaf | 1 1/2 cups Canned Gata
instructions:
Make the sweetened bananas: slice each banana into 3 pieces.In a medium saucepan, combine sugar and water. Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally until sugar dissolves. | Add bananas and return to a boil then lower heat. Simmer until bananas are tender, and liquid reduces to a thick, syrupy consistency. | In a separate casserole, boilsagowith pandan and water until cooked. Wash offsagowith clean water.
 | To serve, place 3 bananas, a tablespoon ofsago, and some syrup in individual dessert bowls. Add crushed ice and pourgataon top.
ingredient_names: banana | brown sugar | sago | pandan leaf | coconut milk

ingredients: 1 kilo pasta noodles | 2 kilos tomatoes | 3 cups olive oil | 50 Grams Garlic (chopped) | rock salt | 2 pieces laurel leaf (whole) | Pepper | 1 kilo tulingan | water | 1 Cup kamias | Salt
instructions: Cook pasta according to package directions. | To make the pasta sauce: Boil ingredients for 1 hour on low fire (The cooks recommend that you use the traditional wood-fired kalan, so that heat is easily controlled.). | To make the Sinaing na Tulingan: In a large pot, boil tulingan in water, kamias, and salt. You'll know it's ready when the bones are very soft and have almost disappeared. | Remove fish from the pot and place on a hot grill to dry. Let cool, then flake the fish. | Pour the pasta sauce over noodles. Sprinkle with flaked tulingan on top before serving.
ingredient_names: pasta noodle | tomato | olive oil | rock salt | laurel leaf | tulingan | kamias

ingredients: 1/2 kilo Chicken (use fillets) | 1/4 Cup Worcestershire sauce | 2 tablespoons liquid seasoning | 1 tablespoon Knorr SavorRich Chicken | 3 tablespoons Garlic (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Calamansi Juice | Salt
instructions: Marinate the chicken in a mixture of Worcestershire sauce, liquid seasoning, Knorr SavorRich Chicken, garlic, calamansi, and salt for at least 15 minutes or longer. | Grill or pan-fry until done. Serve with blanched mixed vegetables and rice.
ingredient_names: chicken | worcestershire sauce | liquid | calamansi juice

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1 medium yellow onion (sliced) | 3 medium tomatoes (quartered) | 1/2 Cup miso (soybean paste) | 2 pieces milkfish (bangus) (cleaned and sliced) | 1 Pack Tamarind Soup Mix | 2 1/2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 6 cups water | Salt | 2 pieces long green chilies (siling pangsigang) | 1 bunch Mustard Leaves (Mustasa)
instructions:
Saute the onion in cooking oil. Add the tomatoes and miso paste. | Let it cook for 2 minutes.
 | Add the milkfish and the water, and the tamarind soup base and bring to a boil. | Season with salt and fish sauce. Let it simmer for 15 minutes. | Add the mustard leaves and green chilies before serving.
ingredient_names: tomato | miso | milkfish | tamarind soup mix | long green chily | mustard leave

ingredients: 1/2 kilo pork (use ground pork) | 1/3 Cup pickle relish | 6 slices ham (minced) | 1/4 Cup raisins | 3 pieces Egg | 1/2 Cup Cheese (grated) | 2 tablespoons red bell pepper (chopped) | 1/4 Cup carrot (finely chopped) | Pepper
instructions:
In bowl, combine all ingredients and mix until well blended. | Divide the mixture into four. Place a tin foil on a flat surface. Place one part of the pork mixture and put it on the bottom part of the foil. Form the pork mixture into a log. | Roll tightly and seal the ends. | Repeat with the remaining pork mixture. Place wrapped pork logs in a steamer and cook for 30 minutes.
 | Allow the embotido to cool and keep in the freezer. To serve, slice the embotido on a diagonal and pan-fry each slice.
ingredient_names: pork | pickle relish | ham | raisin | egg | cheese | bell pepper | carrot

ingredients: 1 1/2 tablespoons Garlic powder | 1/4 Cup Calamansi Juice | 1/2 kilo Beef ((use lean beef), sliced thinly) | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis) | 3/4 Cup water | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | Oil (for frying) | 1 large onion (cut into large rings)
instructions: Sprinkle meat with garlic powder. Combine calamansi juice and fish sauce. Pour over meat and marinate for 3 hours or overnight. | Heat a few tablespoons of oil in a frying pan. Shake off excess marinade from meat and pan-fry in batches. Cook meat for a few minutes on both sides. | Return all of the meat into the pan. Add water to the leftover marinade and pour onto the meat. Cover. Simmer for half an hour or until meat is tender. | Stir in soy sauce. Add onions and cook for another couple of minutes. Squeeze the juice of one or two calamansi before removing from heat.
ingredient_names: garlic powder | calamansi juice | lean beef

ingredients: 1 whole Chicken (cut into serving pieces) | 1/2 piece green papaya (cut into wedges) | 3 cups water | 1 Table Spoon Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (minced) | 1 thumb ginger (cut into strips) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | Salt
instructions:
Saute the garlic, onion, and ginger. | Put in the chicken and cook until color turns light brown.
 | Add the fish sauce and mix well. | Pour the water andsimmer for 30 minutes. | Add the green papaya / sayote wedges and simmer for 5 minutes. | Add the hot pepper leaves. | Season with salt and pepper.
ingredient_names: whole chicken | green papaya | table spoon garlic | thumb ginger

ingredients: 5 cups water | 1/2 kilo Pork belly | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 1/2 kilo tofu | cooking oil (for frying) | 1 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 4 tablespoons sugar | Salt (to taste) | 1 medium red onion (diced) | 2 pieces green finger chilies (siling mahaba) (sliced)
instructions:
In a pot,boil liempountil meat is tender. Season with salt and pepper. | In a separate wok, fry the tofu one by one until golden brown. | Cut the fried tofu into cubes and slice the pork belly into bite-sized pieces then set aside. | Combine the sugar, salt, soy sauce, and vinegar in bowl. Simmer in a small pot and add 1 cup of the water used from cooking pork belly. Take away from heat and set aside. | Add the onions and chili pepper. Add the cooked pork belly and let it simmer until the meat has absorbed the sauce.
 | Arrange the pork belly in a container and add the tofu. Drizzle some of the soy sauce mixture on top, if desired.
ingredient_names: pork | tofu | green finger chili

recipe_name: Baked Oysters with Kesong Puti and Tinapa Flakes Recipe
ingredients: 1 Table Spoon salted butter | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 1/2 cups pechay leaves (sliced thinly) | 8 large Oysters (shucked and left on a half shell) | 100 Grams kesong puti (white cheese) | 1 piece smoked galunggong (tinapang galunggong) (flaked lemon wedges, to serve)
instructions:
Preheat oven to 400?F. | In a pan, melt butter and saute garlic until lightly browned. Add pechay and season with pepper. Do not season with salt. Set aside.
  | Arrange oysters on a cookie sheet. | Divide sauteed pechay evenly on the oysters. Top with kesong puti and sprinkle tinapa flakes over cheese. | Bake in the oven for 7 minutes or until cheese ha melted. | Serve immediately over a bed of salt with lemon wedges on the side.
ingredient_names: table spoon | pechay leave | a half shell | kesong puti | smoked galunggong

ingredients: 1 to 1.3 kilo pork (use leg (pata)) | 4 tablespoons Salt | 4 pieces bay leaf | water (for boiling) | cooking oil | 2 cloves Garlic | 1 1/2 tablespoons Butter | 1 piece finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (sliced) | 1 piece siling labuyo (bird's eye chili) (sliced)
instructions: Boil pata with salt and bayleaf over low heat for 2 hour or until meat is tender. Drain and pat-dry. | Deep-fry in hot oil until golden brown and crispy, about 10 to 15 minutes. Make sure the pata is fully submerged in oil. Set aside. | Saute garlic in butter. Add chilies. Set aside 1/2 garlic mixture once golden brown. | Place the pata in the same wok and toss in garlic mixture. | Place pata on a serving plate and garnish with reserved garlic mixture.
ingredient_names: pork | bay leaf | butter | finger chili | labuyo

ingredients: 1 kilo pork ((use sliced pork knuckles), cleaned) | 3/4 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | 20 whole peppercorns | 1 head Garlic (crushed) | 1/2 Cup brown sugar | 1/4 Cup canola oil | 1 1/2 cups water | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 2 small packs woodear mushrooms (tengang daga) | 2 small packs Banana Blossoms (Puso ng saging)
instructions:
Marinate pork knuckles in a mixture of vinegar, soy sauce, peppercorns, and garlic for 1 hour. | Place the brown sugar on a plate. Coat each pork piece with brown sugar then pan-fry in oil over medium heat until golden brown. Set aside. | In the same pan used for frying, put back all the meat and pour in the marinade and the water. Bring to a boil then lower heat and simmer until meat is tender. After 45 minutes of simmering, the sauce will start to thicken. Add salt and simmer for another 10 minutes. | In separate bowls, soak mushrooms and banana blossoms in water for 15 minutes. Once softened add to the cooking pot. Continue cooking until meat is very tender and sauce is thick.
Other cooks prefer usingsababananas instead of banana blossoms. You can add it whenpatais almost done and let it cook until tender.
ingredient_names: pork knuckle | whole peppercorn | brown sugar | canola oil | woodear mushroom | banana blossom

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 1/2 Cup onion (chopped) | 1 Table Spoon Garlic (minced) | 2 tablespoons ginger (sliced thinly) | 200 Grams pork ((use pork tenderloin), cut into thin strips) | 100 Grams pork liver (cut into thin strips) | 8 cups water | 3 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 1/2 tablespoon Pepper | 1 teaspoon Salt | 3 rolls misua (fine rice noodles) | 1/4 Cup pepper leaves (dahon ng sili)
instructions:
In a pot, heat oil then saute onion, garlic, and ginger. Add pork tenderloin and cook until lightly browned. Transfer pork to a plate.
 | In the same pan, saute liver until cooked. | Pour in water then add bouillon, patis, pepper, and salt. Bring to a boil then simmer for 10 minutes. | Add back the pork then the misua. Turn off heat and add dahon ng sili. Cover and set aside for about 5 minutes before serving.
ingredient_names: table spoon garlic | ginger | pork | pork liver | rolls misua

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Oil | 3 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 250 Grams pork ((use kasim), boiled and sliced thinly) | 6 pieces Shrimp (peeled) | 1/2 Cup celery (sliced thinly) | 3 cups cabbage (cubed) | 1 Cup carrot (sliced) | 1 Cup Baguio beans (abitsuelas) (sliced) | 1 Cup snow peas (sitsaro) | 3 tablespoons oyster sauce | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon Pepper | 2 tablespoons cornstarch | 1 tablespoon sesame oil | 500 Grams pancit canton noodles
instructions:
Heat oil then saute 1 tablespoon garlic and pork. Add shrimps and cook until color changes. Transfer to a plate. | In the same pan, saute the celery, cabbage, carrots, beans, and sitsaro. Transfer to a bowl. | Add more oil to the pan then saute onions and remaining 2 tablespoons garlic. Pour in broth. Season with oyster sauce, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 5 minutes. Thicken with cornstarch dispersed in water. Add sesame oil.
 | Add canton noodles to the pan and cook until noodles are tender but not soggy. Add the sauteed pork and vegetables. Toss lightly and serve.
ingredient_names: kasim | shrimp | celery | cabbage | carrot | baguio bean | snow pea | oyster sauce | cornstarch | sesame oil | pancit canton noodle

ingredients: 3 cups all-purpose flour | 1/2 teaspoon Salt | 1 Cup Butter (diced) | 4 tablespoons water (ice-cold) | 2 tablespoons Oil | 1/2 Cup onion (chopped) | 1 Table Spoon Garlic (minced) | 500 Grams Chicken ((use skinned chicken breast fillets), cut into 1-inch cubes) | 1 Cup chorizo de bibao (cubed) | 2 cups carrot (cubed) | 3 cups Potatoes (cubed) | 3 cups Tomato sauce | 1 cube chicken bouillon cube | Salt | 1/2 Cup water chestnuts (halved) | 1/2 Cup button mushrooms (halved) | 1/2 Cup frozen peas | 3/4 Cup Cheese (cubed)
instructions:
For the crust: Combine fl our and salt in a bowl. Cut in the butter until you form coarse crumbs. Add water gradually and gently mix to form a dough. Lightly knead into a ball. | Wrap dough in plastic and chill for 30 minutes before rolling out. | For the filling: Heat oil in a saucepan then saute onions and garlic. Add chicken and cook until half-done.
 | Add chorizo, carrots, and potatoes. Pour in tomato sauce and simmer until vegetables are half-cooked. Season with bouillon cube, salt, and pepper.
 | Add water chestnuts, mushrooms, and peas. Simmer for a few minutes. Stir in cheese. Remove from heat. | Pour chicken mixture into a deep baking dish. | Thaw dough then roll out to a size that will fit over the baking dish. Cover and pinch the edges to seal. Prick dough with a fork to allow steam to escape during baking. | Brush dough with eggwash (beat 1 egg with 1 tablespoon milk) and bake in a preheated 375 degrees oven until golden brown.

TIP:Eggwash, a mixture of beaten egg and milk or egg and water, is used to brush over pastry or bread dough before baking to create a golden brown crust with a lovely sheen. Make sure to brush it evenly to have a uniform browned surface.
ingredient_names: all purpose flour | butter | table spoon garlic | skinned chicken breast fillet | chorizo | carrot | potato | tomato sauce | chicken bouillon cube | water chestnut | button mushroom | pea | cheese

ingredients: 165 Grams rice noodles | 2 blocks firm tofu (tokwa) | 1 Pack Ginataang Gulay Mix | 1 Cup water | 8 medium Shrimp (cleaned)
instructions: Cook rice noodles according to package directions; set aside. | Slice firm tofu into small squares. Deep-fry tofu until golden; set aside. | Combine Knorr Ginataang Gulay mix and water in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until dissolved, then bring to a simmer. Add shrimp; cook until orange-pink in color. Remove from heat and stir in cooked rice noodles. Transfer to serving bowls and top with fried tofu.
ingredient_names: rice noodle | blocks | ginataang gulay mix | shrimp

ingredients: 200 Grams vermicelli (sotanghon) noodles | cooking oil | 400 Grams Chicken ((use breast part), sliced) | 1 liter water | 2 cubed chicken bouillon cube | Salt | 1/2 Cup malunggay leaves (moringa)
instructions: Soak vermicelli noodles (sotanghon) in warm water until soft, about 10 minutes; drain and set aside. | Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Cook sliced chicken breast until meat turns white. Add water and Knorr chicken cubes. Mix until cubes dissolve, cover, and bring to a boil. | Season with salt and pepper. Add sotanghon and malunggay leaves, cover for 1 minute, and remove from heat. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: vermicelli noodle | breast part | chicken bouillon cube | malunggay

recipe_name: Paprika Prawns, Pineapple Barbecue Chicken, and Tarragon-Pepper Liempo with Olive Rice
ingredients: 2 teaspoons smoked paprika | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1 teaspoon Pepper | fresh parsley | 2 tablespoons olive oil | 6 pieces Tiger Prawns (Sugpo) (cleaned, deveined, and peeled with heads and tails left on) | 200 Grams fresh pineapple chunks | 1 Cup Barbecue marinade | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | Pepper | 1/2 kilo Chicken (use chicken thighs) | 2 teaspoons Salt | 2 teaspoons Pepper | 2 teaspoons fresh tarragon leaves (chopped) | 1/2 kilo pork (use pork belly) | olive oil | 200 Grams black olives (minced) | 6 cups white rice | Pepper | fresh parsley
instructions:
Prepare the prawns: In a food processor, blend smoked paprika, salt, pepper, parsley, and olive oil together. Place prawns in a bowl then pour marinade over. Refrigerate until ready to use. | Prepare the chicken: In a food processor, blend together pineapple, barbecue marinade, soy sauce, salt, and pepper. Transfer to a large bowl. Add chicken pieces and marinate for at least 45 minutes. Refrigerate until ready to use. | Prepare the pork: In a large bowl, combine salt, pepper, and tarragon. Add pork belly and marinate for at least 45 minutes. Refrigerate until ready to use. | Preheat barbecue grill to medium heat. | Make the olive rice: Heat olive oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Saute black olives and toss in rice. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Keep warm until ready to serve. | Working in batches, grill chicken and pork over medium heat for about 6 to 8 minutes on each side or until thoroughly cooked. | Grill prawns for about 2 to 3 minutes on each side or just until they turn pink and are cooked through.
 | Transfer chicken, pork, and prawns to a platter. Serve with olive rice.
ingredient_names: smoked paprika | parsley | olive oil | tiger prawn | pineapple chunk | barbecue marinade | chicken | tarragon leave | pork | black olive | white rice

ingredients: 1 block tofu (tokwa) | 1/2 Cup water (warm) | 1/3 Cup coconut sugar | 4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/4 Cup orange juice | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 2 teaspoons ginger (grated) | sesame oil | vegetable oil
instructions: Slice a block of tofu into 8 slabs. Blot well with paper towels to remove excess moisture. Place tofu in a container. | Whisk together warm water and muscovado or coconut sugar in a bowl until dissolved. Stir in minced garlic, pineapple or orange juice, soy sauce, and grated ginger. | Pour marinade over tofu; chill for at least 1 hour or up to 1 week in the refrigerator. | Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Remove tofu from the marinade and brush with sesame oil. Place on a baking dish and pour a spoonful of marinade over each slice. Bake for 25 minutes, flipping tofu halfway through and spooning more marinade over it. Alternatively, pan-fry tofu in some vegetable oil over medium heat until browned and slightly crisp.
ingredient_names: block tofu | coconut sugar | orange juice | ginger | sesame oil | vegetable oil

ingredients: 2 cups water | 1 Cup mung bean sprouts (togue) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1/2 kilo pork (cut into strips or cubed) | 3-4 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (sliced) | 2 medium tomatoes (sliced) | 1 Cup Ampalaya (Bittermelon) (leaves) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) (to taste)
instructions:
Rinse the mung beans in running water.
 | In a pan, boil mung beans in 2 1/2 cups water. Cook until tender. | In another pan, heat the vegetable oil and saute the pork. Render the fat from the pork. | Add the garlic, onion and tomatoes. | Season with fish sauce. Cook for few minutes. | Add the cooked mung beans together with the water. | Add bittermelon leaves and cook for 5 minutes.
ingredient_names: mung bean sprout | vegetable oil | pork | tomato | ampalaya

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Vegetable Oil | 1/2 kilo Pork Heart | 1/2 kilo Pork Lungs | 7 cloves Garlic | 1 large Red Onion | 4 pieces Bay leaf | 1 large Bell Pepper | 1 tablespoon Siling Labuyo (Bird's Eye Chili) | 2 stalks Lemongrass (Tanglad) | 3-5 pieces Pandan Leaf | 2 cups Vinegar | 1 Cup Water | 1 teaspoon Fish Sauce (Patis) | Black Pepper | Red Chili Pepper
instructions:
In large pot, add pork heart and lungs, lemongrass, pandan leaves, 1 cup of vinegar, 1 tablespoon salt and enough water to cover the meat. | Bring to a boil and cook for 20 minutes.
 | Remove meat, let it cool down then dice the pork finely. Set aside. | In a heavy pan, heat oil and saute garlic and onions.
 | Add the chopped pork lungs and heart, siling labuyo, stir fry for 3 minutes. | Add bell pepper, 1 cup of vinegar and water, bring to a boil and simmer in high heat until sauce thickens. | Add annatto water then season with fish sauce and lots of freshly ground black pepper.
 | Simmer for 2 minutes then place in a serving dish and garnish with red chili pepper.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | pork heart | pork lung | bay leaf | bell pepper | labuyo | lemongrass | pandan leaf | sauce | red chili pepper

ingredients: 2 tablespoons cooking oil | 1/2 kilo pork (cut into small pieces) | 3 cloves Garlic | 2 pieces ginger (thinly-sliced) | 1 large onion (sliced) | 2 large tomatoes (quartered) | 4 pieces eggplant | 2 pieces bitter melon (ampalaya) (cut in half) | 1/2 bundle string beans (sitaw) (cut into 2 inch length) | 8 pieces okra (cut in half) | 1 1/2 Cup water | 1/2 Cup anchovy sauce (bagoong isda)
instructions:
Saute pork in a preheated pot with cooking oil. Render the fat then add garlic, ginger and onion. | Put in the anchovy sauce and wait for the mixture to boil.
 | Add the vegetables: okra, bitter melon, eggplant, string beans, and tomatoes. | Cover the pot and let it simmer for 15 minutes.
ingredient_names: pork | ginger | tomato | eggplant | bitter melon | sitaw | okra | anchovy sauce

ingredients: water | 1 kilo Pork Jowl (Face) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 large onion (minced) | 3 cloves Garlic | 1  ginger (minced) | 3 pieces finger chilies (siling pangsigang) | 3 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 3-5 pieces calamansi | 1/4 kilo chicken liver | Salt | black pepper
instructions: In a big pot, place water and bring it to a boil. Water should be enough to cover the meat. Place pig's ears and pork jowl (or pork belly) then simmer for 40 minutes to 1 hour (or until tender). Season with salt and pepper. | Remove the boiled ingredients from the pot then drain excess water. | Grill the boiled pig's ears and pork jowl (or pork belly) until cooked. | Chop the pig ears and pork belly into diced pieces. | In a wide pan, heat the oil. Add the onions and cook until translucent. | Add the ginger, garlic and green finger chilies and saute. | Add the pig brains or chicken liver. Mash the chicken liver while cooking it in the pan. | Add the chopped pig ears and pork belly. Cook for 10 to 12 minutes. | Season with soy sauce, salt and pepper. | Transfer to a serving plate. Top with chopped green finger chilies. | Serve hot or serve on a hot sizzling plate.TIP: If you are serving sisig on a sizzling plate, you can add raw egg on top.
ingredient_names: pork | vegetable oil | ginger | finger chili | calamansi | chicken liver

ingredients: 1 1/2 kilos Chicken | 12 cups water | 1  onion | 3  celery | 2  chicken bouillon cube | 1/2 kilo Beef ((use kalitiran), sliced into chunks) | 1 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 150 Grams ham (cubed) | 1/2 kilo pork ((use pork pigue), sliced into chunks) | 1  Ham Bone | 1/2 kilo Potatoes (peeled and cubed) | 400 Grams white beans | 2 cups chickpeas (garbanzos) | 1 Cup canned water chestnuts | 1 tablespoon peppercorns | Salt | 1 tablespoon olive oil | 1  Garlic (peeled and minced) | 300 Grams onion (sliced thinly) | 3 pieces chorizo de bibao (sliced into rounds) | 1 piece chorizo pamplona (sliced into rounds) | 2 pieces chorizo Macau (Chinese chorizo) (sliced into rounds) | 2 tablespoons tomato paste | 2  cabbage (thinly sliced) | 100 Grams long beans (sitaw) (sliced into 2-inch pieces) | 2 tablespoons liquid seasoning | 1 Cup chestnuts (peeled) | 250 Grams pechay Tagalog (cut into 2-inch pieces)
instructions: Debone chicken and slice meat into cubes; set aside. reserve bones and trimmings for broth. | Prepare the chicken broth: combine water, onion, celery, reserved chicken bones and trimmings, and bouillon cubes in a casserole. Simmer for 45 minutes. | Heat oil in a pan and saute beef chunks. Add ham and cook until golden. Pour off rendered fat; set ham and beef aside. | Add rendered fat to a stockpot. Saute pork chunks until golden. Add 10 cups strained chicken broth and bring to a boil. Add beef, ham, and ham bone. Boil gently until meat becomes tender. When done, add chicken pieces and continue simmering. | While broth is simmering, add potatoes. When potatoes are cooked, add beans, chickpeas, and water chestnuts. Add peppercorns and season with salt to taste. Continue simmering. | Heat olive oil in another pan and saute garlic. When garlic is golden, add onions. Add chorizo slices and fry until golden. Stir in tomato paste. | Add chorizo mixture, including oil, to the simmering broth in the stockpot. | Add sliced cabbage and green beans. Continue simmering over low heat. Add liquid seasoning. | Add castaas and pechay Tagalog. do not overcook. Ladle soup into bowls and serve hot.
ingredient_names: chicken | celery | chicken bouillon cube | kalitiran | vegetable oil | ham | pork pigue | bone | potato | white bean | chickpea | water chestnut | peppercorn | olive oil | chorizo | chorizo pamplona | chorizo macau | tomato paste | cabbage | long bean | liquid | chestnut | pechay tagalog

ingredients: 500 Grams boneless bangus  (milkfish) ((use belly fillet), sliced into 6 pieces) | 4 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 tablespoon Soy Sauce | 1/2 Cup all-purpose flour | vegetable oil (for frying) | 2 cups dashi | 1 1/2  white onion (sliced) | 4 tablespoons mirin (japanese sweet rice wine) | 3 tablespoons brown sugar | 1 teaspoon sake (japanese rice wine) | 6 cups Japanese rice | 3 teaspoons Nanami Togarashi | 2 tablespoons Pickled Red Ginger Strips (Benishoga)  (for garnish) | Nori (dried seaweed) (for garnish)
instructions: Marinatebangusincalamansijuice and 1 tablespoon light soy sauce for 30 minutes. | Dredge eachbangusfillet in flour. heat oil in a frying pan and sear each side of the fillet over high heat, about 1 minute per side. | Combine dashi, onions, remaining light soy sauce, mirin, sugar, and sake in a medium saucepan. Simmer sauce for 3 to 5 minutes. | Addbangusbelly fillet and continue to simmer over low heat for 5 to 7 minutes. Remove from heat. | Arrange hot Japanese rice in 6 individual bowls. Sprinkle each bowl with 1/2 teaspoon nanami togarashi. Spoon sauce over the rice. | Top withbangusbelly and drizzle with 1 tablespoon sauce. Repeat to make a total of 6 bowls. Garnish with pickled ginger and nori.
ingredient_names: belly fillet | calamansi juice | all purpose flour | vegetable oil | dashi | mirin | brown sugar | sake | japanese rice | nanami togarashi | red ginger strips | seaweed

ingredients: 1 (400-gram) piece boneless bangus (milkfish) (pan-fried and flaked) | 1 medium red onion (minced) | 5 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1/4 Cup carrot (minced) | 1/2 Cup malunggay leaves (moringa) | 1/8 Cup cilantro (wansoy) (chopped) | 1 large Egg | Salt (to taste) | 12  lumpia wrapper | vegetable oil (for frying)
instructions: Combine bangus, onion, garlic, carrots, malunggay, cilantro, and egg in a bowl. mix until well combined. season with salt and pepper. | Lay a lumpia wrapper on a flat surface. Place bangus mixture in the center of a wrapper. Fold sides in, and roll up bottom of the wrapper tightly. Dab the edge of the wrapper with water to seal. repeat to make 12 rolls. | Heat oil in a large pot. Deep-fry lumpia until golden brown. Place on a wire rack to drain excess oil. serve hot.
ingredient_names: bangus | carrot | malunggay | cilantro | egg | lumpia wrapper | vegetable oil

ingredients: 5 cups fish stock | 2 tablespoons curry paste | 3 tablespoons tamarind powder | 1  boneless bangus (milkfish) (scaled, gutted, and sliced into 3 pieces) | 8 pieces Shrimp (shelled and deveined with tails intact) | 1  radish (labanos) (peeled and sliced diagonally) | 6 pieces yard-long beans (sitaw) (sliced into 2-inch lengths) | fish sauce (patis) | 1 small bunch kangkong (water spinach) leaves (washed and trimmed)
instructions: Bring stock or water to a boil in a large stockpot. Add 1 to 2 tablespoons kang som curry paste (depending on the intensity of heat preferred) and tamarind powder. Lower heat to a simmer. | Add fish and cook for a few minutes. Add shrimp, radish, and yardlong beans. Cook just until shrimp turns pink and vegetables are tender. Season to taste with fish sauce and sugar. Add water spinach and turn off heat. | Transfer to a serving bowl and serve hot.
ingredient_names: fish stock | curry paste | tamarind powder | bangus | tail intact | radish | sitaw | kangkong

ingredients: 1/4 Cup olive oil | 1  onion (diced) | 1  Garlic (diced) | 1  celery (diced) | 1  red bell pepper (diced) | 1 Cup bottled crab fat (taba ng talangka) | 1 1/2 cups short-grain rice | 3 cups seafood stock | 4  crab (alimango) ((use crab claws), cracked) | 150 Grams Squid (Pusit) (cut into rings) | 6 pieces Prawns (Sugpo) (deveined and shelled with heads removed) | Oil (for frying) | 1/3 Cup fresh basil leaves | 200 Grams fresh crab meat | lime wedges
instructions: Add olive oil to a 12-inch paella pan set over low heat. Saute onions, garlic, celery, bell pepper, and taba ng talangka until well incorporated. | Add rice and stir to thoroughly coat each grain with the mixture. | Add stock. Using a wooden spoon, stir rice so that it is distributed evenly in the pan. Add crab claws, squid rings, and prawns. Simmer for 15 minutes. | Using another pan, fry basil leaves until crispy and translucent. Drain on paper towels. Set aside. | Check the paella. The rice is cooked when each grain is plump and has absorbed the stock. Taste the rice to check if it needs more seasoning. If the rice needs to be cooked longer, add about 1/2 cup stock to hasten the cooking, making sure to use very low heat. | Pile crab meat in the center of the paella. Garnish with fried basil. Serve with lime wedges on the side.
ingredient_names: olive oil | celery | bell pepper | crab fat | short grain rice | seafood stock | crab | squid | prawn | basil leave | crab meat | lime wedge

ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 5 cups rice (cooked) | 1 1/2 cups longganisa ((crumbled), cooked until brown) | 2 teaspoons Vinegar | Salt | 1/2 Cup onion (chopped) | 1 Cup tomatoes (chopped) | 3  Salted Egg (itlog na maalat) (diced)
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or pan. Add garlic and saute until fragrant but not brown. Add rice and longganisa. Toss to mix well. Drizzle with vinegar and season to taste. | Transfer to a serving bowl and top with onions, tomatoes, and salted egg.
ingredient_names: olive oil | rice | longganisa | tomato | egg

ingredients: 1/4 Cup cooking oil | 500 Grams Beef ((use brisket), cubed) | 3 cloves Garlic (crushed and chopped) | 1 piece onion (finely chopped) | 3 cups water | Salt (to season) | Pepper (to season) | 2 large bay leaf | 1/2 Cup Tomato sauce | 1/4 Cup liver spread | 1/2 Cup green olives | 1 Cup carrot (diced) | 1/2 Cup red bell pepper (diced) | 1/2 teaspoon red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (crushed) | 250 Grams penne noodles (uncooked) | 1 1/2 cups cheddar cheese (grated)
instructions: Make the kaldereta: Heat cooking oil in a large pot. When the oil is hot, add beef and quickly sear. Set aside. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. Add beef back to the pan. Add water, salt, pepper, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil and cook until beef is tender, about 2 hours. (You can also use a pressure cooker to cut down cooking time.) Add tomato sauce and liver spread; simmer for 15 minutes. Add green olives, carrots, bell peppers, and chilies. Simmer for 5 more minutes. Season to taste. | Prepare the pasta: Remove the beef from the kaldereta mixture. Shred or cut into small cubes. Toss together beef, uncooked penne, and enough kaldereta sauce to cover the pasta. If the sauce is not enough, add water or stock. | Bake in a preheated 325 degrees oven for 40 minutes until sauce is absorbed and penne is al dente. Remove from the oven and top with cheddar cheese. Bake for a few more minutes until cheese is golden brown and bubbly. Tip: No oven? No problem! you can BAKE this dish in a turbo broiler. divide among 2 8x8-inch pans, COVER IN FOIL, and bake at 300 degrees for 20 minutes. REMOVE FOIL and bake for another 10 minutes to brown the top and melt the cheese. | Make the kaldereta: Heat cooking oil in a large pot. When the oil is hot, add beef and quickly sear. Set aside. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. Add beef back to the pan. Add water, salt, pepper, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil and cook until beef is tender, about 2 hours. (You can also use a pressure cooker to cut down cooking time.) Add tomato sauce and liver spread; simmer for 15 minutes. Add green olives, carrots, bell peppers, and chilies. Simmer for 5 more minutes. Season to taste. | Prepare the pasta: Remove the beef from the kaldereta mixture. Shred or cut into small cubes. Toss together beef, uncooked penne, and enough kaldereta sauce to cover the pasta. If the sauce is not enough, add water or stock. | Bake in a preheated 325 degrees oven for 40 minutes until sauce is absorbed and penne is al dente. Remove from the oven and top with cheddar cheese. Bake for a few more minutes until cheese is golden brown and bubbly. Tip: No oven? No problem! you can BAKE this dish in a turbo broiler. divide among 2 8x8-inch pans, COVER IN FOIL, and bake at 300 degrees for 20 minutes. REMOVE FOIL and bake for another 10 minutes to brown the top and melt the cheese. | Make the kaldereta: Heat cooking oil in a large pot. When the oil is hot, add beef and quickly sear. Set aside. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. Add beef back to the pan. Add water, salt, pepper, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil and cook until beef is tender, about 2 hours. (You can also use a pressure cooker to cut down cooking time.) Add tomato sauce and liver spread; simmer for 15 minutes. Add green olives, carrots, bell peppers, and chilies. Simmer for 5 more minutes. Season to taste. | Prepare the pasta: Remove the beef from the kaldereta mixture. Shred or cut into small cubes. Toss together beef, uncooked penne, and enough kaldereta sauce to cover the pasta. If the sauce is not enough, add water or stock. | Bake in a preheated 325 degrees oven for 40 minutes until sauce is absorbed and penne is al dente. Remove from the oven and top with cheddar cheese. Bake for a few more minutes until cheese is golden brown and bubbly. Tip: No oven? No problem! you can BAKE this dish in a turbo broiler. divide among 2 8x8-inch pans, COVER IN FOIL, and bake at 300 degrees for 20 minutes. REMOVE FOIL and bake for another 10 minutes to brown the top and melt the cheese. | Make the kaldereta: Heat cooking oil in a large pot. When the oil is hot, add beef and quickly sear. Set aside. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. Add beef back to the pan. Add water, salt, pepper, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil and cook until beef is tender, about 2 hours. (You can also use a pressure cooker to cut down cooking time.) Add tomato sauce and liver spread; simmer for 15 minutes. Add green olives, carrots, bell peppers, and chilies. Simmer for 5 more minutes. Season to taste. | Prepare the pasta: Remove the beef from the kaldereta mixture. Shred or cut into small cubes. Toss together beef, uncooked penne, and enough kaldereta sauce to cover the pasta. If the sauce is not enough, add water or stock. | Bake in a preheated 325 degrees oven for 40 minutes until sauce is absorbed and penne is al dente. Remove from the oven and top with cheddar cheese. REMOVE FOIL and bake for another 10 minutes to brown the top and melt the cheese. | Make the kaldereta: Heat cooking oil in a large pot. When the oil is hot, add beef and quickly sear. Set aside. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. Add beef back to the pan. Add water, salt, pepper, and bay leaves. Bring to a boil and cook until beef is tender, about 2 hours. (You can also use a pressure cooker to cut down cooking time.) Add tomato sauce and liver spread; simmer for 15 minutes. Add green olives, carrots, bell peppers, and chilies. Simmer for 5 more minutes. Season to taste. | Prepare the pasta: Remove the beef from the kaldereta mixture. Shred or cut into small cubes. Toss together beef, uncooked penne, and enough kaldereta sauce to cover the pasta. If the sauce is not enough, add water or stock. | Bake in a preheated 325 degrees oven for 40 minutes until sauce is absorbed and penne is al dente. Remove from the oven and top with cheddar cheese. Bake for a few more minutes until cheese is golden brown and bubbly. Tip: No oven? No problem! you can BAKE this dish in a turbo broiler. divide among 2 8x8-inch pans, COVER IN FOIL, and bake at 300 degrees for 20 minutes. REMOVE FOIL and bake for another 10 minutes to brown the top and melt the cheese.

ingredients: 1 Cup Chicken (use ground chicken) | 1/2 Cup canned water chestnuts (minced) | 1/4 Cup carrot (minced) | 1/2 piece white onion (minced) | 1 medium Egg | 1 Table Spoon all-purpose flour (plus extra for dusting) | Salt (to season) | Pepper (to season) | 15 -20 pieces wonton wrappers | 6 cups chicken stock | 2 stalks green onion (chopped) | store-bought toasted garlic chips (to serve)
instructions: Combine ground chicken, water chestnuts, carrots, onions, egg, and flour in a medium bowl. Season with salt and pepper. Mix well. | Place a wonton wrapper on a flat surface. Take 1/2 teaspoon chicken filling and place on the center of the wrapper. Fold over the wonton wrapper to form a triangle. Take the two other corners, dab the edges with water, and press the ends together to seal. Repeat to make 15 to 20 dumplings. Place on a tray dusted with all-purpose flour. | Pour chicken stock into a large pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to a simmer. Gently add dumplings, piece by piece. Cook for 5 to 7 minutes. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. | Divide soup and dumplings among bowls. Garnish with green onions and garlic flakes. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: chicken | water chestnut | carrot | egg | table spoon all purpose flour | season | wonton wrapper | chicken stock | stalks green onion | garlic chip

ingredients: 1 Cup canola oil | 1/2 Cup Achuete Seeds (annatto seeds) | 6 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 4 pieces Lemongrass Bulb (Tanglad) (pounded) | 1 piece (2-inch) ginger (sliced and pounded) | 6 juice of calamansi | fish sauce (patis) (to taste) | 2 pieces Chicken (use leg quarters) | 1 Cup white vinegar | 5 pieces red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (sliced in half) | 1 piece (1-inch) ginger (sliced) | 8 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1 piece red onion (thinly sliced) | 2 teaspoons peppercorns | Salt (to taste)
instructions:
Heat oil in a small saucepan. Turn down heat to the lowest setting and add atsuete seeds. Let the seeds infuse the oil for 15 minutes. Strain and transfer oil to a large bowl.
  | Add garlic, lemongrass, ginger, calamansi juice, and fish sauce to the oil. Let cool. Add chicken to the mixture and set aside to marinate overnight in the refrigerator.
  | Make the sinamak sauce: combine all ingredients in a bowl or bottle. Cover and set aside overnight in the refrigerator to let the flavors meld.
  | Preheat a charcoal grill or grill pan. Grill marinated chicken for about 12 to 15 minutes or until cooked through. Serve hot with warmed sinamak sauce on the side.
ingredient_names: canola oil | achuete seed | lemongrass bulb | ginger | juice calamansi | leg quarter | red chili pepper | peppercorn

ingredients: 1 tablespoon garlic paste ((garlic pounded with a little salt until it turns into a paste)) | 5 tablespoons curry powder | 1 1/2 teaspoons Salt | 1 1/2 kilos Chicken ((use legs), cut into parts) | 3 tablespoons corn oil | 2/3 Cup ginger (sliced into strips) | 1 Cup onion (sliced into strips) | 2 pieces long green chilies (siling pangsigang) (sliced) | 1 piece red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (chopped) | 1 1/4 cups Tomato sauce | 1 Cup water | 1/2 Cup coconut milk (gata) | 2 cups Potatoes (cut into chunks) | 2 cups carrot (cut into chunks) | 1/2 Cup coconut cream (kakang gata) | 3/4 Cup red bell pepper (cubed)
instructions: Combine garlic paste, curry powder, and salt in a small bowl. Mix until it forms a thick paste. Rub all over chicken, then set aside for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator. | Heat oil in a saucepan. Saute ginger, onions, and sliced chilies in oil. Add marinated chicken and cook until brown on all sides. | Add tomato sauce, water, and coconut milk. Mix well and simmer over low heat until chicken is tender. | Halfway through, add potatoes and carrots. Cook until tender. | Pour in coconut cream. Add bell peppers and simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve hot.
ingredient_names: a little salt | curry powder | chicken | corn oil | ginger | strips | long green chily | red chili pepper | tomato sauce | coconut milk | potato | carrot | coconut cream | bell pepper

ingredients: 1 and 1/2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 3/4 Cup onion (chopped) | 2 cloves Garlic (minced) | 350 Grams Beef | 1 teaspoon ground cumin | 2 teaspoon chili powder | 1  finger chilies (siling pangsigang) (seeded and minced) | 1 (800-gram) can canned diced tomatoes | 1 Cup water | 1 (400-gram) can kidney beans (drained and rinsed) | Salt (to taste) | 1 tablespoon semi-sweet chocolate | tortilla chips (to serve)
instructions: In a medium frying pan or wok, heat oil. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add ground beef. Season with cumin and chili powder. Cook until meat turns brown, about 5 minutes. | In the rice cooker, mix cooked ground beef with green chili, tomatoes, water, and kidney beans. Season with salt and pepper. Turn on the rice cooker. | When the rice cooker switches to the warm setting, mix in grated chocolate. | Transfer to a serving bowl. Serve with tortilla chips on the side. Serving tip: Prepare a big batch of this versatile Mexican dish! It makes for a delicious filling for tacos, nachos, and quesadillas.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | beef | cumin | chili powder | finger chili | tomato | bean | semi sweet chocolate | tortilla chip

ingredients: 1 (1.2 kilo) Whole Chicken (washed and dried) | 1 pack (150ml) Barbecue marinade | 1/4 Cup Calamansi Juice | Salt (to season) | Pepper (to season) | 4 stalks lemongrass (tanglad) (trimmed, stalks pounded, and leaves tied in a knot) | 4  pandan leaf (tied in a knot) | 2 heads Garlic (smashed) | 1/4 Cup Butter (plus 3 tablespoons melted butter or margarine) | gravy (to serve (optional))
instructions:
Marinate chicken in barbecue marinade andcalamansijuice for 4 hours or overnight in the refrigerator.

 | Rub chicken skin and cavity with salt and pepper.

 | Stuff chicken cavity with lemongrass,pandanleaves, and garlic cloves.

 | Spread butter or margarine underneath the skin of the breast and leg parts, being careful not to tear the skin.

 | Truss the chicken (position the chicken breast side up on a clean surface. Cross the legs and tie them tightly with kitchen twine then tuck the wings under the breast). Place chicken on a baking rack with a baking sheet or pan underneath.

 | Roast in a turbo broiler or in a preheated oven set at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 1 to 1 1/2 hours, occasionally basting the chicken with melted butter. Roast until chicken is golden brown and the juices run clear when the thickest part of the chicken legs or thighs are pierced. If the breast is already cooked but the legs or thighs are not, remove the chicken from the oven or turbo broiler, cover the breast and wings with aluminum foil to keep them from drying out, then place the chicken back in the oven or turbo broiler to cook through. Serve hot with your preferred sauce.
ingredient_names: whole chicken | barbecue marinade | calamansi juice | season | stalks lemongrass | pandan leaf | margarine | gravy

ingredients: 1 kilo pork ((use pork spare rib (rib tips)), cut) | 2 - 3 tablespoons Dried taosi black beans | 3 tablespoons cornstarch | 1 tablespoon ginger (strips) | 2 tablespoons rice wine | 1 teaspoon Garlic (minced) | 1 teaspoon sesame oil | 1 teaspoon Meat tenderizer | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | chicken powder (to taste) | Leeks (sliced (for garnish))
instructions: Mix all the ingredients together in a bowl. Marinate for at least 30 minutes. | Steam spareribs for 50 to 60 minutes or until tender. Transfer to a serving plate and garnish with sliced leeks. Tip: You can find dried taosi black beans in Chinese delis like The Little Store, Wei Wang, and the Aranque market, and supermarkets like Unimart.
ingredient_names: pork spare rib | dried taosi black beans | cornstarch | ginger | rice wine | sesame oil | meat tenderizer | chicken powder | garnish

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Achuete Oil (annatto oil) | 6 cloves Garlic (minced) | 4 cups rice ((cooked), preferably a day old) | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 4 pieces Flour tortillas | 500 Grams cooked beef tapa (cooked and chopped) | 6 pieces Egg (scrambled) | 1 medium Cucumber (diced) | 4 pieces tomatoes (diced) | 1/2 head Iceberg lettuce (shredded) | 1/2 Cup cheddar cheese (grated) | Pickled Vegetables (Atsara) (to serve)
instructions:
Make the atsuete rice: Heat atsuete oil in a frying pan. Add garlic and saute until brown. Add rice and mix well. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Set aside.
 | Heat a flour tortilla on a preheated grill or frying pan. Place the tortilla on a plate.
 | Arrange atsuete rice, cooked tapa,scrambled eggs, cucumber, and cheese on the center of the tortilla. Roll tightly and secure with a toothpick or wrap in aluminum foil. Repeat with remaining ingredients to make a total of 4 burritos. Serve withatsaraon the side.
ingredient_names: a day old | flour tortilla | beef tapa | egg | cucumber | tomato | iceberg lettuce | cheddar cheese | vegetable

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 4 cups rice ((cooked), cooled) | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 1 1/2 Cup Chicken (grilled and cubed) | 2 tablespoons Barbecue marinade
instructions: Heat oil or melt butter in a wok or frying pan. Saute garlic until fragrant. Add rice and season with salt and pepper. | Add cubed Chicken Barbecue and barbecue marinade. Toss to mix well. Garnish with chopped parsley, if desired. | Heat oil or melt butter in a wok or frying pan. Saute garlic until fragrant. Add rice and season with salt and pepper. | Add cubed Chicken Barbecue and barbecue marinade. Toss to mix well. Garnish with chopped parsley, if desired. | Transfer to a container; let cool for 10 minutes. Cover with the lid.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | rice | chicken | barbecue marinade

recipe_name: Easy Pancit Canton with Chicken Barbecue
ingredients: 1 1/2 tablespoon vegetable oil | 1 medium white onion (sliced) | 2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 1 Cup carrot (thinly sliced) | 2 cups chicken stock (plus extra, if needed) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons Barbecue marinade | 300 Grams egg noodles (pancit canton) (uncooked) | 1 tablespoon sesame oil | 300 Grams Chicken (grilled and sliced) | 1 head Bok Choy (Chinese leafy cabbage) (steamed or blanched)
instructions: Heat oil in a wok or frying pan. Saute onions until translucent. Add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add carrots and saute until tender. | Add chicken stock, soy sauce, and barbecue marinade. Season with salt and pepper, if needed. Simmer for 5 minutes. | Add pancit canton and mix until the noodles have absorbed the liquid. Drizzle with sesame oil. If the noodles are dry, add more stock. | Transfer pancit to a container and top with sliced Chicken Barbecue and bok choy; let cool for 10 minutes. Cover with the lid.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | carrot | chicken stock | barbecue marinade | egg noodle | sesame oil | chicken | bok choy steamed

recipe_name: Adobo Flakes with Sinangag and Spicy Eggs
ingredients: Oil (for frying) | 3 cups leftover adobo (shredded) | 3 tablespoons kesong puti (white cheese) (cubed (optional)) | seasoned vinegar (to serve) | 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 3 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 5 cups rice (cooked) | 1/2 tablespoon Salt | 5 medium Egg | 1 teaspoon chili flakes
instructions: Make the adobo flakes: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry shredded adobo until crispy. Set aside. | Make the sinangag: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry garlic until almost golden. Add rice and mix. Season with salt. Set aside. | Make the spicy eggs: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Cook eggs sunny side-up, then sprinkle chili flakes on top. Set aside. | To serve, place sinangag in a bowl. Add adobo flakes and spicy eggs on top. Top adobo flakes with kesong puti, if desired, and serve with seasoned vinegar on the side.
ingredient_names: leftover adobo | kesong puti | seasoned vinegar | vegetable oil | rice | egg | chili flake

ingredients: 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 1 tablespoon sugar | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1/2 tablespoon Salt | 1/2 tablespoon black pepper | 1/2 kilo Beef ((use sirloin cut), sliced thinly) | 3 medium Egg (yolks only) | 1/2 Cup Butter | 1 tablespoon lemon juice | 1  Pepper | Oil (for frying) | 2 large Pandesal (sliced in half and toasted) | 4  cheddar cheese | 4 medium Egg | Pepper
instructions: Make the tapa: Combine vinegar, sugar, garlic, salt and pepper in a bowl. Stir mixture until sugar dissolves. Add beef and marinate for at least 1 hour or overnight in the refrigerator. | Make the hollandaise sauce: Place egg yolks in a stainless steel bowl. Place the bowl over a saucepan of simmering water, making sure the bottom of the bowl does not touch the water. Whisk egg yolks until it turns light in color. Slowly add butter in a thin stream until the mixture thickens. Whisk in lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside. | When ready to cook, drain tapa from marinade. Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry tapa until browned and cooked to your desired doneness. | Assemble the tapa Benedict: Top toasted pandesal with tapa and cheese. Toast in a toaster oven just until cheese melts. | Add poached egg on top and pour hollandaise sauce over. Garnish with pepper, paprika, and chopped parsley, if desired. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Serve immediately.
ingredient_names: sirloin | egg yolk | butter | lemon juice | pandesal | cheddar cheese | egg

ingredients: 3 tablespoons Achuete Oil (annatto oil) | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium red bell pepper (cored and cut into small cubes) | 4 cups white rice (cooked) | Salt (to taste) | 3 sticks Pork Barbecue (removed from the sticks and cut into cubes) | green onion (for garnish)
instructions: Heat annato oil in a wok. Saute garlic and stir occasionally until golden brown. Add bell peppers and saute until tender. | Add rice and mix well. Season to taste. | Stir in cooked pork barbecue and sprinkle green onions on top. Serve hot.

ingredients: 480 Grams cooked beef tapa | 1 tablespoon Oil | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 medium onion (sliced into rings) | 3 Small bell pepper
instructions:
Cook beef tapa according to package directions; slice into thin strips and set aside.
 | Heat oil in a pan, add garlic (minced), and saute. Add onion (sliced into rings) and bell peppers (use a variety of colors and slice into thin strips); cook until onions caramelize. Remove from heat and mix in beeftapa. Split 4 to 6 mini baguette loaves in half, spread butter on each side, and toast until crisp on the outside. | Fill baguettes withtapamixture and drizzle with store-bought cheese sauce.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon cooking oil | 3 cloves Garlic (minced) | 1 Cup leftover adobo (minced) | 1 Cup carrot (julienned) | 1 Cup green beans (sitaw) | 1 Cup sweet potato (kamote) | 1 Cup monggo sprouts | Salt (to taste) | 15  lumpia wrapper | Oil (for frying) | spiced vinegar (to serve)
instructions: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Saute garlic until fragrant. | Add leftover adobo, carots, green beans, kamote, and mongo sprouts; mix thoroughly. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside and allow mixture to cool. | Assemble the lumpia: Take a lumpia wrapper and place 2 to 3 tablespoons of the adobo mixture on the center. Roll tightly into a log. Repeat with remaining ingredients. | Heat oil in a pan. Fry lumpia rolls until golden brown. Serve immediately with spiced vinegar on the side.
ingredient_names: leftover adobo | carrot | sitaw | sweet potato | monggo sprout | lumpia wrapper

ingredients: 500 Grams mussels (cleaned and beards removed) | vegetable oil (for sauteeing) | 1 (1-inch) piece ginger (minced) | 2 cloves Garlic (crushed and minced) | 2 tablespoons Soy Sauce | 2 tablespoons Vinegar | 1/2 Cup Mussel Broth | 1 tablespoon brown sugar | 1  bay leaf | Pepper (to taste) | 1 Cup malunggay leaves (moringa)
instructions: Place mussels in a pot and add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil and cover with the lid, allowing mussels to cook. Once shells have opened, remove from heat and drain. Discard mussels that remain closed. Set broth aside. | Once cool enough to handle, remove meat from shells. Set mussels aside. | Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Saute ginger and garlic until fragrant. Add soy sauce, vinegar, mussel broth, sugar, bay leaf, and mussels. Season with pepper. Simmer for 3 to 5 minutes. | Add malunggay leaves. Simmer for another minute. Remove from heat and transfer to a serving bowl.
ingredient_names: mussel | vegetable oil | ginger | mussel broth | brown sugar | bay leaf | malunggay

ingredients: 1 tablespoon white onion (chopped) | 1 clove onion (minced) | 1  green finger chili (siling pangsigang) (sliced thinly) | 1/2 Cup Soy Sauce | 1/4 Cup Vinegar | 2 tablespoons Vinegar | 1 Cup firm tofu (tokwa) (diced into 1/2-inch cubes, fried, and drained on paper towels) | 1 Cup lechon kawali | Red Pepper Chilies (Siling Labuyo)
instructions: Make the sauce: Mix all ingredients in a bowl; set aside. | Combine fried tofu and lechon kawali in a bowl. | When ready to serve, drizzle the sauce over the tofu-lechon kawali mixture and toss. Heat a sizzling pan. Add the tofu-lechon kawali mixture. Serve immediately while sizzling. Garnish with bird s eye chilies, if desired.
ingredient_names: green finger chili | paper towel | lechon kawali | red pepper chily

ingredients: 2/3 Cup pineapple juice | 1/2 Cup brown sugar | 1/3 Cup Soy Sauce | 1 1/2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 3 tablespoons Calamansi Juice | 1/4 Cup banana ketchup | 1 kilo pork ((use kasim), sliced into 2-inch pieces)
instructions: Mix together pineapple juice, sugar, soy sauce, garlic, calamansi juice, and banana ketchup in a shallow bowl or pan. | Add pork and mix until coated. Skewer pork onto barbecue sticks. Let stand for at least an hour at room temperature before cooking or freezing. 9If freezing for future use, transfer skewers to resealable plastic bags. Before baking, let frozen pork thaw until completely defrosted, then proceed with the recipe. Use within a week to prevent the meat from drying out.) | Preheat turbo broiler or oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. After 10 minutes, lay pork skewers on top of the grilling rack or on a tray. Cook for 20 minutes in a turbo broiler or for 30 minutes in an oven. serve immediately.
ingredient_names: pineapple juice | brown sugar | calamansi juice | banana ketchup | kasim

ingredients: 500 Grams clams (scrubbed and soaked) | 1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil | 1 clove Garlic (minced) | 1 piece Bottled Tuyo (crushed into paste) | chili pepper flakes (to taste) | 100 ml clam stock | 6-8  Cherry tomatoes (sliced) | 250 Grams malunggay pasta (cooked according to package directions) | 1/8 Cup malunggay leaves (moringa)
instructions: Boil water in a pot over high heat. Add clams; cover pot with lid and reduce heat to medium. Steam for 5 to 7 minutes or until clams open. Discard any clams that remain closed. Set clams and clam stock aside. | Heat olive oil in a frying pan. Saute garlic until fragrant. Add tuyo, chili flakes, clam stock, tomatoes, and clams; cook for about 2 to 3 minutes. | Add cooked pasta to the pan; toss with clam mixture. Add fresh malunggay leaves and mix to combine. | Divide among serving plates and serve hot.
ingredient_names: clam | extra virgin olive oil | bottled tuyo | chili pepper flake | clam stock | cherry tomato | malunggay pasta | malunggay

ingredients: 1/2 kilograms Shrimp (deveined) | 100 Grams Tamarind (Sampalok) (boiled and mashed) | 1 piece onion (cut into cubes) | 3 pieces tomatoes (cut into cubes) | 1  radish (labanos) (peeled and sliced) | 1 thin bunch string beans (sitaw) (cut into strips) | 2 pieces long green chilies (siling pangsigang) ((Optional)) | 3 teaspoons fish sauce (patis) | 4 cups water
instructions: In a pot, boil the tamarind fruits until shell breaks. Strain and mash in a Pyrex mixing bowl. | In the same pot, add to the tamarind broth the onions, tomatoes and radish and boil. Simmer in a low to medium heat until radish is half-cooked. | Add the shrimps, string beans and mashed tamarind. | Add fish sauce depending on your preferred saltiness or until the sourness of tamarind is balanced out. Boil and simmer until shrimp is cooked. | For a hint of spiciness, add long green pepper when the shrimp is cooked and when the fire is off. You can also substitute kamias or guava fruits to tamarind.
ingredient_names: shrimp | tamarind | tomato | radish | thin sitaw | long green chily

recipe_name: Spicy Eggplant with Minced Meat Recipe
ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1  red onion (chopped) | 1 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1 tablespoon ginger (minced) | 300 Grams pork (use ground pork) | 1 tablespoon Fermented Red Bean Curd (Tajure) | 1 Cup Tomato sauce | 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce | 2 tablespoons sugar | 1 tablespoon black vinegar | 2 tablespoons sesame oil | 1/4 teaspoon Chinese five-spice powder | 1  red chili pepper (siling labuyo) (chopped) | 4 cups eggplant (cut into 2-inch strips (about 4 medium eggplants)) | 1 Cup chicken stock | Pepper
instructions: Heat oil in a large wok. Saute onions until translucent. Add garlic and ginger; saute until fragrant. | Add ground pork and cook until the meat turns brown and some of the juices have evaporated. Add bean curd, tomato sauce, and hoisin sauce. Mix well and cook for a minute. | Add sugar, black vinegar, sesame oil, five-spice powder, and chili. Add eggplant and stock; simmer until sauce is reduced. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Transfer to a platter and serve hot.
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | ginger | pork | red bean curd | tomato sauce | hoisin sauce | black vinegar | sesame oil | chinese five | red chili pepper | eggplant | chicken stock

ingredients: 1/2 kilo Beef (use tripe) | 1/4 kilo Beef (sliced thinly) | 1/4 Cup Beef Bile | 1 medium onion (chopped) | 1 head Garlic (minced) | 1 piece ginger (sliced) | 2 pieces red chili pepper (siling labuyo) | 1 teaspoon Salt | 1/2 teaspoon Pepper | 1 tablespoon fish sauce (patis)
instructions:
Wash and mash the ox tripe with sea salt to remove the musky odor. | Boil the ox tripe in a big pot until tender then remove from liquid and cut into 1/2 inch cubes. Set aside.
 | Saute ginger, garlic and onion until cooked then add the ox tripe. Season with salt and pepper
 | Stir fry for a few minutes then add some water, just enough to cover all the ingredients. | Simmer and add the beef until cooked. | Drop the red chili peppers and green chilies and pour the bile little by little to prevent the dish from becoming too bitter. (You may adjust the quantity of the bile according to your taste preference.)
 | Season with fish sauce to taste.
ingredient_names: tripe | beef | beef bile | ginger | red chili pepper

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Garlic (minced) | 2  onion (sliced) | 1/4 Cup canola oil | 1/4 Cup dried shrimp (hibe) (rehydrated in warm water and drained) | 1 whole Chicken (cut into 10 to 12 pieces) | 2 teaspoons fish sauce (patis) | 1/4 wedge squash (kalabasa) (peeled and cubed) | 1 Cup chicken stock | Salt (to taste) | rice (to serve)
instructions: Saute garlic and onions in canola oil. Cook until onions are translucent. | Add dried shrimp and heat for a few minutes. Add chicken pieces and cook until fat is rendered. Season with patis and ground pepper. | Bring to a boil, then lower heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add squash and mix well. | Pour in chicken stock, then bring to a boil again and simmer until chicken is cooked through. Pour in coconut cream. Adjust seasoning to taste and serve with rice.
ingredient_names: canola oil | warm water | whole chicken | wedge kalabasa | chicken stock | rice

ingredients: 2 tablespoons vegetable oil | 1 Cup onion | 1 teaspoon Garlic | 2 tablespoons ginger (julienned) | 1  chicken bouillon cube (Optional) | 1 kilo Chicken (cut into serving pieces) | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 2 cups rice ((uncooked), (dinorado variety)) | 10 cups water | 1/2 teaspoon black pepper | For the toppings | 4  century egg (quartered) | 1 Cup tofu (tokwa) (deep-fried and diced) | 1 Cup Fresh Shiitake Mushrooms ((sauteed), seasoned with salt and pepper) | green onion (thinly sliced) | ginger ((cut into strips), to serve) | Pickled Radish ((available at Chinese delis),to serve) | chicharon (to serve) | calamansi (to serve) | fish sauce (patis) (to serve)
instructions: Heat oil in a heavy-bottomed pot. Saute onions until translucent. Add garlic and ginger; saute until fragrant. Add Chicken bouillon cube, if using, and cook gently until it melts into the mixture. | Add chicken and cook until browned. Season with fish sauce. Add uncooked rice, then mix and toast for around 2 minutes. | Pour in water and bring to a boil. Season with black pepper. | Simmer until the rice is fully cooked, about 30 to 40 minutes, stirring occasionally. | To serve, portion soup into individual serving bowls. Top each bowl with century egg, fried tofu, sauteed mushrooms, chopped green onions, ginger strips, pickled radishes, and crushed chicharon. Drizzle with calamansi juice and fish sauce, if desired. Thickening tip: If you prefer a thicker arroz caldo, use 1 cup uncooked dinorado rice and 1 cup uncooked glutinous rice (malagkit).
ingredient_names: vegetable oil | ginger | chicken bouillon cube | chicken | rice | the topping | century egg | tofu | shiitake mushroom | green onion | chinese delis to serve | chicharon | calamansi

ingredients: 3 big white onion (chopped) | 1 Cup green olives (sliced) | 1 Cup black olives (sliced) | 15 cloves Garlic (minced) | 2 cans anchovies (oil included, around 50 grams per can) | 4 tablespoons anchovy sauce (bagoong isda) | 1 Pack tomato paste ((150 gram pack)) | 1  chicken bouillon cube (diluted in 2 cups water and reduced to 1 cup) | 3 1/2 tablespoons capers | 4 tablespoons brandy | 2 packs Tomato sauce ((1 kilo pack each)) | 1 tablespoon fresh oregano | 1 tablespoon Italian seasoning | 4 pieces sweet basil leaves | Salt (to taste) | Pepper (to taste) | 50 Grams angel hair spaghetti (cooked according to package directions)
instructions: In a saucepan, saute onions until translucent. Add the olives, garlic, anchovies, and bagoong Balayan. | Add the tomato paste on the side of the pan and let it caramelize. | Add the chicken broth and capers. Pour in the brandy then flambe. | Add tomato sauce and simmer for 30 minutes. | Take off the fire, add the fresh herbs, and season to taste. | Toss sauce with cooked angel hair pasta. Serve hot.

ingredients: 1 tablespoon cooking oil | 12 cloves Garlic (crushed) | 1/2 tablespoon peppercorns (cracked) | 2 kilos pork ((use pork belly), chopped into 2-inch cubes) | 1/2 Cup Vinegar | 1/4 Cup Soy Sauce | water (to cover meat)
instructions: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. saute garlic and black peppercorns until garlic is brown and fragrant. | Add pork belly and saute until the meat is browned. | Add vinegar, soy sauce, and water. reduce heat to low, then simmer until oil has been rendered from the pork fat. store leftovers in the refrigerator until ready to use.

recipe_name: Baked Lapu Lapu with Laguna Cheese (Kesong Puti) Topping
ingredients: 1 (500-gram) lapu lapu (gutted and cleaned) | 2 teaspoons kinchay (parsley) (chopped) | 1 tablespoon onion (chopped) | Salt | 1/2  onion (sliced) | 1/2  tomatoes (finely chopped) | 1 Cup extra virgin olive oil | 100 Grams kesong puti (white cheese) (crumbled)
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. | Stuff fish with parsley leaves and onions. Season with salt and pepper. | Place fish in a baking dish. | Place onion slices and chopped tomatoes on top and around the fish. Drizzle with extra virgin olive oil. | Top with crumbled kesong puti. | Cover with foil and bake for 40 minutes. Serve immediately.Skills

ingredients: 3 cups water | 1/4 Cup sugar | 1/4 Cup rock salt | 5 pieces Chicken ((use wings), tips trimmed and reserved) | 4 to 5 strips bacon | 4 cups vegetable oil | 1/2 Cup mirin (japanese sweet rice wine) | 1/2 Cup light Japanese soy sauce | 1/2 Cup sake (japanese rice wine) | 1/2 Cup japanese rice vinegar (Mitsukan) | 1/2 tablespoon sugar | 5 to 6 cloves Garlic (sliced thinly) | 2 to 3 pieces siling labuyo (birds eye chili) (for garnish (optional))
instructions: Combine water, sugar, and rock salt; mix until dissolved. Add chicken wings and let sit for 30 minutes. | In a heated ovenproof pot, add bacon and render its fat. Add the chicken wings and the vegetable oil. Wait until lightly simmering and put in a preheated 220 degrees F oven. Cook for 45 minutes. | In another pan, brown the chicken wing tips and add mirin, soy sauce, sake, rice vinegar, and sugar to make the sauce. Simmer until well incorporated. Strain and discard wing tips. | Once chicken wings are tender, sear on all sides in a very hot frying pan. Lower heat to medium and add garlic and chili. Saute until fragrant. Add sauce and season with black pepper. Mix well. | Transfer to a serving platter and garnish with tom yao leaves.

ingredients: 2 tablespoons Salt | 1 (1.2 to 1.5-kilogram) Chicken | 4 tablespoons Chinese rice wine | 1 teaspoon black pepper | 12 cloves Garlic | 6 thin slices ginger
instructions: Rub salt all over the chicken, including the cavity. Drizzle wine all over the chicken, then sprinkle with pepper. Stuff the cavity with garlic and ginger. Marinate chicken, covered, in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour or overnight. | Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wrap the chicken tightly in banana leaves, then wrap in aluminum foil. Place on a roasting pan. | Pour boiling water into another roasting pan and position on the lower shelf of the oven. Place the chicken on the shelf directly above the pan of water. Roast chicken for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until the meat is tender and cooked through. Turbo broiler tip: This dish can also be prepared using a turbo broiler. Pour boiling water on the bottom of a roasting pan. Place chicken (wrapped in banana leaves) on top and roast at 400 degrees for 1 hour and 15 minutes.

ingredients: 4 cups unripe jackfruit (langka) (peeled, cored, and cut into 1 and 1/2-inch strips) | 2 cups water | 4  Tamarind Pods (to taste) | 1  onion (sliced) | 1 (1-inch) piece ginger (sliced into 4 pieces) | 1  finger chilies (siling pangsigang) | 1/2 Cup fish sauce (patis) (to taste) | fresh tamarind leaves (for garnish)
instructions: Put jackfruit and water in a stockpot and bring to a boil; cook for 5 minutes or until jackfruit is almost tender. | Add tamarind pods, onions, ginger, and chili; cook until tender. | Add shrimp and cook until they turn pink. Season with fish sauce. Discard tamarind pods. 4 Remove from heat and add tamarind leaves. Serve hot.

instructions: Make the spiced chicken: Arrange chicken leg quarters in a pot then add the rest of the ingredients. Simmer over medium heat for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. | Make the salted fish fried rice: Heat oil in a wok. Saute garlic and onions until fragrant. Add dried fish and cook for 30 seconds. Add rice wine and cooked rice; mix together then season with salt and pepper. Add chopped eggs and mix well. Remove from heat and sprinkle with chopped spring onions.

instructions: Preheat a steamer. Soak noodles in lukewarm water until soft, about 5 minutes. Strain and set aside. | Season prawns with salt and pepper; wrap noodles around prawns. Arrange on a heatproof platter and steam for 7 to 10 minutes. | Make the tomato-aligue sauce:Heat oil in a medium wokor frying pan. Saute onions until soft and caramelized. Add garlic, ginger, bell peppers, and finger chilies; saute until tender and fragrant. Add the rest of the ingredients except for the eggs; simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and lightly stir in eggs. Pour sauce over the prawns and garnish with chopped green onions.

recipe_name: Adobong Manok sa Gata with Chili and Ginger
ingredients: 1 and 1/2 kilos Chicken (cut into pieces) | 1 and 1/2 cups Soy Sauce | 1 Cup white vinegar | 1/2 tablespoon black pepper | 1/2 tablespoon Garlic (minced) | 1/2 Cup ginger (julienned) | 1/2 Cup onion (minced) | coconut cream (kakang gata) (from 2 mature coconuts) | 4 pieces bay leaf | 2 tablespoons fish sauce (patis) | 5  Bicol Chilies | 4  finger chilies (siling pangsigang)
instructions: Marinate chicken in soy sauce, vinegar, and black pepper for at least 2 hours in a coveredcontainter at room temperature. | In a pan, saute garlic, ginger, and onions, then add the drained marinated chicken. When the chicken is half-cooked, add the coconut cream and bay leaves. | Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Season with fish sauce, add the chilies then serve immediately.
